bndA0JYFRxigj9iwAn3nxw.text: Intricacy, healthfulness and quality of the food couples with relaxed atmosphere and friendly service.  Wow!  Do the right thing and eat here often!

30YUfStjFZa_hPG6UDii2g.text: I absolutely love this place!!  I am not a vegetarian, but this is one of my favorite places to eat.  The food is consistently amazing and the staff is always super friendly.  Great for breakfast, lunch and dessert.  My favorites meals are the California Love Wrap, Tacos Vivos, Elephant Curry Bowl, Arizona Roll & the Lumberjack Sandwich.  Honestly though, everything is amazing.  Their juices and smoothies are excellent too...my favorites are the Greena Colada and the Braveheart.  All of the desserts are amazing, but my favorite is the raw Snickers bar.  The coffee is excellent too!  Some people complain that it's expensive, but I think it is well worth the money for quality ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos Vivos!  One of my favorites

0YMfaqt0Ft1VYfIHXgmSpg.text: I had an issue with the service but Cassie made it right. Most business owners make very little effort to make things right, but Cassie went above and beyond.  That says a lot.

m6z-zs78q0PHIb-AXYOXvw.text: First ones in the door when they opened. A couple came in 5 min later. They were served immediately and after 10 minutes,  my 7 year old had to go request a server. Still no other patrons,  25 minutes later,  the couple had drinks and such,  we had water that was refilled 3 times.  No drinks, no food,  not acceptable. (Quote from 7 year old) when I asked to cancel our order, the server was annoyed and offered no apology.  Will never visit again.

2x1FVflObL1MxEakLc4KkQ.text: I'm a total meat lover so even though I own a condo across  the way I have always avoided eating here. My daughter finally convinced me today to try it out and I have to say it was absolutely delicious! Will definitely be making this one of my favorite places!!

TJPcScPeM6YuFbrIiZAFLg.text: Absolutely amazing! Don't be put off by the pricing it is absolutely worth it. No froo froo meals here- you will leave full, if not stuffed!  So refreshing to find a place passionate about providing quality, fresh, vegetarian food! My mother and I were overwhelmed to actually have a menu where we could eat everything! Not just a side here or there but full, flavorful amazing dishes!  I got the avocado sandwich, Ma got the Lumberjack. Absolutely fantastic!  Service was a little slow, but they were busy and we needed the time to choose, so we were fine with it.   We will definitely be back! I only wished I lived closer! :)   Try them- thank me later!

jorYYWgXo7zT8MNYcvOO1Q.text: The food is amazing !!!! I loved everything about it ! One of the best vegan places out here in chandler . Our waiter Justine is such a sweetheart !

MWTT7Ve9fa7qC_4-uAw16Q.text: My little sister works here and she tells me about all the amazing food all the time!  I love this place!  The food is well prepared, fresh, and tasty. I love the gila nachos and the burritos! The staff is friendly. They often have live music playing which is nice too. I just have so much love for this place that I can't put into words.  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Supreme burrito

6yQiy1IgzuXqCAnwGf_InQ.text: OMG!  For once I feel at home with restaurant food.  As a vegetarian for almost 30 years, and now going vegan, This place is the bomb! (Excuse my dated expressions.)  I had the falafel salad and it was sooo good. The waiter asked me if I wanted a take home bag after I had eaten half of it, (It was a huge salad.) but I told him no, that I would eat it all. And that I did.  I consumed this huge salad and enjoyed every last bit.  The prices are pretty good, but I"m cheap, so anything over $5 is a little high for me. (Which is absurd, I really need to work on that mindset!)  I also had some sort of juice.  I can't remember what I got I just remember it being like the drink of the gods.    As far as atmosphere, well, to be honest I thought I was back in the late '60's early 70's.  (Yep, I'm that old!!! But please don't tell anyone.)  Even though I'm an old hippie, it's hard for me to see young ones...now....in 2015.  Anyway, God bless 'em, right? The only thing I wish, I wish they were open at night and had alcoholic beverages.   I loved this place.  The food is marvelous....check it out!!!

PEOn0coWpMocn2RhJZt1_A.text: This vegan restaurant is by far the best restaurant I the Ahwatukee area. They have a great place to sit outside sprinkled with live cactus flowers on each table. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. What truly takes the cake is that they now we've an option of take out or dine in. The food is absolutely AMAZING.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Athena Bowl
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus with veggie sticks
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese quesadilla with black beans and seasonal fruit - Kids Menu

MZYEHglXvV6UjVvISEJHAA.text: I wish I lived closer and could afford this place on a regular basis! The food is always fantastic but the price is a little much. They do give you lots of food though! It's always a little crowded and the food kind of takes longer than it should (about 30 minutes) Staff is always super friendly

W3Do0S7CmQrV9feMVEErHA.text: Does healthy have to mean small portions? I ate sandwich  split side order of "fries" and split a desert 2 hours later I am hungry again and out about $30.   I do like the concept local veggies, meat free food and contemporary atmosphere. But $12 for a BLT and $11 for a Kale salad was a bit steep for a place where I order at the counter, refill my own water etc..    This is the crux of my issue the lack of value.   The BLT it self was decent, the Tempeh bacon was a bit sparse, the tomatoes were good as were the greens. The Side of hummus was bland and came with a few fresh veggies.  The Kale salad was good with a large flax seed chip, fresh kale and many other ingredients.  The pomfrits (french fries) were not as great mealy slices of potato under cooked in oil.  The Desert the almond joy $4 was quite decadent and tasty , however we decided to get this later on and had to wait in the slow line to order to get this.

RI6rgdHC-wUO4_q8ePew9Q.text: I am from Northern California where some of the best vegan and farm to table restaurants exist. I was happy to find this home away from home. BUT my only criticism is that everything that is sweet is WAY to sweet. They need to learn how to balance the flavors to make up for the of animal fat. Most new vegan restaurants do this and it's a shame because that's all you taste-sweetness. The savory dishes I've had are amazing! Just be prepared for way too many raisins in the zucchini muffins and super sweet parfaits.

A6O6T9gGW1qiX8PZEH6fSg.text: Slow service all while the front staff was flirting and chatting with each other.  Good food, just hard to come back when service is so poor and your paying a decent cent for the food.

NpAtnH9KUmkSlWCT7Z3o1A.text: Holy cow this place is so impressive. It took me forever to even decide on what to eat and drink. This cafe elevates whatever you want to eat to the next level with so many flavor bombs, layers and excellent combination between savory, umami, sweet and refreshing. No restaurant works as hard as this cafe to create dishes that you couldn't even try at home. There is no predictability here.

CRVIw8iacZp9bvrtQQptQA.text: Awesome place.  Everything was great,  huge portions for the bowls and no meat, really cool atmosphere.

h5f5W17iNyPCPHGfHA8CLw.text: Such a shame. This is the exact kind of restaurant Im always looking for. Too bad the staff are oblivious to basic customer service. I've never been in, so i asked if I seat myself or wait to be seated. This question really threw the waiter for a loop. He just didn't know how to answer. Because I was carrying my laptop bag- he was more concerned on whether or not a was giving a lecture or something. Very strange... Then I had a seat, but no one came to my table to take my order. So, I notice the "order here" sign. I got up and asked, "is this where I order?". They responded, "wherever....".   It was like pulling teeth to figure out whether I seat myself or wait to be seated, whether a server takes my order or I order at the counter. It shouldn't be so hard to spend $20+ on a lunch and drink. Long story short- I just can't support a company with staff that are that confused and oblivious as to the basic functions of their job or just basic guest service.  I've never seen a place with such confused employees. I mean, who can't say whether its seat yourself or not? Who can't say whether a server will take your order or whether you order at the counter?   Ridiculous.

Rx4cXs_XFOAXh2VMuw3Bgw.text: Pomegranate's savory dishes that I've tried have all been amazing.  Their sweet dishes, on the other hand, are hit or miss.  Their Love the Whales Mac & Cheese bowl is probably the best vegan mac & cheese I've ever tried.  The portion size is huge and I split it up to last me three meals.  Their raw tostadas were absolutely incredible.  Every time I go there I look for this in the raw case, but alas, I've only been able to find it once.  Again, a very generous portion.  You can easily get leftovers from most of their meals.  The quesadilla was also good, and the tofu scramble is all right.  Tasty but nothing special.  Their coffees, however, have all been...well, bad.  I've tried a latte, a mocha, and the coconut caramel latte.  The coconut caramel latte was all right, although definitely not a favorite.  The latte and mocha were leaning toward the nasty side.  Their pancakes and French toast are a bit dry and not as fluffy as I would hope.  The cinnamon rolls, on the other hand, were great.  The chai muffin was all right, but cloyingly sweet.  In short, stick with any savory items you find on the menu, and if you're craving sweets or coffee, go to Nami instead.

0jvM_MfkCZDBnWqe-zPm0A.text: I haven't been back since my last review, and I'm so pleasantly surprised. Everything looks beautiful inside and the workers are vibrant and friendly. I'm so excited and happy for them that they are expanding and I can't wait to visit again and see their growth. It truly shows how much the owners care, that they take constructive criticism and turn it around into a positive. Thanks for being my favorite Tukee spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F_0efJq0UD-4APJh8kU2gA.text: We've been going at least twice a month since this friendly, family owned cafe opened a few years ago. Their vegan/vegetarian menu is creative and full of delicious organic ingredients. I love the Wild Western Tacos for breakfast. And for lunch either the avocado sandwich or elephant curry. (Not made from elephants.... C'mon!)  The smoothies and fresh juices are expensive but delicious. In fact that can be said of everything on the menu! However this is very much factored away when you consider their use of fresh, local, organic ingredients and very attentive service. My favorite juice is the cold and flu buster but often I just go for the fresh squeezed oj. This is the best place to get one of these I've found since moving to the valley 8 yrs ago.

3iuX8HDMGoSocNn_LC32Og.text: This place is a favorite of mine. The service is great. I've never been greatly disappointed by anything I've ordered here. They have some delicious raw dishes. They also have scrambles (vegan or with cage free eggs). The breakfast potatoes are really tasty - they are made with kale and sweet potatoes. You can order things vegan or you can get eggs and/or dairy if you want. The presentation is beautiful. The raw desserts are to die for. If you're needing gluten-free, they can also make anything on the menu gluten-free. Sometimes (weekends) they have a biscuits and gravy special that is one of my favorite things. It is a little pricey, but I don't mind. They do have a rewards type card you can get, and earn points for free drinks.

mw1kxnZ8WXSg8Bi8cxO1zg.text: The worst part about this place is choosing what to order. They have a large, creative menu & everything is good. You also feel good when you leave because everything was healthy! They have very friendly service as well.

bygoZzXz6E-9t8gr1m_5ow.text: Loveeee this place! Best food ever and SO healthy. I recommend the tacos but it is big you could share it easily.  Super yummy. Wonderful service!!!  Going to be ranting and raving about this place for a long time to come!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos sooo yummy this is a spilt porition double this for a single order.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon Mint Tea amazing and refreshing $3.50

jGqE__fLkf2s5SsIm5woyA.text: Went there for breakfast while visiting Phoenix. Hubby had the banana bread french toast and I had a delicious vegan breakfast sandwich I can't remember the name of. It came with a side of "hash" sweet potatoes, which I'd normally love, but they were over salted. Service was great - when I told them about the problem with the side, they took 25% off the price of my breakfast, without any protest at all. Very sweet and personable staff all around. I also had a cinnamon roll and a latte - both delish. I will certainly visit again next time I pass through Phoenix!

Xut76Uk-I7dEJ5fqOcuDWA.text: Amazing. Good raw food selection and great live music on Saturday evening! They use all local and organic ingredients and have cool seasonal drinks and food.

VWHc4aedMSJ2hShJ3VTH_Q.text: I've been to Pomegranate at least three times already, and each experience was excellent. I absolutely adore this establishment.  I love the vegetarian/vegan menu and I love that everything is fresh and local!! What makes this place so special is that it is VERY clear that the owners and employees take pride in their work. Everyone is genuinely kind and helpful.  Oh, and the food/drinks = bomb.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GCXlaXWJlmLaeEO0OXKGEQ.text: cool menu with fresh ingredients, cool concept. One big problem is they are EXTREMELY SLOW! Service and way to expensive. If you plan on going here for lunch break between work you my not get you food in time before you need to go back to work. Plus everything is very pricy, 12-16 oz drink will run you 8 bucks! If you order a meal you will easily run you over 25 bucks.

vhrEGzpqNbJixilZEenFzA.text: I am not a vegan.  I am not a vegetarian.  But man, oh man, if I could eat here every day I just might be.  I don't care if you go meatless or not, the food here is on point.  It's also great to eat something tantalizing to your taste buds and also not feel like a fatty patty when you leave.  Everything tastes impeccable and wonderfully fresh.  Don't forget to hit up the dessert case before you leave!  I'll be a customer for life.

yzb7FR4_epOtY_1a3lDSYw.text: Delicious food, nice atmosphere. I was skeptical when looking at the menu and all the vegan offerings (sometimes vegetarian restaurants try a little too hard to be creative), but this was the best sandwich I've had in a long time (Sunizona BLT). I chose the side of hummus with vegetables; also excellent. The only drawback is it's a little pricey ($13 for a sandwich and side).

TBZlJQlYzbi8KeyVTfIP_A.text: Too bad they put pepper in most entrees. Root beer was tasty. Mac and cheese undercooked and very little broccoli. Waiter very accommodating. Second time here. Potatoes were so peppery my husband could not eat them. Bacon Tempe too salty also. Desserts looked yummy though. Lime lemonade with blue berries was too tart and sour.

7waZcnfPM4ZbEJkg7Gcjfg.text: This place was a huge surprise and a huge relief!  Being a foodie, and quite the fan of healthy food, this place definitely lives up to those expectations.  If you've ever been to San Francisco, then you'll definitely get that feel when you enter the cafe.  It's got a great atmosphere, and the menu is by far the best when it comes to serving healthy "organic" foods.  I know that many places in the valley claim to serve healthy food, but serving "all-natural" and locally farmed foods doesn't necessarily mean it's healthy.  People that are True foodie's know exactly what I mean.  I ordered the Dragon Bowl with quinoa and it was delicious.  I'm excited to try this place again.

cIc0guHaT8ApBTcJLzSexg.text: Everything I've eaten here has been amazing. So far I've had the jackfruit tacos, dragon bowl with tofu and kelp noodles, raw rainbow wrap,  raw everything bagel, love wrap, hummus, and several desserts. I always leave full and happy, knowing I've eaten something made with fresh, delicious ingredients. You can't go wrong with ordering anything on the menu. I could honestly eat here for every meal without getting bored. They're constantly adding new, phenomenal dishes as well as offering daily specials. The staff is knowledgeable and will answer any questions you have. They will also go out of their way to accommodate changes or picky eaters. Did I mention the delicious food? Seriously, check it out, you won't be disappointed.

pdziglYjYTALypSYu7Gqag.text: Love this place. So glad they have the extended hours now. Food is unbelievable delicious and healthy.

_bsBNzlv3CO6CtN_Ra_wbA.text: If I could give this place a 10 star I would. This is the only public food place in the world that I trust 100% with my food.  I stumbled across this place about 1.5 years ago and instantly fell in love.  Their intent behind the food is what keeps me coming back.  The energy in the place is fantastic.  They know what they are doing and build up the community along the way.  I will always recommend them to anyone who is health conscious and understands the importance of locally sourced food.

gyu6lU-5dgsK-3-_vLp3dA.text: I got the Breastfast Burrito sans eggs and tofu because of allergies.. It was amazing!! Their fruit bowl is versatile and fun. Noisy-ish if you're dining in, mostly because of the juicer (yes they juice your drinks right there..) but think of it like a cafe. Fun and original! Great varieties and options for vegans and people with allergies!

ePNgfaUUEHNQftz3QpELFQ.text: I'm in love! This place has delicious, healthy food and a cool vibe. Our new weekend lunch stop. The falafel is my favorite. The nachos are a must try. I was thrilled to learn they are expanding.

lv3Wyu0hrBB2W-gb2Hot8Q.text: Such an amazing atmosphere as soon as you walk in. I was greeted by smiling happy faces which were genuine! I ordered the tacos vivos, recommendation from the lovely knowledgeable girl working there, I also got an abundance drink which was made to perfection!!! I have no complaints about this place! I will def be referring friends to this unique and healthy place!!!!!!!! The food was amazing, the staff was sweet and KNOWLEDGEABLE they could answer any questions and helped me even if I was being a little indecisive, and the atmosphere just added the cherry on top, the energy and vibe in there was just great! i cant say enough good things about this place!!!!! If you have any questions the pretty redhead girl knows what she's talking about!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos Vivos, it tastes as good as it is pretty!!!!!

hmk0JOIM3izL4oAWoryZ4Q.text: very good food, and healthy. Nice staff. The atmosphere is very cute and nice. The ONLY thing is that it takes forever to order and they only have one person on the register to take customers, this can easily be remedied by having 2 registers, but since there's only one, it takes 15-20 to order when it's busy (which is usually the only time I can go).

qv8MNpSdFl0mjTGYp6EBbQ.text: I love that you leave this place feeling so full but not so guilty because you know everything is nutritious and healthy.I love their coffee here too, espresso has an awesome flavor! A bit pricy but hey everything is organic and like supporting our local businesses! Some of my favorites are: Green garden protein bowl All coffee drinks Chocolate pomegranate cake Sizzling sesame salad

d0BmfACV1yivwcWd9WHOcA.text: OMG!  OMG!  OMG!  I could not believe how delicious my meal was.  I had the Kale salad and Eggplant burger.  YUM, YUM, YUM!!!  Then I had the Papaya pie. It has a coconut base.  OMG!  OMG!  OMG!  YUM, YUM, YUM!!! I mean, ya ever watch Check Please where they do the close ups of the food and it looks sooo delicious and the reviews the people give are so enticing...?  Well, that's EXACTLY what my meal tasted like.   I wish I was being filmed so someone else could do the drooling!

z1P8FHsAo2sjWBwE6D28vQ.text: First off, let me say that I love the concept of this restaurant. They focus all of their efforts on local, and organic produce in almost all of their dishes. The restaurant itself is decorated super nice and the overall atmosphere is awesome. My wife and I decided to share a wrap that was stuffed with a bunch of fresh veggies and tofu. The overall flavor of the wrap was good, but I felt like it was lacking something. I did put on one of the hot sauces that they offer and that made it really flavorful. It came with a pretty generous portion of a side salad. While I do understand that serving organic produce can hike up the prices, the price for the wrap was a little steep at $15. However, it was actually a pretty good sized wrap despite the price point. We also ordered a specialty pancake that I was not a fan of at all. I also ordered a side of chips and salsa and I did like the flavor of the salsa but the chips texture were a little off. We really wanted to try a dessert but we were pretty full so we decided against it. I would love to come back, however I would need to order something different to wow me a little more.

-_zUsqAfdz9_RZgZS1EmSA.text: I'm not even vegetarian or vegan and I love this place. I've tried many vegi places and by far this is the best place. Definitely go with the hibiscus cooler. I've had many things even my dog loves this restaurant. The dog usually has a dog bowl which consists of broccoli zucchini cauliflower and quinoa. I like it all for the most part. Now while the food is great, the service can be so so. Also 1 time the 18% tip I left on my credit card was suddenly 25% when I compared it weeks later. No complaints. Just pay cash from now on.

dDeRTxLLc8OUCyYTcofgEA.text: I want to be nice to this place because of the limited vegan options in the valley. But it's also important to be honest. This place changes a lot. They took some of the old staff , particularly the manager, over to the new place I believe because I don't see her anymore. I say this because the place misses her.  Recently they took out the ability to order a small salad. Now it's just large. This particular salad I like (they changed the name 3 times in the past two years and took out then back in the kelp noodles) was only 9 dollars. Perfect for me for lunch. With a tip that's 11 dollars. Reasonable by any calculation. Now it's 16 dollars and sorry too much for me.   In terms of service. Very inconsistent and often dependent on the server. Some just look like they don't want to be there. And yes it's very slow at times. Order something to go and sit there? Be wary. At lunch you will wait a while. I waited 50 minutes. Went to the dollar store to shop and came back. And waited........  Food though is pure. Very good ingredients. The concept is what we need more of. This place just needs to work on delivery.

xD33prJ2Kfe1Ai51kWc-yQ.text: Quality, unique place that definitely adds flair and something special to the community. They had a huge variety of dishes (almost too much variety), that each possessed a high variety of flavors and combinations. Plus, the service was pretty solid for being Sunday during brunch time! Definitely hope to return, but not the best place if you're looking for just average fare

dx9nLiKzA64CsmFrJVz_bg.text: I still love the food at Pomegranate. It is by far some of the best vegan food around. That gets 5 stars from me.   The service though really can be frustrating. I have been coming here a lot on the past year and service seems really hit or miss.  The food always brings me back, but I think the food saves them. Based on service I probably would have stopped coming.   There seems to be a lot of confusion with the staff. Incorrect to go orders, bringing me my cheesecake to go while I'm waiting outside and telling me that the rest of my food is going to be 15 minutes. Can you imagine what 15 minutes outside waiting in 100 degrees will do to my dessert?  Um it's going to melt.    Staff is trying, but not all of them seem like they have a clue. It comes off as too chill, too hippy dippy, not professional, and less than a 5 star worthy rating.  I want to see them take it up a notch and have the quality of service match the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pina Colada Pancakes
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vOeLOh4_UsC2k4228xcpyw.text: Pomegranate Cafe has an excellent choice of foods for vegan diners. We have always enjoyed their food and the service is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Healthy juice drinks at Pom.

a2UVPPhoEkoP5mYmDwJQ6A.text: Pomegranate Cafe was wonderful! I loved all of the healthy options and the menu itself. The only slight downside to this small cafe would be the prices. I understand it is healthy and vegan and things of that nature but two of us ate there for about $40! Other than the price, great choice!

MsC85T_lbUDp3cCKOBnfVw.text: I was very excited to try this place out and went for the first time today. I wanted to love it but had a bad experience so am totally bummed. I used to live in Scottsdale and healthy restaurants like this are on every corner. Now In Ahwatukee they are harder to find however I don't believe I will be returning. After finally being seated following a 30 minute wait for a table for 2 we placed our drink and food order immediately. I ordered one of the specialty coffee drinks and only after waiting 15 minutes for it...the waiter told me they were out of one of the ingredients for it. So after picking something else I finally had my TEN dollar drink...,20 minutes after being sat. It took 30 minutes for the food to come out which is so ridiculous as it was just a sandwich and a burrito. My sandwich was the tiniest I don't even thing they were full sized pieces of bread and the bread fell completely apart I had to eat it with a fork. The bill was $35 for a sandwich, a burrito and a coffee drink. Terrible service and way over priced. I just was not satisfied by any of it.

oPpoTBfc-QTszj00-wV3vw.text: I love this place so much. They always have amazing specials that change seasonally & the food is so imaginative. I like that they have pizza & taco nights & experts that come in to speak about health. Excellent food, great influence on the community.

BWfaYlF9AB6lDkY3Tw80Bw.text: Update: I had a vegan friend visiting from out of town and found out it's really freakin hard to find a place to eat that isn't just bread, water and salad!! So bless this place for keeping my friendship with my vegan friend together! They have such a creative and extensive menu of vegetarian and vegan options that keeps both meat eaters and non happy and full. The prices are a bit steep for lunch but you pay for what you get: truly organic and fresh ingredients made to order. Service is always stellar and excellent and I'll always be coming back!  ----------  This little cafe serves up some excellent vegan food for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians...but definitely at a price. I've come here on a few occasions, usually for brunch also some lunch here and there. Everything on the menu is vegetarian/vegan so you don't have to look twice if you're vegetarian. Everything I've had has been very flavorful enough to enjoy eating your guilty free, meatless dish. My favorites have been the supreme burrito which hides the vegetarian part of it very well, and the dragon bowl. I think the entrees here are moderately priced about $15 for larger portions, however their acai bowls and juices are incredibly pricey. $13 acai bowls and $10 juice is ridiculous but that's the price you pay for all organic ingredients. Overall they make healthy and vegan food very tolerable if you can also tolerate a little hipster vibe. Love taking my out of town vegetarian friends here for brunch.

h7kQBPfLASGLI33aE8YvTg.text: Don't believe the hype!  I'm a carnivore that is still impressed by a great vegan or vegetarian meal. I gave Pomegranate several opportunities to see why it was ranked at 4 stars. The final time was the last straw. This place failed on all accounts.   This review is for the last time I was there for breakfast, which was a few months back.   1) The prices are way too high. For some reason, restaurant owners seem to do this to make patrons feel like it is higher quality. Far from it in this case.   2) The food took forever!!!  It wasn't that crowded. But they had plenty of staff and it's not incredibly involved food to make. Most of it is not even cooked!  3) Even though we were there for ages, we were rarely checked on by our waitress.   4) By the time our food showed up, it was cold!  I'm not a huge fan of cold scrambled eggs.   5) This last part still blows my mind. My girlfriend ordered a blended drink with her meal. Several sips in she had a major reaction. She grabbed her mouth in pain. There was a sharp plastic shard in her drink that sliced into her gums. I asked for a manger who explained that it was probably from the container of one of the ingredients. She then proceeded to give us a gift card that had $25 written on it. She did not offer to cover our $70 breakfast!!!  The real kicker is that we went to redeem the card later on 2 frozen drinks only to find out that the gift card value was only $15 even though she had written $25 on the card. The drinks that we ordered were both so gross, that we threw them out.   Trust me, don't believe the hype.  Just because it's trendy, doesn't mean it's good.

DdhOtjnRMzegW-FTCPhYYQ.text: The wait is always long (no matter what time I go it seems!), but the food is worth the wait. My favorite dish is the vegan nachos...I have gotten it a few times and it never disappoints! Do not come to this restaurant if you are in a rush or have less than an hour to spare, because you will be stressed by the wait. Last two times I've gone, it's been about 1.5 - 2 hrs between arrival time, finally being seated, and then waiting for our order to be taken and then waiting for our order to arrive and finally being able to eat our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qvrxzvRRdtO-hGShApJYDA.text: WARNING-Do not recommend!  Slow service.   Not loving what we got at all MOST important they have macaroni and cheese on the menu and they don't tell u it's made with CASHEWS! We have an allergy to this and no word on the menu at all!! Terrible- who the hell makes Mac and cheese with NUTS  and don't tell you!!!

MZxsWdOYuMqiSWHHdbKBug.text: Beautiful people, beautiful food! This place is very unique with its menu and everything is delicious!!! Don't go home without dessert, there is always something different and absolutely divine! There's a book share outside to read, or let your kids read while dining! The Happy Hour menu has a wonderful selection (raw tacos and "wings") are a great choice! I always have a hard time picking, as all options are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ok36mjSGAHQ-J-YKo_GS6Q.text: Waited over 2 hours for food on a Saturday evening and then when we finally got our food, it was cold. Although the flavor was good, definitely not worth the wait. Very unorganized and slow.

W8h9E3Xie0m4hwUIOkAOqQ.text: This place has become a new favorite! Had a moment of considering moving to Phoenix just so we could eat here again.  My husband and I were road-tripping from Utah back home to Austin and decided to drive through Phoenix. I googled "vegan restaurants Phoenix" and when I looked at the menu and saw that they had a raw vegan everything bagel I just about died. The staff were extremely friendly. We sat outside on the dog-friendly patio with our puppy, who they brought water right away and were very sweet to (that always gets extra points). I was bummed that they were out of the raw everything bagel but everything else was delicious. I got an abundance juice that hit the spot and the raw Arizona roll was light and flavorful- the tumeric dressing was creamy and amazing. My husband is a meat-eater and he got the Pom burger and was blown away- he said he would eat here all the time if we had one in Austin. I tasted his burger and coming from a long time vegan/vegetarian, it was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had! We ended with gingerbread brownies. These were out of this world good! Sweet, fudgey, and just the right amount of gingerbread flavor without overpowering the chocolate. I really wish they would branch out to Austin. We will definitely be back next time we're in the Phoenix area.

BCVEio1CKHTi-Gov-eaJeQ.text: We did not like it at all. There was this pigeon flying inside and constantly disturbing everyone. Food was average, not so good. Won't recommend it.

urAXArbd8QaPe5uQFqsLXw.text: Awesome place to eat - i am not a vegan or vegetarian - i come here because the food is 95 % organic and it tastes good - brought one of my carnivore friends here and he got a burrito - he said it was one of the best things he has ever tasted period -

fWdcmjtbYDVrRw32_soiNQ.text: This place has the best scones! The smoothies are amazing as well. Or server was super friendly and helpful - I believe his name was Rick.  Looking forward to my next visit

gA0f2D3JO2mhvZv7pe9oAg.text: Amazing food!!! Love this place, most of the time. Quite pricey and often wait time is forever. They have both vegetarian & vegan food options, including healthier desert choices. Happy hour is quite good, again a little pricier, but you are paying for fresh, organic, & veg food.

6UDerRn10c1EExPRvtbwSg.text: As a 30 year vegetarian, I'm so happy they opened in my hood. I like all of the options but I've had one or two dishes that were too heavy on the sauces, making every bite of a big rice bowl taste exactly the same. Next time, I'm ordering the sauces on the side! Be forewarned they are pricier than the other local level lunch spots. If they weren't, I'd be there much more often. Their smoothies and juices are off the charts expensive. $12? Um no. My meat eating friends and family like the place too!

t1iKQyxIm60lrvzRQFeQSA.text: Terrible service. They forgot that we were seated; the group that came in after us was given their food before we could even place our order. We had to walk up to the front to get a waiter to take our order. After we did, the waiter lost our order and was looking for it for at least 15 minutes before asking us to reorder. For the high price of the items, you would think the service would be good, but not at all. It took us nearly an hour to get our food.

NKhYbPAh5K8n6kA-XJ40CQ.text: Pomegranate Cafe has delicious vegan dishes. Their desserts and so yummy. Smoothies are energizing.

PJS6aPShih3UZOmW-sYSGQ.text: Loved this place! As I entered the Cafe, my senses didn't know what to do first. The smell of the food was enticing. The greeting by the gentleman was genuinely comfortable. Once seated we got our waters quickly and they were infused with cucumber.  I had the Green Garden Bowl for breakfast.  The food was delicious! If I lived on that side of town, I would be their best customer. I love that things were organic and some were vegan. What an interesting and unique place. Worth the trip!

05ifqdcWO0dCDBZkQ3dL8g.text: Pom has continued to thrive and grow for good reason. Great service, continued quality food and a fun atmosphere with daily specials that tempt even this staunch creature of habit!   Dragon Bowl & Green Protein Bowl are still my favorites. The bean burrito for breakfast is delicious as well.   Thanks Pom for keeping up the good healthy fight!

oUX_L10Mlq3LdWW8LKLqdw.text: Love, love, love this place! Friendly staff, great vibe, and their food is delish!! I have loved everything that I have tried there.They continuously show their love and support of their local community, which is why I continue to go back.

u1SEnVwd_HC9LD6lw8zjpg.text: We are so happy to have Pomegranate Cafe in Ahwatukee! Every dish is delicious! We especially like the juices! Servers are always knowledgeable and helpful when choosing items off the menu! It is so nice to sit out on the patio in good weather! A great restaurant to take out of town guests to! The owner is always happy to help with donations to our local schools! Great community restaurant!

Klo9bFwtHYctrXJnoW5XPQ.text: You get what you pay for. People complain about the price, but they make almost everything in house, many of what you're eating is sourced locally which is very important to me, and it's all organic and non gmo. Which in the real world, are very expensive things in which they need to offset the cost. My favorite ever was the buffalo mac and cheese, among all the dessert goodies. Service is always an issue here I know, but the food makes it worth it. I am a regular customer and it's nice to stop by from time to time and enjoy a nice meal. The happy hour menu is kick ass.

Mds9_YC3iMmeJxvn2CFt2Q.text: Hidden in a strip mall but we'll worth the search right next to trader Joe's greeted immediately by likely the manager owner within a couple minutes a young server with a shirt that said positive vibes grow here she had a million dollar smile place is only 70 percent filled which is odd as most breakfast places along the way had lines outside but great energy inside every vegan natural option you can image a bit pricey had coffee burrito with egg and veggies total 15 dollars power outlets everywhere for working on pc coffee arrived warm not hot and came with coconut sugar which is a first servers are quick to clean after patrons leave a nice covered patio out front food service was quick and quality of food good overall a solid 4 the servers energy and joy made the trip worth it alone nice high energy positive experience

GqimUUzz0CmEZM2WU9LuqA.text: Taking reservations on holidays so all the people who don't typically make a reservation and just stop by and drive over an hour to get there can not eat due to 1.5 hour wait time. It's ok though going somewhere else. Pomegranate usually has horrible wait times just to get what you order anyways so I'll just spend my money elsewhere.

Y3kkTSoRdVSPj9D-NdR1lQ.text: This was my first time here and the food was AMAZING. The service on the other hand was terrible. Our server was rude. She had a stale face from beginning to end. We went to pay and were inquiring about the desserts and my friend asked what flavor of cake there was. In a rude tone she stated that they closed an hour ago and the pastry chef was gone, so we couldn't buy any. We understand you're trying to close but when there are still three other tables who just got their meals, you would think that she would  be able to answer a simple question. To top it off she kept rolling her eyes. I don't think I will ever come back here. This was absolutely ridiculous. It pained me to even leave a tip for such a sourpuss.

nQyS3dzEoDKXEyP5ZROOHw.text: The food is fantastic. If it wasn't for the food, this would be 2 stars. I love eating here, but they have slowest service on the planet. It isn't just one waiter or waitress, it's all of them every time. I keep coming back because the food is fantastic. One time my boyfriend and I waited an hour for our food. I don't know if it's a lack of training or what, but please please please do something to make your service more efficient.

Jug4Os-BbKDaeSFvMztCLg.text: Great atmosphere and my  brunch was delicious!  Too much to eat but I tried.  Highly recommend the biscuits and gravy with "sausage" and eggs . So good.  The smoothies also looked amazing but I was way too full.  Would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m6BISGELB5dqYUTrxDJy6Q.text: Wonderful service! Our server was so sweet and helpful, and provided great recommendations. Our 2 year old loved his French toast, and he got run around the patio in the misters. The dragon bowl was so yummy, and big enough to share. Wish we were in town at 3 o'clock for their happy hour!

bkWCB7PZMGTFUEheso_l9g.text: Service was really friendly, but the food was a little overpriced. Not my favorite vegan place but still worth checking out (:

sKZ_LIR4S27-gELX_t-D5w.text: A huge improvement, a complete turn-around. As though Mr. Happy himself has been imbued into the staff here.   Upon arrival, it was empty but then started filling up. The wait staff and hostess at the counter were pleasant and very helpful.   Upon ordering we received our little flag and found our table to sit. The brownie was brought out first. Very quick this time around. Not more then 5 mins. And within a minute more, another person brought out our drink. She was gracious and very polite, making the experience so much more delightful.   Within a few more minutes, a younger waitstaff came around to let us know our food will be next. Also very polite, and not sassy.   Once again, a complete turnaround from our previous experience. All the i's dotted all the t's crossed. And not just for us, we witnessed the same pleasant demeanor for every guest that came to eat. Always someone stopping by to ask how the meal is, everything to our satisfaction. Perfect - Delicious - Very Hospitable and Friendly  4 stars is only because the restroom needed a little pickme up.   fin

WmC84hVi8d0ome-RL5-AmA.text: Well, my partner and I have been waiting around 45 minutes for two wraps and quite frankly that's ridiculous. It doesn't matter how good the food will be, we won't be returning. Another table of two got their food before us and they came after. One of your servers came around 15 minutes ago to tell us our food would be our shortly. I don't know how you folks run your business, but it seems like slow service is the "it" thing around here.  *Update*  Food was good. Our lunch experience was an arrival of 12:45. We got our food at 1:30, my partner asked for no onions in his wrap, it came with onions. We waited another 10 minutes for his wrap to come back. We finally ate and asked for the check which took another 10 minutes to run the card.   Overall 4/5 for food 2/5 for experience.

ba9E3UQ9O0H6xmEc1CkUEA.text: I love their Power Kale Salad and their AB& J Bowl!!!!  I'm a natural carnivore yet to mix up the calories, I highly recommend this place for their healthy salads and fabulous staff. They have indoor and outdoor seating and 2 thumbs up for their dog friendly patio. Only drawback to this place is I wish the weekday hours were until 9pm but other than that, it's a winner!  Tuesday-Thursday: 8 am - 8 pm Friday & Saturday: 8 am - 9 pm  Sunday: 8 am - 4 pm Closed Mondays

_7KYGWkQgrZw61lY9VanPQ.text: The food is good and the valley desperately needs more vegan/vegetarian options. However the service is abysmal. I placed an order for pick up and was told it would be 10-15 minutes. I browsed around and waited. After 20 minutes I inquired and was told my food was being put in a box. 5 minutes later I asked again and was told it would be a few more minutes. I left for 10 minutes, went to the store, and when I came back I asked again and was told to wait in line. I did so for 10 minutes and was told it was being put in a  box--how many boxes do I need?The hostess offered no condolence, just told me it would be a few minutes because they were busy.  It took 45 minutes to get a to go order from a half full restaurant.   On another occasion I brought my toddler and asked for a high chair. They say is at a high top--the high chair was a foot lower than the table. Their incompetence can be comical.

t1H3pkIidlrPFexT81MxXQ.text: This is my first time here! Recently moved here from another state. Not a vegetarian or vegan, but I do enjoy making healthy food choices regularly. Had the Avocado Sandwich & the Island Green smoothie! Absolutely delicious!  The staff was extremely awesome in helping me decide what to order. As a former manager at Jamba Juice for 4 years, I've had my fair share in health food training & the staff definitely knows their stuff.  I will definitely become a regular here!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado Sandwich &amp; Island Green Smoothie! :)

hpHszNQ_LSAW3DtP_EG4GQ.text: I was glad to learn that the entire menu is vegan unless you ask for eggs/cheese to be added.  The food I had was just OK.  Ordered the "Bountiful Bowl" which consisted of black beans and rice, carrots, avocado, and peppers.  I am an athlete and consume a lot of food, but even considering that, I think the portion size was rather small.  Disappointing.  Left the place still hungry.  My wife had the soup of the day and the Caesar salad which were better than my bowl, but again, the portion sizes left something to be desired.  I might go back and give this one another chance, but I'm in no hurry to do so.

b-3drk0mSJ67-lol_C3AfA.text: I went into Pomegranate Cafe with a friend for lunch. We both ordered some Mexican style burritos and I can't recall the name now. The food was delicious, as was the dessert and the juice. The only down fall was the price. For 2 people to eat lunch it was $58! We each ordered a raw dessert and a drink to go with our food but I still felt that was a little steep.

EFCOZts_mopKI8sqfR0kJg.text: Fantastic! Fresh ingredients and a wide variety if options on the menu. For dessert we had the pomegranate chocolate cake and it was really good, but had too much frosting. Will definitely be back!

3t-zZGvSM5w5x5GsegbcpQ.text: This is a neighborhood cafe that many friends have raved about. I finally ate here, and it was horrible. They mixed up our orders, served us sub-par food, and charged us over $45 for 2 salads and 2 ice teas. The worst part was that I got sick from the salad. Do not eat here.

_-M1wKvzrUInaEq7NG7npw.text: Ordered and they forgot about our order. Took more than 30 minutes to get food. But once the food came it was wonderful!!

GX4elGvdK8mc1NVMByujRQ.text: Albeit a little pricy, Pomegranete's cafe is the place to go for fresh, delicious vegan food. And you don't have to be a vegan to love this place. Everything is fresh-made, so service can be slow sometimes (and often it gets busy in there, so it's not a good combination) but it's worth the wait. With constant additions to the menu, there's always something new to try. I definitely recommend stoping by.

qu5ANCl7V7csddt99Y1zkw.text: Fantastic meal. Had the Athena bowl and it was amazing. It had a side of kalamata hummus and macadamia nut pesto. So many flavors that meshed deliciously!

H2D1xtVZ3UawXRfkAcKzDw.text: This place is fabulous!  We shared several dishes and all were delicious.  The employees are helpful, friendly & lovely too!  We were told the Owner tries to buy everything local, all is organic and fresh.We shared a  raw almond joy like bar for dessert & it was to die for!   Pomegranate iced tea was yummy too. So happy Ahwatukee has this wonderful, healthy delicious place to eat!  Ask for the punch card to get free drinks after purchasing a certain amount.

5pwSPiscaUOgC24fzfsyfQ.text: Finally!! I have been meaning to go to the place forever.  Organic cafe with great food and such a great vibe.  Love the cowgirl cookies and the hummus is amazing.  Why can't they open another location closer to scottsdale?

cvNpttS3yxKnFpWDmqdFXQ.text: A fan. Love the place, the staff, the food. Never been disappointed. And I go there at least 3 times a month. Vegan, gluten free, delicious, healthy.

qv20FKyWUmbZu6Lqyl9dbg.text: I highly recommend Pomegranate Cafe. The food is delicious and the people who work there are nice.

wlsB2U4Du0df8pwKkcRDEw.text: Best vegan option in the valley!  Love that I can go out to eat and still be healthy.  I almost always order one of the specials... love the variety!

Bu79oSjxk7z1tbNSB3eOTQ.text: They have amazing food. Our favorite are the desserts, especially the raw cheesecake. It's not just for vegetarians/ vegans - even my grandpa who eats meat everyday was loving the Philly melt......until we told him it wasn't beef :-)

8zfA_4LL1q0tmwaMXKGjlw.text: This place is amazing! I love the fresh, healthy food - thought it was delicious. And I have to say, I like all kinds of food - not just vegan/vegetarian. So props for that! The "donut holes" (don't be deceived by the name) are delicious and I loved their new "Island Drink" (green and fruit). I've had a TON of food from this place and always enjoyed it.  Now, a note too the not to great reviews that i read. Everyone, of course, is intitled to his/her opinion. The prices are a little upwards of what you expect for a cafe, but the woman at the counter said that EVERYTHING is organic/local when they can. Which accounts for the cost, I believe. I like to support local goods/family owned.  This is not fast food. Go here planning to spend a leisurely lunch/brunch. I also like to go during the off times, around 10am is usually good or for a snack at 3pm.   So it's True that you have to work around a couple of things, but I love this place anyway. Who doesn't want to eat food with heart?

z_gRoVWlPHmA8mUdccL3lg.text: I am so excited for this place! I was just talking with Brady K. about how the Valley needs more breakfast/lunch cafes with character, and for sure Pomegranate Cafe delivers.  They have an extensive juice and smoothie menu, a plethora of unique teas, and ubber yummy breakfast, lunch and confection options.  Best of all, they use local, organic produce from the farms at South Mountain, and make all items on premises...including their almond milk!  Seriously, I love it!    Make sure to say hi to Matt when you go in.  He manages the joint, as well as bakes and makes the almond milk.  Best of all, he is great with names and conversation, so you will feel like you are old friends and you have been going there for years even though it just opened about 6 weeks ago.    For this visit, I had the white peony tea, which has a very delicate flavor and an essence of apples.  Brady K. ordered the Wild Western Tacos, and oh, my, God!  they looked awesome.  Huge portion.  Two stuffed to capacity spinach tortillas with scrambled eggs (or tofu is an option), zucchini, avocado, heirloom tomatoes, sharp cheddar.  Pomegranate Cafe offers good home cooking taken to the next level.  Imagine you had a professional kitchen with all the goodies and could just get nuts with ingredients and creativity.  It's kinda like that.  The kind of food people make because they would actually eat it, not because it's a job.  I can't say enough about this place.    Also, all drinks ordered to stay come with a yummy little cookie.  It's the little things that make a place great!  Today's cookie was an almond cookie made with maple syrup and the almond pulp left over from the latest batch of almond milk.  When I asked Matt if he had culinary training, he just said, "I like to do stuff."  Simple answer, and the awesomeness of his enthusiasm to create is apparent in everything we experienced about this place.  I can't wait to go back!

hVWqm-5-pvScW9Q3_lyPyg.text: Honestly the best place in town for anything vegan or vegetarian. You will have a completely new perspective on how flavorful and dynamic food without animal products can be. The love radiating from those who work there only adds to the environment, and my guess is that its all that yummy food and juice. Take a shot of E3 Live from their awesome juice/smoothie bar, and just see how your day goes. Also I don't know of a single other location with two full racks of completely raw, borderline beneficial for your body desserts. With a menu just redesigned last week it is most definitely worth stopping by soon.

RE340ztNgCTNmKUOY0EXtQ.text: Contradiction: A vegan joint in Tukee? Flavorful AND Healthy? Good for you AND fills you up? Healthy pastries and desserts? Yup.   A locally owned restaurant in the middle of a strip mall that looks pro enough that it could be a franchise. But its comfy and calming. Everyone was friendly and helpful and it was nice to see the owner working behind the counter with her troops.   The food: This vegan had the breakfast burritos AND the Philly sandwich. Affordable -- about $10 per dish. Great drinks with juiced veggies and fruits. I had the cucumber celery apple drink called the Refresher. I had the tofu and vegan cheese in my burro which was great. The bread on my Philly was the right texture and everything flavorfully complimented each other. The dishes are creative and unique -- so much more than salads.   She had the french toast with berry compote and real maple syrup and it was all gone pretty quick. Her Adventure drink was very yummy as well.   The vegan chocolate chip cookies were a great way to wrap up the brunch.   I am definitely coming back here again and again. They've only been open since the beginning of the year. They want to expand to organic wines and dinner times. I'm looking forward to that.

p3xWPqBcm2HPNx4C-_B9ug.text: I love pomegranate cafe for all the gf options and allergy consciousness. I do wish they were not entirely veg however. When I bring other people there they have no idea what to get even if they love veggies and salad. However i won't be going as much anymore. Their prices are exorbitant now with the expansion $14 for a garden protein bowl. A total of $50 for 2 entrees (the protein bowl and a special fish tacos) and 2 drinks (a smoothies and a kids choc. Monkey shake). I can go to other restaurants and get 6 entrees (much larger) and drinks for the same amount.

qCdTZWd0-qcKrJo1cjqHlQ.text: This place is amazing!! I am about 95% raw vegan and this place is so delicious. LOVE raw Friday. The desserts are to die for and well... I have not tried anything that was not Fa-Boo!

dkTzVvqUtn7R0rJZnyarfQ.text: Oh my. I can't believe I have been living in Awhatukee and didn't give this place a second chance earlier.  When this place first opened, my husband and I were stoked as our whole family is vegan. Unfortunately, back then the portions were tiny (my husband was still hungry when we left), the service slow, and the flavor was not memorable.  Today, after several YEARS (yes, years) we tried it again. Oh. My. Gawd. We ordered two of the raw dishes: the raw tacos and the Arizona roll. The tacos were INCREDIBLE. Spicy, great texture, and filling. The Arizona roll was just as filling and flavorable. I've been on a raw kick for almost a month, and I haven't felt as satisfied with a raw meal as I did today.  We spolied ourselves by getting the raw "snickers" bar and lemon bar. The snickers bar was absolutely heavenly. It was definitely enough for two people to share. The lemon bar was not as great, but had I not already tasted the snickers I probably would have thought it was bliss.  Needless to say, we feel guilty about not having given Pomegranate a second chance earlier. We were missing out. I can't wait to go back for "Raw Fridays" and Sunday brunch!

duV0cPCmCrhBTWFBpomK2g.text: Two words... FUDEGE PEPPERMINT PANCAKES!  Oh wait, that's three. My friend and I went for their extended brunch menu and it was the special. You know me, mint and chocolate are bffs when together. It was absolutely delicious.   I appreciate they have vegan options, yet, offer real eggs for omnivores like me. Also, had a pear sangria type of drink and posted a picture. Super cute pear wedge that is heart shaped too.   Def want to be back asap!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pear to my heart

Oo0LDQTuhQqTqbDDE9jgJA.text: I recommend eat here when you're dining in, NEVER order to go. The wait is ridiculous when you order to go. I had to wait nearly an hour on a Tuesday around 6:45pm.   I've had brunch and juice here before and it's been delicious. Last night I ordered sandwiches and they were quite gross. I also ordered a cupcake and I gagged it down just because my bill was about $45. I probably won't be back except for their juice or brunch. Way too expensive for the taste of food.

_yfGFw36r_DyCP8cG-Fctw.text: NOT JUST FOR VEGANS!!!!  This place is always consistently delicious. On this trip I went solo and picked up the tacos.  Great accompaniment of some sort of "special sauce" and a faux chicken that tasted like real chicken lol.    I also enjoyed a bottle of Kombucha from the price stock.   Very good and didn't have a strong after taste others have left for me.    What I really enjoy with this restaurant is the group of amazing staff.  They are high energy people who while being extremely friendly, are very efficient.   Thank you for another great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kombucha!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seating, more to the right as well and a great patio with misters

esiK4x6O8fftlKJ6Qy0-QQ.text: This was my go to vegan spot every week while I lived in Tempe. The food is healthy vegan comfort food with lots of flavor! They have an array of different energy shots and desserts. The walnut nachos and raw tacos will always be my favorite. It has something for everyone is this little gem from Raw vegan options, juices, and GREAT  customer service. Pomegranate cafe is a must try if your health conscious!

8j6tvsVBEP_JTjka7SLGbA.text: I had a great time at pomegranate cafe yesterday. The prices are high but it is worth it for what you are getting. Everything is vegan unless you specify you want dairy cheese or eggs on something. Yesterday I found out they even have cocktails! Two of us got the screwdriver with tangerine sorbet and it was so tasty! It was honestly the perfect summer treat. Another friend got the lavender sour and that was great too! As far as food goes, we all split the vegan spinach artichoke dip. I was skeptical because I like my spinach artichoke dip and I LOVE cheese. it was SO creamy and delicious! It tasted like the real thing and I was honestly blown away. It came with corn chips and this AMAZING bread that I haven't had there before. It was literally so. good. I have tried their Arizona roll a million times and it is a delicious alternative to sushi. I used to get the cauliflower buffalo quesadilla and I was sad to see they took it off the menu, our wonderful server said they could make me one anyway! Overall we had a great time with delicious food. The price is the only thing I wish I could change. I understand because it is all organic, local and vegan though. With 2 drinks each, one meal and splitting the appetizer 3 ways it was about $44 each. Regardless I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-TMwfAnOW_NSvqXBObmxoA.text: Good, and I'm not a vegetarian. It's nice to have breakfast or lunch and not feel gross afterwards. I have the avocado sandwich with eggs. The kids meals are a good deal - entree+fruit plus choice of a dessert for $6. I would prefer to come here than Pita Jungle for a kids meal. My son loved his quesadilla with the side of rice and beans and his cookie. Good teas and hot chocolate too.

1vM3ktWQurRZPu4byMhXGg.text: This place is awesome what a wonderful birthday brunch. We got the nachos and they were so fantastic you wouldn't believe they are meat free. We also shared the elephant burrito and it was amazing the almond Thai sauce really hit the spot. The route wedges were delicious but definitely put us over the top portion sizes are good and feeling here. I had no problem with service and even got a piece of cake for my birthday.

-hJX9lkYYrYNBNjxokKuDQ.text: **Vegetarian and Vegan Friendly**  Cute little cafe with indoor and outdoor seating. They update their menu seasonally! I happen to be in the area and caught the happy hour specials. Happy Hour includes food and drinks.   Happy Hour Portions: Raw Tacos Vivos and Falafel Slider Both items are one serving each, and a great way to taste their menu. The Tacos Vivos has every taco topping you could possibly think of, it was fantastic. And they don't skimp on the guacamole! The falafel slider is served on their house bread, and it was a little dry for me, but the actual falafel was tasty.    Entree: Curried Sweet Potato Quesadilla This was a seasonal item, and it was far better than I was expecting. The sweet potatoes with the tamarind salsa was a flavorful combination that brought the dish together. They have house hot sauces if you need an extra kick.    This place is very popular for juices and coffees. I didn't get any but I would return for a fresh smoothie. They have a very extensive brunch menu and I would love to come back to try this. Overall, I would recommend this to a friend.   PS: If you sign up to receive text message alerts, you can get a free cowgirl cookie (it was delicious) or an iced tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour menu
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Indoor/outdoor seating
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Indoor seating

rtYV4bOkNmRxXj6lfNNw0w.text: While this is a good cafe for vegetarian and vegan options, the service is poor and the food is inconsistent. Portions are fair but you are definitely paying for it. Expect to wait 30 min for your order to be taken. Food was delicious, though. If you're looking for efficient service, do not come here.

JCSLS1nyLz4k_yKazol3Lw.text: Holy cow. Shame on me for taking so long to write this review. The place is earthy, a bit hippy, and plenty friendly. Oddly out of place in the urban jungle that is the Phoenix metro area, but definitely welcome.   Some of the menu is raw, but I'm often up for trying new things, so I ordered the bagel sandwich (no onion). This is without a doubt, one of the best vegan dishes I've had in a restaurant, the bagel was more like a flat bread, and the filling was just the right about vegetables, including sprouts and vegan cream cheese. Fantastic.   I'd also ordered a too large bottle of organic ale (excellent too) , and gave the rest to the neighboring table. Finally, I risked the dessert. It was OK, but it didn't matter, the rest was amazing.   Sadly my short time in Chandler meant that I wasn't able to go again. I'm sure I'll visit again one day. I just hope it's not 114 out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raspberry Peach cheesecake.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raw everything bagel. Wow.

Si3yMRDp9P2NTjg8G1tqdw.text: I have been here three or more times the exact amount I can't recall but every time I've been blown away by each thing i have ordered. First i had the French Toast, it was the best French toast I've had and I'm sad I haven't made the time they serve it but if you come at the time they do i highly recommend it. The second time i had their pom burger and I believe there was a complication due to my pickiness but they got it taken care of right away and were super friendly. The third time and at the time of this review i got the BBQ jackfruit quesadilla but unfortunately they ran out of the jackfruit but instead of jackfruit they let me sub it out for the vegan "chicken" they offer and it was amazing.

_xdEq88NRvnJtA3jqadm3w.text: This little cafe is so cute in every way. They have options for both vegan and vegetarian and the rest.  The decor is kind of country incorporating wood furniture with contemporary light fixtures with vibrant and colorful paintings of plants and flowers.  We had a sweet server.  She was an absolute doll.  I usually ask for help when I have a hard time choosing and the options on the menu were things like biscuit and gravy, quiche lorraine, but the Pomegranate had it's own twist that made each dish, even if traditional american fare, exciting.  The coffee and espresso sounded so tasty but I'd already had my fill.  My compadre enjoyed the Coconut caramel latte.  Mmmmm-of course I had a sip.  I ordered the quiche lorraine  that was topped with the Jalapeno creme and was accompanied with a side salad.  Yum! It had  thick crust and I can't tell you all the ingredients but it was flavorful and a little spicy.  I enjoyed it.  The salad was a great side kick.  It was greens and shredded carrots tossed in what tasted like coconut aminos and citrus!  Yum!  My taste buds were happy!  my friend had a breakfast wrap which was ginormous!  Think cut in two and chipotle sized.  I had a great time here!  The wait time on a Saturday was fast, the atmosphere was casual and the food was awesome!  When I'm headed their direction again, I'll be by!  It was the perfect brunch spot on my road-trip from Tucson to the San Bernardino, CA area!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiche lorraine
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Such a cute place!  We were greeted with cucumber water and a friendly smile!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lol-beautiful roses painted in the bathroom!

Am6MTbsFevqR8EeWMAhplQ.text: My friend and I accidentally came here for brunch after weekend hike. Little did we know it was Vegan/Vegetarian. Now, I'm not Vegan/Vegetarian but am open to trying different things. Everything in this cute little cafe is organic or local bought. I ordered the breakfast burrito and added egg to it. It was filled with egg, black beans, kale, and sweet potato. They gave me a side of tortilla chips and salsa on the side with it. The burrito was just okay. It was wrapped very loosely - Everything was falling out. The beans were undercooked and hard. If I didn't add the egg, I don't think it would have really tasted like a burrito at all. The fresh apple slices on the side of my plate were soggy, old and seemed like it was soaked in lemon water for days. My friend ordered one of their sandwiches. It looked much more appetizing.   Our server was friendly and happy, just slow.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 2/5 Price: 3/5 Service: 4/5

8O7_UhNe_rp5MATvqx0NNQ.text: I would say this is THE vegan restaurant in the Phoenix area with the BEST food.  I love it here.  The staff and atmosphere are great and the food is OH SO GOOD!!  Ok, so restaurant is not strictly vegan, the menu is standardly vegan and you can get egg or cheese added on at additional cost, which I have to admit I LOVE that, after years of going to other restaurants that will "be happy to" make your dish vegan by taking off cheese and egg and charging you the same price.   Anyhow, I went off on a tangent and I only order the vegan options anyway.    The items on the menu are fresh, super duper tasty, and great portions.  Fabulous breakfast choices!!!!! YAY!  VEGANS REJOICE!  It is so hard to find decent vegan breakfast options around Phoenix, and Pomegranate Cafe has amazing breakfast options!!!  I cannot wait until the new central Phoenix location is opened!    Thank you Pomegranate Cafe for being SO AWESOME!

FyEZjFivpwwSS0owWb9vHA.text: My first time there with my friend. I had their Mayan Mocha, the first sip gave me a kick, didn't expect it at all. It was very good!

Ov_aFpHP_3NTzNBbSal63A.text: Fantastic food. Poor staffing and time management. Expect to wait, but it'll be great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plant the seeds of love.

QjpPDnUnNWQzV5RgUz5amQ.text: Met up with a friend at Pomegranate Cafe early evening on a Wednesday, the place was too packed but it was steady. Since it my birthday I had dinner plans coming up so I knew that I couldn't get anything big to eat, and I immediately regretted that!  Everything just looked delish and I wanted to try it all!  After checking out the dessert display, I picked out a Brazilian Brownie, I won't lie, I wasn't sure what to expect from this raw brownie, but I was not disappointed.  It wasn't the same texture as a normal brownie, but it wasn't bad either. The brownie tasted great, it was sweet, but not too sweet, the texture was similar to how coconut would be. I was not disappointed in it at all   Looking forward to my next trip back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brazilian Brownie

o5Mmz9QNYdVnNSlnSHJEtQ.text: Such friendly staff and amazing food! Athena's favorite salad was delicious, I can't wait to come back for more

GLG5VmZCNOPx7jNxmiNLUA.text: Love the biscuits, and gravy here.   The dish comes with a veggie hash that has seasonal vegetables.  It is hearty.  Recently, I tried the quiche, and wasn't a huge fan.  It was lacking any flavor to me.    But, i'll keep trying new menu items.  Cant like everything all the time, right?  This is a great Vegan friendly brunch spot!  My favorite dessert here is the POM truffle.  It is a decadent chocolate treat.

YnZ6Brz6gnzxZxfHI5Ms2A.text: Just came here for dinner with my family. They are super Vegan so I brought them here! We would give them a 5 star but we did feel the service was quite slow. The food was good but not amazing. The smoothies we felt were way over priced compared to other places, although the chocolate smoothie we had was the best we've ever had! The desert was delicious. Would be nice for a vegan dinner date.

E3YAqDzXj3bhtAZeegWZvg.text: I regret writing this because I used to constantly recommend this restaurant and frequent it. I had multiple pictures on my instagram of their food and beverages. Being vegan I want to always support vegan restaurants but the experience I had tonight has literally put an awful taste in my mouth.  A close friend of mine recently became sick after eating one of their burritos and I honestly didn't believe her. That is until tonight when I took my family here to have dinner. My father had to use the restroom at the restaurant to vomit and the rest of us felt sick to our stomachs. I threw up as soon as I got home.   Why didn't we tell the server? Well we had a conflict with not our main waitress, but the waitress who brought out our food. My father's order was not placed correctly due to miscommunication and the waitress had the worst attitude offset by her snide comments. After that ordeal we didn't need the headache.  The food is also very expensive. Save your money.   Overall? As rude as it sounds if I wanted to feel ill after eating, have terrible service, and waste my money I'd just go to the McDonalds in the same parking lot.

hypv5jo6LsnqxXGUHVqw-g.text: Ok so this place is the definition of "my cup of tea" for me. My friend had mentioned it to me and said I would love it and with her love for food maybe being as much as mine I trusted her and she has yet to disappoint.   I called in for pick up and the woman on the phone was so nice and delightful. She said that the wait was only going to be about 10 to 15 minutes which I was very surprised about being a Sunday morning and a holiday weekend. So I ordered the wild western tacos and an abundance juice. the total came out to be $27 which at the time I thought was rather high. When I went to pick up my food the guy at the counter was very friendly and I just instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and environment of the place.   I tried my juice in the car on the way home and honestly it was just okay. For $9 I was expecting a little bit more. The tacos however were AMAZING and such a huge portion which I love so I can save for later.   Five stars. You guys rock.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild western tacos. SO delicious

5bb_aYOS2kJMiEGYzFX_FQ.text: I love , love this place, I was so nerves about going vegan. The staff there was so knowledgeable and answer all my questions about the food and ingredients. The breakfast food was very good! Taste way better than non vegan places. The buffalo wings are amazing! I will be a regular here.

MGvVi02ThkeCitwEk3V54g.text: Went here over 3 months ago. Very delicious and plant based. I would highly recommend trying this place out. They have a variety of drinks to try from! Also the ice cream is amazing as well. The pricing is a little high, but well worth it!

TH7yHkgiVCmE933u9Z0q0A.text: Delicious! Vegan food done right. I absolutely loved their raw tacos and Greek goddess pizza. We shared a large cobb salad (which was huge!) and we still took some home! Very healthy and yummy. I had some room for desert and coffee (coconut milk/oil fans celebrate!!) and it was just to die for! Their brownie cake is the ultimate cheat day delight

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmm

iGDuDZaKpac0LCBUnRpo4A.text: The interior looks like a semi-carrying estrogren crashed into the place, I mean it's nice if you are a female or a dad with a daughter who wants to discuss her life problems in a girly environ.  if you aren't and have a pastel phobia, then don't go in, just order out.  on to the food and drinks...our drinks with whisky in it were dope, the water fly cause of the cumber, and the nachos fresh as H E double hockey sticks.  Even the chicken wings were on point- like real but not quite.  Their food deserves an ovation, totally fleck.  Overall it's reps well and I'd go back again...especially at happy hour.  Yo dang ...yo check this out yo, I almost forgot try out their desserts, so yummy.  (See what I mean about the estrogen thing, it's contagious)

N1vXopwiFbHgZ5XggjmJ7g.text: Gross. Gross. Gross. This place may be vegan but their food safety is abhorrent. Fruit should not be near the floor. There are standards for a reason.  Sanitizer buckets should not be next to the ice. The food is crazy expensive. The wait for food is unreal. Customer service is meh.

t2j3d4vbV9PBlm_ufIXoPQ.text: Charming Cafe.What I ordered was excellent.A bit pricey, but that is the price you pay for fresh,organic, healthy, and delicious food.

o92LNnBd2nevrFf0CrOD5g.text: LOVE this place!!!! The staff are always so friendly and are great with our kids! He patio is an excellent added bonus! If you go try the walnut taco meat! One word...heaven!!! A great local joint! 5 Stars!

P9v2ofCwJPZwH1Z4is8d-w.text: Great cafe with lots of variety on their menu.  Had the Pom Burger with their house bun and potato salad. The mushroom-walnut patty was very good and had lots of flavor. I wasn't a huge fan of the house bun through, I thought it was too dense and more like a heavy biscuit than a bun. The potato salad was really good, I'm not a huge fan of a lot of places potato salad because they tend to over do it with the dill, but they had the perfect amount in theirs.   The local hummus plate was good, could have used more carrots and other veggies. Bit of an olive overload.   Cowgirl cookie- I'm a cookie monster and I wish I had gotten more than one, it was just that good. Their treat case was full of so many tasty looking goodies.   I hope to come back and try their other items in the near future

VFS9-txfWW9mDdV6RTArQw.text: This place is amazing!! Unapologetically plant based, you can get everything vegan and most things gluten free. They are also super aware of allergies and make sure to inform you of all possible sources of cross contamination. But the food here is amazing! I have never been disappointed with a trip to Pom. The meals are pricey but worth it for their flavor and portions. Just the other day I stopped by for breakfast and was treated to a lovely seasonal chai latte and smoothie bowl. Yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chai latte and smoothie bowl-so good!

mNt7MWK6p6_hYrmkUrWGBg.text: I came here this past Easter with my family, we had a decent size group (6) so I made reservations before hand. I was excited to try this location (which is well over an hour away from me) in particular because I wanted to try the different menu options. I had even called ahead to ensure that they would be serving their regular menu items along with the Easter brunch menu and whoever I was speaking with that day had told me that they would be. Needless to say that when we got there and got our menus it was a let down to discover that they in fact were not serving food from their regular menu....We all ordered and when the food came most of the groups dishes were cold and the veggies were still mostly raw in the napoleon grilled cheese and harvest hash! It seemed like the plates had been ready to bring to us for a while so they had just been sitting out and getting cold before they were actually brought over. There were a few mix ups with drink orders on top of that as well. The front manager there (Daniella) had to come over and offered to have our cold meals redone. We eventually got our hot meals but mine was brought out with a completely empty cup where the bbq sauce was supposed to be! How do you bring over a plate and not notice that lol? I just had to laugh at that one though. The food was great once everything was done correctly and Daniella really saved the day. Our meal ended up being on the house which was really amazing of her to do! We got a few desserts, the carrot cake and carrot cupcake. The cake tasted great but had way too much frosting and the cupcake was totally try.

wBacfuLgB2R0fQHrpzJNLA.text: This spot is one of my favorite restaurants. I love their new expansion and extended hours, especially their happy hour with healthy nachos. My go to breakfast items are the Pom scramble with amazing jam and the avocado sandi. I am salivating just thinking about them.   Every coffee drink I have had is amazing as well and so original!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;In Season Scramble&#34; with eggs and dairy. Delicious!

mIfyytRfqzhlaJRk45IfKQ.text: Super friendly staff. I got the Strawberry French toast I think. Delicious. They have lots of GF and Vegan friendly things too! Its right beside Trader Joes.

rThPvhIE6txrDGAB0A5eFA.text: The hubs and I went in for lunch this week and really enjoyed this place. I started out with a Turmeric latte and it was enormous, delicious, and super warming. I had the Dragon Bowl with quinoa and it far exceeded my expectations. The "chicken" in the bowl was Beyond Meat, which I love and the veggies were roasted to perfection. The real heros in this dish are the toasted pecans and the Thai sauce - both are huge flavors but neither overtaking the dish. It's just really nicely balanced and of course super healthy. My husband had the everything bagel and it was just way too much food to eat.
