The bagel itself was more like a bagel chip but dense, so when you bit into it, it didn't break it just squooshed everything out of the sandwich. It was good just really messy and hard to eat. The salad that came with it was a meal all by itself. So overall the food was pretty darn delicious. The server that waited on us was really nice and super knowledgable but not very attentive given that they weren't busy. We'll go back and eat here anytime we're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything bagel
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside

bRGowdw66nw8_5ijD8rAJw.text: One of my favorite restaurants! This place is absolutely amazing. The food is healthy and delicious. I haven't tried everything on the menu, but the gila monster nachos and veggie wraps are amazing. I hope they open up more locations in the valley!!!

eNL7n_OP_nE61Tyc6D05eQ.text: If you are vegetarian/vegan or even just looking for healthy food that still tastes amazing, look no further! The food is phenomenal and the staff is so friendly! Everything about this place is amazing!!  Update: I'm so sad!! This place is no longer good... the last six times my family and I have been here the food has been mediocre. Just came from this place after eating crunchy, cold and char-tasting pancakes and their pancakes use to have the best pancakes in the valley vegan or not vegan. I used to loveee this place! Very upsetting... this food is now everything non-vegans say vegan food tastes like... flavorless cardboard.

QX82y-g_4LzdI8qsENOucA.text: We got the Athens Salad and Wild West Tacos. Both were amazing ! My favorite brunch items.

ToUT6EKWyOM97xjLtIUijg.text: I used Postmates for the first time and  have wanted to try this place for awhile. I ordered 2 things, the buffalo cauliflower and pom burger. Where should we start. Everything was completely squishy. The fries, burger itself was like baby food, the lettuce,  the tiny thin sliced of tomato. The  bread wasn't though, it was dry and crumbling to bits. The onion was the butt so it was just the hard tiny rings left over. The cauliflower was limp and when I picked it up it just flopped over. There were 3 small cherry tomatoes as garnish and one was even rotten with a big black spot on it! I paid 38$ for this crap? It must have been sitting under a heat lamp for hours or this is just how it is I don't know but Never never again.

qpQIWlC2Plfai_vTIqYV1g.text: The food was good, not great. The service was decent. 2 Juices, French Toast w/eggs, nachos, and a bowl of yellow curry with rice and veggies came to ~$70. The food and service deserve 3.5/4 stars, but you do healthy eating and the planet a disservice with food priced like that. There is no way the ingredients used cost more than 10 dollars. If they cared about the planet they would set a price point which more people can afford. I hope they at least pay their servers 15-20/hr. That being said I would never mention any of this, if I didn't see all this big talk of helping the planet and animals out in their menu. But if you're going to use that as part of your schtick you'll be judged on it. People Planet Profit, talk is cheap.

v-j9Zfwyyn2Iw9qV_0Ekqw.text: Went for lunch today and was blown away by the amazing flavors of the quesadilla as well as the humus and veggies.  Leslie was so sweet and so good at describing each item, food and drink.  The lemonade was savory to the last drop and extremely thirst quenching.  I would recommend this to anyone regardless of whether you are vegetarian or not as I am not.

a61nfc6TAUBmjZEuQJSkzw.text: The kale salad is fantastic, especially the dressing! Lots of vegan and vegetarian offerings that are filling.  My only cautions are the raw desserts really aren't that tasty and most of the entrees contain too much bell pepper.  However, the cowgirl cookies are a big favorite with my husband and son.  The special lemonades are also quite good if a bit pricey (refills aren't free so pace yourself).  This is one of the best vegetarian restaurants in the East Valley and the staff is very friendly - especially Matt!

zH3JRcjGAbW8nqxGZdjnmA.text: Sometimes it's difficult to really feel satisfied with a raw vegan diet , but every time I go to Pomegranate's I leave more than satisfied.   The atmosphere is welcoming and delightful, although very busy during the lunch rush. I did have to share a table with a stranger last time I was there but the stranger turned out to be a great lunch companion.  This is a must for anyone who is considering (or already is) a raw and/or vegan diet.  Everything is so yummy you won't know it is good for you!

_hh-vJFuQcDKinF6-wko2A.text: I'm not a vegan or vegetarian but I love my veggies and people who are creative enough to be vegan/vegetarian. My friend and I had a reservation for lunch. Right on time our table was ready, our wait staff was knowledgeable and friendly, and we got great service given how packed it was around lunch. My only complaint was being forced to pick just one dish! Everything looked and tasted wonderful. I had a beet burger (a first for me and I LOVE beets). Most beets can be VERY earthy but this was a beautiful and delicious mix of herbs and spices. They served it with a great aioli sauce, a kale salad and sweet potato fries. My friend had the walnut meat salad which was HUGE but she said it tasted great. We had the Hibiscus Cooler and Green Apple Lime Refresh. It was a bit pricy but no more so than a good sushi lunch. The portions were very generous. The atmosphere was great, lots of couples, families, young and old, and all very down to earth. They also had an extensive GF, GFO, and RAW (basically uncooked)  selection. At some point I'm going back for the RAW! Arizona Roll (vegan sushi) and Abundance juice soon.

C0Equd1JTQIcv7ZtS9Nlzg.text: We eat here often, and really enjoy the food and the staff.  But come on, turn down the florescent lights and turn up the heat.   And it's time for some decor--the garage sale chic is wearing pretty thin.

QmDGuvd63_OQaoX_fO11ow.text: Very good fresh food. Little expensive as expected from a place serving healthy fresh food and also vegan options. There was a long wait. We went on a Sunday morning. The juices menu was very tempting :). We ordered pancake, scrambled eggs, and avocado egg sandwitch. Avocado sandwitch was very yummy. Kids were happy with eggs, pancake, and coconut ice cream.

7ugu_DV9g9LvMFKdBxcKkg.text: The food prepared by Marlene and Cassie of Pomegranate Cafe is FANTASTIC. I had the opportunity to attend a retreat that they came to be the chefs for. Everything they set out -- breakfast, lunch, and dinner -- tasted fresh and delicious. From the handmade granola accompanied with fresh-cut fruit, to the vegetarian spring rolls + peanut sauce, to the veggie burgers, to the apple + berry crisp, to the veggie penne + pesto. I know this is not a review about the cafe itself, but I am here to say that anything produced by these two ladies will nourish you, mind and body. If I ever get the chance to come out to the Phoenix, AZ area, Pomegranate Cafe will be on my itinerary for sure.

BQ1YuNsWbJlDoqp5pm7WHg.text: NOT Gluten Free!  I requested a gluten free avocado sandwich. The sandwich was brought to the table with the the statement "we are out of avocados." I took 2 bites and realized something was wrong. I went back to the server and asked if she were sure it was a gluten free? She came back to the table with a plate of bread and said "no, not all the way but here is gluten free bread for you." I handed her back my original plate shocked And she walked away. No I'm sorry. No what can I do. Very ignorant as to what gluten free means. Eat at your own RISK!

gYbgdf9btgZNX6HY8aKEjQ.text: I love vegetarian restaurants! I support them 200%. So glad this place exists in Phoenix. The quality of the food is beyond excellent. The meals are creative and super tasty. Never disappointed. The only qualm I have is the service. It...is...slow. Whether it's the time it takes for my meal to reach my table or the cashier taking my order to ring it up correctly. The length of time it takes should not be so long. Prices are a bit steep but most vegetarian/vegan restaurants are priced a bit higher than others. I don't mind paying more for quality. Overall this place is a favorite weekend visit. I can't wait for my next meal at Pomegranate Cafe.

V3sEcNBZIcZJqjRFN1Msfg.text: Went on a Sunday when Pomegranate had a freshly made Coconut Lime Cake.  I have discovered a new reason to live  :) mmmmm

lvHE88XrNuJGg76fkWURaA.text: Breakfast food is the best food. I order a tofu scramble burrito and my partner ordered the Ranchero skillet. I loved mine. I tried a few bites of the Ranchero skillet  and that was awesome, despite the super hard tortilla it came with. I enjoyed the earthy ambiance and love eating organic. I am curious to try this place out again. However, I am not sure how often I could realistically eat there based on the prices. Over $30 for 2 breakfast entrees, a lemonade, and an iced americano is a bit pricey.  Overall, my first time at Pomegranate Cafe was a delicious experience.

ffVpz6i6MqraSa2pMQwU6w.text: Was really excited to try and was super disappointed.  I ordered the breakfast scramble which would of been wonderful if it hadn't been completely drenched in oil.  The staff also needs to learn how to smile and greet people.  I sometimes pop in for coffee after yoga.  Often standing there for five minutes just wishing someone would make eye contact, smile, and say hello. It's not very big or ever super busy so out of the 3-4 people working you would think one of them could look up and say hello.  Coffee is great though.  :)

YwzqG91nqkfPItgYyuvaqA.text: I am so happy I now do not have to drive all the way to Tempe or downtown Phoenix to find a place which has healthy food to support my dietary needs. This place is awesome!  They are just coming out of their newbie stage so give them a chance as they are getting busy and also still learning like a new place should. But truly this place is a winner, great food, and wonderful herbal teas and smoothies. They also have raw food amazing cakes, and gluten free choices.  Give it a try....it is not fast food so be patient and enjoy! Hope they keep the same familiar faces as regulars  like to see familar employees. Susan~ Awatukee Resident

-zlzJJJ9mOy5wGejp3aUOg.text: What a fantastic breakfast! My husband and I were searching high and low in the Ahwatukee area for a good breakfast spot. We recently moved to the area and are not into the chain restaurants or fast food joints. Pomegranate Cafe fit the bill perfectly. Breakfast was healthful and delicious with lots of flavorful ingredients like avocado, kale, pesto and nuts. We had the Green Garden Protein Bowl and the Breakfast Burrito- they were both a huge hit. Cassie, one of the owners, was delightful and helpful as we were making our selections. The restaurant itself is colorful and cheerful. We will definitely keep the Pomegranate on our 'must eat there often list.'

QGhESWovmW4nHrwXfVr_2A.text: This place transformed our life!  We are vegetarian, but wanted to give the raw thing a try.  I was very impressed with the creative, delicious meals and desserts!  My kids were even impressed.  The dishes are a little pricey, but I am willing to pay because I know that a lot of effort, time and quality ingredients go into making this type of food.  I love the food, the atmosphere and the nice people that work there.  I will always try to work in a visit here when I come to Phoenix!

SdoGnkkukY0CIjHFfrrm8g.text: Food was delicious, but the service was fairly slow. Don't go there if you need a quick lunch, but if you have the time, you'll leave satisfied.

Zj1nZ80xCuOc7C6pcwdkFw.text: Suhhhh good. Tad 'spensive, but worth it for the quality of ingredients.

SAk31mtv905Zh-xRSe1bIg.text: I had great service and the food was excellent! The juice is really good, the abundance is my fav. The cute short waitress with long brown hair and blue eyes working was very polite and informative. Definitely coming back.

ZbzfgFTlrsBxBfrbOP3S_Q.text: I tried this place based on a recommendation of a co-worker.  I was very excited, so we ordered a variety of items.  The food was just average at best.  The tacos were so salty I couldn't finish them...what the heck!?!?  The salads were pretty good, but nothing over the top.  I don't think I will be trying this again....expected better based on the prices I paid.

FhLJ6UJ-dPVJWeu9-h8d-g.text: This place never fails to impress me AND NO, I AM NOT A VEGETARIAN. Why do you ask?

TpBvM-c7NYxual7pcm68UA.text: The raw chocolate banana cake was fantastic! I had the burger of the day, which was sweet potato, and it was very flavorful. As an omnivore (non-vegan?), I was very satisfied with this place. It was a bit pricey for my tastes, but I realize those food costs are high to begin with. I would recommend it!

WdFXkbdFNomvl4xYaP1saA.text: Great combinations of healthy food.  I'm a fan of the smoothies as well.  Kind of pricey, but not unreasonably so.

T0qW9iiGGcy8zefLLeMahQ.text: I was so excited to try a new place with vegan food, but my experience was completely ruined by the horrendous service. The food we ordered was decent- we tried the nachos (which were okay, but kind of soggy and used a lot of fake vegan cheese) and a veggie bowl (which was much better but not something you can't find at most vegetarian places). The service during our meal was not particularly fast, but average. However, after our meal, we paid and ordered dessert from their counter up front. We expected that we would pay for it and they would hand it to us from inside the glass case. No- instead we waited over an hour for it. I spoke with someone behind the counter after half an hour, thinking they lost the order (why they needed an order to hand us something from behind the counter is beyond me), but the person said we need to wait and would be called when our order was ready. After about 45 minutes, I thought maybe they weren't going to hand us dessert from the display but were instead making it from scratch. Again, no! I was getting ready to walk out of the restaurant and never return when they called us to the counter and handed us our order (a slice of cake) from behind the counter in a box. Why I had to wait over an hour for that is beyond me and I was incredibly angry. Additionally, I was checking my credit card statement after our visit and we were charged an extra seven dollars (presumably for a tip) after we left a generous, undeserved twenty percent tip at our table. We will never return to this establishment and would definitely not recommend it to anyone.

6EZQFe4nsxr7NKzmaL3uDA.text: REALLY expensive but honest food. I really have to budget in order to eat here, but often times just their drinks are good enough. I will say that although they are delicious the food left me in a funk that had me running to the bathroom (I walked there mind you). Either the wrap wasn't gluten free, or I just needed a major cleanse.

A7eFb3jo1OMA6BPSG3VoEw.text: I love this place. Sadly my family does not so I either need to eat alone or do takeout. The hummos is unique and light...I had a salad with what I think was cold quinoa. This opened the wonderful world of quinoa to me.   I love the pommegranite on the salad. So perfect. And the pesto was nummy as well.   I had a gift certificate the first time I web here. It was from a silent auction at our church. Subsequent visits made me realize the cost prohibitive nature of this wonderful cafe.   If I win the lotto I will visit this restaurant weekly.   Really wish they had some coupons or discount dates or frequent visitor program.

bpYNlBXpszedOynO5mhasg.text: This cafe is 100% vegetarian, with the vegan option available on every menu item.  From past experiences with veggie restaurants in Phoenix, this kind of classification would probably make me less eager to try the place......  which is why I'm happy that the chef/owner instead chose to focus on the fact that they use fresh, local, and organic ingredients -- vegetarianism is more of an afterthought.  So we decided to try it yesterday for lunch.  To start, Pomegranate offers a wonderful selection of teas, coffees, and various juice/smoothie options.  I wanted something cool and caffeinated, so I ordered the toddy, which features my favorite local roaster's beans -- Cartel.  My wife order a peach iced tea.  Very good, but if memory serves correctly, you won't find any drink options for less than $2.00 or so.  Then onto the main course.  I ordered the veggie burger, which is made from a sprouted tofu, served on a sprouted spelt bun, and garnished with cheddar cheese (or vegan cheese if you prefer), avocado, tomato, and a little tiny dollop of miso mayonnaise.  It also comes with a catch-all selection of sides: salad, tortilla chips, fruit slices, and a pickle.  $10 or so.....  Here's my take on the burger:  The spelt bun was better than any other spelt bun/bread that I've ever had before.  This was perhaps the second most notable part of this burger.  The most notable was the patty itself, which had a nice mellow nutty flavor -- not trying too hard to be be fake beef and not overpowering in soy flavor.  It was actually one of my favorite veggie burgers ever.  But here's my beef with the preparation: too skimpy on the rich, fatty stuff.  There was a very thin slice of cheese and almost nothing of the single condiment provided, which the menu told me was a miso mayo.  Thanks to the avocado, it was still a little rich, but not the kind of juicy decadence that I've always felt characterizes a great burger.  And seriously, I would have liked to have tasted the miso mayonnaise, but instead added my salad dressing to the burger to make it less dry, and this basically obscured whatever taste the mayo may have offered.  The salad was just fine, garnished with what seemed like a raw berry dressing of some sort.  I had no idea that the white stuff in the plastic cup was also for the salad (apparently a living caesar dressing), until the meal was almost over.  I thought it was my mayonnaise for the burger.  Next time, I'll try to get it right and see how the salad tastes with both dressings.  We also tried the hummus, mainly because it's the perfect baby-appropriate snack for my son to sling all over the restaurant (the remarkably polite staff was also quite pleasant about bringing in a messy toddler, by the way, which is a plus).  The hummus was actually quite tasty, but somehow not in a "traditional" way.  It seemed a little crisper and fresher than most hummus I've had, which was a nice complement to the fresh veggies served with it.  My only additional request for the hummus is that perhaps the restaurant could throw in a few tortilla chips as well?  My wife tried the vegan BLT, made with a tempeh-based bacon.  It must have been tasty, because this is one of the first times I've missed my opportunity to try a bite of her dish.  She literally devoured it and then criticized me for nitpicking at the veggie burger's preparation.  I'm pretty sure she'd give this place a 5-star rating, and she may convince me to do the same on our return visit with the in-laws, who have been looking for a place like this.  Oh, one final note.  I spoke with the chef/owner after our meal, to offer our compliments and inquire about the cuisine and the marketplace, etc.  She mentioned something that should be readily apparent to most foodies, which is that the key to providing tasty veggie options is to go with a macrobiotic whole food focus -- this approach de-emphasizes the constraints and instead focuses on building a good meal from quality ingredients.  Well done, chef.

zVkyP9aZz1cr0zAppAib3Q.text: I'm in love! Their brunch options are fabulous for vegans (yay for me!) and omnivores (yay for most people I take with me!). I am crazy about the Lumberjack breakfast sandwich with tofu and vegan cheese, their breakfast burrito is amazing and kept me full all day. I try to get there once a week at least and always treat myself to one of their yummy vegan desserts. The raw cheesecake is to die for, their cupcakes are fantastic (I even got some from their wonderful pastry chef for my birthday and they were a HUGE hit with friends). I can't recommend them enough!

R7cMSLC612uYnIrg4I86rw.text: I have eaten at Pomegranate 4 or 5 times since it originally opened. I have never, NEVER, gotten my food in under 35 minutes. Keep in mind I generally order for myself, and at most, one other person. Recently I was made to wait nearly an hour for 2 sandwiches. I was one of 3 other people in the restaurant, and I was asked two times after paying what I had ordered. They offered me a "couple of desserts for the wait." Instead I received a single bite sized cookie. The food isn't terrible when they actually make what you ask ( I have asked for no olives on my salads 3 times, and always end up with olives) but it certainly isn't worth the price, or the time it takes. I have wasted several lunch breaks at Pomegranate. I've given this place way too many chances.

OjPE35wloVcQH9UBOv9t1Q.text: My hubs and I love this place. The first time we found it by searching online for veg-friendly places. We found this one, came with family for his bday, and it's been a tradition ever since. Unfortunately, it's far from where we live. We were in N. Scottsdale and now we're in N. Phoenix, so it's always been a hike. But it's been a hike worth taking! The food is amazing and ever changing. We usually like to check out whatever is on the daily specials board. The desserts are equisite! We even had them make our wedding cake (berry lemon ginger vegan cheesecake). My favorite drink is Cassie's latte, either hot or cold. The lumberjack sandwich, the almond joy, the quesadillas...all amazing and vegan! (or with eggs and cheese for other tastes). Everyone is friendly and helpful. And, it's great to see the owners rolling up their sleeves and doing hard work too. Our only regret is we don't live closer to come every week!

Wh4y5mdz_pcDHBPBJbOhNA.text: Lovely! Rates are on the higher side but the dishes are unique and never eaten before... moreover its all vegan..I liked the grand chilli burrito!

9KatZMLXgaKMkhpZv1nzvQ.text: I have to flip a coin to decide between this place and Chakra 4, and even 24 Carrots down the road from Poms. They all are similar in options and prices, but I prefer 24 Carrots as they 100% vegan and a quite bit friendlier. Service can be hit or miss, and there is an older lady that growls at us sometimes -- and I am not the only one that has imagined this. She's been out the last several times I have visited, so I'm happier about that. Yes, they are pricey, but in line with their competition. Parking can be a PITA during the weekend. Seems to appeal to the ladies brunch crowd, but the estrogen decor is not out of control.

QUlIav8SHDWbt3i_v0izew.text: 3.5 --Decided to try this place based on reviews. Was thinking it would be busy but when I walked in not too many people. I went to counter said it was my first visit gave me a menu. Lots of items on the menu. Opted for seasonal omelet, egg whites, cheese, hash, toast. They do offer vegan choices(vegan cheese, tofu). It took a bit to receive my coffee (served gentleman behind me first) and my meal. The plate was plentiful and very fresh. The hash were a potatoes, squash with rosemary. Different but good. The omelet was also fresh but not quite enough cheese. The veggies were squash, carrots (orange, yellow, purple). All in all, I would give this place another shot. Love the freshness...My meal was $14

4H4SC_KvKrjvmANf_5b4lQ.text: I'm not vegetarian, or vegan, but I was charmed by this restaurant.  My omelet was delicious and I loved the lemon ice water pitchers. My vegan friends who were with me loved the place and go there often. I would go there again.

AHT1Cx-ZvutnBjLKlGw8gw.text: Food is awesome! Nutritious, fresh, flavorful. Five stars even though service is a tad slow and prices are high -- but that makes sense because fresh meals take longer to prepare and the ingredients cost more! Thank you Pomegranate!!

GDwl-xEPkgXQSN2DIIkYBw.text: Love this place. The vlt is my fav. The cowgirl cookies are the bomb.

ZLy_BB_5nDaogwu4jsePOw.text: This is the best food I have had in a while, so good!  I had the BLT with veggie bacon and it was awesome and totally satisfying.  My son had the humus and veggies, which he loved.  My husband and mother in law had the vegie burger, which they did not rave about, but said that it was ok.  It is a very cheery interior and we saw some other families come in and dine as well (always good to find more child-friendly places).  This place is truly a gem, will definitely be back!

OqUOX2M-qTW4dTLDhZ81Eg.text: Great restaurant concept!  The food was super healthy and very yummy... I'm coming back soon.

CHO5pCKYjHrJ3Gg-yPgo9Q.text: After Matt's encouragement to return, and letting me know the pancackes I had were prepared, not according to recipe, I returned today.  And, so very glad I did!  He was working, and after a bit of discussion I decided on the "in season scramble".   He had me at "seasonal hash".   I opted for eggs, vegan cheese and requested a side of the salsa, as I do like eggs spiced up a bit it.   The whole grain toast perfect, not too seedy or bland.   The hash; a combination of roasted butternut squash, yukon potatoes and sweet potatoes forced me to devour every morsel.   The fresh squeezed orange juice reminded me to pull out my juicer, so worth the effort.   Marlene offered me a seasonal spice cookie.   Yeah, ate that as soon as I got home, Fall has arrived.    This family owned gem is in my neighborhood, I so want it to endure all the strip mall changes locally.  I will bring friends and family, one can pig-out and feel good about it.   Thank you Matt for the 2nd chance, everyone deserves one.  I look forward to many more healthy meals.  Congrats on making in the Top New Restaurants, of Phx. Magazine.  Quite an accomplishment, for the litte restaurant who does make big healthy meals, vegan or not.

jQY1MyWp4JFpGiYlfyXraw.text: I saw that Pomegranate Cafe was one of the best new restaurants in Phx, so i went to Yelp to read more about it. I had lunch there this week- had the Super Green Kale Salad and thought it was fantastic! The flavors were so complex and yummy, i swooned over every bite! I left there feeling healthier!  People have commented that they felt it was pricey but worth it! I felt i totally got my mone's worth, and didn't even think about price.  Marlene and her daughter go to such extremes to discover new ways to make their recipes taste so delicious, and being all organic and  so incredibly fresh, i would've paid more than I did for the experience!  The cafe has such a friendly, neighborhood feeling, and the perfect place to go after shopping for groceries at Trader Joe's!  I highly recommend you give Pomegranate a try! You will keep it on your list of delicious, healthy eats!

HLG4bI_LtD91BdwVCDbOpw.text: This is a great "health nut" restaurant. The food is high-quality and tasty. They have a couple of raw entrees on their menu as well as vegetarian dishes. The place is busy, so their food is always fresh due to the quick turn-over of food. The  food is high-quality, so I would say the prices are fair. Anyone who shops at Whole Foods can appreciate the cost that went into this food.

SrorpJTtbklSx5CFuULmow.text: Preface-  I am not a vegan and my wife is preggers.... This place had us pretty apprehensive looking at the menu but we took a leap and tried the vegan hash and an Athena's wrap. Absolutely amazingly good. This is easily now in my favorite restaurant list. Everything we tried was delicious.

qyJAIVpZ1HRcPEKUh6cZZg.text: I've been in there often due to convenient location, but, I usually do not feel good physically after eating there.  I've ordered things with cheese, but, I'm very concerned that possibly I may have been getting dairy cheese instead of vegan cheese.  They say they are vegan AND vegetarian.  But, I realize if they are offering dairy cheese & eggs on their menu, I feel extremely uncomfortable with that.    As much as they write they are organic, using local companies, etc., the part that would make them appear ethical....the very fact that they offer dairy & egg products, makes them no different than any ordinary restaurant.  Dairy products are the cruelest industry out there - even more than ordinary meat, &, it's already been proven that even a small amount of dairy causes cancer.  I need to start going back to strictly vegan restaurants, even if they are farther from where I live.  I wish Pomegranate Cafe would just let go of the non-vegan foods.  If they are supposedly so knowledgeable about health, organic, etc., they need to catch up to the several vegan restaurants who are making spectacular tasting foods.

qbK6sbc37m3EZxiHUBZycw.text: Every time I come here it's a consistent experience. Friendly staff, great menu and selection, and I'm never disappointed. One of the best vegan places I've eaten in the area.

DvjwfSj6D1oWrgmL3bBdFw.text: I absolutely love these types of places, the varieties, atmosphere and mindset. Went here Sunday for brunch and it was very busy, aside from the very long wait to be seated and for our food, the service was great and the food was very delicious! I love the lattes and will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pom breakfast

Uh_-zw1hgm6Cz9vexxpC-g.text: What a great place! Our wait was a bit long, but that's to be expected at noon and with so few vegan options in the city. Every thought my we had was bursting with flavor. At the end our server thanked us for our patience with complimentary truffles. Can't wait to eat here again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary truffles as a thank you for patience at the lunch rush.

9zytykqI2Eq8JEbHhGqFGQ.text: Loved this place. The smoothies were not too sweet and the portions were very generous. Would love to try other items when I return to AZ next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bandito bowl I believe!

bgz34z_2W_unFAwUEK3wuw.text: My husband and I returned as one of the meals was comped. Very different experience,  much more organized,  food great and new manager came over and spoke to us about past experience and any suggestions.  I did feel acknowledged and thanks Cassie for the chance to give Pomegranate cafe another chance and create a new impression. We have been here a lot in the past and happy to see they listen to their customers.

56ZULcIAHV1X0rSKmFOQ1w.text: This is my favorite place in Arizona, The staff is lovely and they put so much love in their food I highly recommend to drive to this place even though its miles away! Its worth every dollars you spend. Thank you for making my birthday so special every year

a-603GiH3FGnwOknGmAebA.text: Enjoyed this place but be warned it is crazy expensive.  My sister had a $14 hot tea and I had a $9 fresh powerade type drink.  Both not very big for what you get.  It was yummy but you have to be in the mood to splurge.  Kids did not like the french toast which is much more like banana bread served with syrup.  They also weren't thrilled with the mac and cheese which is white and quite bland.  I absolutely loved my tacos with tofu and guacamole and roasted vegetables.  I will for sure order it again.  We had 2 adults and 3 kids for breakfast.  The total with tip was over $100.  Ambiance is fun and service was wonderful and friendly.

memXvqfjV2LaatPEm7ft3Q.text: So, I am not a vegan, nor am I vegetarian, however, this place rocks my world! Super friendsly (and not overly cheesy) staff, BOMB food, fresh juice, smoothies, espresso and yes, even alcohol.   Raw food options that will blow your mind. The flavor profiles in their dishes are phenomenal. Whoever this chef is knows what's up!  Even if you're not into the whole vegetarian/raw/vegan lifestyle, you will be surprised at how good this place is.   I am currently pregnant and unable to have caffeine and I really miss and crave coffee. The always friendly staff is eager to recommend something new and on my last visit I was turned on to Jnantik. This is a Mayan superfood coffee substitute that actually tastes/smells similar to coffee! They mix it right in with their Pom milk (a blend of various nut and soy milks) and serve it as a latte. So not only did this satisfy my coffee craving, but it is packed with vitamins and minerals to give me a natural energy boost!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jnantic Mayan superfood coffee alternative. Yum! Served with warm Pom milk.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jnantic Mayan superfood coffee alternative. Yum! Served with warm Pom milk.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour Raw Tacos Vivos!

ga9qgU2XYM52TZxRqHTSXA.text: Our meals were fresh, healthy, and delicious! The downside was a long wait for the meal... but yummy so worth the wait.   Our server was happy and attentive with water/orders et cetera.   The maca mocha was DELICIOUS and small for the price ($10!?)... but man, so good. I wish I had another one!  Weird it's in a strip mall, but once you're inside you forget that... especially because of the prices. Am I in Malibu? We spent $95 for brunch for 3 people (one app, 3 meals, 2 coffees)... I expect those prices in LA or NY, so that was a bit disappointing to find them in a strip mall off the freeway.   Portions are generous though. I took my leftovers home and discovered some SYSCO plastic cooked in with my tofu! Glad I saw it before I could take a bite, but does make me wonder what is going on in the back....   Either way, I'd come back! I'd comb through my food a little more carefully and savor my maca mocha a little more slowly.

BVabljLgS5xe4kjJEBt-ag.text: Organic, seasonal, vegetarian and local - music to my ears!  Plenty of indoor seating and quite a few tables outdoors (though you can't sit outside if you order alcohol...just yet. I overheard that they will be building a contained area).   Extensive menu full of vegetarian and vegan options. I was spoiled for choice! I asked the server to recommend a smoothie and he suggested the Greena Colada - great selection; it was delicious although rather pricey at $10 for a glass. Yikes.  For eats, I ordered the Big Kahuna burger (sweet potato and black bean) in a collard wrap with root veggie fries and pom bbq sauce. Again, I thought it was a little pricey at $14 but I have to admit that it was tasty and filling.  It might not be a place that you could afford to eat at regularly, but it definitely is worth a trip once in a while. Tasty food, incredible selection, vast drinks menu (including a few organic beers), and we had a super friendly and helpful server. Oh, and their restroom is cute!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Organic, vegetarian, seasonal and local.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger selection when we visited.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Greena Colada. Pricey but delicious!

zR-gS3exfhlWBvdXRqMPSw.text: Good and tasty all healthy options, great vibe. A bit expensive but good food is worth the money. I'll definitely go back.

WRHNIwhA_Qjvw-xGGv51hw.text: I made the trip from Scottsdale all the way to here to finally try it out after obsessing over their facebook/instagram. Being a vegetarian, it is always so awesome to find an all vegetarian (or vegan) place, I only can think of a few others in the Phoenix area!  The cafe is really cute, near a trader joes which I think is a fitting location haha. Went at like 3pm on a Saturday and there was a pretty good crowd, I'm sure they get busy in there! I liked the decor and how the water was served in mason jars, pretty cute. It was so hard to decide what to order. Everything looked so amazing, totally my type of food! I ended up getting a burrito. I can't remember the name of it but it had a ton of veggies and was covered in red sauce. They used cashew cheese too which I love! The food was amazing and fresh and I nearly ate the whole burrito! Only downside: it was $15 for one burrito. I know it's all good quality ingredients and such but that seemed a little outrageous for me. Food was so good though Id come back. Id like to try something else on the menu too! Definitely a must-try for vegans and vegetarians, yummy!

5t41sTTWPl9bM7AXFAYI7g.text: This place is great if you're vegetarian or vegan. They have tons of options. The food is pretty good and they have a lot of good smoothie and juice choices. I had the chai latte with the pom milk and I loved it!! I'll come back and try the lunch or dinner options I wasn't crazy about breakfast though.

pPnFc93VXQnv537KkEktBA.text: Busy on a Saturday for lunch, but so worth the 10 minute wait. Best Vegan anywhere! The Street Tacos were so good.

4AnhkxpLHZryvPRbf_jDVA.text: My absolute favorite restaurant!! My husband and I come here a few times a month for date night. We always get the Arizona Roll and Gila Monster Nachos, but this past time we also split the Baja Burger... so delicious. The whole meal was simply amazing! Thank you Pomegranate Cafe!!

EbltgD-5O64dZGKiikHTsA.text: I love this place! It's a little pricey, but that's to be expected with any restaurant serving up healthy fare with quality ingredients. I've come here for breakfast and lunch and have never been disappointed. The Green Goddess Burger and the french toast are my two go-to's.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast - YUM!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Goddess Veggie Burger

slM3M-lMxHe7IEstJDlKdg.text: I am allergic to gluten and eggs, so it was nice to find a place that supported food allergies. However the food was over-the-top happy. That's the only word I could think of to describe it :-). Everything is organic , but they go further in making the ingredients only available in its alternative form. For example, organic maple syrup was the only option. Coconut whipped cream was the only option.  Much of the food tasted like cardboard. I had cranberry pancakes that were free and egg free, vegan, and they were not good.  For someone that has severe allergies and likes alternative ingredients, this would be a good place to go. Great atmosphere, good patio to sit on, but more expensive than the average.

RMMmYRuoS-Hpx7jIfgklEw.text: I've eaten at the Pomegranate many times, and never had a disappointing experience. It's my favorite vegan restaurant! The food is fresh, original, and always memorable. You can eat healthy and enjoy the food at the same time. I recommend everyone give it a try for a wonderful experience.  Besides the great food, I admire the courage and compassion of the owners. They stand up for diversity, for love, and for inclusivity. I will always spend my money at a place that aligns with my values.

UUjDQj6yLz0II44JviHGow.text: For starters, I am not a vegan. I am not even a vegetarian, but a total omnivore. I can't get enough of this place. It is my go to brunch option for the jackfruit crab cakes benedict alone. The food is just simply amazing. This is going to sound cheesy, but it's as if I can taste the painstaking care that has gone into every morsel. It is food I can feel virtuous about eating and the atmosphere is oh so cute.  Everything from the smoothies, to the lentil walnut tacos, to the cauliflower buffalo wings is divine. A True treasure.

A98068zR0EApjST_GvJMiw.text: I. Love. This. Place. I live in San Tan Valley, so this pretty far from me. About 45/50 minutes. That didn't stop me tho. The food was hot, fresh and full of flavor. It is kind of expensive but you're getting good quality food. The avocado bfast sandwich is my favorite!! The macadamia pesto has a great flavor with their seasoned tofu and the avocado just makes it blend so well. I'm craving it all over again. And the hibiscus cooler was sweet and refreshing. I would definitely drive here again, it's so worth it to me!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunrise wrap
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pomegranate green tea
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hibiscus cooler

fR_BBlFYlaMC0O01k1avYQ.text: Such a great 1st experience. My breakfast was amazing, I love that they use metal straws. I left with 3 bakery items as well. I can't wait to go back and try more things. Oh and their mimosas are delicious we had an apple cider one this morning. If your food doesn't come with the hash order it on the side you won't be disappointed

gEA9GqiTDb1W5-xO9154rA.text: Awesome spot for delicious vegan food! I had the tu-nut sandwich and it was tasty and filling. Service was really good and this cafe has good vibes. My only gripe was that I didn't feel like my smoothie was worth the $10 price tag, so I will skip that next time. There's also an interesting health food market. They also have plenty of vegan and gluten-free pastries. Definitely check it out!

_m11mVI5oqRglGLwVcsyZQ.text: I've been to Pom multiple times and I am always happy with the food.  Although expensive, it's fresh and yummy.  The service is hit or miss... unfortunately today was a huge miss and I'm not sure we will be back.   We arrived on bike with our two hungry kiddos (3.5 and 8 months). We were greeted and sat right away and ordered two drinks (a cold tea and a hot tea). Our drinks arrived about 10 minutes after we ordered them and were delivered by someone other than our server. 10 minutes after we got our drinks I asked one of the other staff members to please let our server know that we would like to order. About 3-5 minutes after that she came to take our order.  At this point we had been there for almost a half hour already.  She put our order in and we watched 3 parties that had arrived after us receive their food.  15 minutes later our 3.5 year olds food arrived. About 5-8 minutes after that my husband and I got our food minus the avocado toast...our server said the toast would be right out (it never came).  The food was good- no complaints there but the service was horrible. The server did remove the avocado toast (obviously) but didn't even bat an eye about how slow our service was or the fact that we were there for an hour and a half for lunch with two young kids.  I was visibly peeved but decided not to say anything while we were there as to not interrupt anyone else service- they were clearly not staffed appropriately for a Saturday morning/afternoon. I am all about relaxing and have a lot of patience when it comes to restaurants because I worked in one for 7 years through college. What I see time and time again at Pom is disorganization. There seems to be no rhyme or reason to the order of the service.  We ordered 2 dishes and a chimpanzee bowl for our toddler (which is literally cereal and a side of milk) and saw THREE other parties get there food before us who arrived well after us. They were hot dishes too, not just salads or cold wraps that would take less time. Ahwatukee is growing with more and more options for great food.  It's too bad that we had this experience today.

GFRNDTEVdJXOP6N0LnZezA.text: Stopped by with my in laws today and was so pleased. We all got the strawberry bubbles cocktail; it was so refreshing and not strong over overpowering at all. We also go the bountiful bowl and jackfruit crab cakes...everything was delicious. We also left with some sweets at the end; a blueberry muffin and some cookie dough truffles (all gluten free which is AMAZING) and I have no complaints. A wonderful spot!!

hupiGuPg62Hp3q-hrZMDoQ.text: The food here is fabulous. We had the Dragon bowl, and bar b que ranch salad .....great flavors. We love to eat here but today we sat outside and I think our server forgot about us, when we eventually received our food (different server) it was cool / luke warm. We appreciate wholesome vegan food options and appreciate what Pomegranate Cafe offers. Passed on dessert because we didn't want to wait another 30 minutes to receive it. Arrived excited. Left full, but a little disappointed.

Cex_jVusayf6AhIztYhdbA.text: Order an elephant bowl, save an animal's life! I love that this cafe donates a portion of their earnings on certain items towards worthy causes. I ordered the elephant bowl partially because of this (Wildlife SOS receives $1 from each bowl sold). I also had an iced lavender latte.   The elephant bowl comes with your choice of protein and carb. I chose the walnut meat and kelp noodles. I got the order to go and took a seat to wait for my meal.   The lavender latte was made first and was light and refreshing. It had a hint of the lavender flavor but the main component I could taste was the creamy coconut milk. They use Peixoto coffee which is great since they are an excellent local company that roasts fabulous coffee beans.  The main meal took quite a bit of time to make. I think I was waiting nearly 30 minutes but all the staff members were very apologetic about it. My bowl came in a compressed paper container in a brown paper bag. I placed the bag securely on the passenger side floor mat and I was on my way home.  While driving on the way home the curry in the bowl was so watery that it spilled out of the container (Which was on the shallow side and did not have a sauce-proof seal) all over the bag, which caused the bag to leak all over my floor mat. A day later I am still trying to air out my car because curry+ hot car is not a good fragrance in a small enclosed space in the AZ heat!  The actual bowl though was a hefty portion with lots of vegetables, walnut meat, and noodles. The curry sauce that didn't spill out onto my car was full bodied and complimented the rest of the ingredients well. The kelp noodles were intriguing as this was my first time having them. They were clear, had a springy, chewy texture and neutral flavor.   The price was a little high, with my total being a little over $20 with tax. They do use high quality ingredients, use eco friendly packaging, and have generously sized portions to make up for the cost though.  While I enjoyed the bowl and latte, I would definitely not get any orders from here to go again. So, if I'm in the mood to dine in I'll try Pomegranate Cafe again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced lavender latte
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Elephant bowl with walnut meat and kelp noodles, to go portion

u97wZER3e28rov2o8MEU1g.text: Nice service. Breakfast burrito was really filling.  Packed with lots of healthy yummies. I probably won't need to eat lunch it was so filling, which makes me feel better about the $13.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really cute and yummy smells coming from the kitchen

pm2IXU1xSiXtXQBqw_eIDg.text: Best vegitiarian selection so have found.  A bit on the expensive side but worth it.  Gluten Free RED Velvet cupcake for my birthday pre order recommend. One sweet treat!  The also have baked sweet potato fries you just want to dive into.  Those alone could make a meal.  Local sourced food with green environment.  All around a great place for healthy foods disguised as sheer decadence.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My cupcake looked like a pink rose!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten Free Red Velvet Cupcake...pre order is recommended.  YUMMY!

ERicfQoBAvEXPqe8I2mHTw.text: My favorite restaurant I've literally ever eaten t and I'm not even vegan. Soooo good! I'm not from Arizona so every time I visit, I must go here and I think about for months on end until I can go again. The nachos are life changing and the raw bagel is sooo delicious!!! We had lots of yummy drinks and the gluten free chocolate cupcake was the best dessert I think I've had in my life. Literally unreal. YOU MUST GO HERE IMMEDIATELY!!! The sweetest people and the best food!! Didn't get a pic of our food because we devoured it so fast. Un-fricking real!!! The food is so delicious yet so light and yummy that you don't feel like crap after eating it. And I never say that about a plate of nachos!!! But not these nachos!! Vegan superfood goodness is prevalent and alive people!!

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PBCPXpBkqMpUfL_e2bETWg.text: What makes pomegranate special is the good service and wonderful outdoor setting the food is unique and delicious and a break from your typical bakery and sandwich themed restaurants.  The food is very hearty and filling and they have large portions. We got the burrito Bandito, and the grilled cheese sandwich, along with a coffee and iced tea. For dessert we got the chocolate cake which was vegan super dense and delicious. Sitting outdoors on the patio was very enjoyable, there are pigeons around that seem like they are regulars here as well and are fun to watch. They have fresh desserts made from scratch. We had to take ours to go because we got full off of just the burrito and even then had leftovers. The service was excellent, I highly recommend the pomegranate cafe to anyone.
