mwU_y-t7OXS7_CmDjSAGrg.text: Excellent food and idea. But service is slow and food takes forever and ever and ever.

ODgL3Pp7pRYSOuHTkwTzfw.text: An update to my previous review:  I absolutely love POM and so does my pup! Their original location is cute, fun, and vibrant. They have friendly staff and delicious food and pastries. I can't get enough of their food! I've tried almost everything on their menu without disappointment. I haven't tried all of their desserts, but the ones I have tried are phenomenal.  One thing to note, if you've never been or only been a few times ... it WILL take a while for your food to come out - and that has nothing to do with their abilities. It's because they make their food fresh and more-often-than-not from scratch! So be kind and patient, because it'll be well worth it!

uy4OQxzotETq-KYYNvqcVQ.text: My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to Arizona for my birthday and the first place he brought me to was the Pomegranate Cafe!  First: My first initial reaction when I saw the Pomegranate Cafe was, "Omg how cute". The outdoor seating had succulents and mini cactus everywhere! My boyfriend and I walked into the cafe and we were immediately seated. As I look around the cafe, it felt very open and airy. We arrived in Phoenix around 9:30 am on a Friday, which explains why it wasn't so busy.  Second: We order the full size "Gila Monster Nachos" and the "Chimi `Chicken` Burrito. It didn't take any longer than 15 mins to get our food. The portion size for the nachos was huge! It was more than enough for both of us! We didn't even finish it! I'm getting hungry even thinking about the nachos right now. It was soooo good! We both loved everything about it! The cashew nacho cheese, the walnut taco meat, the chimichurri and baja sauce etc. My God, it was so yummy! Then the burrito came in, my boyfriend and I split the burrito because we didn't want to be overly full. The burrito had a lot of guacamole and it was warm (first initial reaction), I gave it a few more bites and I fell in love with it. THE  "CHICKEN" WAS COOK TO PERFECTION! Wtf, it's been 7 years since I had meat and that chicken was probably the closest thing to it! It was juicy and chewy and it tasted like they had seared the chicken! The combination of the beans plus the brown rice was a lot so I do recommend getting one of the other. My boyfriend said he probably would prefer it to be more of a dry burrito, but I didn't mind the gauc, I'll probably order it on the lighter side next time.  Finally: The end result, we loved it. We loved the food, the ambiance, our waitress was really nice. WE LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT POMEGRANATE CAFE!!!!!!!!!  Suggestions: COME TO CALIFORNIA and lighter Gauc for the burrtio!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ukz6M6ZWlb79Lg2eAmNs_w.text: Im traveling cross-country for work, and decided to stop by POM and was amazingly surprised.   The staff was so attentive and kind, even during the busy weekend brunch (which you should go to because the chick'n apple sausage is amazing). The Biscuits and Gravy was the first I've had since becoming a vegetarian, and it took me back to when my mother would cook it for me as a child.   While I waited for my to go order (Get the Fries!!), the waiter asked if I wanted another Passionfruit tea and even offered to make it to go since I was on my way out.  The bakery is STOCKED with amazing goodies. They even use reusable straws!  Stop here when you're traveling by, and you'll be SO happy you did.

x9IMpmhM8zgkmC9Fg2vn-Q.text: POM never disappoints! We had the nachos, mushroom street tacos and happy hour cheese crisp for dinner and all three were amazing! The chili con queso on those nachos is stuff made from the heavens!  We enjoyed after dinner cappuccino and Cassie's latte, with a couple of truffles and the cookie dough brownie. Again, these sweet treats were the perfect end to a wonderful dinner!  I've had the Thanksgiving dinner and treats before but this was the first time sitting down for dinner. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5cgd5UTVkghdCjNoiXfrvw.text: Super yummy food! Great menu selection with plenty to choose from. The food is delicious! I had the bountiful bowl, so tasty! The staff was very nice and the place has a cool vibe. Absolutely will go again, the food is crave worthy!!

km8p1XrqoOAtCkJo38mnkw.text: Love this place. Great vegan options. Perfect local Ahwatukee spot. There is no meat on their menu. Dog friendly. Service takes a little longer at times. Prices are a littler high.

MKFKWtCt7h_Q30calFhPQA.text: Pomegranate Cafe is my favorite restaurant in the whole Phoenix metro area. The food is fresh, healthy, and vibrant! The servers are friendly and I've never had a bad experience here, even on busy weekend mornings. The portions are generous, too! I would love to see them open a Phoenix location again. And I was thrilled to see that they host informative workshops by naturopathic doctors and other health and wellness experts. Not to mention the restaurant's support of wonderful animal welfare organizations!

O1iKPeynz1nrn4O3NP_DMg.text: Vegan, gluten free options, organic! Excellent place, great food, deserts and juices. In the past I've had hard time finding good food in Phoenix. Not now, definitely added to the list of places I will eat at.

5biZGOvbKp_K45TQ5F8b2A.text: I was pretty sceptical about this place from the other reviews that I had read on Yelp. It turned out to be a great place to eat. The only thing I would tell this restaurant to change is to get a bigger location because the place was packed when I went in for lunch.   As far as some of the issues that were mentioned in previous reviews, it looked like pomagrante cafe worked to fix them. No more paper plates and the restaurant was kept pretty clean, especially with how busy they were. While I was there another customer had dropped something and anywhere else it would have stayed there until they slowed down, not here though one of the employees who was delivering food to tables cleaned it up and was busing tables inbetween dropping off food. I was impressed.  There are some things in other reviews that are still True. Food does take a while there, which I think was mainly because of how busy they were. Plus portion sizes were a little on the small side, I felt that they were plety big enough to calm my appitiete, which was what I was going for.   As far as vegitarian/vegan places go, this one rocks. Check it out.

dV5T4UnVGkEniL0BuEeOnQ.text: Can't say enough good things about this restaurant. I am a total vegan food snob and Pomegranate does not disappoint. It's so difficult to even choose what to order because everything is amazing. The bowls and wraps are fantastic. The Elephant Bowl, California Love Wrap, and the Macro Greens Bowl are all wonderful. The tacos are killer. The desserts are sublime. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. On my most recent trip to Phoenix and Sedona I ate at many restaurants -trying to find great food and willing to pay up for it - and the meal I had at Pomegranate stood head and shoulders above anything else.

Fw2Oxnev6lO0_3Nf3fi3XA.text: Pretty bad experience. The service is lacking, good luck getting what you ordered!  All that healthy food must be rotting their brains!

ocoPHXz16a5AMyGe-yxGog.text: As a vegan and  a local I knew I had to try Pomegranate Cafe. And while I am thrilled to have another vegan-friendly restaurant in my area I can't help but feel disappointed.   We went in here for breakfast not long ago and the joint had a nice atmosphere and the staff was super friendly.  Here's the thing, though. While I was satisfied with just a fresh (moderately priced) vegetable juice, my girlfriend wanted to try their avocado sandwich. This thing runs you $7.50 and is tiny! More a bite than an actual breakfast, this item was definitely not worth it. Perhaps their other menu items have larger portions, and I would be more than willing to try Pomegranate Cafe again. But for my money, I'd much rather go down the road to 24 Carrots for breakfast.

8XAyFM92PFHGfa6KxXZArA.text: My cousin introduced me to Pomegranate and now I'm moving to AZ and into the neighborhood so I can regularly get my fix. I love eating and then feeling amazing afterward and that's what happens here.   Follow them on Facebook if you dare ... it will give you cravings like you won't believe! Everything looks amazing and tastes even better! Fresh, crisp, fruity, savory - whatever you're in the mood for they've got it.   My favorites: the everything "bagel", the daily quesadilla, and the homemade snickers bar. YUM!

tpiCW51av-r2BI9YZEUEYQ.text: I have had my ups and downs with Pomegranate, but mainly ups. They seemed to have a new manager my last visit and things seemed to have improved. I enjoyed sitting outside eating. I had the Strawberry Pom Milkshake. I tasted the Maca Magic, but preferred the Strawberry Pom. We had the Mac & Cheese and possibly some type of burger with pineapple I think. I can't 100% remember what I had to eat, but I enjoyed it.

BcrOoRCtUZYlHcTE-vd3Yw.text: As most reviews of this place state, the food is fresh, healthy and amazing. For us gluten-free seekers, there are many options that satisfy on the menu. The inside is large and spacious, casual. Service is not great, but this place also gets pretty busy around lunchtime. If you don't like vegan or vegetarian, this is not the place for you! There are no chicken sandwiches or turkey burgers here! I love the fresh smoothies, but they are quite pricey. Smoothies come in a mason size jar with a straw so this means you're getting a very small glass for about $8. But it's one of the only places of it's kind in our area. So if fresh, different and healthful is what you are craving, you will enjoy.

lyEqibSfcx57afxAb6ox2Q.text: So I've never found this restaurant by searching for local vegan places but it did come up because my co-worker was frazzled and needed WiFi if he was going to eat lunch. My being Vegan, this worked out really well.  He had the elephant bowl and a green apple lime refresher.  He was happy with both, the food is pricey but the quantity is good for 2 servings. I had the bountiful bowl which was a little bland but they have some nice hot sauce which spiced it right up.  The quinoa was cooked just right and I was very satisfied with my meal.  We will definitely go again, the Wifi was good too!

E164Kflp_bWSALBqnTDu4A.text: We just switched to vegan/plant-strong, so we were excited (and perhaps a bit hesitant) to attempt our first outing into the world of not being in control of cooking our own food. This visit left me comforted that there was at least one excellent vegan restaurant nearby ... AND affirmed our decision to embrace this new way of eating!   I'll start out with the one (potential) negative for us -- it was on the pricey side. My wife and I eat had a standard lunch entree (me -- Elephant Curry Quinoa/Tofu Bowl; her -- Tacos Vivas & Kale Salad), and we shared a smoothie of the day (Blood-Builder -- beet, carrot, OJ, mango, pineapple), and the ticket was $30+. Now, I'm not complaining - it was wonderful food (see my much longer list of positives below!) and huge portions, but still a bit more than I would have typically expected to pay for a weekday lunch for 2. Perhaps -- and I can probably believe it -- vegan/vegetarian is going to consistently cost us more now when we go out ... and if so, and if you're used to this, then this pricing probably wasn't out of the ballpark at all. So, with that in mind, and assuming this to be the case, I didn't let this negatively impact my rating. Will we be back?! Undoubtedly, and most likely often!   Now, for the positives!   Great atmosphere -- Very inviting. Casual and informal. We visited at what was probably the height of the lunch rush on a Friday. Pretty consistent traffic, and tables were available but at a premium. A little loud, but comfortable and simply attributable to people enjoying their meals and each other's company.   Excellent menu -- I was impressed with the variety offered. Choices were described creatively and yet were easily understood. Even us newbie vegans had some questions, though, and the staff were quick to answer and provide input. Granted, it was our first visit, but I really had difficulty deciding what to order, as many options intrigued me. I was completely satisfied with my final choice (Elephant Curry Tofu Bowl) -- hit the spot on a chilly January day in Phoenix! A HUGE selection of smoothies, including a couple of-the-day options. We passed on dessert, but the display case was filled with enticing options, too!   Portion size/value -- My wife and I both were impressed with the portion size. I finished mine (no surprise) but probably could have stopped sooner and been satisfied (did I mention it was SO good, though?!). Her purple-cabbage-bowl tacos were even larger, however, and absolutely overflowing with walnut meat, greens, avocado, and a spicy baja sauce. (Can't wait to test out the walnut "meat" with our girls soon...!) She had to leave most of one behind (yes, she did offer it to me, but even I was too stuffed by this point.   Visual appeal -- Everything in the place screamed "fresh" and "healthy" and "natural"! From what ended up on our table (the bright yellow of my curry, the rich purple of my wife's cabbage bowls, and the vibrant magenta of our beet smoothie), to what kept distracting me as they were delivered to a nearby table (huge, freshly layered burgers, piled-high sandwiches, other multi-hued smoothies), and the little peeks behind the counter to the cooler filled with fresh produce and the boatload of fresh veggies and fruit that kept going into the juicer/blender. It really was a smorgasbord for the senses. (My wife and I laughed about previous visual experiences at other "restaurants" like Taco Bell, Olive Garden, etc. ... so sad what we've contented ourselves with as a culture.)   Fun factor -- Again, the place was fun and kitschy. Nothing fancy, but clean and bright and full of life. Smoothies are all served in mason-jar-like containers. Tables and chairs are an eclectic mishmash. Self-serve flavored water (cucumber+carrot, I believe?) was a nice touch.   All in all, I loved it. I left feeling good about my meal, good about how I had just invested my time and resources, good about supporting people who obviously cared about what and how they invest in their world, and good about our decision to change the way we eat/live.   Already looking forward to our next visit! (And maybe also to taking a swing at mimicking that curry bowl here at home ... wish me luck!!)

w3tK_YaVthuVHu59pguteQ.text: After a couple of visits and a strong hope for the start of a loyalty punch card program since I plan on returning for breakfast every weekend, I feel I can confidently give PomCafe 5 stars. The food and atmosphere satisfy everything I look for in a cute, neighborhood cafe that is trying to promote not only health but the idea that health tastes GREAT.   The buckwheat english muffin has sent me on a frenzy to find a recipe and bake it myself at home because it was perfect for that lumberjack sammie. The raw collard wrap I had for lunch today was an unexpected slam dunk - hello almond cheese! And I second other reviewer's prop for the orange juice. I want to buy a juicer now.  Answer your temptation at the raw bakery, trust me. Though the only semblance the raw donuts have of a real one is the shape, they still taste delicious. Chocolate cherry "cheese" cake? One of my co-diners actually had dessert for breakfast because it was too hard to pass up.  So far I have found no reason to dock points. I will keep returning though with solid determination to get to the bottom of each plate in search of any hint of disappointment. I'm fairly certain I won't find it though.

ikBaAT3KKN6K0L61mIKv-g.text: I love this place, they have amazing food!  I love trying new things and this place always has something yummy and new on the menu.  The only bad thing I could say is that it's pretty expensive (hence the reason why I didn't give 5 stars).  I only eat here maybe a few times a year because of that.

yZof-3FBO3rIAsUdB3UryA.text: Outstanding!  In an area full of restaurants serving either A) Stuff that's just plain bad for you, or B) Stuff that's mediocre, or both, Pomegranate stands out. Every dish is yummy AND it's good for your bod! Love this place. My only complaint is that service can be un-even. Mostly it's fine, but on busy days the staff can get a bit overwhelmed, it seems to me, so they get a little stressed and you have to be patient with them.

sm_ELhuT5ch_RLAewuHEbw.text: My husband and I have been hearing about Pomegranate Cafe for the last year, but really never had the chance to try it. Okay - I shouldn't lie, I think we were hesitant because it is a vegetarian restaurant, and we love our meet.  But we were intrigued because of the gluten free options (something that is critical to my husbands health).  Now I am super sad that we waited so long.  We have been missing one of the best restaurants in the Valley.  Both my husband and I had sandwiches for lunch last weekend.  I have never had such distinct flavors in a sandwich before.  It was beyond delicious!!  Maybe getting rid of the meet is critical to really letting my taste buds do their work!!  After lunch my husband and I split their gluten free Tiramisu, and it was HEAVENLY!!!!!!    The staff was super friendly, the service was quick, and the place is very cute and clean.  We will be back very soon (most likely this weekend)!!  I can't wait to share it with all of my friends!!   YUM!!!!!

Sw4Yiy_xtG5D0C6PXfp1PQ.text: Ok so I've been back here several times. Still love it. Their daily specials are amazing, I love the rotating sides and smoothies. They have a green smoothie (can't remember the name) that is amazing! I took my mom here for Mother's day and they gave all the mom's mimosas :) love it. I just wish they weren't so spendy... I'm but a poor college student, trying to eat vegan when I can!

jOD6k1NgYzP4DK0Dg4R1aw.text: they have a great selection of salads. i find their breakfast selection to be soso, but lunch is good. their salads are portioned as an average salad portion for a "large". i was still hungry after downing a "large" salad for $14. but im just going to assume that their ingredients are a higher quality than most non vegan places so im willing to fork over the extra cash. it is serve yourself water, but the waitresses bring you the food after you order at the counter. you can also wait for a waitress to approach you but its faster and hence better to just order at the counter. they do check up on you after your food comes so that is nice. also parking is easy because it is in a strip mall next to trader joes.

8a5jDvh9AmpRYcPjfTX5WQ.text: I've to this cafe a couple times. Their food and drinks are yummy.  I had sesame burger and my son had the teriyaki chicken.  It was a little too different for him but it didn't stop me from finishing it for him.  I would have liked a few more choices of dishes with meat but I suppose that would defeat the whole vegan cafe idea.

NSOFBfsYnAMxP7Ocfq6Z6Q.text: Good variety of fresh, healthy, and organic food.  Friendly people and excellent taste.  It is nice to go to a place where the food is different and good while the staff likes working there.

3oJCdL0mai6rBDWxYMrN9Q.text: Good healthy food with a very friendly staff.  If your vegan or vegetarian this is the place to go.

LFWwOqCk3WJDtJYdEzN9Zw.text: I'm obsessed with this place. My boyfriend and I eat here at least once every two weeks but sometimes more often. After relocating to this area from Northern California i was bummed there wasn't more organic/vegan/healthy places around and I'm so grateful this place is close(ish) to my house and the food and juices are always delicious.

oksayhIHx6Pu5R9Vg-SzWA.text: Food is amazing and staff are friendly and welcoming. Wait time isnt that bad but well worth it for the food.

aRMDUNGbVVd6E4eZqVc3Sg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Everything I have ever tried here is fresh, delicious, imaginative and healthy. Weekend brunch specials are always amazing.  The desserts are worth driving from north Phoenix for.  In fact, everything is worth the drive. My absolute favorite thing is the grilled cheese Napolean, lots of delish veggies, homemade bread. Yum!

Y_hwEnpHNGjoqJIBPxfPDQ.text: Update...  After leaving my review the owner got back to me right away and sent me a gift card. My husband and I went back over the weekend and had a drastically different experience. It was somewhat busy but we were seated right away and our waitress greeted us within a few minutes. The food was AMAZING... it has been every time (my previous review was based on service only). This time we got the buffalo cauliflower wings, Cobb salad with BBQ "chicken", and the elephant curry burrito. We left feeling very satisfied. I truly appreciate the owner making things right, it shows that they truly care about happy customers. This will remain one of our favorite places and I hope the service continues to improve.   I'm going to start this review by saying Pomegranate Cafe is one of my favorite places but the experience I just had was seriously the WORST!!!   We walked in and it was pretty busy, the hostess told us she wouldn't seat us because the kitchen was backed up (there were plenty of open tables) she said it would be a 15 minute wait and asked if we still wanted to eat there... 15 minutes isn't that long so of course we wanted to stay and she put our name on the list. There was a bunch of people that came in after us that were also waiting to be seated (at this point there's a bunch of open tables) finally after about 20 minutes we get seated but they seated everyone else waiting all at the same time. None of the servers seemed to know what the heck they were doing, it was beyond disorganized. We sat at our table for 15 minutes without anyone coming over and even bringing us water! All of the other tables that came in after us got waters and their orders taken. We were literally being IGNORED!!! Finally my husband went over to a waitress and told her we hadn't even gotten water and how long we had been waiting, her response was "oh sorry" and she just went on to do something else. I have NEVER been treated like this in a restaurant!! My husband and I finally just got up and walked out. I am beyond disappointed, we come here every week and to be treated like that was just appalling! I really hope a manager sees this because something needs to be done about this terrible service!!!!!!!!

AfSKPPIiInE_phdYhWPNKw.text: Absolute favorite vegan restaurant ever! Delicious food, locally sourced ingredients, friendly staff, and environmentally conscious owners. This place is a gem!

6AK3VEwoCIzA15iU3Ck1yg.text: the food is really lovely & if you're looking for something healthy & tasty I'd definitely come here!! The avocado toast was really nice & would definitely recommend this place to a friend!

ltLWnxshBvvTDn66o8rjGw.text: It is hard to find great vegan food, this place is fantastic! I love the ambiance. The rest of my family eats meat but even they loved it. I was nervous about the kids liking it but they also devoured their food. Definitely a place to return to!

pv88cJibuxApqYmhHZ5y9A.text: OMG.... The food here is amazing! I got a bowl and my bf got a burrito along witj the baked fries! The food is amazing! Portions are HUGE so beware! We couldnt finish our food so we had to take it to go but it was sooo soooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge burrito!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Macro bowl ( i believe)

DqNHN3Txee6LOspVWF1mzA.text: Pomegranate is the local superstar of vegan/vegetarian food. I go at least 2x per month and have never had a bad meal. Recommended dishes: breakfast club is my favorite. It comes on the house biscuit/English muffin and this is a must try, but I also am in love with their house multigrain bread so I'll also get it on this from time to time. I also recommend any of their breakfast scrambles/omelettes. French toast is delish if you're in the mood for sweet breakfast. I'm in love with all of their breads. You'll also want to grab a latte. I usually go for the standard Cassie's latte. Desserts vary and are all good so save a little room. Strangely enough breakfast is so good I've never made it for lunch or dinner, but I have no doubt the meals are great. Customer service is generally great although sometimes they get really busy and appear slightly understaffed. This is one of the few places that I don't feel the need to add the qualifier of its good...."for a vegan/vegetarian place." This place is good no matter what. They are opening a central Phoenix location sometime in the next year are so; luck you central Phoenix peeps. Next time I'm there I'll remember to update with some pictures!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cassie&#39;s Latte a house made mix of coconut and almond milk.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast club on the multigrain/seed bread. My favorite breakfast sandwich ever. I get it almost every time!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast club. This is the bread the sandwhich usually comes on, but I like to get mine on the house multigrain/seed bread (see next pic).

rtr13fj5pSvz_MRUT-GFjg.text: Pretty good. I've been wanting to try this place but it's too far. So yesterday since I was in the area, I stopped by. I ordered their burger of the day, mushroom quinoa, and it came with root potato fries and a strawberry salad. The burger was great, I didn't care for the fries, and the salad was delicious but it only had lettuce and strawberries, the description said it also included avocado and candied pecans but mine didn't. I didn't notice until I finished. A bit pricier than I'd like for lunch but for fresh, local, vegetarian food I understand. I'd go back if I was nearby to try more items and sample their dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom quinoa burger

cE0qFbe2ElyCD0j78X9Lwg.text: Really good! Cool staff, huge menu, well prepared and thought out.   Really a delight :-)

JXbYhNAbCi0Mg2JCYC6yRQ.text: This place is awesome! Love having a local vegan eatery that serves LOTS of fresh, house made specialties. The food is bomb, the coffee drinks too and the deserts are simply amazing! TRY IT ALL!

l19cEiwKX3u6cizr9dticQ.text: This is the perfect spot for vegetarians and vegans! All of their dishes are creative, healthy and flavorful which can be hard to come by for us non-meat eaters when dining out. I first came to pomegranate cafe about 4 years ago and have seen it evolve into a bustling cafe with more options being added all the time.   I have tried multiple menu items and am always satisfied. I tend to lean towards their specials board and raw specials on Friday which always prove to be delicious. I would recommend their daily soup with a TLT Sunizona sandwich if you're going with the permanent menu. As a caution it is a bit pricey but many are willing to pay since everything is fresh, homemade and they source as much produce as possible from local farms. It can also be quite busy during weekday lunch hours and the service may be slow during this time. With that being said it is always worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cowgirl cookies
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken piccata quesadilla
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai lentil soup!

AcRWRxVc1CV7hmc5KqWyZg.text: Our favorite restaurant in Arizona (tied with Chocola Tree in Sedona.) Our out of town relatives visit multiple times during visits (and some are meat eaters. )   The food is seasonal and fresh. The owners are there most of the time. We have watched them grow and expand over the last few years and have been pleased with all the changes. It can be more expensive to eat at a restaurant with the values that they hold dear. We try to go for happy hour. My children yell "Yay" when we tell them where we're going to eat. Great for gluten free vegetarian and vegan folks. Awesome kids menu. Great smoothies, coffee drinks, tea etc.

qcG0DYOs4ymoOKg0Ipb5LA.text: I didnt know this was a vegan restaurant but it turned out to be pretty good. They have cage free eggs and milk so its not totally vegan as they have vegetarian options . I chose the breakfast burrito with eggs. It was huge and chock full of veggies and good stuff. I left feeling full but not uncomfortable.  They have all kinds of healthy juices and smoothie options.  Definitely a good stop  for healthy breakfast or lunch options un Ahwatukee.

REQBQtMpE62JRCQc4rzoYw.text: Always delicious. I love the breakfast sandwich and tacos, the everything bagel, the nachos, the green goddess burger... not everything suits my taste buds but I can hardly believe most of the food is vegan because it tastes soooo delicious! Portions are huge, service isn't always the best, but the owner is always available to make sure everything is more than satisfactory. I was once given a gift card for the price of my meal because an extra ingredient was accidentally added to it. Also, the baked goods are to die for, but I'm not sure anything that tasty and sweet can be healthy! Love it and would definitely recommend. I just wish the prices were a bit more affordable.

nFCFdVCYXpwhUb7Rklgyeg.text: Between 3 and 4 stars. I love the idea and the ambiance was great but the service was very slow. I went here with a friend and when it comes to a point, after you order, where you have to ask how long we've been waiting to each other, we've already waited too long. And then you're thinking, okay we'll give it five more min, every five minutes, three times, we've waited too long. I ordered the lumberjack based on a lot of people's recommendations. It was good but even better without the tempeh on there. I guess it's supposed to be a bacon tempeh but I didn't care for it and in fact, I picked it out if my sandwich and I ended up loving my sandwich! I ordered the Cassie's latte too which was good but I don't think it's something I'll have often. It also got cold while waiting for the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado egg sandwich
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cassie&#39;s latte
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lumberjack

F1HGlYX_nZXf3rUidRIgFA.text: I'm not a vegetarian but my dad is one. He seemed really happy with his meal and I was very happy with mine too. I was able get a breakfast burrito with eggs substitutes for tofu. I need my protein in the morning. The place was packed but the service didn't suffer for it. I'd check it out no matter your dietary restrictions.

GAyq_WBwHAjQUh0WCtffAg.text: I live very close to Pomegranate Cafe and I'm surprised I haven't stumbled across this gem sooner! I love the nature and ambience of the cafe, it's very low key and everyone that works here seems so happy and so proud of this place. I got this super power smoothie with added protein and it tastes phenomenal. The place looks Beautiful with a lot of great artwork and unique furniture. Overall I would give this place a 10 out of 10. This is going to be my new spot for organic food and a positive atmosphere!

cvMzPwJbBMgghOEvCWPhIw.text: It would have gotten 5 stars if I didn't get a stomach ache from the food! :( other than that the restaurant itself was a very nice atmosphere, felt welcoming and the decor was nice! They also had a little farmers market inside which I thought was very cool!

DImHDFQYCxaaKW07HiSG0Q.text: Gone downhill over the years. I'm hoping their new location opening in Jan 2018 will have the level of attention I used to love at Pomegranate cafe.   I visited recently for brunch. We were seated and they had trouble finding menus for the 4 us despite there only being 5-6 full tables in the restaurant. Then we ordered drinks and it took at least 15 minutes for them to pour a glass of wine and make an arnold palmer.   I ordered Cassie's Latte after asking the waiter if it would be super sweet. He said no. Since I'm familiar with their raw/unrefined sugar treats, I knew they likely wouldn't let me down. The latte was actually sickeningly sweet - like Starbucks sweet. As a replacement, I asked for a regular iced latte with coconut milk. This time, there was maybe half a shot of espresso in it instead of the usual two. Plus, I was expecting the style of coconut milk you buy in a carton (aka normal). Instead the milk was more akin to the full fat coconut milk you buy in a can for baking. It's not good on its own in a drink, super gross. There was another woman in the restaurant who sent back a smoothie 3 times so I think the person working the drink station was having a bad day.   We also ordered the shakshuka brunch dish and it took them 10 minutes to tell us they were out of it, requiring us to go through the menu again for a backup.   We ordered a little over an hour before they were scheduled to close for the day. We were also planning to order a few dishes to-go, at the end of our meal. About 35 minutes went by and we hadn't received our food so my husband figured it'd be best to order our to-go items at the takeout counter in front, so they wouldn't close the kitchen for the day first. The man behind the counter said we had to order from our server, despite not having seen him in nearly 40 minutes.   The food finally arrived about 1 hour after sitting down, which seems a little crazy for 4 egg dishes. I ordered soup too and they brought it with my main dish. How hard is it to run a cup of soup out in 45 mins?   We managed to order our to-go food eventually, and that came out way faster than the boxes we requested for leftovers. Saw the waiter laughing in the back with the other servers and talking about hangovers in between serving tables.   Later we tried to order dessert from the waiter but couldn't chase him down. Asked the man behind the counter, he told us once again we had to order from the waiter only.   All-in-all, it took about 1.5 hours for breakfast, which made me really impatient. Nothing they did was outright offensive on its own, but altogether made for a messy dining experience. I really want them to get it together because Pom Cafe has been one of my favorite restaurants in PHX for years.

zxWsfdpVk6r5TIWj4saF7w.text: Man, I really really hate to give a vegan cafe a low rating. I have two stars simply because it's vegan. Otherwise, it's truly a bust. The Mac and cheese took 40 minutes (at a non busy time) and was cold when I got it. The j-whatever version of coffee they have along with the Pom milk left much to be desired. I am not a picky person but I had to send it back. Asked for a juice instead and it took 15 MORE minutes to get a lemonade to my table! It sucks because I drove an hour to get here but I definitely will not be back. Skip this cafe and try another one instead.  Lemonade was tasty, Shay had awesome customer service... other than that I was not a fan.

mytu9FYJeMQd0oI7dwhD8g.text: I'm a meat eating carnivore BUT coming to this place, I can be a part time herbivore. This place puts the flavor in their food that cannot be replicated in a hamburger. It's vegan and vegetarian and after a hearty meal, I'm not completely stuffed like I would be after a steak.  Don't be put off by the fact that this place don't have meat. It's delicious and filling.   They scored points with me the moment my drink was served with a paper straw. For us avid recyclers, that's a very nice touch.  If you want a good, tasty and filling lunch, stop by! You won't be upset

q4t79A3Lm0v5P23iecShrA.text: Awesome place!  I have several allergies and they were accomodating.  Highly recommended. Nikole was our wait staff. She's simply the best!

322uraMTerWGEUxEZ_yy1w.text: Pomegranate Cafe has mastered the art of making healthy and nutritious food taste good. I'm not a vegetarian/vegan but I've been a regular for years (~5 years). I moved out of the area to central Phx and have yet to find another place that even comes remotely close. Thus, I drive to get my fix.   It doesn't matter what you order, it is all yummy...but some of my favorites are: Vivos (raw) tacos, root wedges, elephant curry bowl, jalapeno avocado cheese crisp (I requested it folded like a quesadilla),  and any seasonal enchilada. For juices I like the abundance and the wellness shot (warning it has a kick!). And don't forget the desserts! Cowboy bars, Cooke dough truffle, lemon bars and brownies are all ridiculous in a "mmmm so so good" kinda way. Oh and the Pom-berry Parfait! Who can resist cashew 'yogurt' layered with seasonal fruit, superfood mix & granola??! Not this girl. Get to Pom and tell Cassie (the owner that is always wearing a smile) that I sent you .

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pom-berry Parfait. #yummy2mytummy

XBPKyIjDwJa_vcJlRJb1Ig.text: My husband and I stopped in for breakfast today, and I was pleasantly surprised by the remodel!  I also love that there is sit-down service now! Other great improvements include alcohol and biscuits and gravy!!  I tried the special, which was cheddar bacon biscuits and gravy and my husband had a power bowl.   My food was absolutely delicious, and I appreciate they still do eggs and dairy cheese for the hubs who isn't vegan.   I wish I lived closer so I could come back and try everything on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bulletproof coffee! Big big portion!!

IfkvWsqYyJr3LVElYBrIoA.text: Sadly, this place has gone downhill fast. This was our favorite vegan restaurant in the valley. We would make the long drive from Scottsdale weekly. After the last three disappointing visits, we won't be back. Today the pancakes were served cold, burnt and tasting like cardboard - twice! We sent them back and they came back just as bad. The cinnamon roll was like a biscuit with frosting, not at all like a cinnamon roll. Last time we went we were served "peppermint mocha" that was coffee with a ton of mint syrup - totally undrinkable. The happy hour has reduced portions and the burgers are not nearly as good as they were. I use to crave the mushroom burger but not any more. Really sad to see this happen. Used to be a fantastic place and now it's awful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kZivqka6BHSwxelrK_uezQ.text: This restaurant has extremely good service and the food is phenomenal, as well as the deserts.  The mock meat tastes very good and similar to animal meat, this is very impressive.  I love this place and would 100% recommend this.

M9ehAoP7RkhBPmCUWBYu8w.text: This place is a breath of fresh air for conscious eaters. Service is amazing.   I had the nachos (not raw) and the sliders. So good.  Patio is nice with the misters when it's hot out. Just beware. The pigeons aren't shy and will land on your table when you're not looking.   Eat inside. You'll love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b36xd9oPzXzgZ9rQ6MBF4w.text: I really enjoy this vegan restauran, not only do they have vegan items but raw items as well . I love the drinks, smoothies, juices, and all their food but they lost a star due to their desserts. I love they have vegan and raw desserts but they lack flavor, so this disappoints me with them.....but I really do enjoy everything else. Drinks are a little pricey which is unfortunate but I will treat myself with one when I am here.  They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner here BUT after 8 pm to the last hour open, you can only order food from the counter and everything is served in plastic (take out containers ) that you can eat outside or towards the front even though they close at 9.  My son says the gila nachos are best he has ever had. He LOVES them !  They have a happy hour that you can try some of their small bites / plates til 6 pm, Mon -Fri. Definitely worth it if you want to try some things from the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mermaid salad (yum), smoothie and chocolate peanut butter cupcake.

FxltSBAmSMhAZ1dAQerJBA.text: Ordered Bountiful Harvest bowl and a greena Colada smoothie. Both were really cooked to perfection.   Wouldn't mind visiting multiple times.

f_Dee-DqwD1jgmZ3oPcpCA.text: This place is terrific.  A point of pride for Ahwatukee.  Clean, healthy, quality food, and did I say tasty.

j9U71bQhnIAs6TvHeoscmA.text: A vegan food wonderland.  A diverse menu.  If you're in a mexican food mood, and vegan, this is a great spot.  All the other fares are also delicious.  Smoothies, cocktails, teas, and spectacular desserts to top it off.  Recommended highly.  Our favorite spot.

wc71vqNDfMj56RpxYxfsfg.text: I came in hoping to order some food over lunch and make it back to work in time. However, it took over an hour to get my food. We were never updated by the waitress on why it was so slow and when our food would be coming out, we just played a very long waiting game.   The staff was nice and overall I'd say the food was average.

eckFcDUhO-MJbXInQfygGQ.text: I loved everything about this place, I wish there were more locations! Staff are friendly and food is great

bIl2RfYqLmIk8mt5fu55iQ.text: I tried to give this place a chance, but after the second time of slow service and mediocre food, I'm done. I understand sometimes service can be slow due to lack of staff/big parties, but it would be nice if the staff would communicate with there tables as they see them sit there forever with drinks and no food! The waitstaff seemed out of sync and unorganized. I ordered the scramble and it was definitely NOT worth the wait or money. My advice: if you go, make sure you have the day off because the wait time is serious.

ECKUYSN33WNs437A0kxaEg.text: I got to check our Pomegranate Cafe for the second time ever yesterday (I know - I can't believe I've only been twice!) I am gluten-free, dairy-free and egg-free, so their menu is pretty much a dream for me. They pride themselves on being able to adapt all menu items for customer's allergen needs, which means that if you are gluten-free, you have an ENTIRE menu full of options! Plus, as most of you know, the entire restaurant is vegetarian and mostly vegan (although they do serve eggs and real dairy for those that prefer it).  I got their "Raw Green Rainbow" salad, which came with their homemade, dairy-free cashew ranch dressing. It was incredible. My mom got the "Garden Green Protein Bowl" with tofu scramble, roasted root veggies, their homemade gluten-free seed toast and homemade POM jelly. We both devoured our food.  Of course, I knew that I wanted dessert, so I stalked the dessert case, asking tons of questions until I could decide which one I wanted. I ended up with the "Gluten-Free, Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Brownie," which was doughy and delicious. Out of all 4 rows of their dessert case, there were 3-4 items that weren't gluten-free - the rest were!  I truly recommend this place for all of my vegan, gluten-free, allergen-friendly seeking customers. I know that feeling of only being able to order 1 thing off the entire menu when visiting most restaurants, but Pomegranate Cafe brings light and life to dining out for those suffering from food allergies, food sensitivities, and/or those with limited diets.  It's worth the trek down to their location in South Phoenix/Ahwatukee area, even if you reside more North. Believe me - It's a one-of-a-kind experience and worth every bite! Gluten-free foodies, unite!   My only request for future is that they offer gluten-free/vegan cakes like the ones they have in their case that are only vegan (not gluten-free). They are so beautiful, fluffy and decadent looking, I would gladly buy a few slices to take home

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu scramble with sweet potato and root veggie hash, their homemade gf bread and homemade POM jam.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten-free, Vegan &#34;Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Brownie.&#34; Yes, it was amazing.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan dessert case, most of which, is gluten-free too!

0N6MjeQq6Vqu-dhVP_JURw.text: OK. I never had Ground seasoned walnuts taste like meat before. The Nachos and Jungle Bowl are to die for. Don't get nachos and two entrees for two people unless you take the entree which in my case is a jungle bowl home and scramble and egg in it the next day as a second meal. Way to go and you can't go wrong there.

hXy_yMqXcooSJh6OdUO4tQ.text: I love PC. A little on the pricey side but so worth it. The nachos the burger and fries are my favorite so far. I haven't tried their desserts yet but that is next on the list. Try it out you won't be disappointed.

CGIQ1NezcRiXI-ARPvWQ7A.text: Amazing eats and funky, laid back vibe. Pricey and slow service but a good treat when you want to splurge.

hXQ1NrrUCDm1rMj2q8c_Mg.text: Great food, great ambiance worth every penny! Choices abound, freshly made authentic flavors, etc...highly recommend it.

DxlM1hlaFbH-GB_KWNF_6g.text: Very delicious food and tons of different options . they have fresh squeezed juice which is really awesome . Their wraps, rice bowls, burgers and weekly specials ... everything deserves a big thumbs up !!  have been to this place 3 times and they had amazing food and service each time .  Its a little pricey for a vegetarian/vegan restaurant .

HrNt9e3zm2vysMY9UlJm4w.text: I visited Pomegranate Cafe for lunch with several colleagues. The juices and smoothies looked amazing, but I held off because they were $9 and I'm cheap. I opted instead for the Green Bandito Burrito. The service was prompt, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Upon my first taste of the burrito, I exclaimed that I wanted to marry it and have its babies. This burrito was equal parts hearty, flavorful and delicious (quite an accomplishment for vegan fare). It arrived nestled next to a strawberry pecan salad and a side of mild salsa. The price was slightly steep, but you can't put a price on happiness. I'll be back soon.

U9G9t94JrL3hSye2xpUdGg.text: Awesome food! So so delicious I am craving it!! I gave it 4 stars because the service wasn't the greatest but it definitely won't keep me from going back.

ewf05qCGF5MjxeUmrSGR8g.text: A new favorite!!! Delicious! Fresh & full of variety. Especially enjoyed the raw tacos & vegan pizza. Pricey but its all organic and a better serving size than some other gourmet joints.

Awg3jAVlQ9DqonGabM_yNw.text: Stopped in for coffee and WiFi,  great spot, cute atmosphere and friendly staff. Menu is perfect for those with food restrictions, though I am not. Variety of salads and sandwiches. The man next to me ordered a burrito -likely a breakfast one? Not aure.. it was enormous. .I bet 6 inches around, stuffed with goodness it appeared. I'll be back to try the menu that's for sure. !!!

yfL1O9MYerFINPjezx6fcg.text: I like to give a place a few chances before writing a review like this... I've been to Pomegranate Cafe at least 4 or 5 times now.  First their food is SO expensive for what you get.  And the quality of food is just meh - they have a few exceptional items, but for the most part, the food isn't super impressive.  Now let's talk about why they get only 2 stars... their service.  They have this large beautiful dining area indoor and outdoor - but never enough staff to accommodate how many people can fit.  The service has been extremely slow - every. single. time.  Today was a special kind of slow.  It took 2.5 hours from the time we got seated to the time we got our checks.  They offered us free desserts to take home to make up for the long waits, then get this... the server took one of the desserts off our pile (we put them on the counter behind us to save table space) and gave one of our complimentary desserts to another customer!!! And then - they ran out of that specific dessert!!!!! Like who does that?  Also they ran out of another food item I had ordered and substituted it with something else without asking if that is what I wanted.  It was literally insane.  I'm so disappointed with this place now.  I wanted to like them.  If it were only meh food, I probably wouldn't have written a review - but the combo of meh food and terrible service has crossed the line and people should know so they can at least fix the service problem!  If you know it's going to be busy (which it's is every single weekend I have been), make sure you have the staff to accommodate your capacity!!!

-o2cCGq_TLVOpzg6b0Ncmw.text: Was in Phoenix the other day and was hoping to find a Vegan restaurant so I immediately got on Yelp and found this place. After reading a few of the reviews and getting a bit curious I decided to come in here. Best choice ever! It was absolutely delicious! I asked for a quesadilla which was amazing!!! The only thing that I wasn't a big fan of was the big pieces of; I believe it was pepper and onions, but that was my fault since I should have asked what they put in it. It was also pricey, I believe my total came out to $12, but for vegan food that you see them make right in front of you. What do you expect? It was so worth it and I hope to be visiting Arizona again soon so I can come back here! It was absolutely delicious!! I'm craving it again right now!

qxJZOSxcptkmRyasvsYNQA.text: Delicious, well crafted, healthy food! The options were many and it was hard to decide. Lots of substitutions in case you're vegan, gluten free, etc. Cucumber water, smoothies, juices, and even a huge case of vegan desserts! Peaceful atmosphere and wonderful service. Loved it all-new favorite breakfast joint!

sgYTuT_GvR5EhmnYaLgnBA.text: Definitely a place for vegetarians. If you're a guy that likes pasta hamburgers wings lasagna etc then this is not the place for you.

aqMYPZKOZ9gmZvv1GJ9BTQ.text: In reading other reviews...some were not so good.. but I really like this place!    Service was good, yes, a little on the slow side...but worth the wait!    Food is fresh and amazing!  I've only been there twice and plan on going many more!

uTHitcPvUQA31Al9JYnYqQ.text: I'm not even vegan/vegetarian. But this place is delicious and earthy. Trendy decor and very eclectic range of people. I feel healthier when I eat here. It's just sooo pricey. I get one smoothie, burrito & cookie for $30!!!!  That's a little outrageous. And the service is always SLOW. But friendly!!!!!

hhKpgfhx3JnDCLAApLrrLQ.text: Surprisingly good.  I like healthy foods, but I usually find vegan food to be gritty or bland or dry.  This food was more delicious than I've had at places that use fat and eggs and butter and all that good stuff.  We went back twice in a row.  The cinnamon french toast was soft and flavorful.  Tiny apple slices brought a medley of tastes.  My friends enjoyed their omelets.  The juices were a little funky for me, but if you like a kick of ginger and spices, you'll have plenty to choose from.  The decor is colorful and inviting, and there always seemed to be tables open.  The staff is young and helpful, and seem to enjoy working there.  They patiently help you navigate the menu.  Some aren't quite focused when it comes to fixing mistakes (you wanted which sauce?  um, okay, be back in ten minutes...), but it's more cluelessness than apathy.  Overall, good for a leisurely and healthy brunch/lunch.  I would definitely return.

2nEq9NLMFCiw6ahgu9Qsdw.text: Short form: ordered our food (15 minutes elapse) we get our iced teas (15 minutes elapse) the tables next to us that had ordered and were seated before we got there get SOME of their food, one sends soup back because it's cold.   (15 minutes elapse) 45 minutes into this disaster, I ask for a refund and we leave   Menu didn't look that appetizing, service was awful, and apparently what they served was poorly executed.  That's enough to keep me from ever going back.  (I should have written a review that takes 45 minutes to read, yet you get nothing from it.... kind of like going to Pomegranate)

fKtzLy3GYrOoOKI5uc7Jww.text: I am a not a vegetarian, but I do enjoy vegetarian food and eating healthy.  I finally convinced my husband to come here with me.  I had a combo with soup and the Athena wrap.  The lentil was was okay, but the Athena wrap was really good.  My husband got the breakfast tacos with eggs (I don't remember the name of the dish).  He really liked them, and they were super filling.  He didn't even finish both of them.      Staff takes for granted that you know what is going on.  It's confusing for new customers on where to sit, where you pay or if you refill your own water or not.  The menu also doesn't list all the ingredients in dishes and the servers don't know.  I asked specifically what was in the lentil soup and wasn't told that it has onions.  The food is really good, but the customer service could use some improvement and the prices are a tad expensive, otherwise it would be 5 stars.

XR3eq3k2BG6cKknZTD30lg.text: Love this place.  Reminds me of the vegetarian places in northern California. I can't say enough good about it.  They will do vegan or vegetarian but don't expect animal meat here (they do have eggs and dairy cheese available as well as tofu, tempah, and other high protein items).  Everything is fresh, fresh, fresh. You get a fair amount of food (often we take some home). The bread is outstanding made from ancient grains.  The food has wonderful taste combinations (e.g. a side salad of cabbage and carrots had fresh ginger in it that made a big difference). How they prepare the food and the taste combinations is what really makes the food great.  They will customize things for you when they can, drinks and food, and can easily accommodate the standard food allergies.  Their hours vary, sometimes they are open in the evenings, sometimes only breakfast and lunch.  Weekend brunch is the busiest so there might be a wait and occasionally on a later evening they have been slow but brought out free tortilla chips which was nice.   They have all sorts of coffees & teas & specialty drinks (hot & cold),  and a case full of deserts, so they are also good to stop by for a coffee.  Dogs are welcome in the outside tables.  One last nice plus, they are a drop off spot for organic farmer co-op shares - sunizonafamilyfarms, where you can get a standard share or pick and choose each week what items you want to order.  We used to stop by about once a week, enough the staff got to know us.  But now we get a farm box and are there a couple times a week - just a nice side effect.

6PZFyhxQ_EQJziWHAbUROA.text: My wife and I were extremely excited to try out this restaurant.  Especially since we have heard a lot of good things about this place and the yelp reviews were fantastic.  Unfortunately we extremely let down. We waited 50 minutes for our food (we had the time we ordered on our receipt). As we were waiting we watched others that ordered after us receive their food. We were also amazed at how quick the 'to go' orders were coming in and out.    Finally our food showed up! My wife ordered a breakfast sandwich that she said was a sold 4 out of 5. Unfortunately her potatoes were cold... to the touch cold as if they were sitting out for 20 minute, the waitress  however did offer to microwave them for us though. My breakfast burrito wasn't bad. I wouldn't say it was mind blowing or bad.   Lastly on our way out we heard the waitress apologizing to an older couple that have been waiting as long as we were. They were offering to give them free drinks and a choice out of the desserts to compensate them for their time.

6BaYKx8-bKjyvAsgKqqW0A.text: LOVE this place.  Perfect for any dietary needs or preferences. Cute date spot for any of you herbivore couples. Glad they're opened up late again!

ImG71Qepf3Ql1NRiQLrDoA.text: FOOD is awesome!  If you love organic healthy eats, this is the place for you. It is a bit pricey but unfortunately, organic food costs more.   It is a bit of a hike if you are just visiting but well worth the visit.  LOVE this place!

4Yao9CiTJMuB1c37NdGUrg.text: Everything was delicious & there was a lot to choose from. The place is an awesome hangout- hip & earthy. We tried the tamales, breakfast burrito and burger with rainbow juice & strawberry sunrise. The rainbow juice was spicy (ginger) & refreshing. I had more energy & felt healthier after drinking it. The $9 price tag seemed a bit high for a juice but thats prob how much all the veggies cost to put in there. Can't wait to go again and try more of their menu options.

qgCH4c9CM_XAiAq25FAKBA.text: While the food is decent the service sucks. Personally I hate the place but I'm dragged here each weekend to endure the conversation of a kid working here who tells me that 45 mins is a standard wait for a breakfast burrito. No more. Today was my last visit. Note--Not all the servers are bad. A couple guys here are really good. I know everyone wants to enjoy a mock sausage scramble...but step up your game on service.  Oh and get high chairs with buckles for infants that work.

w8VCPbGa8t1MGzb-XSxUaA.text: Really cute restaurant fun upbeat place.  My problem was the service, I waited 40 minutes for my food and the people who ordered after me had already been served their food.  Finally I just left and a waitress, not mine ran after me in the parking lot demanding I pay for my food.  I just turned around and said, I was never served my food, and I'm not going to pay for my water.  She looked at me confused and tried to say but your food, and I just walked on.  Unfortunately this was my first trip and I never got to taste the food.  Big fail on the restaurant.

M2clO1gCQ3h7ulk62KZZYQ.text: It's a real bummer that this place is so far away from my part of town.  I was lucky enough to be in the area.  This place is a True vegans paradise.  If you are Vegan then you will not be disappointed with their menu.  They also cater to Vegetarians so if you're not full Vegan you will also fit right in.  Service is great and the patio is a great place to sit if the weather permits.  Don't forget to try some of there delicious baked goods.  All of which are made Vegan style.

osIqNb1q_OhpugDam1P8OQ.text: This is the best vegan place I have ever been to.  It's high vibe people and high vibe food that is creative and delicious!

kYfduVIyxiK5lf4109wSNQ.text: If I didn't live so far away and could eat here every day I would gladly become a vegan (except, of course, for some brisket from Little Miss BBQ from time to time!)  Definitely worth going out of your way for.  Everything on the menu is excellent.  If you can't decide what to get, then go with the Rainbow Wrap and Root Veggie Fries.  I've been a big fan since they first opened. They were amazingly great back then - and since then have gotten even better (and bigger - their original restaurant was eventually so well received and so busy they found a way to expand and more than double the size of the kitchen and restaurant!)  It's inspiring to see the hard work and vision of the owners be rewarded by ever bigger crowds of happy customers (thanks!)

Pyx4i7El6F0uC-H8utt0xA.text: Gluten free options!    Have been going here awhile and finally decided to write a review.  The atmosphere is cheery, bright and casual.  If your looking for meat of any type this would not be for you unless you want to trip something different.  The raw tacos with the walnut meat are very tasty.  In fact anything with the walnut meat is good.  The bountiful bowl is another winner and you can have quinoa or brown rice in it.  They have many different excellent juices or smoothies to pick from as well.  Since they have a lot of raw desserts it gives a person who is gluten free many delicious options.  My favorite is only made on Fridays and is the tiramisu.  With the exception of the crust is even rivals the gluten version as far as flavor goes.  They are a bit pricey, but since quality matters to me I don't mind paying for it. Should you go always check their hours first because they change at times as they have experimented staying open for dinner.    Customer service is very good.  They want your experience to be good and have you return.    The one recommendation I would make is they really need to keep the bathroom clean!  They have one unisex bathroom with just a very small trash can that is often overflowing and unsightly.  It is actually a good size bathroom, but they have no shelf or some type of table for ladies to place their items on.  They have a small hook on the wall, but if you don't have something with straps then you have to place it on the dirty floor.  Also really please clean the sink.

kncWL64nFyxaz5RgTuzVxw.text: The food and drinks are delicious here but the food takes FOREVER. It's consistently INCREDIBLY slow even when the place is pretty much barren. I don't understand why it takes so long but I wouldn't come here unless you have 2 hours to eat/waste.

j6KnSl1V_mhnvgeyg3qyMQ.text: Amazing. It is indescribable how great it feels to go to a restaurant where I can order anything on the menu without having to ask if it is vegan...AND the food is delicious. Just scrumptious. Currently sipping on a pitaya (dragonfruit) mojito that is unique and beautiful as well as tasty. Menu is made from scratch and you can taste it. Vegans rejoice! Now if only I could get them to move up north to Prescott..........

KEUN4dvpwHliOU8wVf6Cxw.text: Im not vegan or vegetarian but I just might be someday because of this cafe. Curious about all types of cuisine, I gave Pom a try one day a few years ago and I have been back several times since. They even deserve some credit for inspiring me to eat healthier and switch to mostly plant based proteins. Above all else, their food is just really tasty. Everything is from scratch and is well seasoned and flavored - not something you find very much in this city unfortunately. Even as a meat eater their food is so good that I never feel like I am missing it. They do serve eggs and dairy cheese for breakfast if you prefer. The breakfast burrito here is one of the best I've had. Can't recommend Pom enough, just wish it was cheaper.

oAC4w_sSxiLPR2oQlfsjFQ.text: Can't wait to come back and try their brunch! Loved the vegan and gluten free options. Desserts were outstanding!

ficnBPsDe-eSM9JVAlQ8yg.text: I gave you all a 2nd try. 11-21-2015 @ 12:30PM and was again disappointed. Food was good, very slow service, actually had to stop another waiter to find our server to order dessert, who then approached in a passive aggressive manner. Dropped desert off without a word (yes we will enjoy, thank you) had to ask a different server to clear plates, get more tea. Etc. dropped the bill without saying thank you and avoided eye contact. Im disappointed because I live a block away and there are few vegetarian places in the area. But I cant abide by bad service and attitude.   Note: thank you Cassie for trying to fix the situation. We appreciated all you tried to do.

r6A5bBswy3-xha2G-zqOzw.text: I've been to Pomegranate Cafe a couple times now.  Today I was really inspired to write a review.  The first time I went to Pomegranate Cafe, a neighbor and I popped in for breakfast.  The food was just okay for both of us.  It was nothing special.  I should mention that we both got egg dishes that day, though I can't quite say what we ordered back then.    Today I was low on groceries in the house, so I decided to bring the family here for breakfast.  My daughter ordered the pumpkin bread french toast, which came with fruit (some sliced apples and pears (I think) and a coconut milk ice cream sundae for dessert (topped with Vegan chocolate syrup and Vegan whipped cream).  She loved it, but the portion was quite small.  She is 4 and a light eater and she ate all her french toast in about two minutes.  I cannot imagine an 8 or 10 year old getting filled up on this portion size.  I ordered the Lumberjack (made vegan) with tofu and vegan cheese. The sandwich was just alright, but the accompaniment was pretty yummerific.  I love sweet potatoes and yams, so anything with them included is already a head above!  DH had the teriyaki "chicken" bowl and it not only looked fab, it was DELICIOUS.   Needless to say, "I'll have what (he's) having."  Maybe I am just a fan of mock meats!    The expansion is great, but even at 10:30 on a Sunday... The place wasn't packed.    With waters all around, our bill came to $30 post tax and tip.    *Once again, I wasn't thrilled about tipping at the register.  I need to start carrying cash for these situations.   I will definitely be back to Pomegranate Cafe!  I can't wait to try their whole menu. :)

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lumberjack made Vegan with tofu and vegan cheese

HZTsJYQOUuUgvo_KIMsCIg.text: This place is great, unless you're in a rush. The food is delicious, fresh, organic, and local. It's all vegan and vegetarian fare with lots of gluten-free options. On top of this, everything tastes great.  The biggest drawback is how painfully slow the service is. Getting seated and placing orders takes no time at all, but be prepared to wait a good while for your food to get to you.

Ptmm6YxiZob41oxzzclvow.text: Highly Highly  recommended!! The staff is very friendly and helpful and the food.... WOW!! So Tasty!! I wish there was a place like this in every town big and small. Fresh juices, tasty smoothies, yummy espresso, beautiful desserts, raw and vegan simple food. This is how food should be. I can't get enough.  The best part is, a mother, daughter run and own it. I love when the owners are hands on getting dirty. You won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almond milk latte. Yummy!

yfKiBRhrJEhcytTY9xqbWw.text: We ate here for the first time the other day, and the food is out of this world amazing! I ordered the Sunshine Wrap with Tofu and Root Vegetable Potatoes, and I have been dreaming of it ever since. Simply delicious! Definitely five *****stars***** on the food.  However, if you are really hungry and can't wait to eat, this is not the place to go. It took us 40 minutes to get our food which seemed a lot longer than the staff anticipated because they were very apologetic and even gave us a free dessert of our choosing.   The staff was very, very friendly and accommodating, but the wooden chairs and benches were beyond uncomfortable to the the person with back problems who had to sit for an 1-1/2 to eat. I left there just about crippled and had to immediately head to the chiropractor.    All in all, I recommend this place just for the food alone. They really have some great food and take pride in their menu.
