Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. AMAZING! Tofu Sunshine Wrap.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brownie

Zf2k_khirPIfsmyGBoiLog.text: My son and I went here for breakfast. I was served granola with fruit that was frozen  solid. Avoid the granola, it is more granola than any human could eat and only a smidge of milk, plus it is WAY too expensive. We spent $40 on breakfast, not worth it.

_OSphxqoXPKgwmqqIZ_ZVQ.text: 10/06/12 Thank you Pomegranate Cafe, Russell, and all of PC's other staff members for helping me forget, for an hour or so, that I was feeling very much under-the-weather. l was feeling elated about my upcoming delights, I totally forgot how awful I must have looked wearing yoga pants, a Life is Good tee, a hooded zip pullover, and glasses. What a bum! Surprisingly, business was bustling this morning-- I've never seen PC full of people, and get this, there was a LINE waiting to order! Because most of the tables were taken indoors, it was very noisy, so I took this chance to hide my I'm-sick-as-a-dog bum from the beautiful people and eat OUTDOORS. But first, I had to place my order. Since I'd already perused the menu online, I knew I was going to have the French toast, no powdered sugar, please, like I usually do, but I wanted to try something new. The basic breakfast (egg, toast, jam, and fruit) enticed, but I quickly drew towards Kamut toast, almond butter, jam, and fruit. I also thought I'd either try a smoothie or an elixir ($8 each), but the menu online stated to ask for an elixir menu for options. There was only one, and it was a "female hormonal concoction" with something, I lost track, since I didn't need help with my hormones, thank you very much. ("Not that there's anything wrong with that.") $8 saved. The smoothie I wanted to try contained pomegranate juice, which I correctly suspected had one or more unwanted ingredients, and for me, that was "grape seed oil extract." (So glad I spotted those juice bottles in front of the cash register.) Good- I was able to hang onto $8 of my money. Last, but not least, I ordered a cappucino (Cartel Coffee) and a glass of water without cucumber. I again reiterated that I did not want powdered sugar on the French toast, which I was told would take twenty or twenty-five minutes to be ready, since they'd run out of the bread and the next batch was in the oven. I said it was worth waiting for, so I don't mind, and besides, I'll have the kamut toast and almond butter. As I paid for my three items, I was told that my food will be out in about 30 minutes, which took me by surprise, but I was in no mood to make a fuss, especially when I needed to secure an empty table before someone else snatched it! I found one outdoors, but it needed bussing. No problem, as I found a shy and cute associate to help me. One thing I really like about frequenting vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free venues, is how most, if not all, of the staff members are so humble, and are good-natured. Another thing is that these venues tend to look so hippy-chic, colorful, eclectic, and FUN! I loved the different swaths of colorful curtains, brightly-painted tables and chairs, whimsical dinnerware, and that was indoors! Outside, I found a mosaic two-top with mismatched chairs- I sat on the one without the morsel of food on its seat. The food didn't take quite as long as 30 minutes. The cappucino yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6... took a few minutes to arrive, and so did the lovely-tasting city water, nicely contained in a lidless canning jar. (There's a reason cucumber slices are used to "flavor" the water, folks!) It was about ten minutes after I started sipping my coffee that the Banana bread French toast arrived yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6..., but it was sprinkled with powdered sugar! However, Russell did not hesitate in taking it back and bringing another. What terrific service! The Kamut toast, almond butter, jam, and fruit plate stayed, however, so I was happy. yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6... Still happy, even when I found out that the almond butter was the raw variety-- I don't particularly like its flavor, or lack thereof, and I only buy and enjoy the roasted kind. It's a good thing I am not allergic to chia (still experimenting), sesame, and sunflower seeds, for while the menu did not mention these were included, one certainly could not avoid their presence on this dish! It's also a good thing they were, since they gave the bland-tasting almond butter much-needed flavor. The fun textures on this dish also gave my mouth something to be happy about! The Banana bread French toast arrived about 5 minutes later, and what a marvel that was! yelp.com/biz_photos/QsJ6... The French toast had the PERFECT crunch on the outside, a gorgeous pound-cake-meets-angel-cake consistency on the inside, and a wonderful roasted-banana scent filled the air around my face that soon delighted my taste buds! The strawberry-rhubarb jam and agave pancake syrup added lovely velvety coats of sweetness and colors, as well. I could've eaten the entire dish! I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. For those who want another perspective on things...
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana bread French toast, up close!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Faraway...

e_P2hTegCAUXepSpKLbnWw.text: I love everything about this place - the food, juices, staff & ambiance all kick ass. They've continued to expand their dining area over the years to accommodate more customers and now have full service waiters so you can sit down and take time to look over the menu. My fiance and I ordered the breakfast pizza special which was amazing. It had this homemade croissant-like crust with scrambled eggs, hash, tempeh bacon & a delicious cashew cheese that has a little kick to it. I would definitely go back and order this again. It's a good size to split w/ someone and have room for juice still. If you're looking for outdoor dining they have a good size patio and its located next to Trader Joe's which makes it convenient to grab a couple groceries after you eat.

saXW7fbZ8_AyTcTvb7QZsQ.text: Service is amazing and so cute inside, however I've never been able to order a drink here that I liked! Weird textures on their seasonal lemonades and coffees. They say it's an "acquired texture"... Must be!

MsM7pVwFrVsoDyU86j4ydA.text: Love this place, so glad to have a veg friendly cafe for when I'm in town visiting fam! Love the POM milk in my coffee...and the rest of the menu,well, I pretty much wanna eat it all! :)  Also, very friendly staff which is always a huge plus.

kZV2o_Mdg6kWRy4YfxewUA.text: Fantastic place.  The food is wonderful and the service is friendly and helpful.  They are passionate about the product and it really shows.   The atmosphere is very bright and cheerful.  Left here feeling full and happy!

BmxDcwtA_l-a1VBK1_eLUQ.text: While not vegetarian, my husband and enjoyed our breakfast at Pomegranate Cafe. Want to go back soon and try some other options. Delicious food, attentive staff, cute environment. Love it!

9g3xp0Wv78Vyvk-aN5rbQA.text: So first of all, I'm not vegetarian or vegan but I don't miss meat at all here. The guacamole made me never want to eat any other guacamole ever again. I ate there several times before realizing it was vegetarian. The Athena salad in the best. I have a family who loves food but had dietary restrictions and they asked to go two meals in a row when they visited me. Soooo good

HJ6H9Pvi2R8cpzXoj43qrA.text: Still miss you guys but having fun with my new life in WA.

1hYwY_n2bcIQQmtW6gAoAg.text: very healthy and surprisingly enough, tastes great too. Don't skip the deserts

bLbxjFve9qZ90gU81BEfRg.text: Another year has passed since my last review and the Pom is still the best restaurant around. Whether you are vegetarian, vegan or not this is a wonderful place to get some grub. The entire staff is incredibly friendly and helpful whenever I venture in for breakfast or lunch.  There are lots of new faces here now, but the service and friendly vibe are all still in full force. They always seem to know everyone. They have a dedicated following, but they are just as nice to new comers. I try and bring all of my friends and family even though none are vegetarian.   They have seriously killer breakfast foods. The top being the Lumber Jack Sandwich though their breakfast specials have never disappointed me. Be on the lookout for their special pancakes and the vegetarian "Sausage Biscuits" and gravy. My personal favorite lunch food is the RAW Tacos which have walnut taco meat ( yeah I know it's still fantastic).  They are the offspring of amazingly delicious mexican food and a salad.  If you don't know what to get just ask. They are always super helpful at explaining things and making great suggestions or just get something from the vegan desert case everything is awesome.  Try:  - Lumber Jack Sandwich - RAW Tacos - Mocha - Breakfast Specials - Passion Juice - Chocolate Banana Muffins - Snickers Bars - Hummus

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai lettuce wrap special.  Awesome.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It&#39;s as good as it looks.

5VHExEEjLZ0ulA-n1wub8w.text: I'm not vegan but the food was actually amazingly good. The reason this review is 2 stars is because... I saw 2 cockroaches climbing the walls. I haven't been back since. Such a shame because I have some vegan friends who love this place but I just can't bring myself to go back there. Ugh.

CRMsQfho1BLWF8NRjk-Nmg.text: Pomegranate Cafe is okay.  I ordered one slice of pink cake, one blueberry cheesecake, and two lemonades.  The total was $26.  I checked the receipt to figure out what I ordered. I get that all the ingredients are fresh and local, but I was still shocked.  I expected the food to be amazing because it was so expensive.  It was okay not amazing. The lemonade was not that good.  It had a bitter and spicy note that threw me off.  The pink cake was a little soggy.    The decor is weird.  I can see what they are trying to do, but it would create a nicer atmosphere if they would get rid of the florescent ceiling lights.  The staff is totally spaced out.  They remind me of the Cheba Hut employees before they became a national chain.

emo6s38BHB_kuHg5-clFGQ.text: The vegan food here is delicious and good size portions! Although the service does not match the food quality. Poor service, awesome grub

SGacrUeqX8esR3A3g3z91A.text: This restaurant almost killed me! As a vegan who is allergic to cashews I am very careful when I go to a vegan restaurant because I know cashews tend to be hidden in a lot of vegan creamy sauces as a cheese substitute. I asked about cashews before ordering, and I asked again when my food arrived. I was assured that the vegan ranch was sunflower based, but when I put it to my lips they ballooned up and were immediately on fire. Thank god I didn't actually put anything in my mouth or swallow a bite of food. I walked up to the kitchen and asked the waiter again, and he still said it was sunflower based, along with one of his coworkers who agreed. I asked him to ask the chef to be sure (because I knew I was already having a reaction) and he finally went to go check. Sure enough, THREE of the items I ordered had cashews. Vegan ranch in my appetizer, in the wrap I ordered, and cashews in the potato salad I ordered as my side. 1. Who puts cashews in potato salad? 2. I ASKED THREE TIMES! The server kept repeating over and over that he was on vacation for 20 days and they changed the menu around while he was gone.  Fine, but then why didn't he check with the chef the FIRST time I asked? He tried to charge us for the full meal even though I was too busy wheezing to eat. My husband refused to pay for food that I was too sick to touch and asked for the manager. The waiter took my food off of the bill but would not get the manager. So here I am posting on Yelp in the hope that someone from management will see this and realize how serious food allergies are. If you're going to hide nuts in almost every dish on your menu and not educate your staff when you change recipes then you really need to have an allergen guide on your menu so customers can help themselves. I was able to treat myself quickly for the anaphylactic reaction that this restaurant's negligence caused but the next person might not be so lucky. I might not have been so lucky if I had actually swallowed a bite. If you have food allergies do not go to this restaurant because they do not take it seriously.

KdLn1cT5LwFzyX2pU1-HpA.text: This place was delicious. Me and a friend shared the big kahuna burger and the bountiful bowl. It was very good and the atmosphere is very chill. The only downside was that they were very busy as it was Saturday afternoon and so the service was a little slow.

6jcTHIvLMbYjpL87r6_IeQ.text: I feel blessed to live right down the street from Pom. If i had money and time to burn i would eat there everyday. Great peeps, quality and choice organic ingredients. Not too many places in the valley where you can get kombucha beer, 100% raw treats and 100% organic infused teas and juices in one spot.

h0cmsgqHCDiBEHLk2z9OIg.text: Good healthy food. You can taste the organic ingredients from the very first bite! However, service is always extremely slow and the place is usually very crowded. So, make sure set aside plenty of time to truly enjoy your experience

mUU2UjJKpKXAml0Q2RG2AA.text: Happened to be in the area on Sunday wanting to try out a new vegan place. Yelp app led me to 24 Carrots which said it was open but was actually closed! Luckily, Pomegranate Cafe was right down the road so we ended up stopping in to try it out.  Great menu and friendly staff. The food was good. We got our food before we got our drinks, which makes sense when you're ordering fresh squeezed juices... so had to wait a bit to start eating. The man was thrilled to find out that they offered a dairy version of the breakfast burrito so he could still eat healthy but didn't have to eat completely vegan.   My fresh squeezed orange juice and kale salad (kale, tomato, beet curls, carrots) was a nice, clean and healthy meal to start off the day.  The space was decorated cutely, and they even offer a few products for sale which are great products, such as Sun Warrior vegan protein powder. Will definitely return to try out a few more menu items!

xt8vKQ0fwvSywU2ozP_bBA.text: Fun and funky that you almost forget you are in a strip mall. For those with dietary restrictions you have great choices that are healthy and flavorful.  Everything we have tried thus far has been delicious.

1oGSUFr5E5zqWKl4J_gjvA.text: My favorite place to eat in Ahwatukee. Only down side is its expensive. But you get great food and s large quantity.  Their homemade desserts are amazing as is everything I have tried there.

m_5Rba8GA6UFawuWP_lAoA.text: Don't get the spicy vegan chicken breakfast burrito. Too hot to taste any other flavor. I think it would have been good otherwise. The hash was great! I liked the cucumber slices in the free water (I am too cheap to buy a juice for 10 bucks). Also, coffee was self serve and we sat outside, so a friend with bad knees passed on buying coffee in light of that journey.  The staff was nice.

M4-1TrQYHGP2oWFdMZ9DKw.text: This place is great! Costumer service is awesome especially Samantha she is the best here! I am so glad she is back!! She makes my day!

GVsp5xjLkLx31md3wKzB7Q.text: Went to eat here yesterday(Sunday) at 130. We had a party of four and we go to the host stand and we were told there would be a 20 minute wait. Ok no big deal however we look around and there are a number of open tables. So we sit out side in the patio and wait and wait and wait. Finally I got up and got us menus then the host came over with waters 20 minutes later. Almost a half hour later we get a waitress. We of course order right away. A smoothie bowl, cinnamon roll and a green goddess burger. The food was great which is why I'm giving this a 2 star. However we got the smoothie bowl first then 7-8 minutes later we got the burger and about 15 minutes later we got the cinnamon roll. Nothing came out together. I don't know if they make the cinnamon roll from scratch as people order but it should not have taken almost a half an hour for a cinnamon roll. Never once were we asked if we wanted anything to drink other then the host bringing us waters. The service was beyond horrible however the food was really good!!!!!

OT-Y-YaUgqcFtTOlcfZSQQ.text: 40 MINS WAIT!!! Dont go here during peak hours. You have to ask for the same thing 10 times. The waitress kept forgetting to bring creamer for the coffee. An expensive place too !

_2WwJ6juklaFUjTyIvahOg.text: Place is a little expensive but it was kinda good. Customer service is pretty cool and I enjoy the really cool vibes this place has...

FxEkmB-ik16AY-etKwX9AQ.text: I love this place. I knew they were my kind of people when I saw the "dog friendly patio" sign. The inside really feels like a welcoming, family vibe with the creative decor like the huge family table with different colored chairs, to the old bar wood style counter.  We had the Buffalo Cauliflower, Tu-Nut sandwich (omg the bread!), Gila Monster Nachos. And a yummy Cowgirl cookie!  Y'all, just go there. You won't regret it. Some of the menu items, such as the Elephant Bowl, donate a portion of the price to Elephant Care Uncained. I mean, why not eat delicious food and support a worthy cause?  Y'all, just go there. You won't be sorry.   (Ps I didn't get a picture of my food because it wasn't around long enough)

aGFdl_0u22X762BewO5SAQ.text: The service was horrible but food is so good. There is a particular waiter there who gives ok service but this one visit in particular has made me decide not to ever go back. I went with a non-white friend of mine and sat outside on the patio, on a not very busy morning for the restaurant. Our waiter took our order, brought our drinks, and we did not see him for over 35 min after that. People who were seated after us receivedtheir orders and finished their food before we ever got ours. We did not order anything special.  After we finally got our food, about 45min later, He never came back to check on us. We kept being pestered by a pigeon so we stopped the waiter as he was done helping another couple, to ask if we can move inside. He said yes and did not offer to help us move, give us a table, or check on us to see if we needed anything.  I have never had service like that before. As I said this particular servicer is not the greatest but service that morning was the worst. The only difference is I had my non-white friend with me.

sNFiNN8eMZagjy1NiwlqLg.text: Drooling just thinking about the jhantik vanilla shake. The nachos are generous delicious and worth what you pay. The cowgirl cookie bar when made right is worth the drive. The tacos are a win-win (raw or cooked) I didn't have a smoothie here that I didn't like. The raw bagel sandwich will surprise your socks off, and the Athenas favorite is called a favorite for a reason. The raw snickers bar is good when they put the right amount of coconut. I have never been able to make it for their brunch, but I seem to make the happy hour. I love this place

We all three got lattes that we were so yummy!

Big portions and even my picky meat eating brother loves their food. Don't leave with out taking some of their raw desserts home. The Samoa cookie is my favorite next to the cowgirl cookie.

It's the perfect fall dessert, the brownie is Moist and rich and the cheesecake tastes like real pumpkin puree- I love it. I can't attest to the food, but if it's made with the same care as the desserts I'm sure it's great too!

I can't say enough about the food! I love the Cowgirl Cookies, Coffee drinks, Vegan Cupcakes, Smoothies, Nachos, Salads, Wraps, Vegan Macaroni, Bowls and Breakfast are all amazing! ccAeWBbCbTM6qjo_xYIA1g.text: After a few straight days of eating pretty poorly, the fella was craving a healthy meat-less meal for breakfast. A quick yelp search for healthy food with gluten free options led us to Pomegranate Cafe. I had a few of their desserts at Sips and Sweets last year, but had never made it out for a full meal.   Tucked away in a shopping plaza, Pomegranate is shockingly spacious. They have a good sized patio that allows dogs, with big roomy tables. At 9am on a Sunday, it was pretty full but not crowded, and the handful of open tables meant we didn't have to wait to be seated. Walking in, the hostess stand is to the right hand side just inside the door. It makes for a little bit of an awkward situation when there are more than two parties waiting to be seated, as there's not much waiting space. The hostesses seemed a little disoriented and scattered, but after a few minutes we were sat and waters (with cucumber!) delivered.   Our server also seemed a little bit flustered, but came over to take our order pretty quickly. I opted for the Avocado Sandwich with Farm eggs (+$1), and the dude had the Sunshine Wrap in the green collard leaf (he can't have gluten) and the rainbow juice. My avocado sandwich was great; all of the flavors played together really well, and in my opinion, sprouts are grossly underrated. My chief complaint about the sandwich was the bread. While it was DELICIOUS--seriously, I love any and all bread, but this was top-notch--it wasn't a hearty enough bread to hold the weight of the sandwich. I ended up abandoning and deconstructing it because the pesto was exploding out of the bread. Plus, while very yummy, this amount of pesto really just wasn't meant to be spread directly on an already weak bread--spread that love between the eggs and sprouts, yo. Super tasty, but not structurally sound. But I cannot fault them for my own sandwich neuroses, I fully realize that I have some irrational hangups. The fella said his wrap was really tasty, but had a similar problem with the wrap's ability to contain the innards. The rainbow juice was excellent.   After enjoying our meal, we took a stroll on over to the dessert counter so the fella could pick out some treats; dairy free, gluten free treats are pretty hard for him to find, so he jumps at the opportunity every chance he gets. We were waiting quite a while before we were helped, and then the employees helping us seemed a little... indignant. We ordered one of the snickers bars, which was clearly labeled in the case; it was very poorly explained to us that what was in the case were actually almond joys, and snickers would not be ready today. That's fine, we weren't upset and we weren't looking for an apology or anything, and totally understand that this kind of stuff happens. But the perceived annoyance towards us was a little off putting, when we were just trying to pick a couple things up and head on our way. The whole process probably took 15-20 minutes.   Overall, food was excellent but a little pricy. Service could use a bit of help. We'll probably be back, but hope the dodgy service this go-around was just a fluke.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado Sandwich with Farm Eggs

G5ZDrFdU5GnWvaGN_zxgaw.text: It took at least 30 minutes to pick from the menu, because I'm not used to having so many gluten free vegan options! Everything I tried was amazing and I was so impressed with their selection which included raw meals & desserts. Definitely a great place I'll be visiting again!

4K30JlDlbODE4xI6nchLJw.text: My daughter and I stopped by to try out something different. As we walked in they were clearly busy and outside was empty so we decided to have our lunch out there. As the hostess sat us she gave us menus and silverware wrapped in a napkin. That was all we had for service. No one ever came out and took our order, or gave us water or to even say they were busy and will be right with us. Over 20 mins we sat there, we had plenty of time to look over the menu and decide what we wanted. But after that much time and still getting up to walk away not one person noticed or even seemed to care. I am glad they are a busy establishment, but if you are too busy for new clientele we will gladly give another restaurant our business.

pWhDxu1os1RnsBPLG5ldJA.text: Don't go on Sunday's. Overly crowded, staff and kitchen not efficient. Took 40minutes for food to come. Potato Salad had some paper/ plastic. Lady next to us had hair on her meal and had to return.   Usually pretty good but today wasn't their day.

AHHhkHmrSt0CInYO3QA6gQ.text: Amazing restaurant! Awesome staff, very helpful and friendly!  On a road trip from TX to CA and back, my friends and I stopped by for a quick bite to eat. This turned into trying almost half the menu and spending hours enjoying ourselves! Even getting extra to go! It was so good, as a matter of fact, that I stopped twice more on the way back! I really wish Houston, being the foodie town it is, would have a great place like this! Great ethos, amazing food, great staff! I will definitely be stopping back every time I am in Phoenix!

vZj6M_OiTq4FntxaC9HIAQ.text: First time having vegan and raw vegan dessert. I got the special Samoan cookies and the vegan pomegranate cake. They also threw in the vegan peanut butter cup :)   The vegan peanut butter cup is good nothing crazy, but a good starter.   The Samoan cookie reminded me exactly like the girl scout Samoan cookies. Except the consistency is wet and moist like. It's also a lot larger!  As for the vegan pomegranate cake, I was not impressed. It just tasted plain but the frosting was delicious.  Overall, they have some pretty good desserts. I need to come back and try their food!  The staff is very nice!!

tz8WYPzVkJSa0P9i1m38HQ.text: My first time visiting, I was completely delighted with the entire experience. The food was delicious, the atmosphere perfect and the service was superb. I had the dragon bowl, which I will definitely be getting the next time I visit (which will be soon). Highly recommended!

punSEv6PVQPryyum3Z3erQ.text: Omg I don't think words can ever describe how thankful and how happy this place makes me. Everything on the menu is absolutely incredible and don't get me started with their seasonal cakes. Man I don't know how they do it! This place makes a vegan go nuts, it will also make someone that isn't a vegan consider it!!! Incredible my favorite place.

sIqImPiSZ-jx524LK7AjVA.text: My family tried Pomegranate Cafe for Easter Brunch and were extremely impressed. Before I get into the food, let me say that I'm not a vegan or vegetarian. In fact, BBQ is one of my hobbies. Don't let the vegan menu scare you off. The food was absolutely fantastic. They do offer eggs and cheese if you need to get some protein and our server knew all about the menu and ingredients.   My wife and son had the banana bread French toast. My wife is allergic to strawberries, and asked to leave them off. Andrew, our server, actually noted on the ticket that there was a food allergy to ensure no cross contamination. Very grateful, and other restaurants could learn from that practice. I had the cheddar biscuits with vegan chorizo gravy. It was outstanding.   Can't believe I took so long to try this place. We'll be back...especially to try the mushroom and poblano street tacos!

_wfTKQX1s503YtS-XKCtLA.text: Great customer service, beautiful decor, nice greek / american style menu. Visited here for business trip, will definitely return before the trip is over.

kTkYP63s_mG1R7Jzzi70dA.text: When visiting Phoenix, I feel like it takes foooorever to drive to anywhere. I was extremely pleased when the family said there was a great new cafe, just a few short minutes from their home! When the omnivore fam try it on their own accord, it really means something.  I visited Pomegranate Cafe for brunch and had the biscuits and gravy. Huge portion with tofu scramble and root veggies! It was great. The menu is extensive, so it was a hard decision. I also had the lavender coconut latte. Highly recommended. I wanted dessert but was way too full and even took leftovers home.  The outdoor seating is cute and shaded, and our server was sweet and attentive. I wish Pomegranate was in my home city. PC- If you're looking to add another location, please consider Bay City Michigan... and leave the eggs off the menu. :)

8e2qzBsE16_nAn2LDMCnZA.text: This is an example of current high-end dining in the modern world. Forget the expensive snobby restaurants that charge $40 or $50 bucks for an entree. The intellectual "earth conscious" choice for the evolved connoisseur of dining out is vegan.   Wake up to the only way to save humanity. Go vegan.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The naked burger with potato salad. And a watermelon margarita. So delicious.

fXAzGkHwm-2S_umKDn6kxw.text: Just left the restaurant- no air conditioning! Who operates a restaurant in Arizona without A/C? Terrible experience. How a bout telling the patrons there's no A/C before ordering food!

_owsV7vSPcBWtChkoxaizw.text: I have been talking about going to this place for months!! MONTHS.  And I finally got to go tonight, and was crazy disappointed by the desserts, food, and service.  The waitress was highly attentive to everyone but us (IT WAS NOT BUSY). She was chatting up other customers, took the order of another table who sat down after us, and never filled our waters. Quite often, she was standing idly.   She only asked us if our food was okay when it was obvious that we didn't think it was.  Now to the food...  We ordered the nachos (best part of the meal... but you can't really screw up nachos), buffalo cauliflower taco (too spicy, I'm Asian and eat a lot of spicy, but that was all spicy and no flavor), pumpkin fudge brownie (aight but boring), and a slice of pumpkin chocolate cheesecake (so bad, and it was their recommendation!!!).   After letting her know about the least pleasurable parts of our meal (buffalo cauliflower and cheesecake), she took it off our bill. So thank you! But then it took her another 15 minutes to get the check... because she just forgot. So no thanks!   Also it looks like some new waitress was shadowing her... terrible idea if the owners just want to perpetuate BAD service.  Instead of going here, please go to Trader Joe's next door, buy some groceries, and make better quality food @ a lower price AT HOME.

zABqWXaBDVwdnhq9XL3aYw.text: Let me just start by saying that it took a few times of going to this restaurant for me to really appreciate it. I was convinced if I found a few items on the menu I loved it would make it completely worth it, there are not very many vegan restaurants like this so I was willing to give it a second and even third chance if I had to. The menu is a tad bit big so it was hard to decide what I wanted to try, and some of the descriptions for the food were off. For example, I ordered the curry and expected something like a traditional thai curry but it was more of a rice bowl with curry seasoning.  Their vegan mac and cheese is amazing, I also love anything that includes their home made bread. I actually usually order the english muffin pizza off of the kids menu because it is the perfect portion, it costs less then the typical meal here, and it is simple. The Jnantik Mocha is amazing, and so are the deserts!

MmqQxE3_0Rz465dRHWKx9w.text: First time here with my family,we waited 45 minutes for our meal and it wasn't even that super busy. When the food arrived it looked like they just threw it on the plates without care;plated horribly,the hash from the Pom Plater were still raw,the coco whip was so watering it looked like a puddle of water and my daughter never got hers ,after the waitress told us she'll be back with it. My wife sandwich was cold,it was a Avocado Sandwich, the bread hard as a rock with 4 mini slices of green apple and a dirty plate,like no care to show pride on plating food. They told us ,after complaining,that we had a free dessert for the long wait and of course it never came. Super expensive and so not worth it. 2hrs of my life I'll never get back

8P7FD0o7J4-cCBRjfyjSSg.text: The food was good...when it finally came. Visited here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and his parents. It wasn't overly busy, there wasn't a wait to be seated and not every table was full. When we were seated by The host, they were out of menus. We sat for a little with only one menu and then had to ask for more after being asked if we were ready to order. The waitress brought us waters but didn't ask for a drink order.  Once we ordered our food it took 45 minutes for us to get our food. The waitress didn't come by to tell us it was going to take awhile until we asked where our food was. When we asked what was taking so long, the waitress informed us there was only one cook. One cook on a Saturday night!! The food was good, not great and it definitely didn't make up for the bad service.

BjT4f9Um-JU0WXX-yCJouA.text: I've been coming here for years and LOVE it! Of all the vegan restaurants in the valley, this one has the largest variety of meal options and never lacks flavors. I have even got my vegetable-hating husband to enjoy a meal here with me once...  Today my friend and I split the Pom Burger and the Breakfast Club sandwich while sitting out of the peaceful patio. The portions were filling and organoleptically satisfying and the service was fantastic so the prices were appropriate.   We also decided to take a piece of strawberry lime cake to go and wow was it delicious!  This place never disappoints.

PNoDMZipjgqpJ__BjtlbZA.text: My absolute favorite restaurant! I frequent here at least 5 times a month. They have the best green juice, chai latte, iced tea and ALL the food!!! There has been nothing that I don't love. My favorite is probably the power bowl because they make the BEST homemade pesto. Also, their sweets are INCREDIBLE and gluten/dairy free!!! Amazing! I wish I could afford to eat here everyday lol! Just a little tip......the service can be kinda slow because they are making you extra fresh and delicious food but just know that going in. It is not a quick dining experience but totally worth it :).

S3Vrt9huq_en47oxIPadvw.text: The Pumpkin French Toast (gluten-free) was delicious.   The server, Austin, is very charming.  I highly recommend the Pomegranate cafe.

This is hands down the best burrito I've ever eaten. Everyone here is extremely friendly and they have a nice outdoor seating area. I wish I lived here so I could become a regular at this place! 5+ stars for this place!

jEfx23DCe0qsO_51PCQUCA.text: Such a cute little cafe! Wonderful for my friend who eats paleo! I got the egg scramble with seasonal veggies and it was incredible! Definitely coming back again soon!

Ghgv52HYu67ibXE1e5kaNQ.text: Found this place on Yelp as I was looking for a hearty but healthy last breakfast in Arizona before I headed back to the East Coast freeze. I wish I had more time to try more items on the menu as they all looked so good! I should have taken a snack for the road...  First, the drinks: the cucumber water was a nice touch! The coffee was pleasantly surprising. When I saw the big dispensers and the self serve coffee I was skeptical. The coffee was GREAT. I drink my coffee black and the flavor was awesome.   Next, the food: I got the breakfast tacos with eggs (rather than tofu) and no cheese. The veggies were awesome! The salsa and the guac were perfect touches and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.   Last, the service: friendly and speedy.   Thanks for a great meal!

GzvwvMogNtWUdOgqABZaHw.text: I had high hopes for this cafe, but we have been sitting here for 20 minutes waiting for our order. The waitperson finally came and told me that I can't have what I ordered. Now we have to wait another 20 minutes. It's not that busy. Why does does it take forever to get our order?  We have to be somewhere in a half hour. I guess we're going to have to get it to go. Don't come here unless you have all day to waste.

y5TsUNOlp0dr5xFALQU--g.text: Not settled on a rating I want to give because this place is inconsistent. First time we went, wait was over an hour to get food for a late lunch. They weren't that busy but didn't have enough cooks. We got desserts to go, which were really good. Second time ... service was slow and spotty, lunch was excellent, but we were there for 90 min cause they were SO SLOW!! Third time, I called in order ahead of time; Told them we'd eat there. When we arrived, food was packaged to go, but we grabbed a table anyways. Food (even though we ordered) one of the same meals) was definitely not as good & just not the same.

QK_x5JecBbmNN_e-CPBqEQ.text: I recently visited this place for the first time, the drinks were great, we ordered two of their smoothies, the food was a bit cold considering we ordered hot foods. Our server was chatting it up with a customer, didn't really check on us.  We didn't receive a check, after waiting for a long time we decided to go inside to find out what was going on, our serve was talking to the same customer from outside, then she finally let us know that the credit card machine was down, we had no other choice but to wait, we waited for about 20 min before we could leave.   This is was a terrible experience, employees don't seem engaging, don't show empathy for what happened and aren't very communicating.   Overall, I give this place a 1.

l0x2iw52Ey1wKN3u4IyBAA.text: So good! Healthy and delicious food in a friendly environment. Great place to come if you're health conscious or like delicious food. We'll be back for sure.

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders!!!

0hK_njT0bKya4905wlueQw.text: Ahwatukee has a hidden gem. My family has been here a number of times. The coffee, drinks, teas, and smoothies are a big hit with us. The prices are reasonable for what you get here, fresh ingredients, organic, vegetarian, and the service is always friendly and knowledgeable.  Thanks to you Pomegranate.

9_OPikOS-i5_BitjtZLIiQ.text: I was wondering when someone would catch onto the fact that we needed a good, wholesome, health food restaurant out here in Ahwatukee!  So many flavorful options on the menu (including delicious smoothies!), which is impressive considering the vegetarian/vegan push.  Prices are reasonable for what a great quality of food you get and the service is always friendly and knowledgeable.  Thank you Pomegranate!

gcoQCgshmTq0XWh0BT-R2g.text: This place is awesome!!! The food is sooooo good and coffees are great as well. Love the deserts too :) I do wish you were open a bit later each day as well

hqpIDQBscAJ-VXaH3ZuGDQ.text: my wife was excited to read about this place. surprisingly the place had been open since February, but we had hand't heard of it until this last week. awesome little vegan, raw, healthy food cafe. chatted to the owner for some time - discussed vegan cheese cake recipes  and swooped notes. very knowledgeable lady owner and very friendly staff, nice selection of drinks, snacks and main courses. the salad my wife ordered was rather large and very tasty, but couldn't be finished. I had the rice, black beans, guacamole and mixed veggies bowl - yummy.

p5gXl084wnRHae2KcPL5SA.text: QUICK AND HEALTHY, BUT I'M STILL HUNGRY :(  The Pomegranate Cafe is a cheery place to have a quick light lunch - emphasis on light.  I was excited to see so many leafy greens in a lighted refrigerator case - these would be showcased in my lunch as I had the soup and salad combo.  The Ultimate "un-chicken" Ceaser Salad and a butternut squash and chickpea minestrone cup of soup had an wonderful variety of colors and textures to make my mouth sing - but after finishing, I admit that I was neither stuffed nor satisfied.  So I got a Larabar from the Trader Joe's next door.    Overall, I'd like to go again to try something else on the menu, but I'll definitely go on a day where I need or want to eat something light.

hNE7eXMqhEKq46IIEv1zEg.text: I hate giving this place a bad review, because the concept is so great.  Healthy food in Ahwatukee.  We were excited to go try it.  But since I'm so sensitive to things, we just got some appetizers to see how it went.  It was delicious.  A little too delicious (the hummus, I think was the main culprit).  We got into the car and went to the nearby park.  I started feeling sick.  Lightheaded, sleepy, out of breath, thirsty as hell.  My friend got a runny nose and headache.  He said "I get a runny nose and headache from MSG".  I was like "yeah, I get all these things I"m feeling, from MSG, too."  Now "healthy" places like Whole Foods can and will claim there's no MSG in their food, because they use some other kind of glutamate, which is the same thing by a different name (ie hydrolyzed yeast, etc.).  There was no denying it, when we got the symptoms at the same time.   We thought back and realized the hummus was over the top tasty unlike a hummus I've ever had before (except once at a Farmer's Market, and they used MSG, too, listed as "spices"). They must get a star, I will give that to their organic juice I  got once before because it tasted great, and I felt great afterward.  But it was a bit on the expensive side.

DsYCVECyu2vIuHAC1k4AXA.text: This is my second review of this restaurant. The first time I went when they opened, I wasn't impressed with the food selections and slow service thus my first bad review. But overtime, they really have IMPROVED-they vamped up the menu and the service is MUCH better. So kudos to them! My favorites are Arizona Rolls and Living Caesar Salad as well as their smoothies and coffee! I am happy to say I go there once or twice/week-their vegan selections are delicious! I'm also glad that it is conveniently located in my area.

ph4fG_yXRMgAVSE4SM24Gg.text: Okay, if you actually like the taste of good whole foods and fresh ingredients this place is an Oasis of goodness. If your looking for a place that says they make natural foods but uses 2nd rate ingredients and comes up with recipes to hide the fact by using spices to cover it up your better off going somewhere else. My family took me here when we were visiting, and it is wonderful. I had the Pesto Presto sandwich and it was divine! I also tried my family's strawberry fields salad and Arizona rolls. They were all really good. The vegetables were fresh and high quality and the price for the portion and quality was a good price. I was amazed that they had a couple of options for people on the raw foods diet. The juices are different, but surprisingly refreshing. This place is a great example that eating well and health can be tasty and satisfying.

O_1ligstJrzFoHeBMXt4Ug.text: Ahwatukee needs more great businesses just like this one.  Fresh, progressive, customer focused and a can't go wrong menu.

Vs_0vP3MIHot8W9woM7EMg.text: I just tried this restaurant for the first time. It was delicious, I ordered the raw vegan sushi and a raw dessert. I thoroughly enjoyed my dish and I also tasted my dates dish which was the raw wrap and that too was yummy. Great service, nice clean atmosphere. I will be returning many more times! BTW I am a raw vegan and have been a vegan for 8 years so I have tried my fair share of vegan and raw vegan restaurants!

VWDM8wlqI49ygwe-wAfdYg.text: Hooray for local and organic, and did I mention healthy and delicious! This place just opened in Ahwatukee, and I am super excited. I just tried their "courage" juice  and it is so delicious. I think it has made my afternoon. The place has an awesome atmosphere and philosophy- all green, all local, and all organic. It couldn't be fresher - they were unloading containers of produce as I got there. Plus the staff is super friendly. I can't wait to try breakfast or lunch here the menu looks great, and I will definitely update on  the food as soon as I get to try it!

r892Q3ObuHr2zoCKZA7WNg.text: Go to this Cafe whenever I am in Phoenix area.  They make great Vegan food and drinks.  Rodrigos rocket fuel is soooo good.  I get it minus the espresso.  I love the Grilled Cheese Napoleon with vegan cheese, very good.  I am already looking forward to my next visit to Phoenix.  I will be there.

U_nu46N-TaQWpgG9z6bbJg.text: We've been here twice for breakfast. What I love most about this place is that it is 100% Vegetarian with almost everything on the menu having the ability to be made vegan by replacing things like cheese and sour cream with a vegan option (I've never been anywhere that actually offered vegan sour cream so that was exciting!). The first time I tried the Lumber Jack - it was okay, but I think the texture of the tempeh bacon is what threw me off. I also tried their cowgirl cookie the first time and it's phenomenal! ALL of their baked goods are vegan (and some are raw/vegan). The second time we went I had their breakfast burrito w/ vegan cheese and vegan sour cream and it was excellent! Also, the teas they serve are amazing. I suggest the white peony - perfect, lightly fruity, breakfast tea. We will be back to try lunch!

shuLCTDHYgsJAJJkjoUkJg.text: great place!!! the products are fresh and organic. huge different between this restaurant and most places out there. enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nl6CS1UnZY4yRodRyj3kNA.text: Great place and it keeps getting better. Their coffee is totally awesome (comes from coffee cartel, how could it not be?) and the menu/food choices keep getting better and better. We love to go for breakfast and get tofu scrambles.  Their vegan desserts are really incredible too. We love this place!  So great to find a vegetarian restaurant of this quality.

jTgNsfQHqkaW_sZR7VsQWA.text: Hip, trendy, in the edges of chandler?  It's  hip but it's also really good.  The juices are creative and exotic.  The prices are a bit steep--but not for the quality.

90-zkWyxzKCu1tMF4jGHKA.text: This place can be nice or terrible depending on what time you go. I usually order the avocado and green chili cheese crisp. My most recent expierence was really disappointing. Before my recent vistit and any time I've gone there they always got my food out looking excellent, taste is amazing (however not consistent). The wait time doesn't bother me, I'm paying for good food I don't mind waiting. I ordered a TOGO of what I usually get and a smoothie that I've gotten before that I really liked. When I got home the smoothie had an after taste of barf, and the food was not good at all. I've gotten it a lot of times before so I'm not sure if they changed the vegan cheese on it or what happened. But it had this orange colored chesse on it and it didn't do the food any justice, didn't taste great at all. I ordered the vegan cheese, but it really looked and tasted like normal cheese. I am really disappointed, I spent a good amount of money on what I thought would be good food. I didn't spend the money so people could mess up on my food/drink. I would have rather them tell me they fucked up my order and spend the extra time making it right rather than getting it out as quickly as possible. I find the best service is around 4-closing. The morning service is just not that great.

yHZPTsl-REw49Ior_Okj8g.text: I just heard about this place from my hairdresser today, and made a beeline for it. Let me just say it was wonderful. The people were extremely friendly and helpful, the food was OUTSTANDING, the ambiance was warm and inviting. They also had a huge selection of teas and coffee's. Their signature pomegranate tea is homemade by the owner with agave. Super yummy! I HIGHLY recommend this little gem to the veggie and non-veggies out there! Yum, Yum!

vCQW_-6QflDaiEgrN-raJQ.text: The food here is fantastic and the staff is very friendly. Looking at the other diners' plates, it's hard not to want to try everything on the menu. I've had the dragon bowl, curry bowl, green burrito, several salads, and a vegan baked good or two... all were excellent. Their order taking and table service process on the other hand is a complete disaster. All orders are taken at the register and you are given a laminated tarot card of sorts to identify your table to the server. I've never been in a restaurant that takes so long to ring up orders. I'm not sure if it's because the menu isn't conventional and people always have questions, or if it's their iPad POS system or if it's the fact that they have to sort three separate pieces of paper in order to keep record of open orders and sales. Either way, it results in a huge backlog of customers. The tarot card system is sort of funny because there are always servers walking around in a fog with food or drinks in their hands searching for these cards or someone with an expectant look in their eyes. More often than not, you'll be offered food that you haven't ordered before you get the food that you did. Lucky for them, they put out great food, and I'm able to view these frustrations as mere quirks that match the staff's friendly, quirky disposition.

ft_Yaf0z7anls8oIoqMuYQ.text: This is just a great restaurant - great staff, and the food is fantastic. Go there, you will have a great experience. Try the daily special, it is always good.

bOCyd9LVJt8S5wf8WIEwCg.text: Didn't know it was vegan when I walked in but I walked out a happy (and well fed) camper. The menu is jammed with all kinds of delicious sounding options. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they offer green juice shots (the bitter-but-good-for-you kind) with a pomegranate juice chaser. Nice touch! Food is excellent and very fresh. Server was incredibly helpful for my first time there. I will definitely be back!

ccR2E89mMHOQkw5BNTR0pw.text: What's the big deal. Food tasted mediocre and over-priced. I had a some egg-like dish. Place looked nice with outdoor seating and colorful inside, that's why I tried it. But expansion seems over-zealous. Waste of money. Try "Green", it's super tasty.

tF8VfeUcUuPq7DIbBm49fg.text: Super friendly, helpful, and attentive staff.  This cafe is so adorable too.  I was really impressed with all the delicious sounding menu options. I could hardly decide!  I got the Elephant Curry Bowl which has roasted vegetables and curry sauce. I chose the tofu and quinoa options. Yum!  I also got a shot of the Brain On which comes with a Pom juice chaser.  My friend and I stayed and chatted for a while after our meal and they brought us a chocolate truffle!   I can't wait to go back.

0DYCxM3tf0K70DH8Ft_HxA.text: Honestly one of my favorite restaurants.  Pomegranate is place I can go and literally order anything and know it will be good for me. I have some issues with dairy and gluten so its nice to know that I can order lunch and not feel gross after I eat.  I usually get the burger special they have which never disappoints. I also love the breakfast protein bowl and have tried some of their raw selections - all so delicious! Everything is homemade, organic and a lot of the food is locally sourced.   Yes, this won't be an $5 footlong but like others have said organic, fresh food is pricey. I buy it for my kitchen. I would rather pay more to eat food that is good for my body and that is truly natural. Thanks Pomegranate!!

TOp_oqllpBOxBXaW4iLCbA.text: love this place, food is so freaking fresh and good. best thing on the menu is the thai dye salad- seriously so good! except it used to be the mermain salad which i thought was better, so i always add kelp noodles to it to make it more like the old version. the only thing with this place is their service is a little slow, so we only go here when we know we have plenty of time to hang out, never when we are in a rush!

4zM6taqDfrWav4pu-vBfGg.text: As someone who is not vegan or vegetarian, I thought this place was pretty good! I went with a friend who is vegan and she was very impressed with everything. The set up inside is a bit jammed but it definitely has a local feel. I don't know if I would be back by myself but if I have someone that's vegan or vegetarian coming into town I'll definitely take them here.

9JbZDo6D99PWttK885OF_Q.text: Pros  Food is always good and fresh - Five stars  Cons - One Star Long wait - I am talking no in store and it took 20 min to make 1 smoothie , 1 Latte and 1 Juice  We have tried .the business 5 time and never been out the door in less than 20 min

dOasj9A_gyx8S6VDzYqMAA.text: First and foremost, I am not a vegan or vegetarian (I did have a little stint back in high school during my XXX hardcore days, but that's another  story). I enjoy eating meat. However, I do enjoy Vegan/vegetarian food as well which drew me to Pomegranate Cafe when I lived on the east side.   To be honest, Pomegranate Cafe is an acquired taste.  It's not for everyone as with most restaurants similar. The food is organic and non processed and most dishes I have tried has an "earthy" taste.  The juices are freshly made and is exactly that JUICE. No additives, sugars necessary.  You get the full nutrients from the food you're eating/drinking.   Whenever I come here (2-3 times/mo), I usually get the Lumberjack, hearty and delicious. I get it vegan even though a non vegan is available (when in Rome).  I also order the Abundance, a mean unpleasant looking green juice that is beyond delicious.  If I have room, as the portions are generous, I'll share dessert with friends.     As I've stated earlier, this place is not for everyone.  The prices are on the higher side, but for what you get, it's well worth it. Can you spend the same amount of money and get 25 cheeseburgers from McDonalds? Sure. If that's the case, then you have wasted your time reading this review. If you want a different culinary experience with healthy food, knowledgable staff, and relaxed ambiance, then give Pomegranate a try!

7KEMQw89O5uEGOYtUvxFHQ.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere and the speed of service has improved greatly!!! Some of the best treats I have ever had in here. Kids love it too!

FLD8cHmOYx_iHobNQdLKgQ.text: It's good to have vegetarian/vegan/raw options in this neck of the woods; they're not that common. Raw food can be pricey; some of the key ingredients are expensive and if the kitchen is making items like "raw cheese", it's labor intensive. The food was good to great. i had the raw tacos and got my daughter the kids scrambled eggs, which seems like a good value for the nice sized portion of eggs, about a half an apple, two pieces of wheat toast and an ice cream cup. Here's the part that was off-putting: Standing at the bountiful raw/vegan/gf pastry bar, waiting a bit for the ice cream to-go, I wondered aloud to the manager/owner/hostess (not sure) about how the raw chocolate-looking items were processed. She explained a bit how it was from "raw cacao powder" mixed with etc, and asked at some point in the exchange if I was familiar with raw food diet. Not quite sure how that was relevant to my question, but it set a bit of an us/them polarity to the conversation. And yes, I've done 2 longish stints of raw vegan diet. I pressed on the processing of "raw cacao nibs", as I've visited a couple of chocolate farms and the processing I learned of included roasting the beans; they're inedible otherwise. She replied that they weren't roasted, and they're certified raw, and "oh, you haven't heard of raw cacao powder?". Again, fairly irrelevant to my question, and yes, I know it's a common ingredient in raw desserts. Maybe it seemed like I was questioning the integrity of the restaurant, which caused her to be so defensive, but I was asking in the spirit of learning a bit more from a (hopefully) educated raw food professional. I shutdown when she mentioned the beans weren't roasted, bc I know enough about the process to know that they HAVE to be. It was good to dig a little bit more into the subject online today, to find out that the questions I asked are actually active debates within the community, ie: nourishmylife.wordpress.... Raw food eating, i think, necessarily causes its participants to be more mindful, and therefore, more educated about their eating and food sources and the processes involved and sourcing. I would love to see Pomegranate, and its staff, as True educators of this type of eating in the very suburban suburbs that the restaurant is located in. Unfortunately, this wasn't my experience today.

8VCQVB975_-xrCas35qfuw.text: I have to start by saying the food is fantastic. My main issue is that these guys can't seem to figure out how to run a kitchen. Every time we go they have a back up in the kitchen and you wait a minimum of 45 minutes to an hour for your food. Because they can't figure out their kitchen then the wait times for a table are 45-60 minutes on a Saturday or Sunday. I could understand having growing pains and correcting the issues but they don't seem to understand how to get a handle on it. This place could be a gold mine if they could turn out food faster and turn tables. If I was a server there I would be extremely frustrated because that is my livelihood and it may affect their tips (I always tip 20% or more).  I can't understand how the new location will be successful considering the problems they have at this location. Why not focus on one location and make it perfect before moving onto opening a new location. Such a shame because as I said food here is the bomb but you have to come with allot of patience and low expectations for service time.

4_zle4dL0NIPwz5nEht0WQ.text: Due to business in Phoenix, I came across this place through a yelp search (what else), and was so happy after my first visit that I came back a second time on my departure day, grabbed dinner and had them pack me something as an in-flight meal.  They offer a great selection of vegan and raw vegan food, and while the vegan choices do offer a few comfort food items for the meat-eating-boyfriend-types, most of the menu is fairly healthy. As a mostly raw vegan, I did appreciate their raw selections, although I admit I went weak and had to try their daily burger, which was absolutely delicious!  They also have an eclectic dessert selection, which I resisted, but looked splendid.  I am sure that I will return here anytime I am in Phoenix.

EUV40FIhJ_1V5pFE48sfkg.text: Great place for vegan food... Nice exotic flavors. We ordered quinoa with soy meat and scrambled goodness :) very pricey for the quantity so a table for two with drinks will not be less than $45... Their exotic drinks are $6 -$12 ... Definite try for once but not sure if I can keep going there :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa with soy meat !

zrctyfQv5DPvqzagBW7NDw.text: Last time I was here I left a 3 star. The owner responded right away & made things right. Today I am here & the food was exceptional as well as the service. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. I drive from north central Phoenix & it is always worth it!! Yum!  Cookies & deserts are the best outside of Denver or San Francisco!

u5VawPNtpd4FytDlad1nIg.text: Very delicious food. I'm not a vegetarian, but I enjoyed the BBQ veggie quesadilla. The food was flavorful and tasted fresh and healthy. And it was plenty of food, I was stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ veggie quesadilla and salad

H5l9HRWqaL_UGSOVPiUrUg.text: I am biased because my family members own this cute little cafe. However, I'm a picky eater, plus I'm a vegetarian (5 years strong). Cassie (my moms cousin) is the sweetest and smartest human on the planet. She is so creative and innovative. I've been here countless times and not once have I been disappointed. For an all vegetarian/vegan restaurant, I've got to say that they're doing excellent. I recommend this to anyone coming to the Phoenix area! I've brought my friends, and even my father, who lives out of town and is the pickiest eater, and he even agrees that the food was delicious, along with their coffee. Needless to say they deserve 6 stars. It's a busy little place and they've renovated multiple times to keep up with the growing traffic. I love Pomegranate Cafe and I'm excited to watch it flourish.

KS19XM6oAUqDNLi_X0ZTqg.text: I went to Pomegranate Cafe today during their lunch rush and it was a fantastic experience.  As soon as I walked in I was greeted with a smile by the young gentleman behind the counter. We were seated promptly and brought waters and menus. A moment or two later another person came over and asked if we had been here before or had any questions. They told us about the 100% organic and seasonal menu. The Meatloaf sliders were AMAZING. They had the familiar taste and texture of meatloaf. I couldn't believe they were vegan and made from scratch!  I love this place and will definitely be back again. The food is worth the wait!

ybksszv4Z9PqEYYB68YHuw.text: I visited this establishment when I was on vacation. I wish I lived closer so I could eat here more often! My daughter LOVED it too!

35szUzwYbSIRYH6j1v7rUw.text: I mean, it's probably the best $15 quesadilla you'll get in town.  If that's not your thing you can probably score a $14 salad.  But if you're really feeling froggy, try the $13 half soup and terrible sandwich!

H-Nq9Tl3xmSaz4q82SUb4Q.text: I'm a long time Pomegranate visitor. It's one of the only options currently for plant-based eaters, especially since Sage closed in Phoenix. The food is decent, though expensive, but i've definitely had better in other states. It takes a while to be seated on a weekend at Pom, and even longer to get your food.

MTdUzUoWOyr19RUiF8VtQA.text: One of my favorite places for vegan breakfast! Today's feast included pecan cinnamon rolls and a tofu scramble! Their secret weapon is an innocent looking pomegranate jam! Knock your sox off!

ss_7AsTshlCpP2CoKxK3JA.text: SUPER APPRECIATION for local produce distributors in the form of edible ARTWORK.   If you value yourself, I highly recommend Pom everything!

QiaL_4dBJWO_OR8dBEdw1A.text: Who knew eating healthy could taste so good. My wife absolutely loves this place and has gotten so much inspiration for our habits at home from this place. For me it's 5 stars for the food and atmosphere.  Only downside is its not cheap. You'll shell out to eat here. I do suggest their smoothies, excellent.

DzQFky-oZzQ0kERzkozIww.text: Please attend this place if you like waiting 20 minutes to be seated when there are multiple open tables. Then get seated at dirty table and then the waitress sprays you with the table cleaner. Waited over 50 minutes for the food that never came and 4-5 "your food will be right up" before walking out. We ordered breakfast and they offered us chips and salsa till our food got there. It was lunch time by the time our breakfast didn't show. If you like that kinda of service be my guest.

qzGUPeghxC5qE-F1ZhEjKA.text: I was nervous about the service situation after reading other reviews but clearly the Pomegranate gang listened to feedback. We were greeted as we walked in and the young lady explained our choices to sit or order at the counter.  The menu was eclectic and had something for everyone as long as no one was dying for bacon. The daily scramble was tasty and filling. Despite the fact I was a square banker in a hippy kingdom, I very much enjoyed the experience and will be back.

E_6o8Sa9R6xAs5PiUpfX5A.text: The food is ridiculously overpriced. $10 for a smoothie? You have got to be kidding. It does have a nice ambience though and the food is decent, but way too greasy.

5Q7R9pCU_a7tFbm1NHvtaA.text: We are not vegans or vegetarians, but enjoy all kinds of food!  We have wanted to stop in for several months now and just found the opportunity.   Nice atmosphere, but the tables were a bit crowded together. We were the only patrons in a Tuesday at 10:00am.  We enjoyed the Lumberjack sandwich with egg & cheddar cheese, Maple Granola w/vanilla yogurt and a kid's bagel with avocado, lettuce and hummus. Pomegranate soda and two coffees to wash it all down.  Everything was fresh and flavorful!  The price was right on for such quality ingredients.   We'll definitely be back to try more great items! Maybe take a dessert or two home.

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet Treats &amp; fresh eggs!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Place your order here.

bzc9QMD_pGRVyJ20-dG9WA.text: I will start off by saying that the food was amazing! But I am so disappointed in the service. I called in my order at 11:40am and asked if it would be ready for pick by 12:05 and they said yes. I get there around 12:07 and my order is not ready, they said they needed a couple more minutes...so I waited...and waited..and waited. At 12:20 no one had informed me about the status of my order, I felt completely ignored. I stand up and ask what is the status, they tell me they need 2 more seconds and offer me a free desert as their apology. 12:32, my lunch is over and my food is still not out, I tell them I want my money back and she tells me to give her one more minute, runs to the back and come running back with my food. It is really a shame that their customer service was not good today, I was a 1st time customer and was really looking forward to it, kind of crappy that their service ruins how amazing their food is, especially when you have a 30 minute lunch.

WCCxnIlCiBMViiNIk-tWKw.text: So, I'm a carnivore, or at least I thought I was.  Never in my life would I have thought food that had no meat in it could be this darn good.  I have had the Lumberjack and the Dragon bowl and loved them both.  The staff is always friendly, despite my many, many questions.  I tried this place because of all the great reviews and wanted to be opened minded.  I am blown away guys, thanks for showing me that meatless meals can be filling, satisfying, and delicious!

gKayjeej39D_BMUtB06ecg.text: The menu is not nearly descriptive enough. I ordered a chickpea Mediterranean salad expecting falafel on a bed of lettuce. What I got was curried chickpea cakes on swiss chard and kale...disgusting. Not to mention two salads and lemonade cost $46. Never coming here again.

TExMV1TgvyuzcSgUD7TNtw.text: I just had the best experience at Pomegranate Cafe! This was my first time and the cashier and the owner went over the menu with me and provided suggestions on what to get. It was a hard decision because everything sounds amazing. I finally settled on the Athena Bowl which has tabouli, hummus, pesto on a bed of kale. The flavor was amazing and the pita bread was great for the hummus and pesto. I must also say that the restaurant is so adorable! They have the cutest tables with great center pieces. I noticed on the way out that they have herb boxes out front amongst the outdoor seating. The desert case is to die for and I gave into temptation and left with a slice of carrot cake AND a brownie. I know, I was really bad! The thing that impressed me the most about this place (besides the vegan food) is that they are so nice! Everyone there was so social and made me feel right at home. I really hope that they open up additional locations and put one in North Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing deserts!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Athena Bowl and Pomegranate Green Tea

W6WcVyKaVwrt5cpm_0b5uw.text: I like their Patio very much and the principle concept of the place. We used to go there regularly last year. But then we stopped since our enjoyment started to drop out of several reasons: very variable quality of the food and drink items, coffee is very sour, tea is served with cups half filled, very pricy and getting pricier and pricier (a kids milk costs 4 dollar, making it also not a family friendly place), high prices are not reflected by high food quality and good taste of the food, the inside is very loud due to use of juice makers in the open kitchen (I know this is common in usa, but it is just LOUD), sweet items are too sugary to the degree that sugar crystals are felt between teeth, and I find also that service does not reflect the price (for a 6 dollar drink-in latte plus sweet, I would like to have it brought to my table, if I sit outside and not wait 10 min at the counter, before I sit down, almost dropping two items and my bag in my hand while opening the door).

yVI2_zDiSnXFydG1tIlMCg.text: We ate there our first day of vacation, Russell was our server.  It was fantastic. We had to return on our last day of vacation and we brought more people.  Place is so great we wish we could bring it home in NH. Awesome! Our friends ate the cakes and said it was the best they ever had.  I'm gluten free and there were several choices. Great, great, great!

ucBaJ-6wVmasG2elPY6wag.text: I have stopped in a couple times to try their coffee and juices. Pretty unique place with a hipster meets vegan vibe. I like it. Service is very nice.  Tried their coffe since it was peixoto beans and was not to fond of their lattes as it is hard to hold a candle to the original coffee shop. The hibiscus cooler is solid! Great and refreshing . The magic coffee is very different for a latte not really my favorite . Just noticed they serve nitro coffee and will have to try next.

w5lFf_2ao_RshFLCT0pL9Q.text: On the one hand... I love the ranchero skillet. Its freaking delicious and I have had it more than a few times. Its super filling, and the last time I ate it, I even got full halfway through it and had enough for leftovers this morning. Its well worth the $10.50 it costs.  On the other hand.... If I buy a piece of $6.00 cake, I expect to get fresh cake. Not the leftovers from yesterday that are hard, dry and stale. We took a piece of cake to go to eat later and was given a piece leftover from what I can only assume was from the day before that was hard and unappetizing. We did not enjoy it at all. If you must insist on selling day old cake, sell if for less than the asking price of the good, fresh cake. Its almost thievery to sell a product of less quality for the same price as the fresh product.

VbAuFft5LMi5s2fIde5I3g.text: Caution!!!! I ate there about 1 week ago and almost exactly 24 hours later I was experiencing severe stomach cramps, vomiting, diarrhea, and just felt like hell. I am not 100% positive it was from this place, but given the timing and the fact that this was the only place where my girlfriend didn't eat the same thing I did, I'm pretty damn sure. I had a vegetable juice with a salad and my guess is they either didn't wash the veggies well enough or aren't washing their hands/equipment well enough. It's been almost 1 week and I am still experiencing symptoms. Considering how sick I got from this place I will probably never eat there again. Caution!!!!  If you have been sick from this place as well, please report them to the county health department so no one else has to go through the same thing.

umOB8j-SQDyDAYlb2Jnuwg.text: My daughters brought me here and we keep coming back whenever I am in town. Clean, healthy, big portions, and made with love. I'm from KY so of course the prices seem high, but the food is worth it. Pay attention to the specials. Smoothie, juice, latte, dang so many fun choices.

1A2-Mz2cU8JXBTk5e8HN6g.text: I went here today and enjoyed it quite a bit. The food is fresh, healthy, and still manages to be indulgent. The vegetables are local and taste so good. The flavors they achieve are something special.   For my entree I had a tahini eggplant burger. It came with lots of greens (I think arugula and kale?) as well as some type of creamy sauce and some other toppings like tomato, sprouts, etc. The bun was flavorful and had good texture, something that is unusual for most vegan buns. It came with a side of potato coins (fried potato slices) and house made BBQ sauce, hummus and veggies (hummus was Indian spice flavor and the veggies were bell pepper, cucumber and a whole purple carrot). The hummus was sort of strangely grainy and chunky, which was not what I was expecting. It ended up tasting nothing like hummus really, but was still good as a veggie dip. The vegetables were crisp and fresh.   We ordered a tiramisu (layers of coffee cream, date nut layers and cream) which was incredibly delicious. I am not vegan and normally approach vegan baking with a lot of skepticism as it is often far out of my comfort zone, but as long as you have an open mind, you'll be pleasantly surprised with what Pomegranate has to offer. The tiramisu tasted like coconut, coffee, cream and HEAVEN. The layers of date nut stuff were slightly chewy and had a vaguely caramel like flavor. It came with some chocolate sauce and strawberries and was on the whole really good.  However, there are some downsides to the experience. The atmosphere is cute enough but it was crowded, noisy, and the space is not that large. The decorations are bright and cheerful but it had a vaguely cafeteria-ish vibe due to the tables being very close together. Water is self-serve. You order at a counter and the service is similar to other fast-casual places. We ordered the tiramisu for dessert and it never arrived, and we had to go back to the counter to ask for it. We waited for another long time and finally someone came to tell us the tiramisu was frozen, and that we could eat it frozen or try something else out of the dessert case.  While it wasn't a problem for it to be frozen, the whole losing our order and then not having the item in the correct condition was frustrating. While at the counter, another person had the same thing happen to their group as well.  The prices are also really high for the portion size. I get that the food is really high quality, and it certainly tastes like it, but my burger was the size of a regular burger and cost $12. With tax and tip my bill came to more than $15 just my entree and a glass of water. My friend picked up the tab for the dessert, around $4-5, and her breakfast platter entree was $10 so her bill was about the same.  Overall it was a good experience and I liked the food, but for the price, I am hesitating on whether to go back or not.

FqNtkxzgJ8RxZz7zxESkrw.text: Breakfast and lunch cafe with good coffee (each order receives its own French Press!). It's a vegetarian cafe, but don't let that scare you away. The food is very good.  I blindly stumbled upon this place without a clue as to what it was about. So, as I was perusing the menu -- scanning, scanning -- I was anxiously asking myself, "Where's the meat?!" Ahhh...ok; there is none. I played it cool though, like I knew this fact already, and I ordered the In Season Scramble for $8.  When my meal arrived (see picture), I was blown away! This was hearty...and delicious! Meat be damned! Who needs it? This was great stuff. The portion was generous; the flavors were exciting -- fresh and yet savory. Even the toast was very good. Oh, and the Harvest (potato & sweet potato) Hash...excellent!  The coffee was good too. They give each order it's own French Press with a mini hourglass: when the sand runs out, press down and enjoy. The coffee roast is a lot lighter than what I typically drink. It wasn't smoky or bold; instead it was light with pleasant fruit backnotes. It wasn't bad, but perhaps a hearty French Roast in the French Press would be perfect.  Overall, I'm a fan. I'll be back. I can put aside my carnivorous ways occasionally and support the Pomegranate Cafe's local, organic (and flavorful) philosophy. I wish this place the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In Season Scramble with Harvest Hash
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado Sandwich with Egg

BAuaZcO69_a9Y6fCQCIX2g.text: We discovered this place through everyone's Yelp reviews and they were right - this place is simply AMAZING!  I wish I could come here more often but it seems to be our before Ikea stop to fill up before we battle those awful crowds.  Please expand your reach and open a place in north Phoenix so we can enjoy your food more often!

exxic5WHLqY61c9lYq_Xhw.text: Had lunch here for the first time and was pleased to know that everything is organic and vegan unless you choose to add dairy or eggs to the meal.   I ordered the Smokey Tempeh B.L. T. (see pics)   First of all the portion was HUGE! Generous helping of Exotic Veggie Chips and a side salad along with a sprinkling of cherries Plus this Amazing Sandwich. I do mean it was AAAMMAZIIIING!!  Seriously, the Tempeh Bacon was practically like tender BBQ Beef Brisket, it was quite a magical moment for my taste buds.   My salad came with a side of Living Caesar dressing, which is all raw vegan ingredients, it was a little spicy for my taste so I asked for the Pomegranate vinaigrette, YUM! Sweet, Tangy and a little zing from some fresh mint it was much more to my liking.   I'm just ecstatic that there is something so Veganly Delicious ( it's my review so I will make up words if I want to)) so close to home.   4 stars for now, until I try more items, but that sandwich was so 5 stars!

I wrote an email to them asking for a donation for my brothers fundraiser we were holding and I only gave them 3 days notice due to the sense of urgency for my brother.  Cassie from POM wrote me back right away and was so generous in her donation. They even delivered to our event location. She went above and beyond to help a family in need.  Along with her kind heart the food and desserts were incredible.  There were several meat eaters there and they all complimented the veggie wraps!

0tjX3t8NsfPMsYt62BwpsA.text: I have been to this place a couple times to get juice that is fresh-squeezed. It's kind of a place for New Age earthy crunchy people. The fresh squeezed juice is good but way overpriced. I just make my juice at home in my juicer. At almost $10 a pop for a glass of fresh squeezed juice, I will go without it.

H-qbpnwBy-ZOg82RtytImQ.text: This is my new favorite restaurant. What an incredible menu and such a kind place to eat. Options for veg/an and human kind in general. We are all gentler souls for having visited this brilliant establishment. Kudos to mother and daughter dream team. SO worth the drive to Ahwatukee.

95Ze99V1F1C-qUHNgen_dg.text: The food was so-so, but what turned me off was the service. We got there on a Sunday afternoon around 1 p.m. The place was busy. We were told it was a 30 minute wait for a table inside. It was 114 degrees. We decided to take a table outside in the shade. About 10 minutes went by and a few other people came and sat outside. Five minutes later the hostess came outside and told one of the other people who came after us that there was a table available if they wanted it. Our table was right next to theirs. So why did she ask them and not us. But those people decided to stay outside. I went in to use the restroom and there were 4 tables ready. I told the hostess and she said she did not know. Whatever, we got a table inside. what a waste of time. Poor quality and poor service. If I could rate it a big fat ZERO I would.

5GxyDL1LIBMi7BJgyvCz8A.text: This is one of my favorite spots in restaurant. Everyday they have such a lovely menu. The Food, juice and desserts are so yummy! I switch up my order everytime because this place has so much to offer. The staff is always so friendly and knowledgeable. If you are looking for a fantastic treat I highly suggest the cowgirl cookies! Yum!!!

tWDtwSqoHidtt7x-WUQP7g.text: Yummy yummy yummy! I am not a vegetarian but my daughter is and I LOVED the food! I had the black bean burger with sweet potato fries and veggies with hummus. Crazy good! I also had the iced latte with nonfat milk sweetened with coconut sugar. I will definitely be back though not as often as I would like. A lunch for two as $36 yikes!
