Too pushed for time to complain and wait for re do.  When you leave most of your food on the plate should be a cue for server to inquire

KquCokPEjkm5K8NkfQJlpw.text: Food is tasty, but over priced. It's simple things put together. Service took long for one meal to go. A nice place to have a Sunday brunch though.

7Smxm3YKBoDXYmj1e48z6Q.text: Pomegranate is my favorite restaurant; everything is fresh, healthy, and delicious. J5EM4oSd5LNDybVmGlEdFg.text: Disappointed in the service and attitude. We used to frequent Pom when they first opened. The owner was always around and she ran a great place. Last three visits soured me visiting again. Still good vegan food, but the bad service isn't worth the drive.

-QmmjyHmylneSm7LAFndOQ.text: This place is seriously one of my favorite places to eat! The food is so good and the service is always excellent, I'm not vegetarian but I still love their food! Their espresso is also absolutely AMAZING! I constantly recommend this place.

wL9ZALFH4CrQZG-1PFqeTg.text: Good food, okay service, overpriced. To bad, because I would love to go more frequently. Again, simply overpriced.

hVmeEYIs9Hvh8-JfmKSRzg.text: Amazing experience I first need to start with the fact I'm newly vegan and my husbands not vegan at all the menu was foreign to us and I didn't know where to start we drove 30 minutes to try this cafe and it was well worth it our server Stephanie promptly brought us water made sure we completely  understood the menu  made us aware of specials.let us try some amazing soup made sure we were aware of brunch specials for the weekends and happy hours that they offer  and even all there yummy looking sweets she made a point to make us aware with no pressure to buy  she catered to us it was a 5 star experience I will continue to rave about this place and my amazing experience  I will definitely  be back

OyRPuin6L4e6sgZxlwc0-g.text: Really good. Will come again. One star off for the confusing order counter vs. sit down.

G2oNC3gvHDeKCUEeGEYo2A.text: I loved this place !!! Food is fresh and delicious!! Menu is original, with many choices to please a family of four! Best cheesecake I had!!! Staff is nice and efficient, and very cool ambiance.

_obb-nkaf2pYjXJYQC3Dkg.text: Love that there are tons of vegetarian, vegan and raw options, and the recipes are different than what you'd expect. They regularly update their menu. The first time I went there they had different types of bowls, burritos, sandwiches, smoothies, juices. They even have a bakery up front. The decor is cute, pomegranate-themed of course, but not in your face. (They even put pomegranate seeds in your water!) The backs of the chairs have enticing words like "fresh," and "natural." You really feel like a lot of love was put into the cafe to provide people with fresh organic food.   They do have mock meat but they have descriptions of what it is made out of. I had the kelp noodle bowl which had clear kelp noodles, mushrooms and marinated tofu. My friend had the sushi (no meat)... sooooo good! The employees are very nice and helpful. Unfortunately, the second time my boyfriend and I decided to go, we arrived after 4pm on a weekday, which is the time they closed. So disappointing! Instead, we had to go to the Mexican restaurant in the shopping center. I would also like to point out that the placement of the cafe is spot on as far as the trend of natural healthy living because it's next to Trader Joe's, a natural pet food store and a yoga studio.

h31HrV4FhrAgzxJm4k9WKQ.text: Local, organic and delicious! I've been a frequent customer for years and the food is always delicious, and the staff is always friendly and personable. There's no way you'll regret giving this place a try!!

FLxmvtvVi5VpBlU_CKKgwQ.text: It really doesn't get any better than this! You could close your eyes and pick anything on the menu and you'll love it! Beautiful , healthy and creative food. The owner is so sweet and the staff so friendly. If I could eat at Pomegranate  everyday I would!

gozbnofHC8_lukXKkQPEgQ.text: Absolutely love this place. I'm not vegan, so I do like that they have free-range eggs. Their breakfast and wraps are delicious, love the superfood hot chocolate and the baked goods are amazing. Probably the best tiramisu and its vegan, gluten free and raw. The service is super nice. I really wish they would open more locations!

2dTFr2vJ7lFvwtKX1qjHaA.text: Let me start by saying I am not a vegan or vegetarian and that is probably why it took me so long to hit this place. That said, I regret not having come earlier. I tried their cashew nachos and was blown away. I never knew replacing meat with cashew nuts would be such a winning combination. Then came my blueberry lavender smoothie, blown away again. Lastly came my main dish, an avocado sandwich with house-made focaccia bread, eggs (they gave me the option of no eggs) and a pepita (pumpkin seed) pesto. Blown away yet again! Three (positive) strikes means it is a 5-star review here!! Must go back!!

lmWfnY53fZhmeu7YxaEpXQ.text: So... I think Pomegranate and I might have more than a spring fling. I don't want to jinx it, but this could be really serious. I introduced Pomegranate to my mom, my best friends, and even my current boyfriend, but everyone agrees, they can see me spending the rest of my life with Pomegranate. Here's my recount of our classic love story, one dish at a time.  I knew I'd fallen after tasting the Strawberry Rhubarb French Toast (griddle-dipped banana bread, drizzled in rhubarb sauce, strawberries, and topped with cream) Then, the Tiramisu (coconut-based espresso, cream, and date-nut crust layers) sent me head over heels. The Breakfast Burrito left me satisfied, but didn't create that same spark that the flavorful Ranchero Skillet once did. Luckily, the hemp milk latte and famous cowgirl cookie quickly helped me remember why I committed to Pomegranate in the first place.  Our relationship moved to a new level - raw - a few months ago. The rainbow wrap was ridiculously huge and filling (much more so than the basic, but tasty, Mediterranean wrap). It was almost more than I could handle. I tossed the bland Indian sweet potato hummus it came with and focused on what really mattered... finishing the wrap. I cared too much not to. After stuffing myself into oblivion, Pomegranate surprised me with a coffee-choco-nana & coconut milk ice cream shake afterward... topped with crushed chocolate-almond pillows. Within seconds of my first spoonful, the fire was back, and burning hotter than ever.  Shortly afterwards, I fell into a confused rut, messing around with vegan meats and cheeses of all varieties. The southwestern mac 'n' cheese, much like the Philly cheese steak, tantalized me with its decadence, but left me feeling sick and low afterwards. Even the delicious, nutritious teriyaki chicken bowl, brimming with sprouts, veggies and quinoa, was only posing as Mr. Right. Tainted by the presence of faux-chicken, I shied away after only two rendezvouses. Not even dessert could lure me back, for both the chocolate cake (dry) and almond butter square (boring) were a disappointment.  It was all my fault. What was I thinking? A few weeks later, I rushed back, determined to mend the gaping hole in my heart. I downed the mushroom bisque and half a pesto presto sandwich (Kamut baguette, fresh avocado, pesto, fresh veggies) in under five minutes. Oh, how I missed the fresh ingredients, the whole foods, the homemade flavor in every bite. Still, I needed some sugar after being away. Lucky for me, the Cannoli (brulee'd sugar shell, cashew cream filling, dark chocolate chips, and berry sauce), not only provided that, but was better than any Cannoli I'd ever had. And I've had a fair share of Cannolis in my day. What more can a girl ask for?   Pomegranate, I do.

iZ0jmHqnhOXsII0Ag1J_rQ.text: Wow, the food was really really good.  I ordered the brunch special: breakfast quesadilla with tofu chorizo and pumpkin latte.  The food was seasoned so well.  Everyone in my group enjoyed their food.  Busy busy place, but worth the wait.  I will definitely be back!

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Quesadilla with Tofu Chorizo

cOhk3RCNSucx6E1x1VC6YQ.text: The entrees are amazing and so are the deserts and drinks.  Have been going to them since they opened.  It is one of my favorite hang outs to lunch with friends or myself.  I enjoy doing work on my laptop at their atmosphere.

iZ9_Nq-8rOnmDgIxtrwlfQ.text: I am completely infatuated with this cafe. I live in Orange County where the raw vegan vegetable restaurant selection isn't so up to par.  Yes, yes, I know it is a nieche market but asking for a fresh healthy vegetable selection when eating out shouldnt be like pulling teeth. Sure we have Native Foods, Au Lac, and 118 degrees but Pomegranate Cafe has captured my heart. The atmosphere is completely unintimidating and the owner is perhaps the most delightful woman I've ever spoken to. She is so personable and I'm pretty sure she personally spoke to every patron in the place in the hour that I ate there.   But I digress... Onward to the food!!! My mother and I ordered the rainbow wrap and the sizzling sesame salad.   The sizzling sesame salad was composed of a sesame tofu, chili spiced almonds and an orange dressing. They rely on flavors versus sauces in this dish and I found it rather refreshing. The hit of spicy and sweet is one of my favorite combinations so this one was really a win.   The rainbow wrap was full of fresh crisp veggies and I had the hummus of the day as a side. ( It was a spicy red pepper hummus if I remember correctly.) The texture was gorgeously fresh  and paired wonderfully with the crispy crunchy carrots, cucumbers, and red bell peppers. The wrap had a cashew "cheeze". Which is usually a soaked cashew pureed with different seasonings. It all danced and sung together in my mouth. Yes, I am willing to speak in metaphores because I loved it all so much.   I cook fairly similar to this at home so it's nice to find a place away from home that can treat food properly without relying on fats and butters and actually tastes good with out being 'bland' healthy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rainbow wrap and Sizzling sesame salad!

T4KNYXPxisoiWXQQ_TotEQ.text: Pom cafe has been so good to me! Such amazing food and what an adorable atmosphere. I've eaten here several times and never had one complaint!!! Love love love

_AX5uXSsUBm1QSV10a-H5g.text: I've been here a few times. The food never disappoints, but the service is absolute crap.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raw Tacos

b1IRwWbCPBvA7zfXxUnnYw.text: This place was amazing!!  I ordered food for a party.  I worked with the owner to figure out my order.  She was so friendly and helpful.  I ended up getting the tacos and the chocolate-pecan cheesecake.  And wow!  They were so good!!!  We had meat eaters and vegetarians at the party and everyone was so happy with the food!  Those who hadn't eaten vegan food before were converted.  And those who had so happy.   Vegetarian/vegan or not, check this place out.

_XUGM0ito6xH-W1IX9N0cw.text: Food tastes great. You can tell that there has been love put in it. We have been vegan for 3 years and it's often hard to find good vegan food at restaurants- luckily we live in Southern California so it's not much of an issue here, and luckily Pomegranate didn't disappoint! I got the blueberry streusel french toast which was delicious, but tiny portion! Hubby got the nachos which were really flavourful, and he enjoyed them a lot. He got the turmeric latte- you can definitely tell that it's fresh turmeric, not powdered. Definitely an acquired taste but since we both enjoy turmeric at home, we loved it! I got the jnantik mocha which was amazing. I'm still dreaming about it now, and can't wait to come back to Phoenix to have another one!  We loved the food so much we even got some to go- the seaweed salad and a raw collard wrap. Both were good! I would definitely get the salad again, it was so different to anything I've ever had before.  The only cons are that the food is expensive (maybe foolish of me but I expected prices to be a bit less in Arizona compared to LA since rent, cost of living etc are cheaper), and the portion sizes were kind of small (maybe just what we ordered). But I do understand that the food is organic, non-gmo, etc, which I really appreciate!   Can't wait to come back!

F_ZyIj-zzNc4VjnUvX_tbA.text: I love Pomegranate!  Everything that I have tried has been amazing and the service has always been excellent!  The only downside is that the prices are a bit more expensive than other vegan places, but they offer many organic ingredients to justify the prices.  I love their bakery items and I would visit much more often if I didn't live so far away!

6KWoJXMJUsBAgKGI3l8D0g.text: Awesome food every time!  We have been coming here for years and the food just keeps getting better.  The owner is passionate about her business and it shows through in her final product.  If you are interested in eating healthy you can't go wrong here.   We particularly love the southwestern mac and cheese and elephant curry bowl.  The staff lately has been particularly great!

L-mrfTsAGOY4WtidHuqDWg.text: Yet again, Pomegranate did not disappoint! The carrot, strawberry lemonade was fantastic, peach and strawberry pancakes with pecans and soy whipped cream were heavenly, and the veggie wrap with avocados and salsa was exceptional! Service was quick and friendly. Atmosphere relaxing and whimsical. Spot on!  PS. I've noticed some reviewers writing how expensive Pomegranate Cafe is...so I must point out that fresh, locally grown, organic, brilliantly concocted food is never cheap! If you are looking for not organic, not local, not healthy, inexpensive fast food- perhaps go somewhere like MC Donald's.

SCMCMyjjxxyDK8G0-KM0YQ.text: Siiiiiigh, I wish it were in my neighborhood. But I still drive half an hour just for their curry dish and rainbow salad. MMMMMM!!!!!!

ASQVLC30duepRIMAfV5yBA.text: Delicious and healthy! I am a certified meat eater, but their walnut taco meat totally won me over. Everything is fresh and delicious. I'll have to try one of their desserts next time.

We had the lumberjack , pumpkin french toast, avo Sammy, and the brunch special  all were equally amazing. We got two juices both so good . I wish we had one in so cal !

HBE9Y-rncESfueGtOc86qA.text: I was delightfully surprised with the Pomegranate Cafe.  I thought this was another coffee house, juice bar, but its so much more.  Organic, macrobiotic, gluten free vegetarian/vegan cuisine that tasted amazing.  I would have given it five stars for the Arizona Rolls alone, but my husband's chickenless caesar was just okay.  They are a tad expensive for a cafe lunch, but I will definitely return to try these tasty and healthy morsels.

GMx5ibkzDqJsTqHeKp6izQ.text: So far I've only had their fresh juices and the black bean quinoa salad but everything was excellent! It did take a little while to get my order but it's called the slow food movement for a reason.

rNZtBNDBirfcCGbsSSWd-Q.text: We've been to this restaurant several times over the last few months. The food is always fresh and filling. The staff is courteous and accommodating. Today, though they were serving only a limited menu, they made a parfait for my husband to bring home to me, since I am stuck at the house with a bad cold. It can get really busy there, but worth any wait.

XR5PqUrPEOEHtAvqLDYEag.text: So far I've only been to this place one time but it was pretty awesome. I had a caramel latte and it was the best latte I've ever had. This place makes their OWN CARAMEL!  Heck yeah! The coffee guy was super friendly and remembered the friend I was with and everyone else who worked there was also very friendly. Go check this place out!

ny-jxrX5yW9YBk1_5JNuSQ.text: I've been to Pomegranate several times over the past few years since it has been open. I'm always trying to give this place yet another chance because I genuinely want it to get better but it unfortunately never does. On every occasion that I've been here the customer service is beyond terrible. It's generally the same staff working, including the owners, and every time they've been rude, unpleasant, and unhelpful to a point where I feel extremely uncomfortable. The reason I've tried giving this restaurant more than one chance to redeem itself is because of the quality of the meals and ingredients that are used on the menu. The problem? It's overpriced. I understand they're using great ingredients, but I do all of my grocery and dining at places that have the same exact high quality standards that don't cost nearly as much as Pomegranate does. Some of the items I have bought were decent but I've had a few meals from them that made me sick immediately after. I love the idea behind Pomegranate so I hope that over time they can improve their menu, prices, and customer service skills.

oPnnYjr_TUhNIQ1C-ogeXg.text: I really wanted to like Pomegranate Cafe-- there are so few family-owned and family-run restaurants in Ahwatukee, and I can't even think of another exclusively vegetarian/vegan restaurant in the area. However, I'm not going to sugarcoat this at all: the atmosphere and the service are severely lacking, and the food is overpriced. For starters, there are not nearly enough tables, and for some reason, whoever designed the place chose to use a bunch of six seater tables instead of the standard four, so you end up with two or three people at a giant table and a waste of space. The space feels small, cramped, and stressful, especially during lunchtime hours. Furthermore, I was standing in a HUGE line of people waiting to order my lunch, and instead of helping expedite the process, one of the owners was standing around chatting it up with a group of women. I then got to wait 30 or 35 minutes for my food. The food was okay, but I have definitely had better-- I had a Philly Melt, and it was $10.50 or something like that. It wasn't worth the price or the wait. If you want good vegetarian/vegan food and don't want to spend this much or deal with the cramped atmosphere, go to Green. If you don't mind spending this much and want a way better atmosphere, go to True Food. I don't think I will be visiting Pomegranate Cafe again.

5AS7s_I8p1LBfX1RIYINRw.text: Tastey, healthy and fullfilling. Love to eat here and so glad there are other options besides fast food.

lEYG6M3bPA8FVTxBRU669A.text: This quaint little place is great!  Awesome selection of healthy vegetarian and vegan food, and everything I have eaten there has been delicious.

u2HQwZlaMjNSShTgqoI23w.text: I love this place!  I noticed a lot of people there and wondered if it was worth the trip.  I wasn't disappointed.  On the day I went, I had a vegieburger and it was really good, came with a salad and blue chips. I brought half of it home and had the other half for dinner.  I also ordered a drink that was cherry and chocolate (delicious).  I am a big fan and would go more but it is a little expensive.  Also took a slice of the chocolate pomegranate cake (their signature dish) and it was really outstanding.  I shall return!

vGBr9iyBaw2saFNdjsCTtg.text: Love this place! The sushi rolls are awesome...! Everyone is very friendly...Highly recommend!

8MroDo_M7pQBWJE4NXHdgA.text: we need more places like this. whole, healthy foods, gluten free, vegan. yessssss! if you're looking for fries and gigantic, unhealthy portions, look elsewhere. the prices are in line with what you get, which is fresh, delicious, healthy, real food.

yew7AQZgPhcMjPQkhMBBdQ.text: I really wanted to like this place.  Read great reviews, and headed down for breakfast.  Nice location next to Trader Joes.  Noticed the menu only had 4 options for breakfast, and as I am a picky eater, only 1 appealed to me.  Guess the menu changes every week depending on what is fresh.  I ordered pankcakes, my fiance ordered breakfast tacos, we both got cappuccinos.  Sat at a rickety table next to dirty veggies in a loud deli case, and drank our espresso drinks, noticing they were HORRIBLE.  Tasted burnt.  Then the food was ready.  OOPS.  Only the tacos were ready, and I had to wait ofr pankcakes.  after a few minutes, I got my pancakes.  My fiance said his tacos were only ok, nothing special.  The pancakes were served with thawed frozen blueberries, odd for such a "fresh" oriented place, as well as COLD syrup.  No butter or even the OPTION of asking for butter.  They tasted like cardboard, no flavor at all.  Terrible.  After choking down 1 pancake, finishing my burnt cappuccino, we bussed our own table, not a problem, except the garbage was overflowing, and no one helped us.  We balanced our trash on the pile, and left.  We will not go back.

BgOL-IUO_IAfOCIZMnzxAg.text: A truly excellent place!  The food is great & the staff is amazing.  I don't love everything on the menu, but love many more items to make this place a 5-star rating.  If you get lucky you may get to have the raw lasagna that is a special only... it's amazing!

B5M_HFK-UXKCyM4Vsaap4g.text: We went here for lunch on Sunday.  We ordered a Buddha's Bowl and a Philly Melt. The portions were satisfying and delicious.  We'd definitely come back here again for brunch.

COuh6TZbza478K5w33dYVA.text: Support the local non chain businesses. Great tea, coffee, breakfast & lunch options. Reasonable prices, expect a bit of a wait. Although this family run business just opened this year, it already has a great following. In the Trader Joe's plaza. Awesome salads!

yF_5poNbV4DLDzP2HyPc1A.text: My husband and I have been searching the phoenix area for some good vegan food... we've found some that's decent, but overall about a 3 on the scale.  This place Rocks.  The food is excellent, beautifully arranged, and you won't leave still hungry.  They also have good raw options! The staff is wonderful too.  This place isn't a fancy, candle light dinner type restaurant, but it's perfect for a lunch or brunch date.  The cafe is cute and cozy, and we will be going back.  I was surprised with a strawberry vegan birthday cake that was awesome.  oh and I highly recommend the philly :)

EMYLbGsHZ0ZoU8kM89XJkA.text: I happened upon the Cafe yesterday for the very first time.  Having newly found food intolerances, among them gluten, garlic, yeast, casein, dairy - I was very pleased to see the offerings on the menu  that met my needs.  I ordered the Buddha Bowl as a Wrap.  I was intrigued by the TEFF wrap, a nice alternative to corn and rice for us gluten-free folk!  It was incredible!  The food was very freshly prepared, flavorful, and above all "legal" for me!  The homemade veggie chips were tasty too!  I will look forward to returning there again soon!  Thank you, Pomegranate cafe!

jr_QzhSFaO6AE9nWyQkUEA.text: I love the food.  Really it is good but.... you better be relaxed when you go there because it will not be fast.  They do have a menu now so that is good.  The drinks are expensive but I had the Hibiscus Cooler and it was awesome.  Try it, you'll feel healthy for the rest of the day.

59dU143-A5Laqm82RIXDgg.text: Today was my third visit to Pomegranite Cafe. Good to see it's grown favorably in the last year and a half with unique organic foods. The staff is friendly but unfortunately there is an issue I'd like to address.  I have a lung issue with cleaning sprays. After each customer leaves their table a staff member quickly comes to spray the table down for the next customer. The tables are very close together. When I asked the staff if there was an order to the spray I was told "absolutely not." Naively, I believed her. The spray burned my lungs and I immediately left my table to move about twenty feet away. Lungs still burning I returned to my friends at the table about ten minutes later. During the meal I found it hard to enjoy conversation with my friends for fear the staff would sneak in a spray. When a second staff member came toward the neighboring table my friend spoke up for me and said, "No spray." The staff member (male) respected that and did not use spray. A few minutes later the first staff member came to a table out of my  view and quickly sprayed at which time my friend said, "No spray, please" but it was too late. I immediately left the restaurant. This lung issue was just diagnosed this year. No one wants to be "one of those people" but unfortunately now, I am. Staff members should be respectful of the customer. I was not respected by the first staff member who sprayed twice at my request twice not to spray. Say what you will, but burning lungs do not make for a restful or healthful lunch, despite the menu.

daarUynjbmwK3RQwqI6FHg.text: If there is one thing I love it is meat. But my best friend has been a vegetarian the last 7 years and recently became vegan. So this was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. I got the Athena salad which was under $10 for the small. I was surprised by how much came in it. I couldn't even finish it because I was full.  We also got a side of the avocado toast with herb bread. It was probably my favorite of all. The bread had so much flavor. We sat outside and had such a nice server. Everything came out within 20  minutes or so, and it was a Sunday. I loved everything about this place, from the cucumber water, to the amazing sweets they had inside. I had the cookie dough truffle covered in chocolate, it was so good! I loved this place, and everything was vegan!! Amazing!

D7-R11N4cmViTkWi3FgmNQ.text: Fantastic burger, that really hit the spot! I had a great server that loved my hat "vegan vibes" (you can use the code SYDNEY15 for 15% off!)   Recently moved to downtown phx, but I will be making trips back to my old neighborhood to hit up this spot.

RA1SSnbeCpslLvtuEUuFvQ.text: Amazing fresh and authentic food! Great quality and a must try!! Love to come here!!   Great vegan and gluten free options too. Not so kid friendly as far as dishes go but gosh love the food here!!

d_-BFYlFKItKxesqus51rw.text: Oh my goodness! The food far exceeded my expectations! What can I say!? Or rather, where can I begin!? We were greeted with such positive energy. The ambience was mellow but also, energetic. I spoke to a few of the servers, Mandy being one of them--and eventually a manager named Stormy - they all were adept in ingredient and nutrition knowledge. The team worked symbiotically! Very Friendly..  The food was more then plentiful. My mind danced around the menu... I felt like what a squirrel looks like! All Manic and excited.. my heart was pounding with delight of the scents, the flavors, the textures-the ambience, the ingredients! I felt like the rat In ratatouille when he bit into the smoked cheese, mushroom etc. sparks were flying..   My spirt felt cleansed during our visit and afterwards and as I typed this now, I'm ready to return!  Thank you Pomegranate Cafe and it's owners It's team members  And congratulations on expanding- they are opening a new location! So thankful that it is privately owned. I see why people travel from far away distances just to experience this splendid healthy well flavored food!  Eat here, rather treat yourself , experience this TODAY!

WOZO4AZwlxUKQLmtGrHdIA.text: This is my mom's favorite restaurant in Phoenix so we always make a point to come here from North Phoenix for her birthday/Mother's Day. This year was no exception. We hadn't been in a while so didn't know a) they take reservations and b) they had expanded.   We knew being Mother's Day it would likely be very busy. As expected we walked into a very crowded restaurant. The hostess let us know it would be about 45 mins so we decided to grab a few drinks at the counter. We ordered three different coffee drinks (I forget what they were called but they were very good). Within 10 min of being there they had a table outside for us. We were pleasantly surprised!  They had a specific menu for Mother's Day so we split the mesquite pancakes (huge portions but honestly wasn't my favorite), tacos and burrito (both of those were delicious). Portions are always way bigger than we remember (definitely could have just ordered two meals for the three of us). And desserts are always on point (we typically get something chocolate to take home). We love that most everything is healthy, vegan, organic and gluten-free. We just wish they would open another location in north Phoenix!

iegb_cAkLPY2Kqf5NZ9GuA.text: One of the best vegan places in town!! Would definitely recommend, haven't had a chance to try their brunch but it looks awesome!!

qBL5Wv7N_vmpeuHctnvs_A.text: Having food allergies I love that I am not limited on what I can and cannot enjoy here.  I love everything I have tried from nachos, tacos, buffalo cauliflower with yummy vegan ranch to their awsome breakfasts and gluten free desserts. Staff is always super nice, and Happy to answer any questions. I prefer visiting for their breakfasts, always start the day feeling great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oPN1yWSEd7aTpGjJzjvfLw.text: This place is always packed! So I thought I would try it it's very Organic and whole foodie if that makes sense so if you like that type of food then this is place for you don't go when your starving cause it's always like 20/30min wait and don't go during prime hours because there's just way too many ppl !

YGN--hENW20wLe5tQ1VvPQ.text: I never like to give reviews if I don't have only nice things to say....but....while their food is very very good, the service wasn't the best. I have now ordered over the phone three times and every time was given "20 minutes" and my office being 5 minutes away i leave at the 20-minute mark-effectively giving them 25 minutes. Upon arrival the first time, I waited an additional 15 minutes. Second time, same scenario, waited 20 minutes and no kidding the third time I waited an additional 40 minutes to get my food. I finally went to the counter and the employee went and looked around and found my food that had been sitting there for who knows how long. Cold and soggy vegan food. I don't honestly know if I would go back.

wPgsCBWS9WPNVE9whJR6bA.text: I feel conflicted about this review.  On the one hand, the food was quite tasty.  I had the happy hour "chicken" wings with the sunflower ranch and a Jnantik latte to drink, while my pal just enjoyed a Brazilian brownie for dessert.  On the other hand, our server misgendered my friend calling us both "ladies". I found it quite odd and we both just looked at one another quizzically waiting for her to correct herself perhaps. Nope. It was really quite strange.  I'd definitely come back and try more food, but perhaps they could just say "hey there" or "how are you two today"? Take the gender out of it so they don't make their patrons uncomfortable.

QxPxbfZsqpegbIUU9oIFhw.text: Great raw and vegan selection.  Brownies and lemon bars are to die for!!!  French toast specials are amazing.  Kale salad is still my favorite.  I do wish they had more paleo options.  I also wish the servers were better educated on dietary restrictions in relation to the menu options.

UJLtDuBLXYp3wUEvakf7gg.text: Food is excellent but pretty long wait for two bowls.  The quality and freshness was on point.  Prices are high but this isn't fast food or some franchise with pre-packaged heat and serve meals.

z4edIYbjpINL8G-yc5UivQ.text: You want fresh food and friendly service. Stop by the POM. Had the raw nori az roll and a snickers. Very satisfied. Tons of healthy choices to go around. I'll be back.

O50UGCwHSQ7CXV-6B7s9HQ.text: Solid food, I had the breakfast burrito enchilada style. Phenomenal selection vegan food that taste really good. Service was great prompt and timely. What an awesome little cafe.

L2ff9aRvMlKoYaMb7T78lA.text: From the passionate vegan,  or the foodie wanting to try something new, or even someone just wanting a healthy meal this place has something for everyone! Even the hardcore carnivores come here and don't miss the meat ;) I have been going to the Chandler location any chance I get and the vibe and atmosphere is infectious with good vibes! Cassie, the owner is such a delight! She is always open to listening to any tips or menu items that were a special that you want on the menu permanent. I HIGHLY recommend the blueberry lavender smoothie! It has a hint of house made lavender syrup and it always a good one on a hot Arizona day! The Green Bandido bowl is also amazing! Their weekend brunch specials are delicious! The green juices have no ice so you're getting your monies worth!   If you plan on heading there on a weekend be prepared for it to be busy! If you're in a rush on the weekend this is not a place to go. Good quality food takes time and it requires some patience as the hard working staff do their best to get the food to you fresh! Come in enjoy the company you keep and fill up on healthy eats! You definitely won't leave being hungry and there is something on the menu for everyone's taste buds! They can also accommodate food allergies for almost anything! Love love love the Pom!

aW-UymdM7n6szSOJbFMByg.text: This is excellent vegetarian food! We started eating vegetarian and on Fridays and are so happy to have found a place that makes food taste great and not just try to substitute things to make them meat like. Great pastries and cookies too!

ROc1jsW1iYMEOG8SVzfhIA.text: I like the food, but the prices are very high.  Every meal comes with a HEALTHY dose of capitalism.  I just bought a 16oz smoothie.  Rocket fuel + Spirulina.  It was $17.20 with a $2 dollar tip.  Yikes...too much for me but they appear to be busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is what $15.00 (plus tip) looks like at Pomegranate.  I really like this place but that is nuts.  Rocket Fuel + Spirulina

Bw4bOeE7urF250_HSnEepA.text: Great service. Great atmosphere. Great music. Great staff. Great food. Our server was Terry and he was awesome! If you happen to get him you will see. On top of everything, quick, and friendly. Try all of their desserts, they are quite exquisite. I had the buffalo cauliflower which had a spicy kick and the ranch dip was amazing. Next, I ordered the Avocado sandwich. The bread was fantastically toasted yet still soft. Make sure you try POM cafe and request Terry as a server. Your day will be a lot better!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunrise wrap with a side of fthwuiths.

9TqflnXxV26-9dv6SVmsnw.text: Great options for all types of food preferences! Friendly staff, cute space, strong community support-- can't wait for the Phoenix location!

eKfrw232firimbiANkf2XA.text: I really enjoyed my first visit to Pomegranate Cafe. I ordered the blueberry French toast and it was delicious and filling! Service was very prompt and pleasant! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast and coconut caramel coffee!!! Delish!

S3oqTJaOk7Ko8C2lWqjwdQ.text: Let me apologize in advance....  First of all, this noshery has to be one of my favorite places in the valley. Maybe the universe! Today, I didn't have time to sit and enjoy one of the many burgers, bowls...burritos or favorites. On a schedule today...so after training, I stopped in to get a vegan apple cranberry muffin, vegan/lavender cupcake and a lemonade.   Let me back up a taste....  This hidden gem is nestled somewhere in the foothills...but easy to find. Great atmosphere. Excellent staff...and the mother and daughter team was not just a dream of there's to provide this eatery- but a blessing, for those that are trying to be mindful of what we fill our bodies and souls with. Outdoor dining is available and great interior decor to boot.   The goodies that I found were absolutely marvelous on point. Straight up delicious. And the lemonade. Wow. Just wow. Local ingredients. Community oriented. Good vibes. Healthy and tasty. Not a surprise that when people ask me what I eat- I say Pom Cafe!   Great job as usual.   Breakfast next time....

Bjdco-xWlpks93L8gxAiWg.text: Delicious and healthy! I was amazed   Cooked to perfection full of flavor and so much love to all that came to the table. I came here to celebrate a bday dinner and everything we ordered was yummy. I have to say the Nachos are my favorite! We had the burger, tacos and the sushi. All was made very well and well plated. The service was great and the restaurant is clean and inviting. We couldn't leave without trying desert we all had to try something from their beautiful display. It was a great ending to a beautiful dinner. The pastries are fresh, beautiful and yummy. I was mostly impressed by the staff. Kind and very helpful.   Just wonderful!! deft. will make this a regular on my list with family and friends. If you want yummy and fresh food that is full of flavor and healthy you will not be disappointed.

I tried the everything bagel that's gluten free with a side of delicious salad! Can't wait to go back and try the rest! Thank you Pom!

QGxwJfYDJkvL9_YapZLVSg.text: Delicious food. The juice was fresh and very very good. The bagel they make out of fresh seed it was a D licious. Good coffee very nice atmosphere nice help. It is very clean!!!

Mu5mENzj-6WxNcclnzV8RQ.text: One of my favorite vegan places. All the food is delicious. The Pom Mac w buffalo cauliflower is my absolute favorite. Downfall are it's far and its pricey! But if you're up for the drive and don't mind the price you'll be very happy!

AFafpfDXJkhKh2WvWK2qYg.text: For those who want delicious food while also maintaining their health conscious way of life. Pomegranate Care has friendly staff and a lovely atmosphere. Two thumbs up!

t_dw0b14xvLBhXJtJRI2wg.text: This place continues to hit the mark when it comes to ROCKING great vegan food.. I recently had corn muffins with Southwestern gravy, roasted potatoes and a tofu scramble - OMG good.  Hubby had the most huge cinnamon roll and we both had lattes. THEN we took a bunch of desserts to a party we were attending - gluten-free and more.  LOVED that because I didn't have to cook in order to bring something delicious.  Whenever we are in Phoenix.. Pomegranate Cafe is on our "must eat" list..

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nicely spicy Mac &amp; cheese with Buffalo cauliflower, triple decker sandwich and mocha lattes

46gx2cS8i2X5jdOgt7IqLA.text: On a 20 day full body cleanse and our diet is a raw food diet.  The Pomegranate Cafe is the place to go.  They over a good selection of vegan choices to choose from and the raw items were very good.  The only drawback is the raw list is limited to only 3 items as a main dish. I had the tacos vivos served on a red cabbage leaf which was very tasty and tasted just like tacos. The side salad was awesome as well. See photo of the taco vivo. My wife had the AZ roll, if you like sushi you will love the AZ roll with the texture and taste of Sushi. Also had the lemon bars afterwards, wow taste like the real deal.  Enjoy the stop and the food.   The place is clean, great work staff. And reasonably priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BkGzAr08kk4Jkm6cnndZfg.text: If you are looking for a vegan restaurant, I would highly recommend this place. I had to go back multiple times because I could never decide what I eat. Everything I had was amazing!

EECEKcc_4AOCafL_DcV9GA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. I ordered from a Post-mates . I ordered the Macaroni and it was wonderful. I also had ordered root vegetables. Unfortunately I only got potato wedged that were soggy. I was hoping for a little crunch and variety. ( maybe carrots, or cucumbers, something besides only soggy sweet potato fries). I'm still giving five stars because I live the people that own and work here and the food is usually great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious rainbow wrap and soup today!

ldOvcARHq9QaYJ7OCQqSsg.text: I love local/whole food cafes with focus on bringing good quality foods! I was asked to try Pomegranate Cafe with friend whom frequents this place on regular. We came in after hour long hike on South Mountain with rumbling tummies for some good food! We were greeted and sat immediately with menus and cucumber waters. I was in awe of the trendy decor with mason jar as light fixtures and community style seating.   Reviewing the menu, you understand Pomegranate Cafe has a passion for bring locally sourced foods with bust of flavor in Vegetarian style. I was amazed all the different selections of salads, wraps, sharables, burritos/bowls and drinks to chose from. I chose the nachos and my friend chose a burrito. My nachos came with "meat" plant based meat that brought it whole another level. It tasted really good. My friend enjoyed her burrito as well. She mentions that we should come back for breakfast as they have good menu. I took note of the brunch hours for weekend, 8-4pm with special items as noted on wall.   Pomegranate Cafe does also have market attached for locally sourced items if you need to grab anything before leaving. You have come experience this gem.

DhxcNFDQpQeXpyCYSRTyDQ.text: This place is amazing. My Jackfruit Burrito was full of flavor. My juice was fresh and had zing. I wish I could eat here daily but Im from out of town.

vI3_kqdcqtdPoRhTRqmp-A.text: Wonderful restaurant cafe. Lots of gluten-free and vegetarian options. My granddaughter was in heaven when she was able to get a gluten-free donuts. She's been recently diagnosed with celiac and she's only seven and that's one thing she wanted was a gluten-free doughnut. She got one there. And everything else we've had there has been just wonderful. We love the place.

XnPfjWiXRbkJlTHmRf8-8A.text: Try this place even if you are not vegetarian. It's that good. It's organic! I repeat this place has all organic ingredients.  I'm not sure what kind of magic they do there but making vegan food that good is a feet of nature. I admit that I am a failing vegan. What can I say this Wisconsin girl loves her cheese. Going to pomegranate you won't even miss the meat or cheese!

fAk-EDd_BgpNCc1XDgyS0Q.text: This place is excellent. Everything we tried was delicious. Have been here twice and looking forward to going back! The barbacoa jackfruit is not to be missed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gxfb9YVrcL4LdyF_YAGcDw.text: The food is always so fresh and filling.   I had the Greek Isle Quesadilla and the pesto in it is DELICIOUS. The coffee with the homemade POM milk is also amazing- they have a thing called JNANTIK which is a healthy caffeine alternative. You get what you pay for - the prices are higher than most, but so is the quality. I never leave feeling hungry and I definitely will have to return for this quesadilla in the future.

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu !

bcUKPXWLxpn0YTjhkKtTwQ.text: For a veggie lover, it is really hard to go wrong with Pom. They have the most extensive veggie/gluten-free menu I've ever seen in the Phx Metropolitan area. {The menu is literally a booklet}.  It's also not just a winner because of the food. Their lattes and smoothies are the zenith of local nutritional fancy beverage (holla @ the coconut caramel latte & hibiscus cooler). You are definitely paying a steep price for some of the options here, but hey, if theyre made with the sweet nector of forbidden fire fruit and blended cashew milk, maybe theyre worth the $10? Definitely just get them because they're served in a Mason jar. Even your cucumber water here is served in a Mason jar. This place is kitschy and rustic and very instagram friendly. For the best shot, make sure you get the cactus centerpiece in {see my examples below}.   Also, a short word on their desserts: they all look nice. They don't all taste nice. Such is the reality of sugar alternatives.   OH and before I completely forgot, their happy hour is dope. Definite go between 4 and 6 for the best value on already good food. {Pom, your Nachos and Wraps are Killing IT}.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Healthy Sonoran eating at its finest.

jif7oqMGfTvTETeZ16QI2w.text: First visit, knew it was all vegetarian. Loved the iced teas, blow away by the Elephant Bowl with walnut taco meat and quinoa.  Tons of flavor, robust and savory, and large portion.  Menu has a large selection and there is something for everyone (except meat).

jLCpjFwuZGq28V5N9Gozdg.text: I have been wanting to try a new vegan/vegetarian place and saw that this place has great reviews, so I decided to try it out! This place is amazing! The service was great everyone was so friendly, the food was really good, and they're pet friendly. The interior is pretty big a lot of tables to sit at. They also do to go orders for drinks as well! I got the raw tacos vivos and the elephant curry bowl with a greena colada! I definitely recommend trying those out for the first time! All of their food is vegan but you can add eggs if you like.  This place is kind of pricey just for those three things I did pay $40 plus tip. But other than that I do recommend trying this place out!

3kjsFF4eJD3OP9AgWzMAaQ.text: Very good health food/natural food/gluten free/vegetarian/ yada yada cafe. Fun vibe in and out. Feels like it should be on Venice Beach in Los Angeles - was very surprised to find it in Ahwatukee. The Mermaid salad was a huge combo of dark greens/seaweeds/tofu - I recommend it for a guilt free dinner. Friends had GF mac and cheese and a huge burrito. All seemed to enjoy. Desserts were mostly raw and 'ehh'. I wouldn't spend the money on the desserts (because when did a healthy dessert really taste great?) There is wine, beer, cider. The specialty cocktails were a bit on the pricey side so I can't say if they were worth the $13 bucks.There is also a happy hour menu but we did not order from it.

gkY_xUO3sAOJejXDmZ6cXA.text: Loved it.. Tried smoothies and juice, they were really fresh. Also they have wide variety of menu. Everything was really tasty and innovative items.

mA3quO7BdtNLEfrh5B5VJg.text: Finally a raw food cafe that isn't in Tempe.  Love their drinks and raw food menu.  Just wish their prices would come down bit.      This is the type of place I could eat at everyday.  I know it is good because the afternoon lull doesn't happen to me when I eat here.      I do NOT go daily, due to pricing, but I would like too, because I would simply live longer eating here.  Your body buzzes with clean energy (non-caffeine) after eating here.    If you are a person who wants to be nice to your body.  Splurge and give your body what it craves....Enzymes.      Who knew raw food was the answer to avoiding afternoon coffee.......?

M0mkXzILSwoSUMaGzRHiSg.text: Absolutely excellent! My favorite organic, vegan, gluten-free restaurant in all of Arizona!  I especially love their raw options and everything I've ever ordered off the menu has been amazing ~ a definite A+. Great atmosphere and service and we come here at least 3-4 times a month, for our "Pomegranate fix". Can't get enough! Thank you Pomegranate Cafe ~

7aO05k3v5eI601uRjjHeBg.text: Excellent menu of diverse foods. Great place for anyone with any food allergies or that practices or interested in a healthy organic diet. The staff are nice and the food is excellent. It's pet friendly on the patio and the atmosphere is nice and its location you can't here Chandler traffic at all.

WRHqdiGGh_3MwI3unWVLhg.text: This place is absolutely awesome.  I can't believe I have waited this long to make a review.  I am super lucky as I own a building down the street that I have to manage on a regular basis.  I always am stopping by here to get breakfast, lunch, a drink in between meals.  I've had a lot on the menu but some of the highlights are the tamale pie, the raw tacos are delish, the kale and cobb salads are great.  The drink menu is also plentiful, some of my favorites are the green abundance drink and the green coffee drink with berries.  The breakfast burritos are also filling and really fresh.  The prices are more expensive than other places but when you look at the quality of the food and care that goes into making their dishes it's totally worth it.  The only thing I would knock them on ( and I won't because the food is 6 stars) is the time it takes to get your order.  I've also been given other people's orders by mistake.  They are always nice about it but as they have become more popular over the years they seem to have a hard time keeping up.  Oh and lastly the deserts are really good and reasonably priced considering they are raw and generous portions.  I take them to go and they go a long way to satisfy a sweet tooth cravings you may have.  In my case I don't normally have deserts but I don't miss having one here.  They are fantastic.  I am super happy to support this place and hope they keep doing well as there is no substitute out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raw Arizona roll with ginger mint salad (filling and beautiful:)
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold brewed green coffee with apple, coconut &amp; lime &amp; berries on top
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cobb salad with walnut meat and vegan ranch.

WE5Cc-VxfKzrVQx6J93tKQ.text: Chili, "sushi" rolls, pizza, kale salad, raw chocolate coconut bar.  All beautiful, creative, and yummy. Everything we have tried is good. This is one of our favorite weekend spots. It would be a favorite weekday spot too if it were closer. We love having so many vegan options on the menu.

xIT3sTIAOgZyvAP5Bze5Hg.text: Some of the Best Vegan food not just in Phoenix but  in the entire USA....and I am a adventurous vegan chef and have tried it all!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hwxE8DH4hwsDAhCyNHi26w.text: There are variety food on their menus, I love the creativity and diversity. I ordered Power Kale Salad and  AB& J Bow , so delicious food with fresh vegetables . For to keep fit ,you may come here and enjoy!

LRhpQIemw-sp4e4Izi-0zA.text: Ok. I visited here on Sunday morning. There were 4 or 5 people other than us in the restaurant. We ordered latte's and a breakfast omelette.   My problem is the length of time it took to receive the latte's. It was nearly 30 minutes. This is ridiculous. The latte was ok but compared to a place like Cartel in Tempe it was substandard and not very robust.  The food was delicious and saved the service and drinks. My fiancee and I spoke about it and will give it another try and hope for better front end service.

aVP0_-advEl7BlmA2MBF_w.text: Great local place to eat and drink! Must go if you love a friendly environment and a helpful staff!

aNj4oVsgFvLljUQboMh33g.text: I got a lemonade and a burger. It was $26. No thank you. WAYYYYYYYYYYY too $$ for what I got.

2F_slKOPujAgj_aWE6xalA.text: Pomegranate cafe is amazing for people with allergies! They are extra careful, especially if you mention specific allergies. There is nothing on the menu that I have tried and didn't like -- each dish is creative and unique, but packed with flavor. Staff is polite and the owner is a total sweetheart. I've been going here for over 3 years now and won't stop any time soon. My only critique is that service can sometimes take a while, so just set aside some time for a leisurely meal and you'll be fine.

aGkE7gNB0vU7pYPZVfD8LA.text: We were visiting from Tucson and decided to give it a try. The food was completely amazing! Like I told the waiter. It was worth the wait. It was Valentine's Day so it was crazy busy. But I am sure that if we would of come on a regular day we would of had the best time here. The manager was so friendly and and the staff was so kind. We had the raw tacos. And the chicken tacos. Give those a Try! So good!

u2xXmlQ0f2Pj1F4hRSHGnw.text: Food is good however, to go order process is a nightmare! Hands down the worst take out process I've ever experienced. (Actually downloaded the yelp app just to post this review! It's that awful!) But at least most of the staff is condescending, so there is that!  20 mins to get cupcakes with two people in front of me. Wow!

g2iHR9h_dcL148vfUeIoCw.text: Furious and starving are the last two things you want to leave a restaurant. In the past, when the Pom screwed up an order of mine, they apologized and gave me a gift certificate (anywhere from $2-10). This I found odd, because other places I go, if the waiter or cook forgets and puts the allergen(s) in my food, I usually get a meal comped. I thought that was the industry standard. I am not saying I expect this, but I found it odd, as the first time it happened, the $2 didn't even cover the tax on the meal. Honestly, all I *really* want is my food, free of things that would cause me a trip to the hospital.  I am a regular customer; I come in there at least once a month with a group of friends. Being that I have a lot of food restrictions, I usually order the same delectable item. However, I was told to have them make it from scratch (the rainbow wrap) because they pre-make them every morning, and in the past, when I ordered it without my allergens - raw tomatoes and onions - they've forgotten, or didn't pick out all of them, and once had to remake it *twice* because the cook was totally on autopilot.  One would think that at a place like this, food allergies would be understood and accommodated without question. However, the other day I arrived with my group, and when I attempted to order, was told, sorry, we're too busy to accommodate you. So it was a question of either order something else (which I either couldn't have or didn't want) or take my life into my hands. That is just not a fair option.   As it was, I was so hungry I couldn't wait an hour or two for the line to decrease, so I left. I thought about picking up something at TJ's and bringing it back there to dine with my friends, but why? Clearly they don't want my business, so why patronize a restaurant that doesn't want to sell me food?

-PerZdlov2ACl-DHl7vP8w.text: I personally absolutely adore this place. The food takes your tastebuds on a ride they are probably not ready for. The staff are always there to ensure you have everything you need and never wrong on a good recommendation. Usually when people ask me for a recommendation for a decent place to eat, it's almost Pomegranate Cafe every time.

AuAQT0UcwnzkS-bCQC3fmg.text: Found this awesome spot on my way to Trader Joes. First off, let me just say how impressed I am with the friendliness of the staff. Very trendy ambiance and perfect if you're into natural, healthy, vegan, and local sources.

Ph9i6nj0nEbCfEqgnSgQbA.text: Great vegan options, but be prepared to wait 45 minutes  to get your food after ordering

4uTp0k2shL0qNTNAo7WpSA.text: It takes 47 minutes to get an appetizer. And an hour and 20 minutes to get two orders. The bread on the sandwich was dry and crumbled off immediately after first two bites. The mixture of taste was on the sandwiches was not what I expected, I couldn't even finish it. The price is doubled than a regular cafe. It's bizarre. I paid for two meals that tasted awful and expensive. My husband and I were not satisfied with the food at all

qZMvhVmuADHyiym_mLb4Lw.text: I used to come here for breakfast when I lived in the area. We usually split the green bandito burrito with kale salad as the side. The salsa that came with it was so tasty -- I would always ask for an extra side!   We also split the berry parfait as our dessert and that definitely hit my sweet tooth. I can't really speak on anything else on the menu, since I get the same thing every time! Highly recommend them both!   I was honestly surprised how tasty the food was. I feel like some healthy places tend to be bland but this was definitely packed with flavor!

ecG5ur-_G7PEcLxdlfygzA.text: Food is good- not the best vegan food I've tried because I've been very a few times and sometimes it's a hit or miss.  Once I got the avocado sandwich and the eggs were pretty oily (I'm hoping it wasn't better). Today, I got the naked burger with the green goddess patty which is yummy but slightly undercooked the potato wedges.  Price- a bit high for the portions (smoothies) and sizes sometimes, however the naked burger plate came with a lot!  I'll still come back but sometimes the food quality varies. Great for vegetarians, vegans or/and anyone interested in trying delicious whole food meals!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado sandwich

PrNABY-jEaNl9Xxmom3lzg.text: Wow we normally love this place but tonight was terrible. We waited on our server for almost twenty min... food took 50 min to come to the table. When it did - only half our food came. Another five min later and almost all our food made it out. We water finished eating and said just box up the food we are still waiting on. Not sure if it was the kitchen or the server Summer but wow. That sucked. The food was still delicious but I'm writing this negative review in hopes that some things can change because the service was just ridiculous. Half the tables were empty so they can't even blame being slammed. It was bad.

TGtvry9TDVbj08wH-kmE3g.text: Service seems to be lacking pretty frequently at the  Ahwatukee location. It takes a long time to even get water and I have seen servers sitting by the computers playing on their phones while I wait to get the check. Food wise, I've had some really great things and some really bad things here. My friend got their "sushi" roll, which was surprisingly delicious. I also enjoyed their raw everything bagel, rocky road bar, and raw brownie. Some of the other desserts, however, were inedible. The chocolate peanut butter cupcake was so dry, I couldn't get a piece to stay on the fork. My husband had a blueberry "cheese"cake that had an off putting color and flavor. Neither of us took more than one bite. I do love their POM house milk, however. It went very well with their local coffee. I also would like to see them drop eggs and cheese off their menu. They really brand themselves as being vegan, I wish they would take the leap and get cruelty off their menu when they are already so close!

Lxn9V9zFdZbxpmodIkYk-A.text: For a vegan, this spot is a must see. The atmosphere is comfortable and eye catching and the staff is very knowledgeable about vegan needs. We got the cheese crisp and bounty burrito.. phenomenal! Even the nachos were killer.. if you had no idea you were dining area a vegan restaurant, you'd have no idea they were 100% animal product free. And their desserts are just like the real thing.. the lemon cheesecake and peanut butter cups are awesome! Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese crisp

DnBfRjKVpFHpb4SRtvvKRA.text: As someone with lots of dietary restrictions (I mostly eat AIP), it's nice to know there is a place that you can safely eat! And the food is great! Service is warm, friendly and prompt. I stopped in for coffee and desert tonight. They use coffee from Peixoto which is one of my favs in Chandler. The only downside here is that it is pricey. But, I'm willing to pay for the quality and catering to all my special diet restrictions. Highly recommend.

YsGx8bZHESXr99j9PH5kBg.text: My friend took me here. It's vegan and organic. The food here is phenomenal. We came for brunch, You can't go wrong with any entree you get really. The pancakes here are so fluffy and so filling. Make sure you share, it's big. Oh and the Chilliquiles. Omg. It was AMAZING. Blue chips, beans, tofu and HOT SAUCE ON TOP. oh yessss. I wouldn't mind eating this for breakfast lunch and dinner.   They have great pastries here as well. Kinda sweet for my taste buds but when I do... it's good.  But why is it so farrrr. lol. The 20 min drive is worth it though.

wknSE_65J4a9zwDZ13z4QA.text: I ordered a vegan burrito and was served an egg and cheese burrito. I didn't know until I bit into it. There were no apologies and the servers even made a joke about not being vegan and trying to switch me back to eating non vegan food. Then my remade vegan burrito came out and was not cooked because they rushed it out. My friend also got something that was really poorly prepared. We didn't even eat our food. We just paid and left. We weren't offered anything kind of discount either. The prices keep increasing and the food isn't quality. I won't be returning.

CSbu8z2GkXeDCxmmaRX3oQ.text: I am not a vegan and enjoy eating non healthy food.  This place is selling unique healthy dishes and it also taste good. I ordered a mushroom burger w English muffins. It taste pretty good. But if you are expecting Red Robin or regular high calories burger taste then this may not be your option :)   This place is good for vegan, vegetarians, gluten free, and healthy eaters. Price is lil high but they use organic ingredients.

DEIcK26fBzAND6lpMf-Gkg.text: Everything about it except for the amount of time it took yo get our food. The lavender coffee was amazing.

w64Y3sbCw7P_i5e28QZvVw.text: Great place, wonderful service, food was excellent, juice was amazing,would highly recommend.

nzQaRLyzTY6K2jGAutyMHg.text: There is nothing better than fresh, flavorful and healthy food. My family visit the Ahwatukee area several times a year and this is our favorite place. My husband is here every day. The daily specials are always delicious and the smoothies are our favorites. The Green Warrior is my "go to" for breakfast or lunch, and The Cali salad is another meal I look forward to. Come to think of it, I've never had anything at Pomegranate that wasn't superb.  The service here is consistent and caring, and friendly. And- I think it's the best food in the area.

NqEkQEWRps7UhH_3Y93lHg.text: So many options! Nice boho environment with tons of yummy 'guilt-free' options for brunch, lunch, dessert, snacks.. etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pick up and to go cashier and baked yummies display

FtiwqHtq5xCWzoFRQnqGVQ.text: Great Cafe. Seating outside wonderfully food friendly staff. Had a fresh made juice with your meal.

_PTmym3iwzih7ZGwcfoLzw.text: Pomegranate is definitely one of the best veg restaurants I've ever been to and has to be my favorite. They have a vast menu with a variety of options and even have a separate seasonal menu, plus weekend specials. Since moving to Arizona I have eaten here at least 25+ and have yet to be disappointed.   They use fresh and local ingredient that are always flavored/cooked to perfection. You'll want to save room for dessert (be careful the meals are filling) because their pastry display case is to die for. And on top of all their amazing food, the staff is always super friendly.    They have the 3 best qualities any top restaurant needs, great food, great service, and a great atmosphere. I would 10/10 recommend this for anyone whether you're vegish or not. All of my non-vegan friends that I've taken here were in shock that it tasted so good and filled them up!! Take a look at their colorful instagram and you'll see why I rave about this place.  I have never written a yelp review nearly this long before but I don't think I'll ever find one thing wrong with Pomegranate. If I could afford to eat here everyday, I 100% would.

eKlpGApykOmMmBlR_bE4RA.text: This place is for vegetarian and anyone who want to eat healthy. I am the meat lover and I really think they do not make the food tasty. My wife loves it but I dont. But I go there often since I feel healthier whenever I eat their food. Their healthy juice is very healthy taste. The major downside is not the taste, it takes forever to make its food. This is casue they make it so fresh and healthy. If u r looking for delicious food, do not go here. But if u want healthy  food, this is the best place in town.

G_5zK4EtMyPahleQwTroKg.text: First visit*   Terrible service. If you dont mind that. Enjoy!   Many people experience terrible service here. Read the reviews. I dont feel alone anymore.  The manager was frustrated that we asked for a plate and silverware.  They made the mistake of not seating us. Then the MANAGER came to my table with NO PLATES ..to verbally tell me they wont serve me again if i make the mistake of ordering at the counter.    I politely shared that i told them we were ordering in. I decided to tale my family and leave. I already paid 55 bucks on food  Yup! I was shocked too.  Wow.

ewIEbJjoPsh7NxqU3dAu1Q.text: I love this place!  Great service and folds.   I loved the hollandaise  sauce.   The pom cooler was way too sweet so i watered it down.    Only bad side-  i do not like their baked goods.  I tried the below:  Almond joy- tasted like it was made with old days Fudge brownie- also tasted like it was made with old dates.   I couldn't eat more than 1 bite.   Pistachio  cookies- THE BOMB!! I love these Pesto scones- these were just ok.  I love the flavor but way to dry.   They crumbled in my hand.    I will be back though i will stay away from the juices & baked goods.

tpJCmgaou_pC5jlstoM_Ng.text: I recently became vegetarian (on my way to becoming vegan) and my best friend (who is vegan) suggested this place tonight for dinner... and I have to say my mind was blown!!! Everything was so delicious! I got the Bountiful Bowl... a sort of Southwest style taco salad. It is huge and so unbelievably flavorful. My friend got the Mac & Cheese... the portion & flavor were outstanding as well. For desert we both got the Almond Joy type bar... it was better than the "real thing" and with no added/refined/artificial sugar!!! I am officially a fan. I will be back very soon.

gcZYo69bufB_cSSadXVkGg.text: This place is so epic!  A vegans dream restaurant! The place was decorated super cute, and the drinks/food were exceptional!!

mfs1jPbNId6BkTuJ-s6Egg.text: The jackfruit burrito was super flavorful. They take a while to make the food, but well worth the wait. The magic coffee (iced) was awesome too. Not sweet at all.   Love the metal straws.

KcaHhHNE31_hkMMNWhY4pg.text: Like a scene suspended in time. This was the Pomegranate Cafe with the light of sunset streaming in through the windows. I'd been envisaging a visit and finally had the chance today.   The commute was 50 minutes from downtown Phoenix to the Chandler Blvd. location and well worth it.   Ordered a ginger peach tea. After the heat of the drive, it was cold and flavorful. Then on to a chimichanga burrito packed with nourushment and the flavors of vegan chicken, avocado, potato, and tofu. They had a delicious vegan potato salad which was consumed with happiness. Fresh and excellent.   A friend dining with me ordered a Grilled Cheese Napoleon - which is a three layer sandwich on ancient grain bread with melted cheese, macadamia basil pesto, tomato & sauteed farm veggies. Looked great and he said it was delicious.  Satiated and benevolently comfortable, I slowly drained down a wonderful Coconut Caramel Latte - which is popular at Pomegranate. It is espresso, almond coconut milk, and house caramel syrup. So smooth and delicious.   Finally purchased a Dragon Bowl to go so I could eat it tomorrow. The Dragon Bowl contains farm vegetables & broccoli stir fry with sweet chile tamari sauce over quinoa.  If you appreciate professionally prepared quality in the form of vegan fare, coffees or smoothies, then Pomegranate Cafe will not disappoint. Good service, ambiance, and a cafe atmosphere with a background of music. I'll see you there sometime!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Atmosphere
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese and pesto sammie
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Art

_u_g1buArgn9_wQSfhjdwA.text: Love love love this place.  I've been coming for the Happy Hour menu for months and finally just came in to try the rest of the menu on a weekday afternoon.    Pom MAC and Cheese is hands down very impressive especially for the my family who are big meat eaters.   I love the vibe of the place and the customer service is impeccable.  The servers know their menu and have been wonderful making recommendations.  What a great place to come and enjoy wholesome and clean foods.   The best part is Dessert! They have gluten free, dairy free choices to satisfy your sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kombucha Tasting
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RA53VswqTKGGYDfAeC8o4g.text: Food is delicious. Local ingredients when possible. A great alternative to greasy fried food you see throughout the valley. Staff is very friendly

Qs-xT4EnZHWecTdUd7j-Xw.text: I have been to Pomegranate Cafe twice now and I was underwhelmed with both visits. The first visit was over a year ago and I don't think that review is necessarily relevant now so I will only review today.   We arrived and waited for a few minutes to be acknowledged by a staff member but we were eventually sat at a small table by the window and patio door. Not ideal or very comfortable. After we sat we waited again for a server to take our order. It looked like there was only 1 or 2 servers there.   We ordered mimosas and they took over 15 minutes to get to our table. Our server kept saying they were coming but that is a very long time to wait for a drink. Our food came out just a few minutes after the drinks which didn't give us any time to enjoy our drinks.   My friend and I both ordered the crispy "chicken" chimichurri burrito and I found it to be a very odd dish. The tofu was nowhere near crispy and was actually very squishy and off putting. There were so many beans and rice and everything just started to taste the same and was mushy. It also was very poorly wrapped so it fell apart everywhere.   Food and drinks are very expensive and I don't understand why. I don't think I would return after two poor experiences with food and service. They seem busy and to be doing well, so good for them! I am always happy to see a local business thrive, this place is just not for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chimichurri &#34;chicken&#34; burrito - not a fan :/

lu-duROwyeZgT_nJAqpH0A.text: I'm not vegetarian or vegan but I could be if I ate food like this every day. Absolute gastronomic! Love this place and am so glad they have expanded. A local favorite ...

NxbQGz_FkFJndUTsCM9LKg.text: After waiting for 10 minutes in line with only 1 person in front of me, the cashier takes my to go order and tells me to pick it up in 20 minutes. After waiting for 20 minutes and waiting in line another 5 minutes; they tell me my order was never taken because the cashier did not have all the details. Terrible service!! Management and the cashier never tried to rectify the situation.  I walked out after waiting over 35 minutes hungry, bewildered, angry and resentful.  I wouldn't  recommend this establishment to anybody!

903Jr_sBtg3gojQJdCTB0Q.text: Let us get this out of the way upfront. They are pretty expensive- so this prob isn't a place you go to everyday...but with that price does come a pretty great meal, all organic, farm to table, vegan/vegetarian (gluten free options too).  I ordered the Supreme Burrito ($15) and wow was it great. It comes with this extremely tasty Baja sauce on the side and chips and salsa. I do like their food so this is a nice periodic splurge place I can get good vegan food in my neighborhood. Side note* if you want to try bites of their food they look to have a fun "happy hour" Tues thru Thur 3-6 where you can get smaller portions for great prices and a beer, margaritas, wine!   Eat Local!

S-JTBfi_AAge_HlpVhKQxQ.text: Well if you don't mind the resident restroom cockroach that resides adjacent to the kitchen, or the potato MUSH versus potato wedges that I thought I'd ordered, you'll be happy. I should have left with the scrambling critter that circled me when I was washing my hands for lunch. The new waitress was very nice though. Just not good enough to be nice if you want to keep customers. I used to look forward to eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potato MUSH vs verges
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cockroach in restroom, which is right next to kitchen. Yummy.

o8341q5O_0J86hcq1dQtZA.text: My first visit here was on the hottest day of the year so far.   My friend has been here many times and raves about it.  She said , let's all go here and try a  Tumeric latte . So we did.   It was our friend Cristina's birthday. They were even kind enough to give her a delicious dessert since it was her birthday.   The Tumeric Latte was divine. Made with Almond Milk and a Human made Honey . Yes, very unique. We all 3 got one. The menu  looks very good and very healthy. There's even a little Market shop on the other side of the Bar. Then there's a nice sitting area outside.Although sitting outside when it's 116 is a no go. Will try that when it's cooler. Staff was friendly,and restrooms were clean.  Lots of parking and you'll find it in the same shopping center as Trader Joe's .
