vEonuZ3-LpT35-vqOqLeFQ.text: Was looking for somewhere with WiFi that I could get some coffee or tea and found this gem.  I just got an iced chai, which was great. I tried their vegan PomMilk, made from different nuts and seeds and really liked it. Mostly tasted like almond milk.   Will try to get back to Ahwatukee soon to try more than their Chai.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chai tea

EUMQFU1CbCeROO_pQnGXww.text: This is a great breakfast place.  They are mostly vegan with a few vegetarian options like eggs and dairy cheese. They are 100% meat free but they are definitely a great place even for meat lovers. I'm not a vegetarian, I eat meat often but this is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in town.  They have a great rotating menu that they put it on a huge chalkboard inside and a regular set menu so your favorites will always be there.  I've had their wild western tacos with real eggs (you can sub out the real eggs and keep it vegan), banana bread pancakes (seasonal item), French toast, and I always get a hot chocolate with Pom milk. (It's a nut based milk). They have a super foods hot chocolate (it's a bit spicy so it's not for me but my husband loves it!) and I always get the kids one.   The only issue this place has is it's service. The staff are not well organized, call aheads  for tables get lost, so even though they say they will hold a table, don't be surprised to show up and no one has any idea what you are taking about and no table is waiting for you. The food can take a long time, and they also mess up orders a bit more often then I would like, but they are always quick to fix it and everyone is usually very friendly.

3pHq0S7dz2yyuRv-3iMZMQ.text: My favorite Vegan restaurant in the valley! I love bringing my friends who aren't Vegan here because the vibes and view at sunset are the best. They have an amazing happy hour, which is recommended if you'd like to sample more things at a reduced cost.   The food takes a maybe 18-20 minutes to come out, which is expected. You can't go wrong here!

ram0NKliz8_cqYn0yiJlTg.text: A nice vegan restaurant! This was my first visit and I kind of liked it, however my husband had been there a few times before and his visit this time wasn't as good since he ordered his usual Napoleon Grilled Sandwich which he said was very dry and did not have enough cheese for a grilled cheese (I totally agree). I had the SpinArt Quesadilla which was okay - did not have enough stuffing since the ends were almost dry. The hummus platter was great! And also the pomegranate chocolate cake was really good. Would probably return when in mood for vegan but wouldn't order the sandwich & the quesadilla. Also- I think the food is pricey for what you get.

dfovgz8_PlBsvaqtJfR6RA.text: I have such mixed feelings about this place.  My vegan girlfriend absolutely loves it, and we have been several times.  To me, it is just ok, however, they make an honest effort and my girlfriend loves this place, so they get 3 stars from me.  I don't want to imply it's a bad place, it is just so average and underwhelming -- from that perspective, 3 stars is appropriate.   Multiple times we have been and they have inexplicably run out of popular dishes.  The waitstaff is extremely polite but most of the time seems very harried which leads to awkward vibes during the meal, they are always running a bit behind, but they get the orders correct and are mostly attentive.    The menu itself is diverse, enough so that even a non vegan diner will find something tasty and good.  The restaurant is well decorated and there is always a crowd, I wouldn't try to go here if I were in a hurry.   The cold coffee is decent, while the hot coffee is just okay.    I'll probably go back here again and again, but each time, for me, it's just okay.  I'm sure you'll have a good experience and don't want to scare you away, however, unless you're vegan, I wouldn't prepare to be impressed.

ciitG3N9fJmiQUoFbJR1rg.text: So so so good. I was so sad when the central Phoenix location closed. I stopped in on a Sunday for coffee and a pastry, it was pretty busy! Sunday brunch seems to be a popular time here.  I got their seasonal pumpkin caramel latte made with house made POM mylk and oh my.. I can't stop thinking about it! I asked for half the caramel then usual and it was perfect, not too sweet, not too spicy, just perfect. Definitely got a pumpkin flavor but not overwhelming and the espresso was great. I grabbed a sweet potato pecan muffin for myself and a banana walnut for my hubby. My muffin was so moist, huge portion and chunks of pecans on top. The banana walnut was also huge and delicious. The pastry case was fully stocked with treats so I had a hard time deciding what to get!   I definitely want to come back and get brunch someday, I'm also hoping a more centrally located location will open up soon!!   The employee at the pastry counter helping me out was very pleasant, took time to answer my questions even though they were busy. I had a great experience.

XcaZE6QejYXAQJbhqeRHOQ.text: This place was recommended to me as a vegetarian. I appreciated their extensive veg options but the food was really just ok. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good. I had the breakfast tacos. They were way too big for tacos and fell apart due to the wet ingredients. I had to eat them with a fork. My husband's biscuits and gravy didn't have enough gravy, they didn't split the biscuits, and the biscuits just weren't very good. Maybe I'm biased since I'm from Kentucky. The worst part was the service. It was busy but not too busy to be seated immediately. The server took our order quickly, and the food came within a reasonable amount of time. However, our waters were not refilled one single time and we were left to eat our meals with no beverage. Additionally, after finishing, we waited a small eternity to get our check, and only received it after flagging down the server, despite every attempt to convey visually that we were done. I don't think we will be back. Too expensive for what we experienced.

6itJBNFb4L0OnuMk0eogZg.text: You guys have the freshest healthiest vegan food in Arizona I'm pretty sure..which I LOVE! The hibiscus tea is my FAVORITE..mmm so great! The Pom burger is great along with so many other dishes! The service is always on point, everyone is so friendly and helpful! But the desserts tho..mmmmmmm I could get fat off eating ALL of them  never taken any pictures of them because I just wanna eat it lol peanut butter chocolate cake is the BEST! It's about an hour drive from where we live but the food is worth it! One thing I would say is there should be more kid friendly options because my daughter really doesn't like anything from here except the sweets so that's a big reason we hardly come here..usually have to feed her something else before we come

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids Mac and cheese my daughter doesn&#39;t really like it but I LOVE it haha
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raw Tacos Vivos with a salad not sure if that has a special name..but bomb af light and healthy and DELICIOUS
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. street tacos...would not get again

bDRiZHCoVBw9W9Zlb9Ep-w.text: It's super dead here. Waiters look up and down at you as if they're too good for you. We smiled politely, walked in and asked for a place for two. We waited for 30 minutes. They kept passing us. The people who came after us got their orders. We wanted to order but they never got to our table. Even though it's dead here. We just politely gathered our things and left because it's not right when the waiters are on their phones and talking amongst each other. It's not nice and very rude of them to act like their patrons don't exist. We always went here but after this experience we won't be coming back :(  Every time we came into chandler we were so excited to come here. Too bad we have to go elsewhere now. Management, please train staff to be more attentive and give proper customer service. :( we don't like being ignored!

E7Gz5SGEJN2OAOHrahPHjA.text: I ordered the wild mushroom and poblano tacos and a turmeric "latte".  Both were very good. My dining partner ordered the green goddess burger and a lavender matcha hot drink. He didn't enjoy either of his as much as I did mine and he's the vegetarian so...*shrug*. Service at the end of our meal was very slow. Prior to that  all was well.

ulqCwsZH-qqQMtlNl-P_xQ.text: Came here while driving cross country and sad that I don't live down the street from this place. I would eat here every single day if I could. This was the absolute best breakfast and the best vegan breakfast I have ever had. And they made the best coffee I have ever had. The wait staff was so nice and so knowledgable. Keep up the fantastic work, best breakfast  ever. Definitely eat here!

onHMeEW4SiYfg1RHoF0ftg.text: Super yummy ! I'm not a vegetarian or vegan so I was iffy on the food at first , so glad I tried it out . Had the avo jalapeno crisp and a smoothie . Best lunch I've had in a long time .

uNtjbSeejtdB-aOu7gmYMQ.text: Ate at Pomegranate last night.  Food was ok, but took forever.  Restaurant was not that busy!   We were told by waiter that there were lots of takeout orders (there weren't.)  we were also told by cashier that evenings were not busy during the week and service would be better.  We should have left and found another restaurant.

1a4Jdmpi4jDABbQxszT_Uw.text: My favorite! Their coffee, mimosas and root vegetable fries were really good! Being that I was avoiding all dairy while nursing my daughter, it was great peace of mind knowing this place is strictly vegan unless you ask for eggs or otherwise.

1B3aLOgRfZLeLUN93uvi1A.text: Awesome vegan food and great staff. The vibe inside is also very cool with nice music, art, and ambiance.

0a7ZNiM3XbsHsLvKDkUI9g.text: Place is ok. My girlfriend gets really jacked on going here and the food is always great. The service has been lacking each time we go. We usually sit for a while before anyone even brings us water, then the wait to order is forever.

gv46TNYfudUEx9x-JGzpNg.text: One of my favorite dishes as a meat eater was Shepherds pie,  so since I no longer eat meat I decided to try it vegan style.  All I can say is that it was warm, satisfying and delicious.  I was pleasantly surprised at the depth of flavor.  As far as the cost at Pomegranate's it is pricey but on the other hand you can feed two people with most dishes they serve there.  That includes their wonderful bakery items.  I have eaten there on 3 occasions and each time I have been more than happy with the food.  My only complaint is that it does seem to take a while to get your food which is okay due to the quality, but if you ask for something else, extra during your meal it seems like you may never get it.  Then suddenly when you have about given up here it comes.  The staff there could not be nicer but they seem somewhat spread thin.  Oh and I want to mention almost everything in their desert case is gluten free and the gluten free bread there is delish.

zUcRCV-7sDKyYSQT5N7Vfg.text: **Bumping this down a notch from 5 to 4 stars. Something has happened to this place over the last 2 years. It used to be a 'order your food and pay at the counter and we'll bring it over to you' experience. Now they try to herd you to a table when you walk in the door, so that you can wait for someone to bring you a glass of water that you used to just get yourself and then wait for ages for someone to take your order. And then wait for ages for the bill to be brought over so you can pay. We stopped frequenting this place simply because of this new way of serving people. We typically liked to come here during lunchtime or before heading somewhere else so can't afford to wait for very slow service. On a positive note though, the food still rocks.   ----  I have been a customer since moving to Phoenix several years ago. This place is great for vegetarians, but good for omnivores too. Meat eaters tell me the Lumberjack is awesome. I'm vegetarian, and this place is a unique find for veggie food in a very meat centric city.    You can make anything vegan, just by opting out of egg and milk products. Both are equally good.   I have enjoyed the freshness and tastiness of everything I have ever ordered here.  I usually have juice and one of their bowls with yummy pesto.  The place is usually pretty busy during prime mealtimes, so expect to wait a few minutes. It's also pricey. It isn't unusual to have a bill total $40 for two people.  That is the price you pay for fresh, healthy and organic goodness.  I have never had an issue with customer service, nor have they screwed up my order. The fresh juices and smoothies run around $8 or so and if I remember right the meals are $10-$12, give or take a couple bucks.  I have only had a few of their baked goods, but they always look tempting. Gluten-free options are available too.

q2LNKJ7pIUtGjhQ3Ykf8nQ.text: The menu is chock-full of amazing ingredients that are tasty and nutritious. They are a bit pricy but worth the money.

Thdtk5mh9F5I4zjU4p4-Hg.text: What a great addition to the list of Ahwatukee food options!  I've been to Pomegranate Cafe a few times now and have left happy each time.  Perfect for that pre-grocery shopping (at Trader Joe's, next door) meal so that you don't go starving and buy WAY too much food.  As the slogan states, and everyone else has mentioned, Pom Cafe is "indulgently healthy."  Fresh, organic, vegan, even raw food options.  Breakfast and lunch, juices, teas, elixirs, espresso, and baked goods.  Walking in, the atmosphere is calm and relaxed.  Walk up to the counter, check out the chalkboard for the specials and browse a paper menu for the rest.  Place your order at the counter and try not to be tempted by all of the delicious looking desserts calling your name.  Sit down at a table and they'll bring you your food.  If you feel like helping out and clearing your table, great!  There is a busing station on the back wall.  Or leave your dishes there and they will clear it for you.  The staff is friendly and energetic; you can tell they enjoy working there and giving you fresh healthy food and drinks.  I have tried a few different menu items and it addition to enjoying good tasting, healthy, vegan food, the portion sizes are quite generous and very reasonably priced.  I have left very satisfied stomach (meaning, I'm full) but not that heavy "oh-no-what-did-I-just-eat" feeling in my belly and my conscience.  Feel good and taste good healthful food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa tabbouli salad

lXIDaHrym7Xll4GJQrT2hQ.text: Expensively delicious!  The food is absolutely delicious for vegetarian style.  You need to be rich to be able to afford to eat healthy.  Who knew vegetarian food could so good and so expensive.

5lFr6xLe1YWrisnKljB0qQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Healthy, organic/local options, breakfast, great staff, and fresh squeezed orange juice

yhDQEFhj8JGHN-n-Ws23tA.text: I went to Pomegranate Cafe today and it was a total disappointment.  I show up and the place is arranged as an "order yourself" restaurant, which is perfectly fine.  The first thing you see when you walk in is a big counter, and no directions (or menus on the board, etc).  I walk up to the counter looking to order something, or learn how the process works, and the gentleman behind the counter asks if I'm dining in.  Kind of caught me by surprise because I'm thinking why is that the very first question, I just want to order food.  Let me stop and say that already, while he's polite, he's definitely making me feel like I'm doing something stupid and I should already know how the process works.  He tells me to take a seat anywhere, I look around and there are no seats available, he realizes it and he says there's plenty of seating outside.  That's good with me, I like sitting outside even in az, and he says he'll take water to me.  Ok so far not too bad even though the process is awkward and I still haven't seen anything resembling a menu.  But here's where it gets really bad.  I go ahead and take my seat outside and just wait, and wait, and wait.  No water, no menu, no greeting from any waiter, NOTHING.  Of course now I'm disappointed; I followed the directions from the guy at the counter and proceed to be completely ignored.  I felt like leaving at this point (who wants to be ignored?), but I was craving their type of food and had gone out of my way to go there today, so I thought I'd give it another try.  I walk back in to the place and speak with another nice young gentleman who after learning what had taken place proceeded to only say "oh when we're not busy we like doing table service so we'll follow you with a menu, but I think when you sat down we got busy in a rush."  That makes no sense at all of course, I was perfectly willing to order at the counter but they were the ones who asked me to grab a table/seat.  Then he did nothing except give me this card that has a link to their website and a couple of marketing tag lines.  Did not say sorry, let me take care of you now, or anything.  I stood there not knowing what to do so I just said thank you and walked out.  Extremely disappointed, because I was looking forward to trying this place after I heard good things about it.  This really should be a one star review, but I'm leaving two stars for two reasons: one because I didn't actually get to try their food (unfortunately), and two because if I leave a one star this review may not be taken seriously, and I do feel If nothing else that their management should fix this.  I understand they may cater to a lot of regulars and a certain type of clientele, but I'm sure they would welcome new clients as well.  Today they did not, despite repeated opportunities.

Q1sb93OWODT6UxQPkGypEA.text: Please open a location downtown!!! I'm never in this area but have wanted to try this place. It's on point! the chai latte is wonderful. Just enough spice and sweet and smooth with their homemade but milk. Salad was soooo good. And the soup: eggplant chowder. Flavorful and delicious. Love it!

xSg0lwSOM-Cb6NfvbNGB2w.text: From the food to the atmosphere to the people who work here, every moment I have spent at Pomegranate has been Bliss. I wish they would open a location where I live, in Los Angeles. Last time I went I had the Bbq jackfruit Mac n Cheese, which is the best mac and cheese (vegan and wheat free) that I have ever had because not only is it delicious but it is a hearty portion size (unlike a lot of vegan places, Suncafe Organic, Rasa, I'm looking at you.) I also had a 'milk'shake that had caramel and jnantik (a mayan superfood that tastes like coffee) topped with cocowhip and that was a massive treat. (In LA we pride ourselves on being on the cutting edge and I don't know of anyplace here currently offering jnantik.) I took home a bunch of sweets and my favorite was the chocolate cake, though they were all great and I'm confident you cannot go wrong. I've been craving their fare since and look forward to the next time I visit my cousin in Tempe so I can come again. Can you ladies publish a cookbook please? Thanks in advance.

XtkybbGqy97X-i6aehK5cw.text: I stumbled upon this cafe on a Saturday afternoon. When I walked in the hostess was very friendly and sat me right away. She brought me water that was cold and had fresh cucumber- yum. I was excited to try the eggs and since they stop serving those on Sat at 2, i was eager to order. The wait staff kept walking around, helping other tables, cleaning off tables, etc. no one asked me if I wanted a drink or if I was ready. No one stopped at my table. After 10 minutes, I left. Service is EVERYTHING people. Good service will trump a LOT and there was not good service this day. May try again, but disappointed!

D8jNYAUCdkPPFRtk6Nltlw.text: I'm not sure if it's just me, but does anyone else have a hit or miss with the salads lately? :( I remember ordering the naked burger once and the kale salad that comes with it was so dry and the kale was almost yellow? Then I've ordered the native cobb to go, twice, and the first time it was missing the guacamole and even when mixing the dressing it was still so dry. The second time I asked for the dressing to be mixed in and it was still dry? Don't get me wrong, I absolutely love this place to bits and rave about it! I'm bound to return, but it kind of sucks making the 40 minute drive to treat myself to food from here and I get my meal only to be mildly disappointed.

yHG-T1WqUxtGEiRIEyoHkw.text: I went back to try their food. The place has been remodeled since I last visited, six months ago. It's bigger and can accommodate more people, but it did lose that vibe that I liked about it. Regardless, the staff was still friendly, the food was delicious, and the drinks were still good!  Drinks: 1) Braveheart (leafy greens, kale, cucumber, celery, apple, orange) 2) Some kind of berry smoothie? Both were refreshing and good.  Entrees: 1) Breakfast Burrito (Egg, potato, sweet potato, cheese, anasazi beans, salsa, seasonal vegetables, spinach tortilla) 2) In Season scramble (Egg scramble, seasonal veggies, cheese, harvest hash, kamut toast & house jam): loved the house jam! 3) Hummus: the bread and veggies were very good and fresh and the hummus was okay. It was a little grainier and had a more cumin taste but it tasted fresh. 4) Raw Berries & Cream Parfait (Raspberry cream, seasonal fruit, berries, nuts & seeds): one of my favorite parts of the meal. SO good

QiYjEAkCONrxs_xvUYdtow.text: If I could give this place 6 stars, I would!  Tasty? Indulgent? Doesn't-taste-like-it's-vegi/vegan? Check, Check, Check!!  Honestly I have probably never been more emphatic about a restaurant.  This quaint little shop (although it has been expanded) has a wonderful vibe, and you are able to see just how fresh their food is. Their chalkboard of daily specials welcomes you and their glass-door refrigerators remind you that you are eating fresh, whole, and unaltered vegetables and fruits.  The cashier is knowledgeable, friendly, and greeted with a smiling face.  I ordered the Strawberry Rhubarb French Toast and a cup of the daily soup: Curried Sweet Potato. (I'm a sucker for anything sweet potato.)  I sat down with my number and waited for my food. Both dishes arrived shortly, and my mouth watered at their sight.  The french toast (banana bread with the rhubarb jam and whipped cream) was likely the best french toast I've ever had. I used to have a favorite place for french toast, but this plate left it in the dust. The banana bread was moist, thick, and came with delicious fresh strawberries. Not too sweet, and the light rhubarb jam complemented the thick banana bread to a tee. Unlike other new and healthy restaurants, the portions were not tiny and unfilling. On the contrary, I would think most people would split the order of french toast. I just wish I had come on a day with a special french toast on the menu!  The sweet potato soup was sweet, creamy, and the curry flavors accented it wonderfully.  To finish things off, I couldn't leave without trying one of their tempting cakes! I spoke with one of the owners for a while (who is wonderful), and based on her recommendation I tried the mango and blackberry raw cheesecake. Not only did this cheesecake not taste like it had no dairy, but it likely tops other cheesecakes I have tried.  I can only hope this place stays in business for years to come. When it comes to nutrition, it is vital for restaurants to be completely aware of what they are serving, for them to strive to bring patrons healthy meals, and have fun doing it! Pomegranate Cafe does not fall short; I will be back soon!

E-baDS5-l9JZh8bXflRvYQ.text: Pomegranate is my favorite restaurants. I am consistently impressed by the high quality of their foods, the different specials, the customer service, and the atmosphere. As a vegan, it is hard to find restaurants to eat at, and even harder to find ones that are packed full of whole food ingredients and made on-site. An example of their exceptional customer service was on this past Mother's Day, when we did not have a reservation (and the restaurant was packed), but the workers made a point to help us find a place to sit anyways and were very accomodating to my mother's food allergies.   My last visit, I shared an amazing slice of chocolate cake (very rich and surprisingly like the non-vegan variety), two delicious juices, the raw tacos, and a loaded baked potato quesadilla. Both entrees came with an amazing kale salad. In the past, I have had brunch and dinner.   If you are looking for a healthy, satisfying (you won't leave hungry) and appropriately priced (when you consider the value you get) meal, come to Pomegranate!

34M3Kycc1BYqo3y3v5UTpQ.text: I miss coming here. I moved from AZ, and this is almost worth the plane trip in itself for these raw goodies.  Everything is made fresh in house. You won't find corn syrup or sodas, or GMO products. Instead, you will find organic, vegan, and raw selections  that won't make you feel you are sacrificing taste for healthy.  When I'm visiting AZ, this is the first place I want to eat at. Everything here is delicious and while the menu does keep a few classics, it also rotates with fresh soups of the day, desserts, and juices to keep new tempting offerings to chose from, and my taste buds wanting more.

stEM7aS3p7CHuRKbLRGSrg.text: I am from out of town staying in lovely AZ for 3 months so it has been fun to explore the different food offering that this sunny state offers.  Pomegranate has to be one of my favorites.  I am on a strict diet of no sugar, gluten, dairy, grains, beans, etc. so mainly a vegan diet (doctor ordered) so finding this gem was a god sent.  My first time at the cafe I had an Athena Wrap which was actually suppose to be a bowl since I cant have grains but that was my fault because you are given options of either a grain wrap, collard leaf wrap or in a bowl  I forgot to order the bowl, it still was really good.  The lemon bar made with xylitol was a good no sugar dessert option and surprisingly sweet tasting.   Second time in,  I order the POM "nut cheese" plate and the Raw Everything Bagel (the bagel being made from nuts and vegies).  There was so much food I could not eat it all and I really tried.  The POM cheese plate offer three different types of cheeses all made from nuts.  There was a cheddar rolled in walnuts, herb and spreadable almond cheese that didn't have a name but was delish.  It was served with various fresh vegetables, flax seed crackers and strawberries.  The Raw Everything Bagel sandwich was a nut and vegie made bagel with loads grated carrots, cabbage, sunflower sprouts and a almond ranch dressing spread. It was tasty but my only complaint and it is a common complaint of many restaurants is that stack the fillings so high that it is impossible to actually take a bite of your sandwich without everything falling out all over the place.  I ended up just pulling it apart and eating with a knife and fork to cut down on the mess.  I walk out with my doggie bags and a very satisfied belly and no guilt.

NDChW4xJysXP9DM5vkuvYQ.text: Loved the Passion Juice. The ginger flavor was subtle, but it elevated the juice significantly. I had the Beet POM burger, which was good but not great. Would definitely go back to try more specials.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. succulent, strawberry moon, and passion

03q0FaIR2wlSUxmSWcqSow.text: I hate to have to give such a low review but it's mainly because the service is just so slow. The food is good but without good service it really ruins the experience. I dearly hope that this improves so my family and friends continue to enjoy POM.

jdsAtJOiaRyUqEIv6XI35Q.text: This place is simply great. You can tell a lot of love and consideration goes into every meal. They have vegetarian, vegan, and non-vegetarian options for a TONNE of their dishes, and regardless of your preference, you won't be dissatisfied! Go on then, go try it! :)

J0SCsEbv82ktM98LtnMi8g.text: We love EVERYTHING here! The atmosphere, the staff (especially Stephanie), the food, the drinks, the desert. As vegans with allergies to gluten and dairy, there is no place we would rather eat!

wONvbLeLZNisTkXhE2NGrg.text: The Pomegranate Cafe is delicious! I love the GF mac n cheese, and the other day I shared an amazing pesto quesadilla on a GF tortilla with vegan cheese with my friend, it was incredible! Pricey but totally worth the trip! Great service and outdoor seating.

WVfUcBeYps-2IGqBFMrWxw.text: It was surprisingly good Vegan food. I had breakfast there and the cinnamon french toast was AMAZING!!!

Q86G7XYtstjq4tMQQWw4Qw.text: Food is great here. Been here a few times with my wife and meals have all been good. It is a little pricey but you get a good size meal. Definately will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very good food. A little pricey but you get a lot of good clean food.

i7URPd12eAvTUAOHE9dVtw.text: This place is amazing!! I'm so glad that I work close to a place that serves such delicious veg/vegan food. I have to say, it's pricey for what it is, but if you want to eat well, it's worth it. I had the Kale salad with an organic Arnold Palmer (it's not on the menu--I asked them to mix it for me). Both were delicious. It's one of those places where you pay, get a number, and pick a table where they come bring your food. The staff is very friendly and attentive. They came by a few times to see if I needed anything, and even offered me free refills. I'd come back here any day to try more items on their menu, but I'd probably have to limit it to about once a week. My lunch came out to $18 the last time I was there (not quite sure how though).   Overall, give this great place a shot if you don't mind your wallet taking a little bit of a hit. The veg/vegan options are among the best I've ever had.

fibdgBoCOryjwMA2ys5Avg.text: My little brother brought me a BBQ Buffalo Salad from Pomegranate cafe today. I need some greens in my life and he suggested the spot. My salad was loaded with high quality ingredients and was quite good. And I felt so healthy eating it- everything from the power greens to the tofu tasted so yummy and super duper fresh.

VWFSZBkIadPR39d6EXCg9g.text: I was so happy to find this terrific cafe. The food was flavorful, and the staff were attentive  and helpful. Great place,  I'll be back!

-p7r8vfAUwJrDpnyreWkdg.text: This is one of my favorite little places to eat! Everything I've tried has been amazing and the food portions are pretty big.     The only downside is the price. A smoothie starts at $9. It makes eating here (for me) a rare treat.      I love that local produce and fresh ingredients are used.     My weakness is their raw desserts! You must try the raw cheesecake or tiramisu. My go-to for an entree is their Elephant Curry Bowl with tofu.

OJygfw8qFpJrVy9ie06ZLg.text: I love this place! Great vegan food and desserts. It is a bit of a drive for me, but it's worth it. The people are friendly and service is great. I love supporting local businesses.

N9m7hSoz0p9j1_1ngAYLbw.text: Went here for the first time and really expected more from this place. I had been wanting to try it for a year or so and convinced my guy friend to go in with me. When we came in it wasn't too crowded. We only had to wait a couple minutes for a table which was great, but after we got seated the service was horrible. We got in around 7:30 our waitress greeted us, got us our drinks and food. After that we didn't see her for forever. Everything was so hectic. We had different servers refilling our water checking in on us, everyone seemed to be doing 5 different jobs on top of their own main job which is completely unnecessary (one server to one table doing one job is what should have been happening). When our food came I wasn't too impressed, I got the macaroni pesto dish. The veggies were great but the pasta just lacked flavor. After we finished our food we waited about 15 for our waitress to come back to take our dessert order/ give us boxes. On top of that our desserts took so long to come out. I ordered the Brazilian Brownie which took another 10 minutes to get to me (which easily could have taken 2 minutes to be taken out from the front where the dessert counter is and placed on to a plate and given to me). My friend order a milkshake and that took almost 20 minutes for us to get! When it got to him he asked for it to go since we were already there so long. After waiting about 10 minutes to get the milkshake to go I had to go upfront to ask for it along with the check. My waitress was up there working the register and handed me the melted shake that had been sitting out for some time now. We got the milkshake and the check and got out as quickly as possible. It was literally 5 minutes till close when we left.  The food is extremely overly priced as well, if it was exceptionally well I would understand but it's mediocre. I know the food I all 100% organic, nonGMO, is really Eco- friendly and has quality ingredients, but the pricing is still way too expensive. With two plates and two desserts it would have came to $ 46.00 ( $52.00 with tip) but our waitress took off the milkshake given it was so melted.  The business NEEDS to work on organization. I would suggest having a set group of people working the register (pick up orders, desserts, & making stuff for the people who come into pick up smoothies, drinks ect.) so the servers don't have to do all this stuff as well. I've worked in the restaurant business before so I understand a place being busy and lacking a 5 star service but this place wasn't that busy. They had 3-4 servers covering maybe a total of 8-10 tables. Where I worked 1 server would take on 6 tables at a time and still give the best service you could get. The servers and workers could easily give great service but it's so unorganized and the servers don't seem motivated to get things done.  I won't be coming back anytime soon.

8zvGASnYA_I3D4zTd_QNHw.text: This place makes my top 3 restaurants of all time list. A friend took me here while I was visiting from Texas and OMG it is so amazing. I got the green goddess burger. Talk about mouthwatering delicious!  I desperately wish they had a location in austin Texas whet I live as, this place blows all the vegan options there out if the water by far. Or maybe if they had a cookbook!   The owner even gave us a pomegranate chocolate cake ball and another dessert when we were wit to leave just so we could try them. The pomegranate cake ball was one of the best desserts I've ever had (I'm including all non-vegan desserts in this comparison as well).  Get the kale salad too. It's amazing,  and the dressing they make in-house is sooo tasty!  I'm a little embarrassed to admit it,  but this place is so good,  I went back the next night before my flight flew out and got the same dinner to go. Yes,  It's that good.

wGwLOqOzodLjEwi7QdHGqg.text: I am in LOVE with this place. My husband & I went on Saturday after I discovered this existed. It's 50 miles from my house & SOOOO worth it!  I plan on asking if they will make some vegan desserts for our upcoming wedding.  The staff was super friendly and the food & desserts were amazing. We had a dragon-fruit cheesecake & also an almond joy bar for dessert. I had a supreme burrito for lunch.. it was Muy Bueno!  Highly recommended even if you're not vegan.

GsQSeCOLMTIklPLIvd_9qw.text: I like this place because it's one of the only places around here to get a coconut milk latte.  They also have AMAZING gluten-free and dairy-free treats, and kombucha. Win, win, win.  AND it's right next to Trader Joe's...win!  However, their hours keep changing, so I never know how late they will be open.  Also, it is very confusing as to whether you seat yourself and someone will take your order, or if you go order and then sit down.  Last time I was there, I saw people doing it both ways. I had ordered and then sat down, and the servers ignored me, but seemed to wait on everyone around me.  It's also expensive and usually crazy busy.  But I continue to come here for the coffee and raw/gluten-free treats, and fun health-foody finds like maca powder and mason jar glasses!

HL42xag8GkJGygwoF2FHjA.text: Creative and great food. I went to several vegetarian restaurants in the area and this was the best so far. I plan on going back several times before I leave. The food is presented in a colorful and beautiful way and tastes great.

Zp9kpMaBZy3kG0wPTVdLDg.text: Love the energy & food. I need to go here more often! Service is spectacular! I could definitely become a regular. I love that they have coconut cream for the nitrous coffee... Keep up the PALEO options!

K1BChzep2S5OWKlT0zpiVg.text: Very bland and very overpriced. Would not recommend this place.   The service took FOREVER (20mins and you pay at the counter) and the food was entirely trying to be too trendy and lacked in all aspects.  Pass.

Vr3VAQqzBJOyYDe4KLo53w.text: Wonderful! I wanted to go out to eat with a friend who is gluten free and this place hit the spot. She felt like she had so many options and went with the mac n cheese. I really love the atmosphere of the place. The only confusing part is if you should get a number from the register, or sit down and have your own server. I highly recommend the grilled cheese with veggies, delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. kale salad &amp; grilled cheese

bGtqdXU8Mx6X0Vu5yVG_cA.text: My favorite vegan restaurant in the valley, hands down!!   Everything from the breakfast burrito to the handcrafted desserts are simply divine and will leave your taste buds craving more!  I wish this restaurant was closer as I would be there weekly, if not daily.  Well worth the drive and the money if one desires an unforgettable culinary experience.

8swIaMoWXT0WLrMM06Gtog.text: My belly, heart and brain are happier after eating here. This place is the equivalent or the slightly better half of cafe gratitude in California.  We went for breakfast and was so pleasantly surprised with how good the food and service were. Our waitress was absolutely darling and made our single order pancake look and taste as good as the full order. We left feeling full with good healthy ingredients and will definitely be back!

G55wzcYfLe7uJNjjgFkPEQ.text: I love this restaurant go there any time I can get over to that side of town. Can't wait for the new one to open in Gilbert. The BEST vegan, vegitarian food I have had around. What a great concept and love the new makeover of the place. The owners are doing their best to always improve their food and service so give them credit and patience and be respectful of the staff and the customers. Very home like atmosphere. The deserts are pretty amazing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OMG the burger is fantastic, love the new flavors they are bringing in.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I always have a hard time deciding on which dish to order always so yummy no matter what choice I make.

64Sz6T85jqmmd4emO6DR4Q.text: I need to go back to this place to really rate them accurately. All I had here was a cowboy bar, and unfortunately, I wasn't a huge fan. It looks like a chocolatey delicious bar and was highly recommended by the staff, but it tasted like oatmeal or something....an overwhelming odd flavor, especially in the after taste. It was 5$ and the husband and I didn't eat it all, so it wasn't a great value. I noticed other items were also very expensive, they had a juice that cost 9$...whoa.  I would want to try other things here, but so far, I'm not totally convinced.

oWCTGLyg0zIm14ZCM8NISA.text: LOVE this place, the atmosphere, the breakfast food & especially the coffee.  We moved from Ahwatukee to Tempe but still try to make it over to Pomegranate as much as we can.

YCsvh_jvcoHlQzbDJ5qJ2Q.text: I was skeptical of a restaurant that proclaimed a vegan menu, but I'm so glad I read the reviews and gave it a shot! I took my husband and two young sons there for brunch and we were treated to a great meal. Service was a bit slow but could say it was laid back and relaxed I guess. I had a maca smoothie that was incredibly flavorful and the seedy toast with strawberries and nutty butter. It was fantastic! The kids enjoyed their breakfast burrito and eggs/toast meals, and my husband was in love with the special he ordered, but I couldn't tell you what it was other than some eggs and lots of spicy vegetables! Eggs are an alternative to tofu you can order on any menu item for an extra $1 if you prefer. We will definitely be back!

RyWkMF0m5UxkJQcBh-IjSg.text: I'm not a vegan but I appreciate the variety of trendy diets that pomegranate caters to. I like going somewhere that I know is consistent and the food is healthy and delicious. The portions are bigger now than a year ago and I think suit the prices better. The desserts can be hit or miss but mostly hit and vegan pasties are a real treat to see so kudos on that. I like the casual atmosphere and the staff is always polite, knowledgeable and friendly.

9OVZsq73F5iC-6ptCHVbdA.text: Amazing food accompanied by amazing service.  Also, if you're lucky, you'll get Stephanie as a server. Very attentive, kind and helpful. A great meal for vegans and non-vegans. Will be back!!

z-HQZ6D54cB7GTQoto8Bjw.text: I came with a friend who loved this place  for her birthday dinner and I must say, I loved it too! This was my first time trying vegan food and I was really nervous to try since the prices are kinda high. However I loved the food and the proportions were really big! And I was extremely impressed at the desserts. I wish I could've had them all! My only complain would be our waiter who barely checked up on us and had a bad attitude. But the rest of the staff seemed really nice. I can't wait to come again with my family!

76OTxJnnIls55vTpQALSFQ.text: I'm have been vegan for many years & am very cautious about GMO's & avoid them at all cost. With that being said, I absolutely love that most everything at Pomegranate Cafe is vegan & organic & bonus stars for the raw options. I went there the first time towards the end of October & I had some kind of a burrito. I ate the whole thing, it was delicious. I then ordered a caramel coconut drink from their coffee menu along with a desert. Everything was delicious. After I was finished m I went to the bathroom to wash my hands & I am not sure what happened but shortly after I came out, I got nauseated. I puked all my lunch which is way odd for me to so b/c I NEVER vomit/puke or anything. Not even when I  sick. Maybe I was so excited I ate too quick & too much? I don't know. Another weird thing that happened was, during our lunch, I asked to keep one of the menus b/c I wanted to continue browsing through (it was my first time there) I was told I couldn't b/c they were short of menus. LOL. Odd. Then a few minutes later she gave me back the menu. Alrighty. Ha!!  My B/F said that we should not come back b/c he was sure it was the food that made me sick but I refused to believe. We went back again a couple of weeks later & I had he raw tacos. They were good. We had a good experience. Except when I ordered my caramel coconut drink from the coffee menu, it didn't taste the same as last time. Like AT ALL. I ended up throwing it away. But, overall, a nice experience.  My 3rd visit just a couple of weeks ago, I ordered the French toast and was very disappointing. There was nothing French toast about this French toast. It was a pastry, like banana bread. Totally didn't even eat it. Had a few bites but that's it. I did order the organic scramble & it was super delicious.  4 stars for now.

i0Np6PwCMdrC7lY0PHbJjA.text: Yummy, healthy, nutritious! I've been coming here for several months for my fix of coffee, smoothie, and green goddess burger naked style. Their sauces are so delicious. I cannot imagine how they make them without dairy! Very friendly service too.

nsug1G-DnoAk0PLEEnStnA.text: Just found out about this great vegan cafe and took my guy there for a birthday treat. WOW I must have been asleep to have missed this gem tucked away in a strip mall!!  The smell of freshness, a funky and warm vibe are what I noticed right away!  Great food, Pillsbury wines, delightfully hand made desserts and great service!!

I5JYb03vagJNeqQx3rwhLQ.text: The food there is really good!!! The service there is not so good as the food tho. They are very busy most of the day so it reflects on the service over the phone also....almost always they put me on hold when I can them. Overall I love going to this place :)

kkWXCGu1SpHQmODvA7jpWw.text: If youre into eating healthy...this place is perfect! Great smoothies as well. The only reason i didnt give ot 5 stars is because the one time I went it took forever to get our food. But the servers were nice and the food/smoothies were worth the wait.

ZbRg_2HX7gB2NVyYHTKcVw.text: Amazing vegan food!! So far I've loved everything I've eaten here! Nothing is sub-par, you can tell they put a lot of effort and time in everything they make, with fresh ingredients!! I adore the atmosphere as well! They've expanded a lot and now include an area where you can buy produce, grab and go items, and little trinkets. The fried tofu avacado breakfast sandwich is amazing, definitely try it! The staff is also incredibly friendly and knowledgeable! Pricing is also more expensive but you get what you pay for.

3Or9eSmRKYCdtPp3esHpAw.text: We are not vegans but transitioning to a more plant based diet. I thought the menu was extensive almost too many options but decided on the omelet special. Everything was very tasty for my meal, but my husbands buffalo "chicken" wrap was beyond spicy. Our toddlers' meals (Mac and dairy cheese and grilled dairy cheese) were terrible. The pasta was mush, needed salt and tasted strange even though it had real cheese. Her side of broccoli was supposed to be steamed, but was pretty much just as crunchy as crudite.   The service was just a hot mess. Our waitress was kind and friendly but it too over 40 min for our food to come out, with hungry toddlers...not fun!  It seemed as if there were tons of employees but not many doing anything productive. While changing my baby in the bathroom, we asked for soap since the dispenser was empty. No one ever came back with a refilled soap...so had to wash our hands with just water after a #2 diaper.   I'd go back and try something else and perhaps a dessert, but the service was just slloooww especially on a weekend.

aWtkInRjzBCa_iAIFE6sjw.text: Ugh. What a mess.   We went to this cafe Sat. night for a friend's 30th birthday. Let's run through the whole event. We arrive at 7 with a somewhat large-ish party (8 people) and they weren't too busy - well more than half the tables were empty. We went inside and one of the staff members helped move a couple tables together to seat everyone. 15 mins later, a waitress comes by with a tray of waters. She literally threw them at us. They were slammed down on the table with such forces that water spilled out the top. No apology, no offer to clean them up. Waitress looked like we personally had run over her dog, scowling and glaring at us. So, not off to a great start. Another 15 mins passes and she comes back to take our drink/appetizer orders, again gruff as can be. Ok. Maybe she's having a rough day? Whatever. Another 20 mins and she comes back to take our food orders. She brings out the drinks and appetizer about 10 mins later - mind you, it's been an hour now since we were seated. 45 mins later (no joke) she comes back to tell us that one of the ingredients for a dish one of our party ordered is unavailable. They ran out. Ok, whatever. That happens. But it took you 45 mins to realize this? Oh, yeah. And by this point, we still haven't received food, our waters have never been refilled, no one has checked up on us to make sure we're doing alright, and the bread that we ordered for our appetizer still hasn't arrived. Another 30 mins passes and finally our food arrives. It felt like they just dumped hot sauce all over everything instead of actually trying to make things taste good. One of our party members had to send her food back because it was simply too hot for her to eat. Again, no apologies, no recommendations for something else... she did offer to at least remove the food sent back from the check. So around the two hour mark, the last dish for our party arrives. Normally, I don't have the patience to sit around and wait for food this long but it was my friend's birthday, she picked this restaurant, and I'm going to be patient for her. But after two hours of waiting on terrible service, I was at my wit's end. A couple people order desserts to go. The desserts tasted pretty good so at least they have that going for them. But they brought them out on plates, not to go. It felt like we had to repeat everything for them a few times just so they could get the orders right. After another 20 mins, the waitress comes back out to finally check on us. We ask for the checks and try to figure out why our service was so terrible. Her excuse? "Well, we're kind of busy" - (by this point, we're one of three tables remaining) "all of our food is cooked fresh" - (half our plates were "raw" food, no cooking required and every other restaurant cooks their food fresh, too, and it doesn't take two hours to get it). Very lame, very unapologetic excuses. Every time we looked for our waitress, we saw her standing around talking to other staff members. So busy. She comes back out, 20 mins later, with the checks and offers to take 10% off because "we were so patient with them tonight". Whatever, it's a gesture. However, still no apology. Maybe she thought that since we were getting the discount an apology wasn't necessary? I couldn't tell you. The icing on the cake of all this? Our waitress was the restaurant's MANAGER. If Stormy (our waitress/manager) is working when you go, don't bother. You will wait around forever for your food and she'll treat you like you're the one that screwed up for coming to this establishment. Suffice to say, I will never be returning to this cafe. Over 2.5 hours just to get food and basic service? I could have gone to the grocery store, cooked all the food myself, made it better than them, not have to put up with absolutely dismal service... and it STILL would have been cheaper than going to this place. This location is poorly managed and there is just no excuse for that.

SyvtECrXTc_ZDxPPCGSFMg.text: The only sad thing about Pomegranate is that I have to drive here from San Diego to enjoy their gastronomic delights!  Keep up your amazing work...

sf5V7xbDAQ-37tPHoRyXFQ.text: Breakfast, lunch it's always so good and refreshing! The Rodrigo Rocket Fuel Smoothie is one of Amy favorites!

Atqw1-nKwKdZKbjjRK0-jg.text: The family and i come here all the time.  Today they seemed a little off their game compared to past experiences, but the managers awareness was on point, and she made sure we were all happy before we left.  They need to put their biscuits and gravy on their menu permanently!

hyxMxQAr-xb0HpvvBqZptw.text: If you are vegan or a veg-curious, Pomegranate Cafe is the best hope you have to stick to your new-found diet.  The staff and owners are passionate, intelligent, and incredibly hardworking.    Look folks... in order to be able to make as much fresh food as this place does, it is going to cost a lot on overhead.  Just to carry all of the fresh veggies and fruits for smoothies and juice has to be a fridge jenga feat on it's own.  Most restaurant owners do not care enough about their regulars to make this a reality.  To be completely honest, Pom is undercharging on most of their pastries and juices which is why I am totally blown away by their customer service.  What's that?  You used to eat cheesecake while watching Oprah in the 80's but you can't do it anymore because your trainer said that those days are over?  Well, then you should eat the delicious RAW VEGAN CHEESECAKE at Pom (shhh... it's made of nuts and other goodies).  What's that?  You like to go to Whole Foods and pay 10 dollars for juice?  Pomegranate is faster, cheaper, and they use local ingredients when it is smart to do so.  Conscious capitalism indeed.  Oh, you like to eat in unique, vibrant settings?  This place has beautiful colored walls, an open view of the juice bar and clear fridges so you can dine and feel like you are part of the action.  While most places will hide what they do to YOUR food, Pom offers more transparency, so you can rest easy that your food is being prepared with great service and with fresh ingredients.  What is this green stuff?  Look, I have eaten a lot of the stuff here, but STRAIGHT UP, you have to try something that has the cilantro pesto.  This sauce will gussy up any Mexican food dish, a spark for the tip of your tongue, with a small lemon tang, and a nice fresh smooth and soothing swallow that blooms with spice and heat.  And this sauce is a beautiful baseball field green.  I didn't even know that this was a culinary possibility until I ate here.  I noticed that there are some reviews on here about bad service, but I was informed that the space was remodeled about a year ago.  Most of the one star and two star reviews were from before the remodel, which shows how much focus and attention the owners (a mother and daughter that currently work at Pom) and staff have really put into growing as an establishment.  Please, do yourself a flavor, and stop in for a juice or treat if you happen to be in the neighborhood.  You can either sit down and eat a full meal (appetizers, course, desert, coffee), or take a quick juice or pastry to go in minutes.  It can't be easy to offer so many types of service AND be all natural plant based.  KUDOS TO POM FOR SETTING THE BAR HIGHER.  Nom Nom Pom.

tCbDpLfpBEfj1zJ2Ely3mQ.text: Pomegranate Cafe deserves 6 out of 5 stars. I'm not a vegan, but the food here is incredible. The cakes and other desserts are also worth getting.

KLa6FrvquIYk6to6znHPgQ.text: Love Pomegranate Cafe! My favorite meal has to be the elephant curry bowl, so full of wonderful flavors and textures. Don't even get me started on the drinks and desserts! I pretty much can never leave the shop without my cowgirl cookie and the rocket fuel protein smoothie...they are perfection. In fact, every dessert and smoothie I've had here has been absolutely delicious. My only con would be the prices. I have a hard time NOT indulging here, so a full meal can make a bit of a dent in my purse. The quality and service here does make it worthwhile, though.

WFgwGDZNKnUxeT63B1EaYg.text: One of my FAVE local places. Let me be clear that I'm a carnivore and I cannot imagine a life without meat. But this place rocks. Their food is so creative and flavorful that you won't miss the meat! I love heir breakfasts, but their other foods are great too!! My husband and I come here for breakfast as much as possible and he loves their smoothies!! Their baked goods rock too!!

0G4CdilGCMboCTPoiz4zug.text: This is my all time favorite place to eat! The food is absolutely delicious with a wide variety of cuisine to choose from.   The staff are friendly, courteous, and very helpful especially in making food recommendations.   My only complaint is that I don't live close enough to eat there more often!! Please come to the East side!!

bY2KHU5_qeHwsUumLx0ajA.text: I absolutely love Pomegranate Cafe. I'm so excited that they are open for dinner now. Perfect for a healthy Happy Hour. This place IS pricey, especially the juices, but they taste awesome. The owner is so sweet and they put so much thought into doing eating clean the RIGHT way! I am gluten, dairy and soy free and it so so cool to be able to have dessert! If I could afford it, I would go there everyday. Skip the crappy food at happy hour and come here instead, your body will thank you!

BXIJFOJTwo2zpVbKLQkPmg.text: The food is absolutely delicious! Try the banana bread French toast! OMG! It's heaven! And their smoothies are amazing! I found this place looking for a healthy breakfast. I drive over an hour just to eat here.

F7sj4PMI5cLPN_fWjDHQAA.text: I REALLY want to like this place. I've tried numerous times! Their food is delicious.. especially their cakes, oh my. But seriously, the staff is not the friendliest, (at least the times that I have gone), and the service is extremely slow! :( I just can't get past that. Service is just as important as the food being served!

DN7ZltNy_TYAyDPdisJf9w.text: I hadn't been to Pomegranate Cafe in a while. but was really craving a Cassie latte. I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in and saw how much they had grown! I was so overwhelmed but one of the pastry chefs walked me through the menu and the yummy pastry case. She helped me find the most healthy options for my needs. She was very patient and knowledgeable.  I will be sure to go back more often now!

UcpZkzoleMfvCc7kS3z7fw.text: I love this place! Most tasty tea in the world. I highly recommend to everyone! Don't be afraid of vegetarian food!

kzRVizC2UnGke-0BH3zQXA.text: The food is good! But that's it!  Worst services I have had. Been there 3 times and every time my "server" if you even want to call them that didn't do anything but take my order. Today I went and waited 20 mins to have my order taken. Then another 25 just to get my drink. It was an hour from the time we got there to when we got our food. Very slow and our server only check on us once. Asking if I got my drink. Isn't here job as our server to bring our drinks and food out. I understand it can get busy but it wasn't. I watched drinks sit at the window for well over 10 minutes. And food sat at the window for 5 minutes before the cook yelled at them to take it out. The last 45 minutes of us being there and eating our server didn't once and ask how how we were doing. I watched her do side work and roll silverware. Someone else cleared our plates and brought was our check, then another gal checked us out. Very disappointing. They did comp my drink and the food is good but when you have bad service 3 times in a row. It doesn't matter how good the food is.

av_yNY9ul9lQ8aTjUopLvA.text: This is my kind of place! A place where you can indulge but not feel bad about what you just ate... You certainly don't have to sacrifice flavor, presentation or quantity, as each menu item offers plenty of each. Had breakfast at PC on a different day and the front counter was VERY SLOW, despite there being no customers ahead of me. Courteous employees to be sure, but slow. TIP: Arrive between 10 - 11 am for a late breakfast or an early lunch. FAVS: The Mediterranean Wrap and The Scones are TDF! Overall, the food is wonderful but the prices are high ($5 for a glass of fresh-squeezed orange juice--where are we, Alaska???) and the service is slow.

OA_nFsS_CqnbgjhFI1k0cQ.text: My favorite healthy restaurant! The food here is unbelievably tasty! So much so that you won't even miss the meat! I admire their commitment to local, organic produce and the love that goes into making and serving every healthful meal, dessert or juice/smoothie! I'm a regular here now, and have visited countless times with never a bad experience. My only complaint is that they are becoming so popular, that it is more and more difficult to find seating on the weekends. They are a tad on the expensive side, but until more people start demanding organic food, the price for organics will remain inflated. A cost the business bears and must pass onto the consumer.

q4QCsBWjH1VAtf2tbIuJhQ.text: Who owns this place? Met a friend, was first in line and then watched as a table of 4 and another table of 2 was seated while I waited. I ordered the hummus plate and waited over an hour and 10 minutes. My friend ordered tacos and got those about an hour in. The worst service ever. Food was nothing special. I WILL NOT return and I honestly wonder how they stay open. Lots of bad reviews. They deserve a big fat zero! As a professional I think this is a very poorly managed place with poor communication between staff. Not sure how anything comes together. They need to get a clue!

P6IO2K9lJQG2WqYsAO-kdQ.text: Pomegranate's quality is second to none. I enjoy the lumberjack for breakfast and the bountiful bowl for lunches and dinner. Have also tried their pancakes which are amazing. There is always great ambiance with pleasant music playing, self aware and health conscious people inhabiting, and fascinating employees. My only complaint is the price. Most of the types of juices made here are offered elsewhere a little cheaper. But the quality is truly their greatest value and for that, I will continue to come back here every time I swing by good ole Ahwatukee!

jThuixYrfSSxxV03qNhhXg.text: Over priced breakfast poor service consitently. I have been here 4 times now. Vegan options are good very social employee's with each other lots of conversations  going on about everything but my meal which comes in late 3 out of 4 times.  NEVER order off menu they will make you wait as if to punish you for it. And if your a verstic expect to be referenced as "honey or sweetie" by some young girl who maybe all of 24 years old. I am also not  a fan of uncomfortable seating.hitting my knee on a round barrel table nearly broke my knee cap. They are very impressed with themselves and less concerned about your dining experience. Too bad.

s9psVbc-8O8jCfadiev15A.text: Unfortunately, I will never dine at this establishment again. The service I received from a waitress was horrible and very unprofessional. I was made to feel that my business was not wanted and that I had no business making a special request. There is a male supervisor that is very kind and professional there that knew the waitress was giving me horrible service. On top of that the food is overpriced and not very flavorful.

dokJ83avFu0ryZXaBUkCOQ.text: Pomegranate never disappoints.  Get onto the vegan and raw vegan deserts.  Pomegranate cake will blow your mind.  And the Almond Joys are awesome.  You'll never know they are almost healthy!

rGJgxi4ys88PvwgPlM4wxw.text: So on our visit to Arizona we wanted some vegan food since that is what we are.. vegan. Pomegranate cafe came up on our yelp search . Let start out by saying the food we had, had a laxative effect on my whole party. I had the grilled cheese Napoleon, thinking it would be hard to screw up a grilled cheese right? Wrong this place found a way and a way I had never thought of. It committed the most diabolical of culinary crimes,putting carrot in a grilled cheese!! Carrot? You have to be kidding me, who does this? They do. The bread was soggy and oily and fell apart when you picked it up ... on to the crab cakes Benedict. Two sloppy crab cakes with a heaping of a way too spicy sauce that just killed any flavor profiles the dish had. It was taken back immediately. It was unpalatable and could not be eaten. The biscuits and gravy was terrible. Two doughy biscuits with a flavorless gravy and some scrambled tofu and four bits of vegan sausage. The biscuits were too large and too soft to eat . The tofu was unremarkable and made no impact It was a overpriced fiasco that was very disappointing,the service was very very slow but the staff were very nice and accommodating. The availability of vegan food is bad enough in some areas and the pricing of some restaurants is just ridiculous and unnecessary. This is plant based dining and should not, ever be this expensive. Unpalatable vegan food and overpricing is the reason people poke fun at a vegans. A Plant based  diet is a way of life not a trend and shouldn't be charged as such

7ra9x8RXIRyOTlTljRGW9A.text: The food and the fresh juices were amazing! Staff was very friendly. The buffalo cauliflower was for sure my favorite.

47T769tmYtnmAOieTgfriQ.text: Got up and left after not even being acknowledged after sitting awhile even though waiters were buzzing around us

oBn2Gbb0yPtOcfGFz8jWdA.text: Won't be returning again. Service has much to be desired with slow service just to place your order. Really felt ignored.  Second, screwing up on simple beverage order, and  not informing me that the entree I ordered is not available, and substituting another entree 180 opposite to what I would order! What ever happened to addressing the customer by saying " We ran out of your chosen entree, could we interest you in something else?"  But no....  Third, the price for two to have entrees and 1 appetizer was $52.00. And trust me this place is shabby and lacks comfort and decent servers. My wife and I are frequent customers of The CuttingBoard in Mesa AZ. We were told Pomegranate was the same perhaps better. We think not! The CuttingBoard rocks and service is exceptional. Save your money and humility and stay far away from Pomegranates. They are lucky I gave them 1 star.

vjmYwnM9r9Nq7wLuMMPnyQ.text: First time here.  I ordered the mushroom lentil walnut "burger" on a bed of mixed greens.  The food was good though a little too salty.  The prices are high and the food took quite a long time to come out. My colleague and I were on a lunch break and ended up barely having time to eat and pay before having to return to work.  My only other comment is they should have all nutrition info. for each of their dishes.  I specifically asked for the info, and after checking, the server told me they did not have this info. available.  That's frustrating when trying to watch my intake.  Decent food but not sure I'll go back.

eWFFqDr5GgKIqv2ph1bQ5Q.text: Yummy for vegan all natural organic eatery. I've been here before but didn't get a chance to eat so I finally made a point to do so for a late lunch. Where to start? Menu: food menu and drink menu (healthy drinks) were plentiful! I had no idea what to choose for either of them. I finally decided to go for the supreme burrito and the blue lagoon smoothie.   Supreme burrito = grilled spinach tortilla stuffed with brown rice, kale, carrots, zucchini, other farm veggies, beans, cheese and guacamole and cashew sour cream. Smothered with enchilada sauce with a side of purple cabbage ginger slaw and a couple slices of oranges. Not sure if I could really taste that but sounded so unique! This can definitely fill a hungry man's stomach if he's not the type to eat healthy food. $14  Blue lagoon smoothie = blueberry. pineapple. Spirulina. Chia. Kale. Coconut h2o. Brain on (helps focus. de stress. Lifts mood). Topped with a couple frozen blueberries and a couple squares of pineapple. This was surprisingly  blue-licious!! $14 - yes $14 for a drink!! Better have had given me all those health benefits!  Baked goods = seasonal pomegranate cake and their thick chocolate chip with oats, walnuts and choc chip! $8 and $3 respectively.   All in all this place was quite delicious and healthy. Servers were nice. Waters were given in jars and to go cups. You can enjoy eating outside as well as inside. One part of my food had a possible hair but I think I will try to ignore that part..  Minus that tidbit of un-welcomed thing I will give it another shot. The desserts and drinks are begging me to come back.

IENjimzy6UMK5Bq5FSg-gA.text: Sunday morning brunch is best the time to come here. Such a happy, calming atmosphere and love that they move at a slower pace here so it really forces you to be present for a whole meal. It is busier on weekends for brunch but worth the wait. All their food is amazing and made with great ingredients. Coming here is like going to a wellness center, just doing something good for myself. Love their pancakes and breakfast sandwiches. Really filling and delicious. So far I've tried lemon blueberry pancakes and rocky road. The rocky road pancakes were so good but be ready to share because they are super rich, chocolatey, and basically dessert. I got tofu scramble so I could have a bite of something savory too. Besides their brunch menu I've also tried their desserts. When you walk in they have a case of raw cakes, muffins, cupcakes, and chocolate desserts. I usually don't like raw desserts much but everything they have is so good.

PjYX4H8kB5Rv35qWlxmMLA.text: My husband n I are visiting the area. Decided to try it out. Well all we tried was the water. The waiter was to busy talking to coworkers to ask if we would like coffee or smithing else to drink. He said "oh your first time here, I will be back". Leaves water n walks off to chat with coworkers. After a good 5 Minutes n no acknowledgment from anyone we walked out. According to my daughter in law they also had bad service there in November and didn't care for the food. So I guess he saved us from this over priced restaurant.

ujYtSkY9RM5INF-fFpLfcg.text: I was a regular at Pom for many years. Quality has gone downhill recently. I'm not sure if the chefs have changed, but the food no longer has the appeal is did previously. The wait times are long and prices are high.

u6wUx6Y8qZ1ITmzdHoLQyw.text: Loved everything about this place...except for the damage it did to my wallet. I had the lucky dragon bowl and a side of the potato salad. Both items were unlike anything else I've ever tried, which isn't something I can say very often. I loved the creative approach to each of the items. The fact that they were able to create such unique flavors while incorporating vegan, organic and non-gmo ingredients is even more impressive. My only complaint is the cost of the meal makes the restaurant more of a special occasion spot than a regular in my restaurant rotation. Mostly, I'm just bummed that I can't go every week to try something new without taking out a second mortgage. I guess it's True though ... you can't put a price on quality. Try this place out and enjoy!

8ugAdSZbdBumv30V4aBFmg.text: This is some of the best food I have had in Phoenix! I came here for a "snack" with a co worker while on business and was blown away by their buffalo cauliflower wrap that was vegan and gluten free. Our sever was awesome and the food was incredible!

2r1kOnKHT2zJ46_wkITHIA.text: Good food but the price are a bit too high for the value you get. Do wild flowers bread if you want salad :- )

QW4azdVKGm4kkXdJmzfCcw.text: Ok, service aside the food is great. I had the chai latte and soup (clamless chowder) & half salad (mermaid). Server was super knowledgeable about the menu and the vibe here is good. Prices might come off a tiny bit high but its super clean eating and I had so much food/bev that I couldn't finish.   It might be because I was eating a "quick bite" alone but service was nonexistent. I sat a long time waiting to order, to get my order, and to pay (no extra stops made by anyone... In fact the hostess saw my card out and closed my check). I was here for about an hour (not so quick) plus the "5min" wait that was more like 10-15. Again no big deal but something to keep in mind. Oh and its not that busy. There's a steady flow of people.   Overall I liked this place, could probably get my bf to try it, but I wish the service matched the ambience and the food.

JujX89Z29eBsiQXuXltg1w.text: Great place, atmosphere and customer service. The food was really amazing especially their drinks! If you ever go or live in Arizona I highly recommend this place!

tnZp53jLsmRW5KktVBMNfw.text: Outstanding vegetarian and vegan dishes.  Professional and courteous waitstaff!  Cassi, the owner, likes to socialize with patrons.  The kitchen is very flexible on preferences and dietary needs.  The atmosphere is friendly and frequent patrons share in conversation with others.

0210SrT3jdlGIw9CPlJHTQ.text: I had really high hopes for this place. I am very into raw/vegan food and was excited to see that they served fresh food that suited my palate.   I went this week with my son and friend and the bill was close to $35. For a small serving of food I was really surprised at the price they charged. In fact, I had a juice a two sides in order not to spend $10 on kale.   The juice I had (kale, coconut water, berries, etc) was really good. The portion size was nice and I noticed that they had other really good veggie/fruit combos. I think that if you are into juice and have money to burn then this should be your go to place.   As I mentioned before, I chose to have sides to avoid their high plate prices. The pasta salad was pretty bad. The beet salad was also very bad. The beets were cooked, which I didn't expect and there was no dressing on the salad. It was just really bland and not at all what I expected.   My son had a quesadilla and it was really small. They gave him a few carrots and half a cookie which made the $4 price tag ok. I nibbled on all of these and was totally unimpressed. No thought goes into the kids meals apparently. He gulped half of my juice, which was good.   My friend had a falafel and a potatoes that were served with a pomegranate bbq sauce. I only tasted the potatoes and sauce and it was actually quite good.   After lunch I bought some macaroons and donut holes (all raw) out of the deli case and they were ok. I liked them but they didn't wow me.   I think that you should try this restaurant out for yourself. I really hope that your experience is better than mine. I really, really want to give this place a 5. In fact, I was hesitant to write this review just because I want them to succeed. I don't this can happen if they don't improve their menu and pricing. I will not return to pay $35 for mediocre food. It pains me to say this, but my first visit will be my last visit.

_txdATEgoASevoEy8LTQrw.text: Such an amazing restaurant and the only vegan one I have so close to home. The vibe there is so amazing and so is the service. They have only "messed up" once, of the numerous times I've Been there, and immediately apologized and offered me compensation. They said the food was taking a while to come out but to be honest, I didn't even notice, which just shows how diligent they are. The food there is amazing, I would recommend the curry bowl, sushi or rolls ,as they call them there, and the coconut brownie...as a drink the coconut mocha was amazing, never disappointed by this place.

kAmaTpLPwCHtyxT9Dj8x5Q.text: Not worthy of a near perfect rating, that's for sure.  Had the lumberjack. It was okay, nothing to write home about, needed extra flavor and spice. Very bland.  Took twenty minutes to get our food. Seemed like a long time since you order and pay and then sit down and wait.  Lastly....Price! Holy crap!
