HvTCbkJyKwknQB7ij9j9ZA.text: Very interesting place. I got the magic coffee which was tasty . To me it's like whole foods made a restaurant. It's very nice and I will be back to enjoy the food.

O_BM3KWrv9SOgjWXgpcapQ.text: Love this restaurant. My siblings are vegetarians from San Francisco and this is A favorite spot when they visit. Never had a problem here and food is delicious. :)

xpr43SWCAL-nquaTyuYOcg.text: This place is great. I went out on a limb for this place. I was heading to chandler when I wanted something fresh and light. So I yelped my way in the direction of my final destination and found this delicious little spot.   I had the Tacos Raw and the lime-ade to drink. The tacos were AMAZING! The lime-made was ok. It was a bit expensive for what it was. I really liked the concept and set up of the restaurant. I'd recommend this place to my friends. If it weren't far from where I lived I would definitely go back regularly.

jHZCF3sNsI5GgmVVIheJpQ.text: This is a great place to go if you're aiming to eat healthy! This cafe offers raw, organic, gluten free options too. Their ingredients are extremely fresh and their dishes are beautifully plated for a casual cafe.   We tried the pesto presto sandwich, which consisted of avocado, sunflower sprouts, tomato slices and pesto on a whole wheat baguette. They give such a generous amount of avocado it is SO good, and the pesto flavor is perfect and not too over-powering. The tortilla soup was the best I've tried yet. We also had the BLT on whole wheat toast. They use tempeh bacon and it was delish!  We also tried the "donut holes" - if you check-in on foursquare (1st time only) you get a free donut hole.  Well, they were definitely not the donut hole I was expecting - basically a ball of organic raw type ingredients...of what I'm not sure but the two flavors they had resembled the taste of a Lara Bar - just in a ball. :)  Only downside is that it is a little pricier for their sandwiches/ lunch. But definitely worth it!

y18FDX0KMwFdXT-GgU_nvA.text: I should start by saying I am not vegan or vegetarian I just enjoy clean, healthy, local eating and small family business. Pomegranate cafe has delicious food, amazing staff and service and a family oriented family feel. Highly recommend this place.

cBT399-9eKXvhdh07Icw_Q.text: I love this place! For me, their dessert bar is heaven on earth! I can never have dessert anywhere due to my severe dairy allergy and so this is such a treat for me! Everything is so good. I will drive miles out of my way just to go and get a cupcake after the gym or some scones for the next morning. Try their chocolate pomegranate cupcake and their chocolate pomegranate truffles. Their cowgirl cookies are so yummy, too. Oh, and the best part is you can order a cake!! a delicious, moist vegan cake! I will finally be able to have a birthday cake! Portions are pretty small for the tab you pay, I don't really leave full (especially if I go after a workout). I understand most restaurants serve huge portions of bad food and so we are used to over-eating, but I am a pretty small/petite woman and it definitely doesn't fill me up, but I'm so happy to have something healthy and yummy available that it is still one of my favorites.

jA8tUd3LDGGebp3pPVMs7Q.text: I'm only going to give a three star rating because of the lady at the register was helpful and courteous otherwise I was not very impressed. Now let me state it smelt great but the food is way to pricy to want to come back. Plus not once was i greeted at the door with a "hello, welcome in" but I waiting patiently and before I knew it I was being cut off in the line by a guy looking at the snack bar and ready to pay his bill. I spoke up that I was already in line and he gave me my spot back but stood right behind me so close that I could hear his comments . then a hostess/waiter came up to him and stated "just trying to pay your bill?" he then followed with " yes and they should have moved her to someone else, I'll be speaking with so and so"  coming in as a NEW customer unfamiliar with the way this place works I was unsure of where to go or if there were several lines for different things plus again nobody had greeted me. To close this off I felt very low and that my business did not matter so I'm sadly saying I'm not going to be coming back which sucks for me because I really wanted to enjoy this place. So you got your way buddy someone else will be helping me!

AwjRaOWeLQTc0jz1FvOBnA.text: Delicious flavorful vegetarian restaurant the best I've had in phoenix. Prices are higher than most buy for all organic ingredients it's understandable. I would recommend this so long as you know it's 25 percent more than everywhere else.

lX0Z0OhOSpfdJij4i-BfMg.text: Pomegranate never disappoints with their food and friendly staff. The prices are reasonable and there is so much to choose from. Every time I go in there it's always really busy but the food comes out within minutes and its delicious. In practice of being a vegan or at least a vegetarian, they make it very easy to stick to a healthy diet. I usually always get the avocado sandwich which comes with egg but I substitute it with the tofu option and it tastes exactly the same, if not better. Every meal usually comes with a side and they make their own juices right there in front of you, which are also super healthy and delicious.  The Pomegranate staff is super friendly and I wouldn't want that place to do anything different.

R6IkKurwistC2Y_GsKWxsg.text: I only had a few minutes to get something for lunch but when I got there it was packed. I got there about after 12 lunch. Even though the wait was long I ordered a strawberry smoothie. The staff were awesome to everyone waiting in line. The smoothie was really good too. Next time I'll have to order one of their avocado sandwiches.

NZ2IUMUHTcd1Xly8oCmfcA.text: The Pomegranate Cafe was recently named "Best New Restaurant" by Phoenix Magazine, which is a lifestyle rag for urbanites with dollars to burn.  The restaurant in question is in Chandler, home to many of these people.  However, Pomegranate Cafe is family-owned and vegan-friendly, so I had to check it out.  Everything on the menu is vegetarian and can be made vegan.  There are also gluten-free and raw options, so there's something for everybody.    The restaurant serves breakfast foods like tofu scrambles, French toast, and breakfast burritos, but when I went, I chose a vegan BLT from their lunch menu.  It was made with delicious smoky tempeh "bacon," and the addition of avocado was nice.  My hot date ordered a pesto sandwich, which he declared pasty but tasty.  Neither sandwich was huge, but they come with a spinach-pomegranate salad and some veggie chips.  You get a full plate of food, and everything is extremely fresh, but I wasn't too stoked on the salad, though my hot date liked it.  It would have been nice to have a choice of sides, like some fries or potato salad or something, but that was not the case.  We also split a berry smoothie, which was pretty tasty.  It was no tsoynami, but...what is?  They also had a good selection of vegan desserts, such as cookies, donut holes, cakes and even cheesecake.  We got a slice of chocolate cake topped with pomegranate seeds to go, and it was delicious.  It's so rare to find dairy- and egg-free desserts.  The atmosphere was bright, clean and cheerful.  It was an enjoyable meal for sure.  My main gripe about the place brings me right back to my first paragraph: everything was sooo damn expensive.  Sandwiches are $8-$12, the smoothie was friggin' $7, and the slice of cake was $6.    So, if you wanna splurge and try a new vegan place on the far east side of town, it's definitely worth a try.  But unless you're one of those rich people that can afford things, you might want to bring a friend and split some stuff.  The food is tasty, but I don't think I'll go back because I wouldn't dream of spending that kind of money on a meal these days.

CmAS1r7BAjjNEp3lRrnh-Q.text: Hi everybody!  This is a tough review for me because I shop at trader joes almost exclusively and my wife and I watched and waited for this restaurant to open. Granted it has been open for awhile it took us some time to get to it. I am not really sure it was open many times as we passed and were hungry. Finally we checked the menu and CHACHING!  So we moved it to the top of the list for trying and we were excited to come. As we only eat out on shopping day. Maybe too much. As usual whenever we eat at any restaurant we asked our "vegan" questions. We were told that someone there was a vegan nazi and if it says vegan it is, and this is very good.   I will say that i do trust that Pomegranate Cafe serves what they say they serve and the food was very high quality and very delicious. We shared the lentil burger ($12) that was on the menu board behind the counter. I really wanted to try the desserts but decided to wait till next time.  Everything was going great and we waited patiently for our food. Granted it was busy so it took a little time and this also is ok.   Here is where my problems begin. Bellieve me I do not want to give ANY business ANY time only 2 stars.  Trust me i just don't and i feel bad for doing so however, I did say on my profile that the reviews i do are very important to me. I am the kind of person who does not mince words and you will know where you stand with me. If i see something i do not like i will say so.    That being said  Now I will say that I have worked in the restaurant industry since i was 16. I have done every side job known to everyone who has set foot into a kitchen. (explained later) I have helped build business for many. Though I do not have any degrees or anything I have seen many meals being sent to customers in many differents ways, and styles. Some were good, some were bad, some were happy, some were mad. But they all ate and they either came back or they didn't. Currently I work in not one but two very popular digs. I work very hard to make sure my customers are happy, and i know how hard it is to work in a small family place. I worked at a local chinese restaurant for 6 years and barely got  a day off.  Do not get me wrong there is nothing wrong with the food here. my issue is with one small thing or two.   Why does a new business in the realm of Pomegranate (a higher class cafe which serves vegan food) charge a plate splitting fee which i believe was $2.00. Then give us our food on a paper plate. Please, this is ridiculous. We always split our food no matter where we go. It is pratically the only way you can stay healthy these days. Not to mention we believe that there was no more food for this charge. (for example: if there were more chips or pickles or fruit, then i do not have a problem with this fee. however I would say when asked to split. " OK, no problem, however there will be a $?.?? charge, and for that you will recieve ....) if i would have known this i would have gotten it to go and this review would be totally different. And in my humble opinion it is not a good idea to charge this fee in an uber difficult restaurant "genre".    Believe me there are lots of people like me who want food like this. Do not make it harder on yourself by adding on fees which really are not necessary! Are you not making enough money off of $0.25 worth of lentils?  I also have to say that I had trouble choosing something to eat from the menu, because many things were scratched off. ???? Were they out of that item? I think the thing that bothered me about this was there were so many that i wanted to try but could not. I saw many that had promise, as I am a vegan nazi and i really was stoked to eat here. It is my kind of place almost to a t. Too bad that did not work out.  Now for the side job part.   While we waited for our food i noticed that this restaurants dining room was not very clean. the floor looked as if it had not been cleaned for a few days, the windows were very dirty, and the window sills were covered, and i mean covered in dust. Complete with cobwebs. From what i could tell the kitchen was clean.   Here is how I see it. Please do not serve a $14.50 burger on a paper plate EVER! To me this says that the staff does not want to do dishes, If something is on your menu keep it there, when people find something they like they will come back no matter how much it costs if they know it will be there. Clean your dining room! it is uber, uber ,uber important that your customers see a clean dining room. it does not take that long and it will go very far impressing your customers, especially when you are first getting started. When a restaurant does not take the time to clean thier dining room they most likely are not cleaning thier kitchen as well. I hope this is not the case with Pomegranate because I really would like to try more food here. I only will know by stopping by again.   Thank for reading.   Late, Greg

gg9K1DRUdB90HypcNowtdQ.text: Amazing food and customer service. I ordered the summer breeze juice which was refreshing and the smokin blt. So good. Tasted better than actual bacon. I'll be back again. Highly recommended.

wFch0HNdsyVN8GMJcqncKA.text: Great food but I can't tolerate poor service. Called in order and was told they were busy. Would be 20-30 mins. Order took an hour. Unacceptable.

c3q9cUNN00T3rX_70g4gPg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. Today was the first day I had ever tried this little gem and boy, was I happy! I ordered a Pom Latte with caramel, pesto Caesar wrap and a rocky road bar for dessert, which were all so yummy!! The place is so clean, open and fun with a great atmosphere. People would stop by our table to check up on us to make sure we were okay, and our server was very kind. My party also ordered the dragon bowl and Kung pao wrap, along with the lemonade and pomegranate green tea, and pecan and lemon bars. Everything was EXTREMELY good and I'll be more than happy to go back! :) a tad pricey but for the quality, amount of food and the fact that it's all organic and vegan/vegetarian without GMOs, it was definitely worth it!

gYhVe4QJ7a_MjYmPM9Z3aA.text: The place was really cute and the food was good. The host took a few minutes to acknowledge me which wasn't the best, but my waiter was great. The only other downfall was that there was a long hair in my food. I would totally give it another try though because the food options looked great.

nEGdi-qarkK0FbJaUM2Rnw.text: My husband and I love this place. The food is amazing. We have tried a lot of their menu and we have never been disappointed. Service can be slow due to the small kitchen and limited staff but I would say worth it overall.  We will be back time after time!

pETyXhGL4P0V_5bfEnGjpA.text: Let me explain something to you: I am a man. I like to eat MEAT, and I don't want some fru-fru ingredients that I've never heard about. Don't try to serve me brocolini - just give me broccoli. Or better yet, just give me a small tree because I am a man and when I eat, I mean business.  Due to this, I avoided the Pomegranate Cafe for a long time, because what am I going to do with a tofu burrito? That's not real food. And a taco made with walnut meat? Walnuts aren't meat - they're wood. I don't want that.  Anyway, my wife talked me into coming here, and I have to take everything back. This place has serious flavor - flavor that would scare lesser men. I had a burrito without any meat in it - not even eggs, and it was both filling, and really, really delicious. Also, they have some pretty wild deserts here, so even if you're not willing to try bread made of cauliflower, try the chocolate cake, or even better - the banana cake.  Do know that they are slow - like... extremely slow. If you have the time, it's worth it, but don't come here if you've got somewhere to be afterwards.  Also, they have fake bacon, which is nothing like real bacon. I'm not saying it's bad - just don't order it if you're like me and expect what you're used to.  Other than that, enjoy! And I recommend sitting outside - they've got a lovely patio and a basket full of squirt bottles to ward off any adventurous birds.

v0cClmKxkT24k07R5-xFog.text: This place has a cool ambiance, very modern and a bit hipster. They have cold brew on tap, which is a big plus in my book. the food overall was very average. I had the Arizona wrap and Anna had another wrap. We both thought they were very average at best. The kids had french toast that was very good. I wouldn't come here again unless I was with vegetarians they wanted to come.

sjuIiTCoyVGq955GnocbgQ.text: I had the best grilled cheese sandwich ever.  Ok, I'm not a g.c. afficianado but it was different and very tasty.   It has a home made grain bread, avocado, onions, some greens, and cheese (I ordered dairy cheese).  It is piled high and you'll stretch those mouth muscles for every morsel. I had to box half of it and take it home where someone else made the discovery and devoured it.   The restaurant is kid friendly and the kids in our group enjoyed cheese crisps and fresh fruit.  If you make it known to your server that there are allergy issues with anyone in your group, you will not be surprised with the ingredients in your meal.  It has been awhile since I last posted a review on Pomegranate since it is far from my home.  It is well worth the drive.  There is a discernable difference in taste between the chain restaurants and the mom and pop establishments.  In this case, the "mom", is an outstanding cook and entrepreneur.

hh2CbkZZ0sx8IoPWuvqn8Q.text: Pomegranate Cafe is popular-and for good reason. The all-vegan cafe with a few egg and dairy options for less-strict vegetarians had a line out the door, with 10 people ahead of me, when I arrived for Sunday brunch. And that line didn't decrease over the entire hour I was there. It might be the reputation the suburban success in Ahwatukee, Ariz., has garnered as one of the very rare restaurants that serves a vegan brunch every day of the week. Or, it could just be the spectacular food. (I saw at least one culinary institute coat and I can assure you, these people know how to cook.) Be forewarned: Dishes here are too numerous to choose from. You'll be compelled, more likely compulsed, to come back. My dining companion and I had the In Season Scramble-hers with dairy and eggs, mine without. Both were delicious and accompanied by "harvest hash" (a surprisingly balanced medley of potatoes, sweet potatoes, kale, peppers and other veggies) plus toast and homemade jam. I consider this simply an introduction to the restaurant, which boasts a tantalizing array of vegan desserts (make no mistake: The baked-goods counter is food porn at its best-resistance is futile), not to mention smoothies, raw dishes and lunch offerings that would have any foodie's palate irrevocably aroused. I'm coming back for the Raw! Lasagne, "Today's Burger" (I had plate envy of the diners next to me), Wild Western Tacos and mmm, mmm, mmm, like everything in the dessert counter. (Please, chocolate cake, be there upon my return). If you live within 25 miles of this place, it's worth a trip simply as a dining destination. To view the menu in depth (warning: not for the faint of willpower!), visit pomegranatecafe.com/pdfs....

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The baked-goods counter at Pomegranate Cafe

E0VIOmCYpJRqxZVq5BUPFw.text: Added teary beans to the breakfast tacos. Excellent. Next time I would even order them without eggs.

dGuzm-ZhMBlewyIviLNzMw.text: What a find! Heading back to Tucson we were searching for a place to grab lunch and we landed at this fabulous little place. Quality ingredients, skillful preparation and wonderful presentation made our meal enjoyable. We sampled the breakfast burrito, avocado and egg sandwich, fresh juices and a Milky Way coffee. The fresh veggies, tepary beans and were tasty and nothing was over cooked. There were no salt and pepper shakers on the table- they weren't needed because everything was seasoned just right! The comfortable, light and inviting atmosphere completed the experience. We will be back!

oMxM72mSRy55rwgWHXwf5Q.text: I'm giving it 3-stars because the food is actually really good. One thing I didn't like was the customer service and how everything was run. We went yesterday around noon, so I was expecting it to be busy. Every sit was full except for the bar so we went to sit there and basically was ignored. If, we didn't flag anyone down, I'm pretty sure we weren't ever going to be helped by anyone. When we finally flagged someone down and ordered, we waiting about 20 minutes for the food which wasn't bad timing. I am a little surprised on how expensive it was, hence for another -1 star. For 2 bowls and water, my bill came to about 30 bucks. Yikes. I could've went to Panda that was down the street and have leftovers.   Besides the expensiveness and the bad customer service, the food tasted really good and the portion wasn't too bad (although, for paying 30 bucks for 2 plates, I expected bigger portion of food). Other than that, here have 3 stars on me.

YklPW6g3TKiyQ-oHf1Zvcg.text: I can't say enough good things about this place. I love their business as a whole. Local resources and vegan/vege options that are delicious to even the meatiest meat eater. Plus AMAZING coffee. I would literally keep this place in business with just getting coffee there if we lived in AZ.

uDIBc1hWvTNDFkwp_VY-EA.text: Meh....this place went through some major renovations. And while I appreciate it being a healthy option, I think it's sort of ridiculous for the prices. Parking is always hell on the weekends so beware!

jDGx4brav7FCg9c0bqOSBg.text: THIS IS REALLY GOOD VEGETARIAN FOOD.   The spices are spot-on and accentuate the vegetarian-based dishes, which is hard to do.  The "meat" patties for burgers are delectable and made of walnut and mushrooms.  Again, his alone is hard to ached in the many vegetarian restaurants I have eaten at.  Nice work!

SWxFUZihfen4yyFh05ZZrw.text: Pomegranate Cafe is my favorite vegetarian restaurant! The food and the service is always top notch.

7AOJxbdob_W92DuKLHwjng.text: The ambiance is great. Love the outdoor set up even in the AZ summer heat. The inside is adorable! The mango coconut muffin is great the toast I ordered is dry. The Milky Way drink also take dry and far too strong. The service overall is good. The sever I had seemed annoyed by me asking questions (this is my 1st time here). I will be back in hopes for a better experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the toast and muffin! The muffin is AMAZING!

W-FR3ox_nSfCmIK7JjVOWA.text: I've been to pomegranate cafe twice now and I am for sure going back. I had no idea I lived so close to a vegan restaurant that also has raw-vegan options and I'm so happy this place is delicious!  I got the mermaid salad last night to go and though the tofu was rather over cooked and a bit too salty the rest of the salad was delightful. I'm a bit of a salt fiend but I think next time I'll order this salad sans the tofu.   This morning I dined in for a late breakfast with my non-vegan boyfriend. I had the Pomuffin and he had the Avocado Sandwich and he actually enjoyed it! We both appreciated the freshness and portion sizes. The drip coffee is really great, I can't wait to try the lattes and desserts next time.

xVnTWwzXMGf17-0bJoEm-A.text: Came here for breakfast with a couple girl friends. This is such a cute place! A bright, open dining space with colorful (and slightly girly) decorations. I love the local environmentally-conscious vibe, and the staff are really friendly!  I ordered the In-Season Egg Scramble, which came with a delicious stir fry of fresh vegetables, and yummy multi-grain toast! I love their toast! Much more fun than the regular wheat toast at most breakfast places, with a yummy berry jam! My friends ordered the multi-grain toast with almond butter, which was beautifully plated (with pomegranate seed topping!) and looked delicious as well! (And is a good way to go if you don't want a large portion). The best part, nothing felt heavy/greasy!  They also have an assortment of baked goods and desserts, which looked delicious! And they have complimentary cucumber water, which was super refreshing! I'm excited to come back and try their juices as well!

qtneLgGpzluhnkVKdG4c7A.text: Hands down the best place for clean eating in Phoenix. So so so yummy, I'd eat there daily if it was close and I had $13-25 bucks to shell out on every meal. They're expanding their space once again, but I wish they'd open a second location in Arcadia, folks up here would eat that ish UP.   Service can be pretty slow at times, but I can tell they're making an effort to speed it up, and honestly, I just don't care. Good food takes time and hipsters operate on their own internal clocks, so just expect it or gtfo. Soup and salad lunch is always a good choice if you really need to get in and out in an hour, otherwise order for pickup, make sure to pay over the phone, and take it back to the office or even monge on the patio.  I love the Rainbow Wrap, and the Falafel Caesar. Kale Salad is a good standby too. I wish they'd do a slightly refined dinner service on Friday and Saturdays with a changing menu, but I appreciate that they stick to their strengths, breakfast and lunch. Honestly, I haven't even tried 90% of the menu, but I can say without hesitation that it all is good.  And O, thee breakfast. I've only been there once for it but damn was it tasty.  If you wanna get your inner hippie on, get to Pomegranate. Seriously the best green eats evar.

CBTI-EUH3ZaO9qA339O7Ig.text: Sarah H and I came in for lunch today because we've been both wanting to try it for a while.  The restaurant was bustling when we arrived so we waited line and ordered our lunch.  I settled on the Elephant Curry Bowl, recommended by the cashier and Sarah ordered the Daily Burger which was a sweet potato burger today and a pomegranate lemonade.  We took our table market and found a place to sit and chatted while we waited for our food.    Her lemonade came out first.  It looked like the pomegranate was fresh squeezed.  I forget her exact words but something like it was interesting.  She drank most of it, but not all.  Also, the glass of lemonade was on the small side.  Not what I would expect for $3.  Our meals came out and my Elephant Bowl looked good.  Yellow curry with lots of fresh vegetables and brown rice and tofu.  Everything I like.  Maybe I should have just ended the meal there before the disappointment set in. For a curry it was terribly bland and strangely enough made my tongue numb.  I ended up bringing the majority of it home and spiced it up a bit so I could finish it.  I had a bite of Sarah's burger and it was pretty good.  It tasted predominately of sweet potatoes and lentils, but I enjoy both of those.  She had the root vegetable fry's on the side and those were good as well seasoned with rosemary.    I would like to try this place again.  I noticed that many of the reviews were not good for many's first visit but then improved with their second.  It might be good for Abu J with his vegan/supermodel diet.  I'm curious what he'll think of it.

0etF2hz1uZhpWGnqI30wCg.text: Loved this place! I am not vegan but cannot do eggs, dairy or gluten... I had so many options at this place even with my allergies. I settled on the scramble (tofu) of the day which was with maple tempeh and dairy free cheese (daiya), sweet potato hash, and gluten free-vegan toast. I had never had a tofu scramble or tempeh so I was nervous I was going to be left disappointed and hungry! It was quite the opposite. The portion was perfect and the food was delicious!   My husband, who doesn't have any food allergies, ordered the enchilada scramble (regular eggs) which also came with the sweet potato hash and regular toast. He loved his meal! He mentioned that the enchilada sauce was so flavorful!  We both ordered lattes, his with regular milk and mine with soy milk. They were both pretty good but def not great.   We sat outside (on a not so hot summer morning) with the misters. There were plenty of plants which made for a nice environment.

sx0gvlu2uaj1XqxvCg2OOg.text: I really like this place and they have wonderful food.  I know organic, vegan will usually cost more, but the food here is just overpriced.  I will still come because there are limited options in the east valley, but I am going to start looking for new places that are priced fair.  The smoothies alone are twice what I expect to pay.  But the food really is excellent!

DCGTM-stIsD6vW5SOEHrXg.text: For those of you who just like your facts/ info short and sweet, here you go: -It is a locally owned (family owned too) & operated cafe! -Located in Ahwatukee (...imagine that!...of all places;-) -Offers a truly magnificent selection a FRESHLY made items: tea, fresh squeezed juice, coffee, brkfst foods, lunch items, ("healthy"/wholesome) treats / desserts, and so very much more... -Very reasonably priced items -Great helpful, energentic & informative staff! -You DON'T just have to be a "healthnut" to eat here (which it's certainly okay if you are...BUT It's a great place to hangout for tea, coffee & "people watching" too!) - Free wi-fi (yeah-True- Starbux has it, everyone pretty much does - BUT Pomegranate is way superior overall in every aspect!) -For more info see their website at: pomegranatecafe.com - especially for hours, location & menu! For those of you that need a little more info / aka a bigger -nudge- to be persuaded to try this great place...check out my long winded love letter -oh, I mean overview. I hope you find it to be honest, humorous & helpful: Pomegranate Cafe' is sincerely a WONDERFULLY delightful place! ....& it is truly a DREAM COME TRUE! The the newly decorated window of this awesomely vibrant, yet quaint and cozy cafe reads 3 simply lovely words: *Local* Seasonal*Organic The day that I saw this sign I knew I was in love...or- that a small piece of heaven had quite literally landed in my "backyard" (-aka it's just a few blocks from my home! yippee!). I then sighed with an unmistakable sense of "finally, a breath of "fresh air!"...in a world of lack luster fast, processed foods- a place I can go to be free from it all...close to home. A locally owned cafe of this high quality caliber (again they organic, seasonal and even some Live/Raw items), comfort and affordability I feel is very a rare thing...Not forgetting to mention that this cafe is NOT located in Downtown/ Metro PHX...It located in Ahwatukee! It's right next to Trader Joe's on 38th & Chandler Blvd! This place will be mos def. be my "hangout" from now on, whenever possible- until I either leave PHX, or pass into another life! I am only 30- so I hope that it isn't the latter! By the way, in jest- I told the owner, Cassie that if I could I would love to just sign over my paycheck to her, & I meant it! She would only have to share it with a few other fave places like Changing Hands Bookstore,Trader Joe's,W.Foods & Agritopia(& Joe' s BBQ), (& the local farmer's mkts.)! Well, since that isn't possible of course I will just have to continue to support this little awesome local business in any way I can! Which bring me to the last, but certainly not least... Mentioning of he cafe's {glorious} offerings! Seriously. I mean this...Sincerely superb!!!! Everything on the menu is so very fresh and equally fresh tasting! I would be hard pressed to think that anything you could ever order from Pomegranate to be any less than perfect & enjoyable! My very first visit, on their {soft} opening day- I had a severe cold and the nice young lady / staff made me an herbal tea called "Vitali-Tea." After that very 1st visit- I was truthfully dumbfounded and struck down by the very feeling of unadulterated *love* embodied by a physical place! I counted the days until I could make the time to visit again! My 2nd visit was actually just yesterday. I hadn't eaten anything in the morning, it was way past lunch & and I was extremely hungry! I was also very tired from a company mting- which was in freaking Peoria! (grrr!)- & as I passed by Phoenix's demure skyline (*i'm from NWI/ Chicagoland area*) my tummy & mind wandered through the "Roosevelt Row" area of metroPHX... However, I was drawn closer & closer to home in Ahwatukee, not just by the promise of sleep but also by the overwhelming desire to visit Pomegranate once again. I stepped in the Cafe' with a big appetite and little desire to spend a great deal of $...Pay day, bills and such...pending...a horrible concoction...So I decided on the quiche of the day which came w/ a (phenomenally fresh) house salad. I then splurged and opted for some energy in the form of a cup of fresh-squeezed juice drink called "Laughter." I broke out my net-book, sat down to eat....And my mouth was over taken by the fresh flavor of each individual item that I ordered as I ate it. Complete taste bud loveliness...and overload at the same time! I kid you not! I even had tea & dessert! I sat for at least over an hour, eating slowly enjoying eat bite. Computer screen blank. I just read the drink menu instead (...also i forgot my log-on password btw-lol!)..yet...I was still amazed as I throughly read through each drink description. The drink offerings / menu are the size of a "normal sized"/8x12 food menu. The mind blowing variations of teas, fresh squeezed juices & even elixirs on both front and back. And that's just the drinks! The food is amazing! "Love" awaits you too! ;-) Gottah go! Sincerely, S.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. To Pomegranate Cafe&#39;: with patronage devotion, love &amp; respect...Sincerely, S...

Y7aelTlknMWGzH54PB9Sng.text: I absolutely LOVE this place.  The food is consistently amazing, high quality and fabulous tasting.  The owners genuinely CARE about the food, their staff, the clients and it shows.  Thank you for being my favorite cafe.  Keep up the awesome work.

CYIF96Wt3ZlVeaj9WdXZ_g.text: I need to start by mentioning that the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. Also, the menu is fantastic. Not the actual food, but the menu itself. The dishes are simple and there is enough variety to appease just about anybody. The main problem with this restaurant is the execution of these dishes. The food is bland, vegetables are soggy and wet, and the meat substitutes are poorly prepared and undercooked. I have been a vegetarian for 16 years, and I eat mostly vegan. My diet consists mostly of fresh vegetables, so I am no stranger to this type of cuisine. The ingredients used are fantastic, they just need to better season and cook them. If that were to happen, 2 stars would be added to this review. The other star would be earned from making the dining room more comfortable. Every table was filthy, and I mean filthy. Crusted old liquids and crumbs adorned them all. The thermostat is dangling from an electrical wire from the ceiling in the middle of the restaurant. The wall paint is splotchy and unfinished.   While this review is very critical (as reviews should be), it is not intended to damage this restaurant's reputation. The owners have a very solid idea, but it is obvious that there is an absence of a talented chef. If the Pomegranate Cafe invests in paying more attention to flavor and a more inviting atmosphere, they will have a 5-star restaurant.

Rd4arecdKXFtrx_VzaJBUA.text: Best raw vegan food in the valley.  They are not exclusively raw, but do have a half dozen or so raw dishes on the menu daily and do a raw special on Fridays.  The quality of the food is excellent.  I have eaten here several dozen times and never had anything that wasn't good.

gPeEunN-vq711cDcYfoSVg.text: I didn't want to like this place, but the food was really good. I had the lumberjack sandwich. I was a little leary on the idea of the food when it came, but after tasting it my mind changed. I won't give up real meat or dairy, but I will try this place again.

0PEgY4AIObPJDXjQg92c5g.text: The food is excellent and the wait staff are super friendly but man is the service SLOOOOOOOOOW!  I realize that they care about every dish but, their wait times are ridiculous.  You can't be in a rush or on your lunch break when you go to this place.  It is also quite pricey compared to anywhere else as you are getting organic quality food.  Other than that, it is good food.   Everything I have had here is good.  This last time, I got the rainbow wrap but, instead of having it wrapped in kollard greens I got it in a spinach tortilla.  Very good, healthy and filling without feeling too stuffed.

R5GMJA2Q-x6Nl2hRpKrJ6Q.text: This place is amazing!  My husband and I are gluten free and dairy free. His birthday was coming up and I had yet to bake some sort of birthday cake... (Not my strong point) so I had heard that Pomegranate had a small selection of desserts that were gluten free. Desperate NOT to bake myself I went in,... Low and behold I hit the mother load of deliciousness!  There were so many options that we could both have it was amazing! Since I could not decide, we got pretty much one of everything (some items we did get 2 of) and there was not 1 thing that I tried that was not fantastic!  Even my children who crave refined sugar and corn syrup and various garbage thought everything was delicious.  It was not until AFTER they had ingested it all did I mention that they were actually healthy treats!  I cannot wait to go back very soon!

Xih7Xrr3K7wnkp-2cboCzw.text: It was my first visit and probably my last.   On the plus side the food was delicious. Tiss a shame that the taste and presentation was not the only piece of our experience.   On the minus side the first choice of meals was unavailable, however I was given the option to wait while they went to trader joes next store to grab soy chorizo. The portions small, we waited 15 minutes for one coffee, and  30 minutes for the other.  my 4 dollar mocha missed the yuminess mark, and my wifes cup of joe was not delicious enough to remind her she had wanted it before eating most of her meal. At a half hour wait we went to check on coffee two, when it was delivered it was not with a smile or apology, but with annoyed a toss the cream onto the table in a huff during delivery. The shop uses mason jars or old fruit jars for glasses, neato recycling effort,  Bright burgundy lipstick on one of the water jars not as welcome. We watched the inattentive staff ignoring orders to go out from our seats.  I was definitely not feeling the service or care love of the staff. Unfortunately the vegan wife left very unhappy with the 40 dollars spent on breakfast for three, leaving still hungry, and feeling poorly treated.

zAQcRjZIvnKcB3h476qjTA.text: I absolutely love this place...one day I will open my own raw/vegan/juicing cafe...but until then...this will do. I only wish they had a Scottsdale location. The RAW TIRAMISU is to die for!

udu4ipJYcgP9Tz6G0xIGbw.text: We are not vegetarian, but heard good things and it's right in our neighborhood, so wanted to check it out. I tried the lemon poppy seed pancakes with strawberry compote and they were very good! My husband had the dragon 'burger' and he really enjoyed that as well with a side of hummus and veggies. The juices and smoothies seem interesting, but I'm not sure if I'm brave enough to try them...We liked the atmosphere and we will return to try more new things here!

d3G3oydCgIhBXzAo_NNTBA.text: Best raw vegan cheesecake..ever!  The daily soup and sand was the bomb!  A must try, vegan or not, when in the area!  Highly recommend for all my macro friends!

S1fJ0JocqyzxNPvNAo8YqA.text: Definitely liked this place even more than green. The rainbow wrap was delicious, fresh and filling.

_NYv85ExV-MW8KSEYFtc9w.text: Amazingly great food!  The sandwiches and salads are delicious....the deserts are so decadent!  I really loved the shabby chic earth friendly decor....very friendly staff.  You have to try this place!

cad334QVcK87yMnM8cuzkA.text: I finally tried this place after hearing a lot of good things about it, and....it was just okay.  I was happy to see a real, varied organic and vegetarian menu.  The food was good, and fresh, but not worth the price, especially considering you have to go up to the counter and order, and don't receive any real sit-down service.

21YOq9VJyszCgTE4cCxQWQ.text: We live about 25 miles from this restaurant, so it took us many months to find an opportunity to eat here.  After a strenuous hike at South Mountain Park, I forced my boyfriend to take me to Pomegranate Cafe for a late lunch.  I saw this restaurant on Check  Please,  Arizona several months ago and since we are watching our gluten and animal product intake, I was excited to try it.  My boyfriend is French, and graduated from culinary school in France.  So, needless to say, he is freaking picky as hell.  Taking him to new restaurants that I choose can be a nightmare.   So, on to the food!  I had the lumberjack sandwich, and since I was really starving, I ordered the kale salad as well.  The boyfriend had the omelet of  the day with fresh herbs and veggies.  EVERYTHING was delicious!  It's a miracle!!  After the complaining about not being able to order a cold beer after our 2 1/2 hour hike, he shut up and ate everything, commenting on how good it was.  This is nothing short of a miracle!  The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful.  I'm in the service business, so I really appreciate that.  The ingredients are top notch, and thoughtfully put together, and so good.  The hash that's on the side of the sandwich and the omelet was so good, I would have just had a big bowl of that!  For dessert, we had the Caribbean pineapple coconut cheesecake and a chocolate pomegranate cake ball, and a chocolate macaroon.   The French guy loved the cheesecake, and he's an expert on cheesecake.  All the chocolate desserts were super good and the coffee was great, too.  I will say we tried Green vegetarian restaurant about 2 years ago, and that was a disaster.  We also went to Santa Monica last summer, and tried Real Food Daily, which we thought was kind of bland.  So to get the boyfriend to try another vegetarian place was rather difficult.   We might actually be back!  Like I said, we live far away, but we could make a day out of having lunch, and then hitting Trader Joe's next door!  So convenient!   Thank you, the staff at Pomegranate Cafe, for putting out such a quality product.  You guys are great!

74GKal4i2OhEdJPZyyRrqg.text: I'm not a vegan, but I thoroughly enjoyed the tempeh bacon in my Lumberjack sandwich I had for brunch.  I got the side of potatoes with the pomegranate BBQ, but I wasn't a fan of the sauce.  I switched it out for the spicy "cheese" dipping sauce, much better.  It was a great breakfast, I'd def go back there again.

XCqom4OIC_MIYF7GyWZ_1g.text: I am so glad that Pomegranate has graced Ahwatukee with it's AMAZING vegan and vegetarian fare. Thank you for bringing this type of cuisine to the masses and showing people that GREAT food can be made without using animal ingredients. XOXOXO

ci_J9gOXUoUMAlDb6G9y0g.text: I was very impressed with the quality of food.  A great destination for those who are looking for an organic, very tasty meal.  I'd definetely go back.

ZBVZ_co9G_EwErMTy3WJqA.text: What a great cafe! Incredibly fresh food that tastes amazing and is probably quite good for my body. I had the garden burger and my favorite part - without a doubt - were the huge slices of avocado on top. I also had "Cassie's latte" to drink. I loved it because it wasn't bitter. (Therefore if you like your coffee bitter, DON'T order this drink.)  The menu items were a little on the pricey side (luckily I wasn't paying) but I was definitely full after my meal. I hope they're able to add dinner hours someday!

EM7Y-F4qAnBfUeLRzqHuDw.text: UPDATED REVIEW on 10/30/2017: Cassie, one of the owners, reached out to me the same afternoon as my original review (below) and apologized, which I greatly appreciate! She really went above and beyond to make sure that she understood my experience, and we had a nice conversation about the cafe. She was honest about areas of improvement, and explained to me the reasoning behind some of the policies. I was also offered my order at no charge, so I had a chance to actually try them. The cinnamon rolls are MASSIVE, and are quiet good. Thank you, Cassie!  At this point, my impression of the cafe has certainly improved. I was already favorable with the tone of customer service at Pomegranate Cafe, and after interacting with the management, it's all the higher. I'm glad to try more dishes and pastries in the future, and will recommend PC to my vegetarian and vegan friends. :-)  ------  ORIGINAL REVIEW from 10/28/17 - one star: I want to start by saying that the staff is incredibly friendly. Very personable. But aside from them, my experience with Pomegranate Cafe was poor.   I was given a gift card to PC, which I had never tried before, so this was my first (and frankly, last) experience there. I had called ahead of time to place a small pickup order for the next morning. Nothing major, just six cinnamon rolls. I'm told that it's going to be an extra $20 because it's considered a "rush" order for not ordering 48 hours ahead of time.  Little weird - and steep - but fine...the gift card will cover it.   They ask for payment information, and I tell them I'll be paying with a gift card. That's not accepted over the phone, and they won't place the order until it's paid for. Okay...so, we get special permission from the manager to order my six cinnamon rolls with an assurance that it will be paid for when I pick them up at 8:30 the next morning.   I arrive at 8:30 on the dot, specify that I need to pay, and the guy (super nice) checks to see if the rolls are ready. They're not. Apparently, they burned the cinnamon rolls and need to remake them. But I'm still going to be charged the $20 rush fee, and they won't be ready for pickup for another HOUR. This was not going to work, since I had placed the order specifically to get them on my way to a 9am meeting.   Long story short: the order was cancelled, I've still never eaten there, and I guess the corrected cinnamon rolls are now orphans.

4URt36zA32Qi9LC5OVUbOQ.text: I am neither vegetarian nor vegan and my bf is a meat lover. We ate there today for brunch and the food was delicious, fresh, and the service was fast. I had the 'crab' eggs Benedict and my bf had the sunrise breakfast wrap. Both were so amazing and the portions were huge. We brought half of it home and I'm excited to be enjoying it again tomorrow. We also tried two desserts, the lemon bar and the rocky road bar. Omg heaven in our mouths!!!! Daniella and Justine were accommodating and genuinely friendly. We will definitely be coming back and I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys a well prepared, fresh and tasty meal.

iYpZOqZsXsRi1qwdNKALtQ.text: This place is every vegan and vegetarians dream! I visited on Tuesday around lunch time and I came right before the lunch rush where people had to wait for tables and for the kitchen to catch up with tickets. They did only have 2 waiters which was a bummer but if we needed anything the front cashier would ring it up and put it on our tab. She was very friendly and it helped sitting in front of the dessert display distracting us in how delicious everything looked. Outer waiter was a gentlemen and even though he was swamped that Tuesday he was very friendly and polite. I did wait a more than I'm use to on my lunch, but..... come on this ain't no Chili's where things are frozen ahead and deep fried in minutes.

H9HJ-ANIlPLNIUntefnp_g.text: The food is pretty inconsistent but the desserts are great. They are very slow, understaffed and not so willing to customize orders. The service is an issue with some servers being nice and some not so much especially when you only order off of happy hour menu. Not too willing to come back! It used to be 4 stars but went down to 2.

H3zCvPyVxLTWQndQMdeicA.text: I love pomegranate seeds so why would Pomegranate Cafe be any different?   This little mix matched spot is adorable, it's what my Pinterest boards dream to look like. Wooden tables, chairs with fresh words on them, mason jars EVERYWHERE and all fresh ingredients to boot.     I've had a sun warrior smoothie and the Raw! Tacos which were to die for. The walnut meat was spicy and delicious wrapped up in cabbage leaves. I'm hooked on their food pairings and the vibe they give off.   P. S. Their dessert selection is to die for. Lemon bars? Gluten free goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LWyfkGbLupXfigJ-QAEWyA.text: I am not usually one to post reviews but I just had to say something after my experience here. I was visiting the area and looking for something healthy and new to try so I thought I'd check this place out. Wasn't sure what to order but the girl working, I believe her name was Shannon, recommended the ab&j smoothie. IT WAS AMAZING!! Not only was the smoothie one of the best I've ever had but Shannon was unbelievably friendly and welcoming. I'll be in the area a couple more days and definitely plan on going back because of my experience!

GaEIBdr3kAyj2KWsIduHsw.text: We usually love this place and give it a lot of support but today we had quite a bad experience. We ordered a curry elephant bowl and a casadilla. Our server waited until our food was about to come out to tell us they were out of the stuff for the elephant bowl and it will be 20 more minutes fir the dragon bowl. Very annoying. Then the casadilla came out and was very different from last time, had no cheese on it, and was kind of awful. The nachos had a minuscule amount of cheese and when we asked the server why things were so different he acted surprised like he didn't know what we were talking about.  I think we will be taking a break from this place for a while. At these prices they cant afford poor service and subpar food.   So the manger came over before we left and we told her what happened. She cut our bill in half and apologized, explaining there is a new chef.  She was very nice about it and we appreciate her listening. Also, we bought some cowgirl chocolate tarts to go and they were the bomb!

XCOvCefefh4CTGcOoSYXxA.text: love the food at this place however, Sundays are rough there I don't mind the wait I was single person so I sat at the bar and was asked 3 times would I like a waiter after about 25 minutes of just sitting there looking around I guess it's Pita Jungle for me today

HdXA4OWZsLLDzbD5N4FIXw.text: Best vegan food in town without a doubt. Even my dedicated carnivorous friends love the flavors, textures and overall experience. Service is very good as well, this is my second review and I have to give full credit to the management for turning this place around in terms of service. The food was always awesome and is still amazing.

UhAjiOInCYyrjmQkDLt7qQ.text: I've been waiting to have a reason to be in the east valley just to try this place. I wanted nothing more than to be able to have an awesome lunch and write a great review. Unfortunately that's not gonna happen. We were sat right away, server came right over, super sweet and friendly, got our drink orders (my husband and I ordered two different iced teas, which they brought out with both flavors mixed in one glass? Typing that makes me laugh)  Ok whatever, no big. We order food and wait. And wait. And wait. ALMOST FORTY FIVE MINUTES FROM ORDER TO TABLE! Then. My order came out wrong. The one thing I was most excited to try, the TLT, wasn't even brought out and I had to ask for it. Oh btw ask me how many times our teas (once put in delegate glasses were refilled in the hour and a half we were there. The answer is zero) Now we're rushing and order a dessert to go, our server took like $3.00 off the $65.00 bill. Um cool thanks.  In the midst of this, I'm watching the manager (I think?) go around checking on other tables, not once did she come by our table during the ridiculous wait or after just to be like hey sorry about that.  The food was good. Didn't love the root veggies. But the sliders were yum and my kiddo loooooved the French toast. But honestly by the time it got there, we were so rushed it's not like I could enjoy it no matter how great it was.

zlhmQSNYWLKwP73hxbVD_Q.text: They get super busy and mess up on orders a lot and pretty upsetting when they're. It working on the orders in which they come in!  Seems they're always slow on to go orders and making other people's food first that order way after!

OPcn4aX6-OaUSKB8sNmGtg.text: Pomegranate's is a really awesome vegetarian/vegan place, even for us meat eaters out there.  They really do a fantastic job of keeping their food flavorful and interesting, it almost makes including meat in your food seem like cheating.  I had the supreme burrito and have to recommend it as it really was delish.  While the menu may seem daunting at first and all the 'meat' in quotes seems odd, you get over it real quick once you get your food and get a taste.  If you are like me and tend to stay away from vegan places, this is defiantly the one to risk it at!  The coffee here is also good.  Now that we've had many years of the Starbucks $5 espresso drinks, the price point seems reasonable and you will find much better quality here than at a mass market place.  They also have some really interesting vegan 'cream' that is quite good.  Also, good hint for those looking for food they will recognize.  Head over before 2pm for breakfast/brunch.  Their egg based dishes are excellent, tasty and completely reasonable for those seeking traditional protein.  Only warning, the price point is a little above our normal range!  It just seems like more of a $12 instead of $18 place to me, but not enough to knock it down a star since you won't be able to find a legit comparison point.  It really is unique so give it a try and decide for yourself.

QdjPh9cuQOpjTF2wuUeghw.text: We must be cursed with this restaurant. The food is amazing but the kitchen has no idea what the hell they are doing.   My family has been sitting here for almost two hours and we STILL don't have our food. The last time we tried to eat here they lost our order and t took over two hours to get our food.   Do NOT come here during any time where it's busy as you will literally be waiting for hours.   I wouldn't be so annoyed if we didn't order before every single table around us but they all are eating. But not us.   We just can't waste our time ever coming here agin unfortunately.

fsrnr3cNkfPQAgJBwWz-bQ.text: This place was AMAZING! The workers were extremely helpful and kind and the vegan quesadilla that I got was divine. Do not miss out on this place if you're in the area-- it is an absolute gem!

saT73ZfQx53yEf3V4dyX2Q.text: Waited an extremely long time after placing our order and ended up leaving and going to Mod pizza instead. My daughter also has a nut allergy which made finding a safe meal choice a little nerve racking considering everything has nuts in it here including the kids mac and cheese. Waitress was very nice but the wait just killed it for us.

sSMxIOIUHlXJihMUC5SI_A.text: An incredible restaurant! I've been going to Pom for years. My favorite dish this month is the Bountiful Bowl. YUM. I think the service has improved over the years, and I like the recent addition of table service. The desserts are to DIE for, and ALL vegan. You must try the Brazilian Brownie and the Chocolate Pomegranate Truffle. The owners are super sweet and are always around. You can tell they love and take pride in their product(s).  I would like to give them five stars because they're awesome, but the last two times I've felt like the portion was smaller and they completely left some ingredients out of my bowl last time. They did promptly remedy the missing ingredients. I hope they don't do what every other restaurant does and keep charging the same or more and lessen the quality and portion size!   This place is a MUST For vegans and non vegans!

fX8jHniqviGI7XXMZiKdqw.text: Always amazing. Can't get enough of the Athena bowl. You can't go wrong with any of the desserts!

TVjr1GRpvtDMnmiuK0Tb3Q.text: I placed an order through Door Dash. After a while I got a call from them telling me that my original order wasn't available, so I told them my second choice. When the Door Dash delivery driver arrived, he was told that my second choice was also not available, and that if I wanted to order anything else to-go it would be 45 minutes. This was AFTER I'd already waited nearly an hour for my order.   I understand that Door Dash employees aren't the actual customer, but they represent us. They are there for us. And the fact that the manager of this restaurant, that I so loved going to, treated him and me - by way of my delivery driver - so poorly makes me want to never visit again.   UPDATE: After much back and forth between Pomegranate and Door Dash, it all boiled down to this from Pomegranate:  "You should ask Door Dash to refund your money for today's poor service." (And I did get a refund from DD without having to ask for it because DD apparently cares about its customers, so ...)  Wow.  Passing the buck. Thanks for looking out for yourselves and not your customers.

DJq7ofNc58j6-WoWkCqglw.text: This is our favorite vegan restaurants in the greater Phoenix area. Cassie and her team take great care of their guests Serving up tasty food healthy food in the friendly environment

2HgwUaoo_wPj8AQFDCPHbA.text: My husband and I are just a joy to cook for. He's gluten and dairy intolerant, and I'm a vegetarian. Pomegranate Cafe has us both covered with numerous menu choices plus a great dessert case.  I first tried this place with Laura L., and I was delighted with the lumberjack sandwich (tofu and regular cheese) and sweet potato hash . The sandwich was great, and despite the name, it was a reasonable size. I also had a nice latte along with my breakfast. At the time, I paid with a gift certificate so I didn't pay attention to how pricey it was.  I returned for lunch while my car was being tuned up, and I got a massive burrito filled with quinoa and veggies. It came with a lightly dressed salad on the side. I brought home a carrot cupcake for my husband, and he thought it was great. My lunch, latte and dessert was nearly $30.   Perhaps Pomegranate Cafe isn't a great value, but all the food is delicious. It's an excellent choice for those of us with special diets.

KVXnlOEVbjso01Y6OTr7uw.text: Yummy options for those who are vegan or vegetarian. My husband who loves meat enjoys their meat free meals and smoothies. The environment is nice and located right by a Trader Joe's! I like to come here after a long hike with girlfriends.

8wuEL6apmts0uAUUkwWd4Q.text: The food and drinks are extremely good! Selection is fantastic! Great healthy choices.  They are such a great part of community.  We are fortunate to have networking meetings here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love meeting new friendly people.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. After networking no one wants to leave.
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Networking, building relationships

u1sdqyA2MhGmL_gaxQvy5Q.text: Phoenix location is Open!  Was feeling a bit low energy today but came here and feel much better!  So glad I don't have to drive to Ahwatukee!!

0j-Q7dJ5mORZ6SOz82MfmA.text: I have been an infrequent customer (due to the location) for almost five years.  Back then, they had odd hours, small staff, but the food was beyond belief.  I recall the best vegan nut nog possible. The high prices were worth the months of fond food recollection. I decided the other day to order one to go, however, this time the nog was bitter, chunky, and a complete waste of $8.  I threw it in the garbage once I got home. I have noticed other menu items that no longer meet the praise I have been dishing out to my friends so I will stop recommending your restaurant. I'm sure there is still plenty of good food but this is supposed to be THE place for food purists, IMO.    UPDATE  I'm happy to report that on subsequent visits since my mediocre review last year I have been generally very happy with this restaurant. They made my last complaint right and I support their mission to creat great vegan food. I can't give 5 stars yet because I feel portion sizes for the price are a little small but I'm glad Pomegranate is around supporting local foodies.  Keep up the good work!

aY5SQ4qD2dC3ISx9ZHp2Qw.text: Tonight was my second visit. We had the tacos vivas and the nachos. Both were fantastic!! For someone who is just learning about the vegan culture and is a diehard meat eater, Pomegranate Cafe has become one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in the Valley!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3agj2zokvzXdyRUPxouNng.text: The raw vegan tacos are absolutely amazing. They R made with walnuts and taco seasoning, which was surprisingly delicious. The menu items are diverse, exotic and healthy. The service was also exceptional. But I do think the young girls need to not have too much attitude and just do their jobs. Can't wait to try other food items. This cafe will be the first of my top five vegan friendly restaurants to regularly dine in.

KX8ojplOYcVNcWc4SjglPA.text: It should be said that Cassie and Marlene Tolman have done an important thing for the valley food scene.  Restaurants focused on organic, healthy, and environmentally conscious products are relatively easy to find in various urban parts of the valley.  The suburbs on the other hand are typically a parade of chains dishing out high volumes of product that often only pay lip service to those who seek out sustainably produced and harvested foods.  By locating their fledgling business in Ahwatukee, the Tolmans have taken a gamble on spreading that business model to very edge of the valley.  A gamble that has clearly paid off.  Pomegranate is a fairly lengthy drive from my apartment, but I've really enjoyed sampling some of their foods at various food festivals here in the valley (the PHX Vegan Festival being the most recent).  Looking to get the full experience of Pomegranate, I made my way here for breakfast on Saturday morning.  On the southeast corner of 40th Street & Chandler in the Safeway shopping complex, you'll find Pomegranate by virtue of their fenced in outdoor patio lined with tall wooden tables and umbrellas.  Inside the restaurant is a beautiful array of color (pink being the most dominant among them) with the the sit down restaurant on the left and a small market on the right selling a variety of food and non-food products.  I came at the opening expecting a busy Easter weekend crowd (which sure enough filled the place within an hour).  I grabbed a table in the corner to take it all in.  The menu as noted earlier is focused heavily on organic and sustainable products.  No GMO products allowed and the bulk of the food is vegan (with some vegetarian alternatives available).  They source locally, compost their leftovers, and much of the menu changes with what's available in season.  The first menu item that caught my attention was the Chimpanzee Bowl.  Granola, banana, seasonal fruit (in this case, strawberries), and what they call a "superfood mix" (I picked up on a variety of nuts as well as some coconut and dried berries).  Douse it with their "Po" Milk (essentially milk made from various nuts and seeds) and you've got a giant bowl of granola, nut & fruit cereal.  I loved this.  Clean fresh flavors with a balanced sweetness from the fresh fruit (including the dried berries).  Footnote: The cafe donates $1 to the Jane Goodall Institute (a global wildlife and environmental conservation organization) for every Chimpanzee Bowl ordered.    I also ordered something they only sell during weekend breakfast hours.  One of their giant cinnamon rolls.  Came out to me fresh out of the oven.  This isn't the biggest cinnamon roll I've ever seen (The Machine Shed in Iowa still holds that title), but its pretty large (I'd guess 4"W x 4"L x 2"H).  The cinnamon roll was okay, but didn't knock my socks off.  I was expecting a smoother texture coming straight from the oven, but it was a little nutty and grainier than I wanted.  I prefer cinnamon rolls where the breading and frosting do most of the talking, but that's just me.  Lastly, to wash it all down, I got one of their juice drinks called The Rainbow.  A mixture of beets, apple, kale, ginger, orange, carrot, and cucumber juices.  As intriguing as it sounded, the flavor was absolutely not my thing.  I guess I was expecting the fruits and the cucumber to be a little more dominant but all I could really make out were the beets.  If you love beet juice you'd probably love this drink.  I only got about halfway through mine before I just couldn't handle it anymore.  Total price for the food, drink, tax, and tip came to about $35.  Having dined at plenty of vegan and vegetarian establishments in my time, I'm fully aware that restaurants focused on sustainability can (and often do) mean paying a premium.  Still, for many Pomegranate Cafe likely wouldn't be an affordable every day (or even every week) option.  Based on the response they've received from the Ahwatukee community it seems as though plenty are willing to make the journey here, which I'm glad about.  As more restaurants look to innovate using a sustainable model similar to what the Tolmans are using, perhaps the price point will be such that places like Pomegranate can reach a larger audience.  From my own experience, Pomegranate is great in spots, not so great in others, but completely committed to their model of sustainability.  I would come back for a quick bite for breakfast or lunch if I were in the neighborhood, but probably on a special occasion basis only.

Ewip_g4saaR-8dT6jnxnEA.text: I stood up at the front for probably about 10 min and finally the male server helped me out.  I sat at the table probably for about another 8 minutes (I got bored so yeah I timed it) before I was greeted, the girl gave me a water, "how are you?" Then ran off. Did not give me any option to order at that time or ask me what I actually wanted to drink.  About 15 minutes later she came back to take my order, never asked me what I actually wanted to drink.  I came to this place because I called that morning to ask them if they had vegan pancakes and the girl on the phone told me every day until 12... then my server told me oh that's actually on the weekends. Cool, so I drove 30 minutes out here for poor service with out pancakes lol   I know you were understaffed the day after Christmas. There were two servers handling the entire restaurant but as a bartender I know the difference between slow and good service and slow and poor service. Very poor service. No one asked my how my food was, I had to get up and refill my own water glass and I had to stare down my waitress with my card in my hand just so I could pay.   I wouldn't be opposed to trying this place again but unfortunately I had a terrible first experience.  The concept and decor seemed very appealing.

7klLedMRnT82jr-tfGYsGQ.text: They forgot to seat us and then the food took over an hour to come out. The waitress was very nice, but the waits were just ridiculous. Don't come here if you want a quick bite.

NrNPtjDvfGP8aTSwyN84dg.text: Do you believe in love @ first sight ... or perhaps love @ first bite? ;)   Seriously ... as soon as I pulled up to the front of the Pomegranate Cafe I just had that lovin' gut feeling ... It looked like such a warm cool relaxed atmosphere...  When I walked in to pick up my order I really liked what I saw ... Very cool decorations and to be honest it reminded me of my house and I truly felt @ home.  The best was when I got home and bit into one of the Wild West (Breakfast) Tacos, and yes I will admit it was definitely a party in my mouth!!  The savory taste running through my taste buds was such a great feeling ... If you haven't figured it out by now I loved the Wild West Tacos, and of course who doesn't love fresh squeezed OJ?!?!  The gentleman that took my take out order was great ... I told him that it was my first time placing an order, so he gave me the detailed run down on all the possibilities. There are so many different healthy options here that I was truly amazed when I heard all the different ways/modes/mediums they can incorporate when creating your meal ;) VERRRY coool stuff my Yelp friends!!  It is definitely an absolutely charming cafe ... I do have one suggestion though ... SERVE BREAKFAST ALL DAY and you will have me hooked!  Please!!??  In regards to the Wild West Tacos - they were        H-U-G-E!!!! And they tasted magically delicious, and you could taste the fresh ingredients ... So I can't complain about the price point of $12 - I think it's reasonably priced based on the portion.  However, I do think $6 for a cup of OJ seemed to be excessive, maybe offer a larger size @ that price point ....?  Otherwise I will probably do without the OJ in the future.  I would absolutely recommend everyone to my newest favorite spot, because it would just be irresponsible not to tell people about how awesome the Pomegranate Cafe is!! ;)

2st31hYBvZUMNd0fqIGnUA.text: What's more important than good food? Good food you can eat, for me that means vegan or vegetarian options. Furthermore, food I can eat sustainably and feel good about. A friend recommended this place and we went for breakfast. Had the seasonal cherry cappuccino which was bomb.com. The star of the show is the breakfast wraps which absolutely blew my mind. The people, the food- all exceptional. I truly hope everyone gives this place a shot.

J07WFJwz1ltaTvxOJM_WNQ.text: The rainbow salad is so delicious. They lightly toss the greens in a subtle dressing and top it with spiralized beets and carrots, cauliflower and  avocado among other veggies and seeds...paired with some sort of creamy nut based dressing that's so good.   The nachos are delicious as well.   Tons of gluten free options for both dinner and dessert. Service is nice but sometimes the sense of urgency is lacking. Oh well! The food is what matters

xCXU6dB9PRehaQrWZlM9bQ.text: First impression was horrible. We are visiting from CA and our family invited us here. The menu options looked appealing, food took a a while, dishes were dirty (the plates looked like they were literally weren't wash underneath), prices are high. Not sure I would eat here again next time we visit.

crbJ4_AAyRqKJsrR25KV8g.text: I love supporting local, I don't mind paying the price because realistically that's what it costs to eat quality ingredients in a scratch kitchen, I loved the service and the vibe. For those reasons I gave PC 4 's.   It may have been what I ordered, (pumpkin French toast, biscuits and gravy, scrambled egg, and a Carmel Coconut latte) but I didn't enjoy it. I realize that you don't keep a 4 plus star rating with 777 reviews and not be incredibly good. We just couldn't wrap our mouths around it.

b8kcMBLtxbWJZKaS9_sufw.text: My last experience this restaurant was less than satisfactory for two reasons, first of all we got there 25 minutes before it closed and the waitress informed us that we had only two minutes to order because they were closing so that made us feel rushed; then we waited for her to come take our order which was more like five minutes. My meal (macaroni and cheese with pesto) Was served to me just warm instead of hot like it had been sitting on the steam table for a while so I ask her to take it back and microwave it or something to heat it up and then I had to wait another 15 minutes. When I finally ask what it happened to my meal, The waitress brought it but it came back again just warm, like they left it sitting on the steam table. The other times I have had this dish when it is served hot it's absolutely delicious and it's enough for two people even though it is somewhat pricey. My friend had the quesadillas and she was not impressed with her choice. We left feeling somewhat gypped due to the fact of being rushed and then not having our meal served at proper temperatures.  The owner needs to have a discussion with her employees about customer service. Also serving hot food hot and cold food cold!

s73WOnmNmIu8Wi26ehZRlw.text: Food is great.  Price and Wait Time not so.    For 2, expect to spend over $50 for lunch.   And if you go for lunch, you will need 90 minutes, cause it really takes a while to get your food, even your 'smoothie' is gonna take some time.  Not sure why they are so slow...been to plenty of vegan restaurants and just don't see wait times like this.  Good food, but not good enough to go back when there are other Vegan options available that are quicker and cheaper.

RQKXCe19I9yPbR3c9OLjkA.text: So glad this location is still open! I love pom cafe. i definitely recommend signing up for the text rewards! the vibe, service, and food are delightful. pom, i love you!

u78582Lbz4gFfnN6V-ybQQ.text: NEW FAVORITE! Have been doing meatless Fridays (works better than Mondays for us) and so have been trying tons of vegetarian places (with a True carnivore's make-no-sacrifices palate). This place is exactly why we were motivated to try a meatless day, and the best by far!   Their food is my personal ideal when it comes to wholesome, plant-based deliciousness. Tried the tacos vivos, and my plate was exploding with color and flavor! The tacos were amazing, and the side salad was surprisingly incredible too! It also all left me with that happy belly feeling, where you are full and content in a way you just feel good about.  There were so many other seriously enticing items on the menu too.  I left really happy this place is local and I can come back to try more soon! The service was also really good and friendly, and the atmosphere is awesome too.   Would be pumped to come back any day of the week!

nVoj5lb6Iz0DA3Ajh_U_Dw.text: I would happily recommend this place to friends.  It is a cute little cafe nestled in the tukes. Food is fresh and flavorful! Vegan options galore.  Yummy desserts,  great atmosphere, and delicious coffee drinks! I love going here with friends for lunch.  The food and service are also nice and quick,  which is appreciated. The only drawback is the price. I once split a meal and it was $45/person for lunch. All I ordered was a sandwich, drink, and dessert.  It added up fast.  But, you pay for quality and the quality was there. Very good,  enjoy! Maybe skip dessert and save a few bucks, but that will be hard because the desserts are sooo good.

EOo3iD9yiTJt2uPMyFCDjg.text: High quality food that tastes too good to be True. Hands down best vegan restaurant I've ever been to. I've loved everything I've tried. Drinks are amazing as well. Friendly staff but they seem to be a little slow on checking in with tables. It's tolerable though (if you're not in a rush) because the place has such a chill and comfortable vibe I don't mind hanging out longer. Another plus is the dog friendly patio.

IZmWff2WpQNeDRFU08CSXA.text: I have a gluten intoletance and hardly eat out. My sister dragged me there and I am happy she did!  Portions huge! I had the mushroom burger on a homemade gluten free bread! Delicious!!! I was so full! As a dessert I had the lemon bar! I highly recommend it. The kitchen and the rest of the facility is clean! Food and desserts delicious. My wild cream drink with jalapenos was too HOT! I tried to soften the spice out with milk but that didn't work. A little pricey, but worth it!
