E21jUf_bpkFpZa-8_Sl2qQ.text: Amazing. Period. Blew my mind.  This is my new all-time favorite restaurant. The food. The service. The atmosphere. All spot on!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lK2nM2LPhV5yiemmaN7ndQ.text: I'm not one to complain. I've always worked in restaurants and know how it can be a challenge to focus on a table outside of your section but I did not think the service could be that poor. My party (2 adults and a child) arrived at 12 PM today and requested to sit outside. We were greeted promptly with water and flatware. During that visit, I requested a kids apple juice. It took more than 10 minutes for the juice to be brought out. Then, our server (whose name I don't even know) took 50 minutes to bring out our entrees. There were parties sat after us who received food before us. I know that some orders may take less time to prepare but 50 minutes was ridiculous. The server had definitely forgotten about our order. He then was quite prompt to process a payment.  Although I may return because I enjoyed the food, I will definitely request a different server.

oo7IIok-lKfM1KVWBeD2aw.text: Great food! The service, the food...really is a great experience and very close to home.  I ordered the chicken salad and the greens were crisp, flavors were really good. Love their salad dressing.

o_49KvS2C6uQvcWP-2byrg.text: Decided to try Pomegranate Cafe for Sunday Brunch. This is a busy time for the cafe, as expected! Ordered a take away meal of 2 burritos and ended up waiting about 30 minutes. Food was really good and I enjoyed the side of chips included. The only thing that confused me was my "burrito" was truly two oversized soft tacos. Not sure if this is normal or not, but I was expecting a traditional folded burrito.

0v5qYzJwAzaZaa4jbwZbDw.text: Honestly thought food wasn't anything special for the price. On top of that waited quite a long time for the food to come out. The cheese in the nachos were dry and stale compared to the yelp pics posted online. Maybe will give a second try for other items on the menu but most items are 14$+ and food portions are okay not huge.

BIZwBw4KlWLL-JPaH0BCZA.text: As much I used to love this place, always looking forward to eat here while visiting Phoenix, the last time I ate there, it was mediocre at best! The burger I ordered was saggy and pretty bland, they forgot the dressing they charge extra for, the place was overall unorganized, to-go items were sent out with no cutlery or napkins, and the icing on the caramel strawberry cake tasted like a cake from Walmart. I think the hype around it made them relax and fall short on the quality of both food and service.

A12iVSMP-8ppREfcv9KucQ.text: I have always wanted to love Pomegrante Cafe, but I have always had hit or miss food and/or service, so I never bothered to return after spring 2013.   In February 2016, after a near 3 year hiatus, I finally gave them another go.  I tried the raw tacos, a couple of street tacos, and a burger slider from their happy hour menu.  The raw taco, served with walnut "meat" was pretty tasty.  Everything else was just ok, and I found pieces of real cheese on my vegan plate, so I was thinking it may be another 3 years before I returned.  However, recently they posted items from their Summer 2016 menu, and I was enticed by their new banana split and hush puppy offerings.  I figured if I keep giving them chances, it'll eventually pay off.    We went during happy hour (which is 3pm-6pm, Mondays through Saturdays) on Friday, 29July16, and ordered a bunch of different things.  TEPARY I'ITOI HUSH PUPPIES - $12: I believe that hush puppies are a southern dish (but I won't swear to that), and from where I come, we love them.  They are fried balls of cornmeal/bread, mixed with onions and sometimes peppers.   My mistake was expecting these to taste like homemade southern hush puppies; they didn't. In their own right, they are pretty good, just not what I was expecting or wanting. Try them for yourself; you may love them! Over-priced.   TU-NUT SALAD SANDWICH - $14:  I omitted the sunflower ranch and tomatoes.  I enjoyed this dish. It was a tasty vegan tuna salad version on warm toasty bread. Only some vegan mayo spread on the bread would make it better. The seasonal side was potato salad, and theirs is pretty good.  Organic or not, for the portion, it was not worth $14; $10 maybe, but not $14.   GILA MONSTER NACHOS - $8 (HAPPY HOUR PRICE): This colorful dish comes with a huge heaping of corn chips, walnut taco "meat", beans, jalapeno, pico, and guacamole (I omitted the queso and sour cream, but the 1st order came out with both, so they had to remake it).  A deliciously satisfying dish which is large enough to share, although you may not want to. The regular price is $12. I would return for this dish any time of the day.  POM BANANA SPLIT - $10: Sliced banana coins, vegan vanilla ice cream scoops, chocolate syrup, caramel, brownies, and coconut whip cream. The description includes a Pomberry syrup, but I didn't see anything resembling berries or berry syrup. This dish was pretty darn good, but it could've been great if the ice cream didn't taste freezer-burnt. Also, the brownie had nuts in it, and this was not mentioned in their menu description.  Luckily, I am not allergic, but those with nut allergies should remember to always ask, as even the healthiest food venues don't always consider allergies when writing their menus.  Being that this dish is large enough to share, $8-$10 seems fair if it's in a perfect state (ice cream not icy and all described ingredients included).   DD got the Maca Magic Smoothie ($10), Napoleon Grilled Cheese Sandwich, with real cheese ($15!!), and the Root Beer float ($10).  She enjoyed the smoothie and drank almost all of it.  She didn't like that grilled cheese sandwich one bit and wasted my $15.  The Root Beer float was a hit; it came with 3 scoops of ice cream and a full bottle of root beer for her to pour herself.  Personally, I think the smoothie and root beer floats should be about $7-$8 each, not $10. The grilled cheese was completely over-priced.   My cousin ordered the BUFFALO HOT WINGS ($10), JAMAICAN CURRY WEDGES ($8 on HH menu; $12 regular price), BBQ Buffalo Wrap ($14), Macro Bowl ($14), Hibiscus Cooler ($6), and a Banana Split as well.  She absolutely loved every single thing that she got, which proves, to each his own.   I tried her Buffalo Hot Wings. The buffalo sauce on the wings was good, but I didn't like the texture of their wings.  She loved them.  I also tried the Jamaican Curry Wedges... LOL! No. I was expecting hella spice and flavor, but as colorful as was the presentation, it failed to deliver. Maybe under another name they wouldn't have been so disappointing? They were not bad, just not what I expected, given the name.  They certainly are not worth the $12 regular menu price. Try for yourself during HH, and save yourself $4.   Even though I wasn't 100% happy with everything, I can appreciate that the food was fresh, filling, and quite tasty.  Table service by Brittany was excellent. She was friendly and attentive without being over-present.    The main downfall, aside from location, is that they are just too expensive. If you get a drink, appetizer, main course and dessert, you're already at $50 per person! This isn't New York and they shouldn't be charging Phoenicians that much, organic or not.

cVB8lsGk1mWub6zZmLi4_w.text: This place was delicious! The decor and ambiance was nice and inviting and the staff were very friendly. Lots of options for vegan, gluten-free, and soy free foods! I had the pancakes and the berry cooler, which were both very good. I couldn't eat the fruit side (due to allergies) but, the waitress was nice enough to make me a custom fruit cup! My boyfriend had the French toast and the blueberry basil kombucha and he liked that very much! Definitely give this place a try! Even if you don't have any food allergies the food here is very good!

YC6HXZquKmhyPSSpQQ27NQ.text: Came here Friday and really enjoyed the tacos and a burrito. Saw the brunch menu and made plans to come back Sunday. Greatest vegan biscuits and gravy! I would put them up against any biscuits and gravy. This will be a frequent weekend spot for sure.

p8IPYNJvovePA3nK5b2_-Q.text: I have been wanting to try this joint for over two years and I finally took the plunge to drive 30 minutes for lunch here. Walking up I was told to wait to be seated. It took another 10 minutes to have someone come over and give me water. The part that bothered me the most was the girls were behind the counter complaining how slow it was. They waited another 10 minutes before the waitress actually came over to me. At this time I ordered a $4 nitro cold brew coffee. I attempted to order my lunch at the same time but she walked away mid-sentence.  The coffee was 3 star taste, but I think it would have been better had it been colder. Perhaps I should have asked for ice, but it's odd to have nitro on ice.   When she came back I ordered the $13 buffalo "chicken" wrap. It came out rather quickly. Their fake chicken is spot-on! I really enjoyed it. Unfortunately it didn't taste anything like buffalo but rather bbq. It was even the color of bbq - maybe I was given the wrong one. Had they had a vegan cayenne-based hot sauce it would have been a lot better. I make vegan wing sauce at home all of the time, It's very easy.   I ended up eating it like a salad because the burrito fell apart. I dumped the contents out, drizzled the ranch, and embraced it as a salad. Their sunflower seed ranch is the bomb! I'm very impressed with how much it tastes like ranch despite being vegan.   I've read other reviews and it seems like the trick around the slow service is to order at the bar and then sit down.  I really hope they open up a Scottsdale or Phoenix location as long as they improve upon their service.

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffalo cauliflower wrap - good but fell apart and tastes more like BBQ not really Buffalo.

-Om4CD8E-brzyvUvbPfn_Q.text: Over priced and food isn't very good. Took four visits to finally get to order something and it was terrible.

8jgB2ZAXzFanu9TfR8iMtg.text: I love this place. They always have the most unique specials. Definitely a place everyone needs to try, even if you're not vegan/vegetarian.  Service is slow most of the time, but once you get your food it makes up for that extra time.

VQZ4S1J3Q7YDur0qGrFiug.text: Amazing happy hour menu including miniature sliders that are delicious. I had the mushroom burger "cheeseburger " and the Tacos  Vevo's raw and they're all delicious this is the best vegan place around!

d7VP8MbCYBHRLoTWw5kurg.text: Absolutely stunning place! The best raw rolls ever!  Delicious, well-priced, but worths it 100%. Cafe is pretty big and spacious.  The variety is generous. Although I wish they could be STRICTLY vegan place as I have heard a conversation that they can make You a non-vegan replacement if You don't like  tofu for instance.  Also, they have a dog-friendly patio, which I personally don't support, because food and pet bacteria is not a good mixture.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fE9fZ7uIQa-ew9gtEwp8Fg.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots. The decor is hippy meets farm house, with lots of bright colors. It's very cute and girly! The menu is organic and vegan. But they will add eggs and cheese to some dishes upon request, making them vegetarian. My go to breakfast order is the wild western breakfast tacos, which I order with eggs and cheese (vegetarian but not vegan). Some of their portions are on the smaller size, but the breakfast tacos are actually huge and I never leave hungry when I order them. It's pricy when you consider there is no meat being served, but I figure the organic, locally sourced ingredients cause the higher price point. I have never been here for lunch/dinner; I'm going to need to try it out one of these days!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bcdxoJPyRAl6jtITh0Il2g.text: My vegan friend and I went here last night.. it was so so fabulous! We ordered the nachos, side of potato salad,  Mac and cheese and tacos.. of course it was totally vegan, with perfect raw ingredients as well, and absolutely delicious! ( I'm eating the cold leftovers now!) The staff is very friendly and helpful, happy and smiling!  As being veggie since 1997, and vegan since 2008, I will say that this restaurant will rival any that you'll find in Los Angeles, and I cannot wait to go back! Pomegranate Cafe will be a permanent home for me!!

EggjE_Rx3sP68kpD5mh3zQ.text: What an amazing place! It really overexceeded my expectations, everything on the menu sounded delicious and unfortunately I could only choose one thing! I came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was pretty crowded but it took no time to get us seated. I got French toast and pineapple melon lemonade and it was amazing!! My only complaint is that the prices are crazy expensive, $6 for the lemonade and $12 for the French toast! I suppose this is the price you pay for a quality meal, but make sure your wallet is prepared!

rsf1icpWjhE7_0446osG-A.text: I love this place. I'm bummed about the hour change during the week. Food is awesome, drinks are great and they offer take out

-AEPWkz6cCbllR6Ye3mJoA.text: Came here because I am vegan, although my partner is not. We both enjoyed the atmosphere, food and service.   Pomegranate Cafe's ambience is inviting. Tables outside as well as lots of seating inside.   My honey and I got the BBQ jackfruit Mac n cheese and the Harvest burrito. The Harvest burrito donates $1 of purchase to wildlife which is the reason we decided to get it.  The jack fruit was delicious! My omnivore boyfriend was dumbfounded how yummy it was (mostly the fact jackfruit taste exactly like pulled pork).  The Harvest burrito was a miss, we were both pretty disappointed. The quinoa overtook the whole burrito instead of adding to it.   We came on a Saturday night and the service was pretty slow, but the servers seem like they all help each other out so no one has to wait too long.   Over all super cute! Like any other vegan and/or locally sourced place your dollar won't stretch far. Burrito, Mac n cheese, a shake and two desserts was $50 not including tip. $$  Side note: I got the Snikkers bar, but don't let it fool you the description is that of an Almond Joy bar! I did not read the description and fully expected something of that similar to a known Snickers bar. Nevertheless it was yummy!

Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1rq7RMx4uAHrUtIHlLUpTA.text: I really liked this place. The scrambles are great but I have a problem with the management. My wife had a bad experience with a pick up order and instead of owning the mistake they tried to push the blame around. So now the wife won't go back so now I take my family of three to The Coronado once a weekend for our traditional breakfast out.   All they had to say was sorry and we'd still be loyal customers.

S4Ipue_cnxT0HoItnGPQQw.text: My son and I came for dinner and we fell in love. We recently moved to Ahwatukee and we're looking for a restaurant that had plenty of gluten-free options. My son was recently diagnosed with Celiac's Disease and he's been having a difficult time with it because his diet was pretty much anything on bread. He walked right in and asked if they had gluten free food (he's 6) and the staff was so friendly and inviting to him. They didn't seem annoyed with him at all for asking if everything (item by item) was gluten free. We ordered the Mac and cheese for him and the nachos to share and I had the mushroom burger. It was all tasty! The nachos were pretty spicy, their jalapenos are no joke! I love that they're 98% organic and vegan. They're also a socially conscious business! They compost, recycle, and shop locally for their food. Such a cute ambience too! We will definitely be going back!

LXoQANL1I0Hl3SGiytzZVQ.text: I'll be very honest.  The produce here is pornographic.  Brightly colored, clearly fresh and fragrant, it looks like it belongs in a commercial and I want to know how to get my hands on my own sexy produce.    Definitely one of those hipster our-forks-are-vegan places but it doesn't matter.  The food is terrific and the dishes are flavorful, creative and healthy.  Save room for the x-rated dessert case.  Even if you're full, you'll want to take something home.    It's a shame I live on the other side of town but I could be easily convinced to swing back by for a jaunt to the Fruit/Veggie Red Light District.

vddfsaeFXbE4VcM_Dxqb2Q.text: I love love love the food here! The staff is also friendly. I take all my non-vegan friends here to show them just how good it can be to be vegan

AZ9Tcyy4olmKFr6-uxLBZg.text: We enjoy the food and ambience. However, recently with breakfast or dinner, it's been long waits to get our food. This wasn't the case before. My wife and I are becoming discouraged about coming here because of the long waits.

EPcmfUziU9cDa7CSd5x2CQ.text: Love this healthy funky cafe. The servers always are able to recommend something new and delicious. I've heard people at tables next to me complaining about how thins tasted. They do a really good job at turning healthy food into something that you wouldn't usually associate with being healthy. So if your expecting the real thing then this won't be the place for you. But if you love healthy food that tastes great you'll love it. Also, really enjoy there  read made in house. My only complaint is the price. The smoothies run me $10! And a latte for $5! A little over priced all around but because the food is so good I keep coming back.

aGYhmH7rdk8LOCES57biEQ.text: This place has the best dang chilaquiles ever! Also fresh lavender kombucha. Service is excellent! The food is so filling too, that's good wholesome food for ya  I wish they had one in Scottsdale coz it's a drive but TOTALLY worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles the best in town. Vegan too!!

U2wsCdHJbqSdPDPUZAkpBw.text: I love the concept of Pomegranate Cafe.   It's a vegetarian restaurant that promotes healthy and clean eating. They have lots of gluten free options or gluten free substitutes, so it might be a good place to go to for people who have allergy concerns. They serve lots of organic and local produce, and have cute hip decorations. The water that they served had cucumbers in it and came in little mason jars, so yeah, trendy. It was quite busy even on a Friday afternoon, which shows that many people enjoy coming to Pomegranate Cafe.   I had the breakfast burrito some time ago, and I liked it a lot. This time, I ordered the protein bowl, which was great. I loved the scoop of pesto-macadamia-avocado topping on top of the eggs. To be honest, I feel like I might have been able to make the protein bowl on my own with lots and lots of great veggies and eggs, but I appreciated that the cafe served dishes where people could could decipher what was in their food. My mom got the Athena wrap, which she liked, and my sister got the Kung Pao Burrito; she was sweating by the time she ate half of her burrito because it was spicy.   The only downside about this restaurant was the price; it was a lot pricier than I expected it to be. To be fair, there were lots of organic produce that went into creating the dishes, so I can tell why the prices were higher. I would go more often if the prices weren't so high; overall, I would give this place 4.5 stars if possible but rounded up because of the amount of thought that must have gone to making healthy foods tasty.   Bottom line: Trendy and hip vegetarian restaurant that promotes clean eating... with flavor. Highly recommended.

DSem9_h0IDFkzKfzDSxLvQ.text: They seem to use good ingredients but everything is "sloppy" - kind of like backpacker food - thrown together.  I had the street tacos which were quite good but the mushroom sliders just didn't work somehow and the tuna melt sliders were gross, really truly one small bite gross.  My server seemed completely indifferent to a returned full plate of food and asked if I wanted dessert, so just to reinforce the fact that I was still hungry I said "yes".  Still not one word of reaction, yes I could have said something but most well trained staff would have asked without prompting.  Poor food and bad service - this place isn't for me, never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yuck !!!

D8jKAIllcYudDIjKcJstFw.text: I absolutely love the Pomegranate Cafe! It's so nice to have a wonderful place with great staff. I don't care if this place supports a specific candidate or even had a political candidate to come and speak. I think it's great! Getting involved with the local community is the best thing a business can do. It lets people know hat they actually care. I would like to tell everyone to please try the cafe out and see for yourself why it's a great place that includes EVERYONE, and not just a few. Thanks for standing up for what's right and having excellent service too!!

WVjk2gTLvGBuAnEBEm2ncg.text: This place is a vegan's dream come True! Everything on the menu is vegan by default and if you want dairy, you have to request it! the menu is pretty sizeable and includes everything from french toast for breakfast to some sweet treats for dessert! I had the Chick-un wrap which comes with a vegan aioli and some really delicious marinated kale, avocado, and a bunch of other yummy stuff. For dessert I gave their cheesecake a try, which was....eh. I also had their version of an almond joy which was awesome! They also have some pretty delcious looking cookies. The service was good and I'll definitely be back.

zBsWL7uWzecYIZ0XP__d8w.text: This is a lovely gem.  There food is wonderful and healthy.  If you are looking for inspiration for tasty and healthy check this place out.  Locally owned and operated with a wonderul atmosphere.  Go check it out!

IsgafmZ-t3LA7som9MLtkA.text: Super friendly staff, great tasting food that's good for you! So amazed by the deserts. I can't wait to go back and bring my family members!!

16Rt0IRCg60BObJQukzg4w.text: What a great restaurant- I hate that it took me this long to come out but I'll be back again. They have a delicious menu selection, friendly servers and great feel to the place. Love everything the Pomegranate Cafe stands for and represents and are proud to have them in the community!!

4F2NFUOEdSzXb5_jXR3Oaw.text: This is one of the best vegan restaurants I've ever been to. The nachos are the best vegan nachos I've ever had, so tasty! Can't wait to go back soon.

O_16jXaz6wLVGXqKNk3dQw.text: Service, all stars. I had the spicy dragon bowl with tofu and kelp noodles ( pro tip: ask for sriracha if you like heat), and it was delish. I'll be back- likely tomorrow!  Not your average vegan restaurant ( i.e. Bland)

oEjYxC40p9AVEGL_32Ldrg.text: Absolutely THE BEST vegan/vegetarian restaurant in the valley. The food is not only healthy but so flavorful. I especially love the tacos & nachos, having to give up dairy with those I don't even miss it & there is plenty of protein with the walnut taco "meat". The desserts are out of this world & there are many gluten free options. Also very friendly servers. You can't go wrong eating here but it's a small place so don't be in a big hurry because they can get backed up & very busy. Just enjoy the cute surroundings & friendly people. Outside seating when the weather permits, alcohol, happy hours, amazing coffee drinks & weekend brunches- what more could you want?

DiEO_KgVP6T-ecpV5hik_w.text: Tried the coconut caramel hot coffee which was delicious.  BUT, this review is for the desserts which is the only reason I went.  We had a chocolate-strawberry cinnamon roll that was really hard and flavorless, the brownie was also really hard and strong-like dark chocolate.  The cheesecake was decent but still flavorless, although it reminded of ice cream almost.  Totally a waste of $26 for the 4 items we purchased.  I should've spent that much on gas to travel to a different bakery (say, the one in PHX......).  So disappointed.  Maybe I should've gone for the food instead of the desserts and I might have had a different outcome, but at this point, I'm not going out of my way to try this place again.

seO7IOWOmQxcxyVVd9ylIQ.text: Another place that I've been dying to try! I finally made it in and am so glad I did. I had a vegan Monte Cristo on gluten free bread, with a side of potato salad.  It was so delicious  and satisfying,  didn't even miss the lack of meat(or gluten)! I also enjoyed a latte(dairy free) with my meal. A touch pricey, but not bad considering the quality of the ingredients. I'll be back, and maybe next time I'll get a chance to check out the store attached with all the healthy goodies they sell!

FWfGzgHfQXjjoz9VIRcitw.text: This place is great if you are vegetarian or vegan... or just want a vegetarian or vegan meal. However if you're just looking for a breakfast/brunch place... I think it's overpriced. Went on a Saturday, the day before Father's Day at about 10am and the place wasn't crowded. The service was adequate and it was good vegetarian fare...

wUI_CjnvjpUiI6XLJX32kQ.text: I doubt that I could add anything that everyone else hasn't already said.  The food is PHENOMENAL and the staff is kind and knowledgeable.  This place is run by people who have integrity and who truly care about the community.  It shows in the food and in the service.  Healthy, fun eating doesn't get much better than this.  I eat here almost every week.

7ww2vHkotuXvOomUPbNfmg.text: I sincerely wish there was a Pomegranate Cafe in Seattle.  I had a few hours to spend before heading to the airport and this was the best meal I could have ever wished for.    The cherry on top: jelly filled raw donut holes.

tqZHwQsacLMqjZ0U6lzAIA.text: I have now been to Pom Cafe maybe 4-5 times.  There are numerous interesting dishes on the menu, and most of the dishes are heaping with food, so the prices are not that bad.  The veggies are fresh and delicious, and I love the hummus.  I've also ordered some of the rice and tofu and was impressed, although it could have been a bit more spicy.  I've ordered the hummus with bagel that also comes with veggie chips - very filling and tasty.  I need to branch out and order more things the next times I visit.  One of my friends is picky and vegan, and she now frequents this place quite often.  I recently ordered a salad with kale, and whatever the dressing that was on the kale was the most delicious dressing I have tasted in a while!  I have also ordered a veggie wrap with the "cheese" made from nuts (I think).  It was deliciously flavorful and interesting. The flax crackers that came with it weren't really enough, maybe 25 kcal worth. I also have tried their sweet stuff, and the homemade granola bars and cheesecake bites are fresh and tasty.   The staff members are always friendly and happy to chat for a few minutes when picking up orders or trays.   There are a few things that could make the place even better.  If it's busy, be prepared to wait for a while for the food.  Sometimes the portions are big and then sometimes they are small. I was expecting a deliciously large veggie plate like last time (normal size plate) but instead got a cake-sized plate with maybe 1/2 cup veggies  and hummus.  Also, some items are pre-mixed, and peppers make me rather sick. I have to pick them out or order something else.  Sometimes, or often, things are forgotten in an order, so make sure to check before leaving.   Pomengranate has expanded the menu since my review in August or whenever, and they now have dinner. I noticed on Facebook that they have pet happy hour, which is cool for people who have dogs.

d_1TxtFUCg5pLdANhFj6BQ.text: Pros: Their food looks and tastes awesome! Just looking at a plate from Pomegranate makes me feel healthy. So far everything I have eaten there is absolutely delicious (and I'm not a vegetarian). Their pastries, smoothies, and juices are great, and today I just tried their daily quesadilla...wow!  Cons: As you will see from other reviews, it is very pricey. My quesadilla and a slice of cake was $21 (no beverage included). The other problem is that the wait can be annoying. I typically wait about 10 minutes just for a fresh juice, and yet today I ordered the quesadilla and it was ready in 5 minutes. Maybe it is a sign they are working out the kinks. I wish this place would provide waiter service and use the counter only for takeout orders. That would really speed up the process overall.  Great, local, organic, amazing!

YyLOwGJhSGf7mWz23pB6oA.text: Love this place.  Local, organic, vegetarian/vegan.    The food is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for here.  You can tell that they put in the time to make each dish an experience.    My favorite item thus far is the Smoking Tempeh BLT.  It comes with a great salad, that would suffice as a meal on its own.  But the sandwich was fantastic.  I thought about it the rest of the day.  The Arizona Roll is another great item.  It's Nori seaweed stuffed with almond spread and a mix of vegetables.  The almond spread is especially delicious.  The roll is served like sushi, with soy sauce and wasabi.  The loose leafs teas here are really good too, as are the fresh juices.

XpyI6kxKzFIEicdltmGItA.text: Prices had increased a little, from when they first opened.  But the shakes and juice mixes are really fresh and tasty.  The guy behind the counter, the manager I think would make interesting concoctions, they made something called morning dew one afternoon, with like mint leaves and some other ingredients that was left to bake in the sun.  I had a slice of their really nice pomegranate chocolate cake and it made my day :)  Its next to Trader's Joe and is near the Ahwatukee area, so it attracts a nice variety of people, ranging from young sporty types, to family spillover from shopping from trader joe's, to groups of friends catching up.  I don't know how good the food is, but most of the people who came seem to like it.  I think if you are looking for a nice play to chill and have a cold refreshing juice or shake and catch up, this would be a nice place to go.

Y13RtDU8MfHmPbR8Syqv1g.text: Cinnamon rolls are great! Made with spelt, which I can eat despite having a gluten intolerance. They use lots of organic ingredients and are accommodating to changes. Eating out often gives me a migraine the next day but this place never does  - I think because all their ingredients are natural. It's often busy but staff is very nice. Just don't be in a hurry when you go.It is pricey but you get what you pay for. Lunches are so big, I usually split with a friend.

EAuVqmS9FkK8wySkbwYmJg.text: Very creative food options for those who are vegetarian, vegan, raw, etc. Love that they are organic and make everything fresh! Many many options as well. Love the feel of the place! The vegan cheesecake was so delicious! That was our favorite! Love to support healthy, local places!

x1BCyBvsRnNZXER-RFHnTw.text: This place is probably as close to a 5 star rating as it can be without being a 5 star. If you like raw, organic and natural food then this is a great mix of food choices with all sorts of flavors, delicious smoothies, teas, coffee and sundry other treats. Oh and don't forget to make them work behind the counter when you ask for 2 oz wheat grass shot. Love 'em! Yes, the prices are not cheap but well made food with honest to goodness good ingredients does not come cheap. You can eat cheap at fast food restaurants and we all know all to well what can happen in a paltry 30 days thanks to Mr. Spurlock. If you want to eat healthy and enjoy a tasty meal in the process I give Pomegranate Cafe a two thumbs up! Come on by and give them a shot. Of course I meant the wheat grass shot! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wheat grass shot.

hFpHNSGGrFNz-4oNgdW35g.text: Fresh organic ingredients, you can't beat. The place is pricey but the quality is there. If you like fresh squeezed juice this is your place, plus the omelets actually have real veggies in them. It's an eclectic spot with good vegan and organic options. The wife luvs the raw desserts...

lY1coiB1N5-efILClzz7Vw.text: I've been waiting for this place to open and finally got my chance to visit it this morning.  In fact I'm sitting in it right now.  The name attracted my attention.  I'm all for Pomegranate anything (When pomegranates are in season, I generally eat 2-3 a day..yummy)  I'm having their Compassion (one of my fav words) juice...Fresh organic beet, orange, ginger and carrot juice, freshly squeezed...The glass is a deep red luscious looking juice with a slice of lemon riding shotgun.  Very tasty... Come and get one!  The rest of the menu looks very interesting as well.  A fresh beet, baby arugula and goat cheese salad sounds like it belongs in my belly.  Soup of the day is a creamy carrot and parsnip.. I just had my steel cut oats with goji berrys, ground flax seed, almonds, raw cacao nibs and mila at home.. If it wasn't for that, I'd been grubbin' some of this grub!    I mean.. are you getting hungry yet!  I know you hate visiting Ahwafakee but if you find yourself in my part of town for any reason.. drop in on this place.   This one's a keeper!

gB8MrmFbzMvNcCaPTL7CTQ.text: Cafe had great pastries and coffee the service could be better. It was loud and crowded with younge teenagers. Maybe it was me but I could enjoy my self as much as I wanted ton

4Ar6kDFOAJ2BnO2FIwH4jA.text: I love the food here. Everything I have had has been very good. The deserts are excellent especially the tiramisu. The space is great and the vegan/raw options are great. My only complaint is the price. I can never get out of there for less than $30 for 2 people. So unfortunately I cannot visit as much as I would like to. So I have been trying to make the same food at home. If prices were a bit more reasonable I may go more often, Until then I stay home with the occasional visit.

ViCVNNlqYCpG5jAE1Iiomw.text: One of my favorite places to eat in the valley hands down. Always fresh always organic. Can get just about anything gluten free or dairy free. The Dragon Bowl is awesome! The owner and her daughter run this place and both are very sweet. The staff is very knowledgeable about allergies etc.. go here and try it ! You will love it!

Sq6w8aitVgwyhcPwxfdtgQ.text: I will try this again.  The interesting food on the menu excited me, but the actually food was disappointing.  I tried the kale salad and it was mediocre.  I tried my friend's BLT and it was good.  I will try again, but my first experience wasn't the greatest.

CROWlDC2n8thvCwpHFuV4g.text: Great menu. I had the pizza, almond joy bar and one of pomegranate soda mixes. Everything tasted fresh and delicious.

RG5bPjgv3nQt--BkMADaLg.text: Brunch was wonderful.  I love that there are so many choices for vegans for breakfast. All of the baked goods are vegan, too!

sE7m1H6Vjh2Hl0iLyqN0EQ.text: Wow, this place has amazing food!  It is so refreshing to see vegetarian food with variety, flavor and creativity.   I wanted to eat every single thing on the menu, and so did my friend.  We decided to start off with the hummus of the day (Butternut squash), and split two meals, the vegan tacos and the burger of the day (Sweet potato and Mill).  The tacos were filled with a spiced walnut "meat" vegan nacho cheese and sour cream and served in red cabbage cups.  They were soooo good, I would have never thought to use walnuts as meat substitute, brilliant! The burger was another big winner! It had a jalapeno curry sauce that was so flavorful, and it paired nicely with the sweet potato and avocado. On the side were yummy baked fries with homemade barbeque sauce... still licking my lips!  I'll definitely be back, again, and again, and AGAIN!

qLV8aHT2o_Ppn4RRAZB4Lw.text: Love the nachos here the walnut meat is super yummy. They also have great coffees juices and desserts. I like the snickers bar!!they are all vegan too! So no dairy. Yay! Can't wait for our next visit.

lEfc_Q1mjiBkuNd0TouY-A.text: The food is excellent but it's overpriced even for organic food and much of the staff seems like they smoke too much weed before work. Also, the food takes a long time to arrive. A 25% reduction in price would seem like a fair price for wholesome food and that coupled with a "smoke less weed before work" policy would warrant 5 stars.

gM3-suGK9B0cTQSI_SV6ag.text: Have been here 2 times. The food was ok just not my type of food.  The service was slow and the girl who helped my friend and I seemed like she did not want to be at work.

_W3TwCLb4wKuRJjbTYbu3w.text: My favorite restaurant ever! I moved to the neighborhood partially so we could be close by. We can walk there now and its amazing! The food is as beautiful as it is yummy!

XYvZJm9p_8Zd-GG23bTGDA.text: Well if you're into that super healthy eating this is t he place for you! If you're into meats with flavor this not the place for you but all in all the atmosphere is niice and the mood is chill definitely not a place for me!

h4B9w1exwTsiqnjGFvMFkA.text: Love this place!! I love that the waitress referred to it as your happy place, cause it totally is to my vegan friend. There elephant something bowl is my favorite.

C239p16_VcH0YTikP_cMpQ.text: I had heard many great things about this place, but had no idea just how good it would really be! A little slow on service on Sunday, but the food was well worth the wait!

Z1PNLw7KnzMZakKccHoMeA.text: Great place for vegans! So many options, though a bit pricey, are very filling and delicious! We got the biscuits and gravy, and the chilaquiles, both with tofu and some leftovers for later. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the service wasn't the best...we weren't checked on - so we didn't get water refills (sitting outside in Arizona), we didn't order drinks or desserts because by the time he came back, we didn't feel like waiting any longer. I watched the two tables next to us get waited on hand and foot by their server! She was coming back and forth so much! We spent an hour there and i can confidently say 20 minutes of that at the least, was sitting and waiting for our waiter to come back and let us box up our food and leave. Some more water would've been nice too. Oh and the smoothie and juice we wanted but didn't get because it would've been another 20 minutes waiting for our server, who's name was Danny.

bB6Q-Sh_09CJBmOuWouvQA.text: I've been here a bunch and the food is always delicious. It's a bit on the pricey side for veggie fare, but I just tell myself I'm back in Los Angeles and get to enjoying my iced Pom milk latte with my $14 breakfast bowl. The coffee is really great, especially when it includes their house blended non-dairy milk. I tend to like the breakfast options more than lunch, the Pom Muffin, bowls, and scrambles always well cooked and tasty. For lunch, the nachos....are not good so avoid those, and get one of the salads, bowls, or sandwiches instead. Service can be a tad spastic, and you do have the sense that the regulars get way better service post-yoga class than any newbies in town. They have a lovely pastry/dessert case up front, too, so grab a gluten free power bar, a cup of coffee, and get prepared to eavesdrop on people extolling the virtues of hot yoga and wheat grass.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Goddess Burger with roasted root veggies and BBQ
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gila Monster Nachos

rZp0PhwS__56vy4crGH6uQ.text: Was so excited to find this on Yelp and was even more excited when I got to the restaurant for dinner and found so many delicious looking options. After entirely too long, I decided to try the green goddess burger on gluten free bread with the root vegetable fries. Holy smokes! Best vegan sandwich that I've ever had! The fries were served with a homemade BBQ sauce which we bought a jar of.  We naturally tried some sweets after we ate. The cowgirl cookies were wonderful! The rocky road bar was a little too rich for my taste buds but my boyfriend devoured it.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other entrees!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Goddess Burger on gluten free bread and root vegetable fries.

Z38AFCwBqX4D7sQ1IxWnBQ.text: Quaint environment and great for vegans and vegetarians. Prices are steep but quality is good too. I ordered a breakfast plate from their board (no price listed) and a pomegranate tea - was surprised at a $22 bill.   Now, I'm not vegetarian so my perspective comes from a "likes to be healthy" meat eater. Eggs were good. Veggie bacon wasn't for me because I really like the real stuff but I think vegetarians would love it. Pancake special was tasty with fruit, sprinkle of chocolate  and nuts in it. Pomegranate tea was only okay and apparently cost $4-$5. Service was minor - very little interaction with those of us sitting at the bar. Decor was cute.   Overall - I'm glad it's here for all my vegan/vegetarian friends but would only come back with them. The price was just too high for my simple breakfast needs.

PBwfya5bGE3Jgn-v8rhsUA.text: This cafe never disappoint, for vegans and non vegans alike.  Try the elephant curry bowl or the lucky dragon bowl. I'm not a fan of tofu so I always get the bowls with walnut meat as my protein option.  yummmmmm. Staff here are super friendly and you can tell they are passionate about the food.  Love pomegranates !!!

_7aFE8C-SMR0Ll8lXJ5znA.text: This is my favorite restaurant! I love all of the vegan options,(if you are not vegan and you can choose egg or cheese). My favorite right now is the cauliflower Mac. I also love chocolate cherry bomb smoothies.  Green smoothies are great as well.

LnwK_pxSqr6XdR8VqQZrYg.text: Absolutely amazing!!!!! I had the Wild Western Tacos and they were flavorful and absolutely delicious. One of the best vegan meals I've ever had (I had it with tofu) and I am definitely coming back! Our waitress, Shelby, was absolutely wonderful and made it a great meal.

nbjBkFfvK_Rymtw7DiZSug.text: FINALLY, The Funk has come back to South Phoenix.  Have you ever done something one day and was more upset the next day about what you did? Well that's how I feel about dropping $45 on Pomegranate cafe for a late veggie lunch - solo. (I can imagine the heads shaking from all the carnivores. That's steak money, right?)   Yeah, I feel ya'. My support for veggie eateries is quickly waning. They are over-priced and can be quite pretentious with the creativity.  So, I was down south on a hot afternoon and really worked up a sweat. I remembered reading that Pomegranate Cafe sold fresh juice and was located somewhere near 40th St and Chandler Blvd. Had I known to look for the shopping center with Safeway and two doors down from Trader Joes....Landmarks, folks! Very important when giving directions....   PC's white and pink sign is a tad dull against the building. If I wasn't specifically looking for the cafe, I probably would have missed it and gone somewhere else to eat. But anyway, I walked in, grabbed all the menus (regular, HH, and juice bar), and had a seat. (Only order at the counter if you want take-away).   Asked for a juice right away and despite the "slow service" comments that other reviewers have posted, I wasn't too bothered by the several minutes it took for juice to make its way to my table. I pushed aside water and guzzled it down. Aahhh. I could feel, see, hear, smell, sense, taste, perceive the essence of life coursing through my veins. That must be the feeling Popeye gets  after eating spinach (mmmm, love those greens).  Why only three stars for PC? One for just being veggie + One for being freshly made + One for serving fresh juice   Fresh juice was the best part of my afternoon. I wasn't too impressed with the food. I ordered off the regular menu like an idiot and hit myself later for not giving the happy hour menu a chance. Could've saved myself half the price.   Truth be told - I should've stopped with the juice, paid the bill, and walked away. But, ooh, I spied with my little eye jackfruit tacos and jackfruit sliders.   - BBQ jackfruit sliders (3) for $12: jackfruit, peppers, onions, jalapeno cabbage slaw, chimichurri on bun.  Even though I asked for the BBQ sauce on the side, the jackfruit itself had a sickly sweetness that cancelled my enjoyment. What I really liked, though, were the silver dollar-sized buns.   - Jamaican jerk street tacos (3) for $12: jerk seasoned jackfruit, cabbage slaw, pico, baja sauce, chimichurri on corn tortillas.  Did that say jamaican? Show me the jerk who thought of that because wurnt no part of those tacos Jamaican. Spicy? Nope. All I could taste was that sickly sweet jackfruit. Created and tasted exactly like the sliders.    The jackfruit wasn't prepared the way I'm used to having it. In fact I couldn't even tell that it was jackfruit by sight because it was mixed with other stuff and only one spoonful of it was buried under the mounds of cabbage slaw and sauce.  When I mentioned the sweetness to the two staff members who checked on me they blamed the jackfruit. Really? I know what jackfruit tastes like. Even when fresh it's not overly sweet. Either this jackfruit was sweetened and then packaged, or one of PC's sauces used in the dishes was too sweet. Won't order it again.   - For dezzert, a slice of tropical cake. Good cake, real cake, but could have used more tropics and less sugary lemon frosting. AGAIN with the sweetness.  Overall, PC's dishes are very colourful and look beautiful. I'll try a wrap and/or salad next time, but I won't go out of my way to eat there again any time soon.  Four items averaged to about $10 apiece, then tax and probably a surcharge for a take out box.  You would think that would have filled me up, but actually I stopped somewhere else on the way back to central Phoenix.

L8LmU5aOsV4QIBhj3luULA.text: Even meat eaters will seek this place out if they are adventurous enough to give it a try. Vegans will Love love it.  Everything I've had has been excellent. Some faves: * TLT *Vegan  grilled cheese  napoleon  * salads...ALL of them!  Native Cob with "chicken" is a standout * elephant  bowl * CA  Love Wrap * sliders & quesedillas no matter what the fillings are!   The best part....no animals have to die!

XzjKx8Rofoo07sID2XSv4A.text: We came for brunch. It was exceptional. We are not veggies but that was irrelevant. Everything was amazing and different. Service was the same. Go here.

ftb11KFXDlRXSB0LXFzPTA.text: I just dined here and am writing this as I am leaving the restaurant. We were really excited about trying this restaurant because we're vegan and really enjoy trying out new places. We heard great things about pomegranate cafe and so we made the drive out here. We got two coffees, a hummus side, the green goddess, and the green bandito as a bowl. My entree was the green goddess and it literally tasted like nothing while the potatoes were very very cold. My friends food literally tasted like a baby ate Mexican food and then threw it up onto a plate and that's how it was presented to us along with taste. Her food was mild on spice but had absolutely no flavor. I had to ask for salt and pepper for my food, but even then was only able to force down half of my burger because I covered in so much hummus for it to actually taste like anything. My friend ate maybe two bites of her food when I left over half of my food on my plate still hence our plates still had almost all of our food on it.The server was a Indian girl who asked us if we wanted boxes for the rest of our food and I said no because we didn't like it. She did nothing to try and make it better or right, and didn't offer to have it remade or anything. I paid $45.07 for food that I literally wasn't able to eat.   The reason why I'm posting this review however is just to warn others. Go to Pita Jungle or Green to eat vegan, the food actually has flavor and is a lot better priced. The servers will actually take care of you and the experience will be better.

OxkoROpIktgPR6TSfoC93Q.text: Vegans! Alas! I've finally found a place that dishes are mighty flavorful and healthy. Let's start with the elephant curry bowl with tofu and brown rice. It was incredibly delicious. Carrots and purple cabbage brought the crunch while the soft curry bathed rice and tofu almost melted in my mouth.   The enchilada style burrito supreme tantalized my tastebuds. Each ingredient playfully danced in unison among the authentic Mexican spices.   Last, but definitely not least, the country mushroom soup. Quinoa, corn, onion and vegetable broth were tied up perfectly with the mushrooms. I was never a fan of the fungus, until now. I've rescinded my hatred and replaced it with love.   Pomegranate Cafe, we will be back. I'll be longing to try other items on the menu until we meet again.

lZFOqgevSNRCCKdo_vKRDA.text: I love Pom with all my heart. Never leave this cafe disappointed! The food is beautiful, DELICIOUS, and colorful! I love the staff because they give their All when it comes to service. And they are helpful, friendly, and work hard to keep you satisfied. Your tastebuds won't be disappointed!! Try the beautifully crafted desserts, soups-Try It All!! One of my favorite spots to study, take my friends, and I enjoy the positive vibes!!!

0eMn7bC8PhxC8RkL2xFKXQ.text: Really liked this place. Has no idea everything was vegan and was pleasantly surprised.  Had the western tacos.  I'm not a vegan but I would  recommend this place to anyone regardless of  their dietary preferences.

0RzLPMbFzGUqtou_luHV6Q.text: Absolute awesome place. We got the parfait, holiday hot chocolate, curry bowl and lentil walnut burger. Nice customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parfait
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Holiday hot chocolate

1F4FendWOTBMcKX5-8LjXQ.text: If you're into healthy, organic/vegan, fair-trade food, this is the place to go! It's generally always busy so I wouldn't say come here when you're in a rush. I have tried several things on the menu and am never disappointed. I'm only giving it four stars though because yes, it is a bit pricy. Still- worth it!

jBngKzAR9KNPOJ6I2NQKyw.text: I love the freshness and natural components to Pomegranate's menu.  The food all has an organic and earthy taste that is delicious!  I will continue to go back again and again.  Only downfall is that it is VERY expensive!

pDQ0dvQCZ_4ZBi04Rx0AsQ.text: Local. Organic. Raw. Vegan. Gluten Free. Fresh and Tasty. Coffee/Toddy. Raw Deserts

yJw49R_ZRdreNzvDCa6y8Q.text: This is a great restaurant if you're looking for a healthy, clean meal. Even if you're not vegan or vegetarian you'll love the food. Service is a bit slow, but that because the food is fresh and mostly raw veggies- it must take a lot of chopping! It's a bit pricey, but the food is high quality. Definitely check this place out.

lvoAnlt6EcBN2TAvS3aUOQ.text: OBSESSED. Can't get enough.  The desserts. The food. The coffee. The love for community.   My only complaint is the cafe isn't anywhere remotely convenient for us but that's not their fault. Given the 8pm closing time, the hours are a little less-than-convenient but again, if we lived closer this probably wouldn't pose a problem. Please open a location closer to Central Phoenix!

Fw5Gqp_2xseBnqQk5tcsvQ.text: The breakfast burrito was so good!!! Would absolutely come back and recommend to a friend.

-xka7UAshvTSNZsRs7ifCA.text: I love this place!  Gets very busy during lunch, and the wait for your food is long, but so worth it!  I had a green smoothie which was great, and the raw tacos.  OMG.....sooooo good!  I can't believe something raw could be so good!  I wish it was closer to my house.  There are a dozen more menu items I'm dying to try!

0vTaAputt0J44q06u7amaQ.text: Food is great. BUT.. Completely over priced. And to top that off they recently  raised the prices!! Food comes out different portion sizes every time too..kinda frustrating.

bBfSEnpqICesZhvCYI5P3Q.text: Fresh, local, and amazing. A bit pricey, but I'm willing to pay more for high quality food.

bjI3QzgrRBkxLEPa2K2cLA.text: Wonderful healthy flavorful place. The bowl I had was a taste bud's dream. Right next to Trader Joe's was a bonus.

L56js_qTFyjpECoIZ71TXw.text: Absolutely love the food!  So hard to find a good, organic restaurant so it's nice to find one that actually makes great food!  Great variety, friendly staff.....little pricey but that's what you expect nowadays when organic is concerned.  Until the rest of the world catches up, prices will always be high for food such as this....quality;)

TdaVhdx5-ZlVhe9R0CIDtw.text: A friend of mine recently told me about Pomegranate Cafe in Ahwatukee. I didn't know that all their menu items are vegan---how cool is that? All the baked goods and menu items are vegan, but they do offer eggs (instead of tofu for breakfast/brunch items) and dairy cheese (instead of vegan Diaya cheese) to appeal to vegetarians.   We went for a late afternoon lunch today and ordered pomegranate iced green tea, roasted red pepper hummus platter, and tempeh BLT sandwiches. The tea was tart and naturally sweet; very refreshing. The hummus was tasty and served with vegetables and warm bread slices. The BLT was simply awesome. I have to learn how to get my tempeh to taste like theirs! The baked goods looked way too good to pass up. So, against my waistlines wishes, we got 2 slices of vegan cake (lemon with strawberry frosting), raw vegan donut holes and coconut macaroons to take home. I will say that the donut holes don't actually taste like donuts, but they were still delicious. The cake was so amazing that I muttered to my husband that we need to order a whole cake (I'll have to see if they offer whole cakes...it was like wedding cake-good). I wish I could have tried everything on the menu...I just have to make plans to visit often. The berry pepita french toast sounds absolutely divine...for next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. L-R: Coconut macaroons, raw donuts holes and chocolate coconut macaroons
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This lemon cake with strawberry frosting was like &#39;wedding cake-good&#39;. A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
Photo of Pomegranate Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside view

ceHvfqdrS11n-MJEm16jPQ.text: I have been here several times and I will say the portion sizes seem to be shrinking. We went a couple of months back for a simple breakfast I had coffee that was cold that I sent back twice and I ordered a simple over easy egg with their grain toast anyway It came out to over $20. I had asked for a slice of tomato lettuce and some onions --I was up charged for the slices, onion &  lettuce. Also used to have a delightful kale salad but the last time I ordered it the portion was small and it was mixed with other random lettuces anyway it was very expensive and disappointing at best. It does not have to cost a fortune to be organic and healthy --not sure how this place does so well.

eVwdnL_daPSH3zgpP4vYTg.text: Soooo, this is one of my favorite places to eat in the Phoenix area and have watched it grow almost since it's inception...Food is always super fresh and delicious! Sometimes the food has taken a bit, but well worth the wait.  Plus they started bringing out chips and salsa which made me almost forget I had food coming because the salsa was SO good.  Needless to say I have brought many friends/family/carnivores here and NOT ONE of them was disappointed.

WHHoPn0ZnfiGIw8KKekq9Q.text: I LOVE the food here.  It is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for.  It's a little nosy inside so I would rather sit outside if it's not too hot or cold.  I'm not really sure how they can make it less noisy.  The chairs and tables and unique which is cool but they wobble sometimes because they are made from different types of material.  All in all, amazing place and I'll make special trips from the west valley just to go here.

7RzOMF6gj_uMx9FRtYEpeQ.text: Just tried to eat lunch here (1PM on a Thursday). Waited five minutes to be seated (plenty of tables open). Waited another ten minutes with zero staff interaction and decided to leave. Service is just terrible. Which is too bad, the menu looked good and interesting.

HT3mOpcNyillI5K-uzBWLA.text: I love their food. Pomegranate Cafe has a lot of options for healthy, wholesome foods that you can't really find anywhere else. I enjoy the atmosphere, there are a lot of people who tend to be at the Pomegranate so it's always very lively.  Of course, with so many people there also tends to be a long line. This is probably the one thing I hate about this place. Sometimes it can take anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour just to get an order placed and find a seat, and that's not even going into how long it takes to actually get your food.  Overall, the place is good, the food is good, but unless you get there early or don't mind waiting in line, it may be best if you avoid this place.

HSbI2crPRSbOyC35KcNygQ.text: Great food! Great staff. Highly recommend if you're looking for a healthy food option in Ahwatukee.

0DXon-ZmKomZGruYm_qIlQ.text: If you want to eat healthy food that makes you feel better after eating it- you found your place. The only opportunity for them I see is that sometimes the owner can be a bit cold toward their customers as you see her walking around. Aside from that please don't let that stop you from going - it is truly the best vegan/vegetarian food you will ever have.

2bQ8unvbg2SYNp_pxH_HrQ.text: This place is FANTASTIC! Fresh juices of all sorts, breakfast and lunch.  I went here for breakfast and ordered the Pina Colada Pancakes not knowing everything was vegan (which is a plus in my book). The pineapple compote was warm and not too sweet, dusted with coconut. I liked the food here so much I came back the next day for lunch and had a curried sweet potato/tempeh bacon and tofu sammy on GF bread with a carrot ginger juice. YUM!  Next time I'll be in to sample some of the raw vegan brownie/powerbar/ball/tirimisu/cheesecake desserts!  I would eat here everyday, but I think this ma + daughter place will burn a hole in my pocketbook! It's a little pricey, but it's so good it's worth it to put some real nutritious food in your body. A+
